thrummed hat made mee poore dutch suite rubbing dust make seeme old taylor said took paine spoyle make bought linnen stocking discoloured face hand without cloake sword hand hose tooke place poore waggon practised much could pythagoricall silence asked told poore bohemian long serued merchant leipzig left mee dispatch businesse stode commanded follow emden seene seruile countenance mine eye cast ground hand hose modest silence would haue taken harmelesse yong man many pleasant euents happened thus disguised wherewith trouble onely one tied impart came breme doubtfull doe letter thought deliuer keepe till fitter time least send messenger haue broken promise haue lost fruit recommendation opportunity see mother sister without hope hereafter see thought deliuer disguised base apparell confesse wherefore disguised looked face glasse could shame take course last resolued deliuer say seruant selfe wherein lyed haue euer much obeyed owne affection master meaning passe stode sea feare abouesaid danger sent land command stay leyden bee briefe went mother house seruant opened mee doore gaue letter scarce looking would haue locked doore took letter againe saying promised deliuer owne hand entred gaue hand mother sister inquired much much master might perceiue made friendly mention letter entertained much curtesie thus disguised owne seruant went away mother would need giue mee six batzen spend neither would refusall preuaile must need take set marke vpon peeces left spend hope ere die shew purpose dore met brother seene frankfort little afraide left disguising would haue knowne territory count emden castle could get waggon place wee went one mile foot long selfe hauing gold gulden shooes could remoue without suspicion way irkesome mee came countrey house wee found good cheere man paying supper seuen groates selfe sitting last table reason poore habit paied much best fedde worst minde bed meat one companion supper hauing streight boot taught pull one helpe staffe recompence counsell desired mee pull disguised could well refuse next morning hired waggon eleuen stiuers passed along mile leere towne subiect count emden dwelt far dunort strong castle way fen deepe waggon wheeles pulled went good part way foot vnderstood spanish freebooter called english malecontents lay aurick another castle said count loded booty taken barke force passe ouer emsz cutthroates vsed time raunge spanish garrison vpon lowcountries spoile passenger part confidence count oldenburg offended citizen breme permitted theeues rob also malicious breme lately taken thirty foure freebooter beheading altogether set vp head vpon stake besides count emden hauing beene lately driuen emden citizen tumult religion permit freebooter lie country spoyle merchant city chiefe captaine freeboaters lying aurick han iacob notable roge malicious english vsed spoyle apparell handle cruelly mocking english word cannot tell swearing would make tell themselues countrey men passing way dayes hee taken foure english wollen clothes many flemmish linnen clothes diuided length ditch stead better measure glad heare diuision fell variance han acob would haue stopt part chiefe captaine garrison rest cryed dutch wir wollen dein mawger kopff lieber zwey kleiben stelen wir sur andern vnd hangen far vns selbs wee rather cleaue thy leane pate two shall steale others hang selues vsed many reproches chiefe captaine saying dutch finstu bringt mirs hangstu aber habt dirs die iudem pfaffen hauptleinte vnd hund ver dienen ihr kost mit thr mund findest thou ought bring hangest thou take thee lewes priest captaines dog earne liuing mouth cutthroates howsoeuer passed emsz yet meant presently returne spic euery towne village returne iourney lay leere night doctor ciuill law seeing mee walke garden thinking seruile habit fit contemplation commanded mee draw water horse giuing mee reward presently onely nod yet drunke friend going said knecht dore hastu zu drincken sirra drinke left supper hauing expected bed almost till midnight maide last told mee must lie vpon bench washing foot gold shooes gauled espying silke stokings wore vnder linnen ran mistresse procured good bed effect pleased well afraide cause lest bee discouered hasted away early next morning paied heere supper breakfast fifteene stiuers giuing seruant one paine hee would haue restored mee seeming habit haue need thereof himselfe night next day great store raine fell winde tempestuous could passe water neither would companion hire waggon besides way time dirty waggon could passe notwithstanding since onely two mile remained dangerous iourney thought thiefe would come raine resolued goe foot companion emden two mile vnspeakeable length difficulty passe high way wee three passage one vpon top banke lying vpon arme sea rather vpon riuer emsz running sea passage tempestious winde like beare v ouer blinded v driuing salt water eye besides wee went ouer shooes dirt second passage side banke water somewhat fairer troublesome wee forced continually leane vpon staffe euery one hand lest staied staffe fall lower way intolerably dirty lower way third passage bottome banke furthest water passage waggon field round ouerflowed winter passage way passed long mile little city leere village aldernsea seuen clocke morning twelue come first tenne companion iourney comming six left v despairing passe contrary winde foule rainy day foot sticking fast dirt mocked obstinacy going within selfe wet skinne shooes euery step almost forced binde foure point neither v looke backe fellow helpe hee could follow haue fallen sea confident none would haue come back succour gone halfe mile one foure companion young man blacke beard able body would goe one foot though one stiuer purse forced borrow money v might stay poore alehouse came aldernsea freebooter spy came inne gaped vpon v though wet skin yet durst pull thing dry sest inward garment better vpper betray disguise neither durst call wine spend freely lest thinke store money v paied seuen stiuers dinner another companion left v tired hee went bed without eating one bit onely one companion left called anthony man little stature citizen emden free dangerous iourney went forward came village freebooter spy came close v beheld v narrowly seeing v couered dirt tooke v poore men prey vnfit followed wee gathering vp strength went till last wee weary hauing strength chuse way wee cast away staues went almost vp knee dirt lower way last hauing gone one mile thought wondrous long one emdex clocke afternoone fiue wee came emden selfe entring gate could stand till souldiers writ name lyen downe ground giuen mee seat danger freebooter giuing name wrote selfe englishman stander little wondring put self dangerous passage truly iourney free danger yet without gate faire pasture large plaine lodged englishman house chiefe host city either dispising england englishman much respecting master friesland gaue entertainment tooke one old picts hauing enchusen city holland fortified wall earth strong rampiers lieth length north south hauen lie east side new city building towards west side city lying betweene mouth german sea amsterdam another city holland beginning warre taking part prince orange forced amsterdam stopping supply victual yeeld said prince hauing made short stay tooke ship againe sayling siue clocke euening twelue night inland sea entered riuer tay cast anchor till foure morning setting sayle passed one mile riuer sixe clocke landed amsterdam fiue streetes city diuided water riuer tay flowes like large calme sea north side safe port trafficke great amsterdam city midleburg since passage antwerpe stopped vpon hauen lics field market place called campplata citizen vse behold friend going sea returning home place towards south lie warmerstrat long large street betweene two riuers part city called new ditch merchant summer meet vpon bridge winter meet new church great number walke two rankes couple one ranke going vp another going downe way get church except slip doores one rankes passe east side city wall stone higher city hauing pleasant walke vpon place house exercise shooting gunneo crossebowes beyond wall another earth betweene wals new city plotted house built since heare fully finished likewise south west side two like wals plot said new city many faire house built field side without gate fenny drowned water doe make city strong cause say foundation house laid water cost much house themselues riuer amster word dam city named running south three lake entereth city passing fals riuer tay north side city hath fiue gate shut dinner supper though danger warre farre two church haue two sermon second day foure sunday city lay length north south adding plot new city round forme streetes narrow building bricke low roofe shewed antiquity haue two almeshouses called gasthausen house stranger old monastery one house built round cloyster nunnes wherein sixty bed time made poore weomen diseased another chamber thereof fifty two bed made auxiliary soulders england hurt sicke third roome eighty one bed made hurt sicke souldiers nation souldiers sicke weomen giue cleane sheetes good diet necessary clothes great cleanlinesse allow physitians surgions cure city prouinces haue like house lodged englishman paid dinner supper twenty stiuers guest inuited supper ten stiuers three pint chopine spanish wine twenty one stiuers amsterdam went boat three mile harlam paid passage foure stiuers passed farre amsterdam came damme shutting flowing sea water salt thus farre though ebbing flowing sea hardly discerned amsterdam depth riuer tay aud inland sea shew little ebbing flowing boat lifted ouer damme rope let fall water side mariner paid tribute another damme greater barkes dammes let water land pleasure haue dam torgay let againe sea land hath much water hence seashore way north side farre distant side water passed faire pasture parted ditch water riuer running amsterdam east north doth turne neere harlam towards south diuideth city side compasied harlam nauigable water north side neere gate iansport frederick sonne duke alun pitched tent meadow besieged city spanish force much spoiled part beating downe gentleman faire house dwelling frequently part artillery playing street hauing name knight saint iohn side two gate sayleport cruyseport without old house vse one marketplace sweetly shaded tree second marketplace good length selling cattle likewise side another part spanish army lay destroyed pleasant wood gate street haue name report bee faire pasture betweeue city sea among church called great fairest lady church vulgarly called vnserfraw kirke next beautie sea coast holland sandy downe great store cony citie make great store linnen clothes hath fiue hundred spinster water heere city standing little nothing mouing subiect stinking forced fetch water brewing boat paied supper part wine twenty stiuers dinner without wine thirteene stiuers mile city sweet hil called weligheberg whether bride vse walke take leaues virgin mid way towards almer another hil count holland vvere vvont bee consecrated marketplace ouer pallace shew house one laurence iohn vvhom brag bee first inuentor presse printing shew two bel brasse corinth say brought pelusium city affrick vpon nyle harlam wee hired waggon eight stiuers came fiue mile fiue houres space leyden waggoner baiting horse mid way staying leyden little way side faire pasture passed lake mere harlam lying towards south sea bankes vvithin sight towards north high wayes prouinces seeme forced made art sandy dry though pasture side bee compassed frequent ditch water gate leyden men goe vvaggon onely vvomen may carried city lest thinke vvheeles loaded vvaggons breake bricke pauements street hence returned presently amsterdam might receiue money sent exchange hired vvaggon eight stiuers part hence harlam way obserued vvaggons hauing past halfe way must haue way giuen waggon meet horse reason weary harlam paied supper bed breakfast twenty fiue stiuers hence vvent vvaggon paied part sixteene stiuers three mile amsterdam receiuing money returned harlam drawne ouer snow ice plentifully fallen sledge paid foure stiuers obserued many markes set vp field direct way passenger harlam returned leyden lodged frenchman house intending bestow time french tongue till letter dispose leyden estate england famous vniuersity city found abiding fitter paid diet chamber frenchman house three guidens fifteene stiuers weekely common innes pay ten fifteene stiuers meale sand daily cast vp sea filled place vp thought haue made hauen fast could dig yet long would cease ill aduised worke notwithstanding salt water come vnder earth sea ditch carry vnto city make salt vtretcht male called iohn female elizabeth together mother died one day lie buried church lausdune happened poore woman bearing armes two twinnes countesse wondering said shee could haue one man reiected scorne whereupon woman sore troubled wished countesse might haue many childen birth day whole yeere besides course nature miracle fell table briefly set downe perpetuall memory old chronicle well written printed almighty god must beheld honoured extolled praise euer euer amen hage selfe consort hired waggon two gulden passed leyden hauing side faire pasture fruitfull corne field pleasant country course permit made resolue passe kingdomes denmarke poland fortified city wien austria iourney howsoeuer goe much way like indure many trouble yet thought nothing difficult willing minde iuly fiue clocke euening tooke ship vpon mast whereof garland rose master ship wooed wife ceremony hollander vsed sea calme wee passed eight mile enchusen wee cast anchor way wee passed shole sterne struck twise vpon sand without feare greater mischiese saturday wesayeld betweene west freesland vpon right hand towards east holland vpon left hand towards west tenne mile sayling came iland fly small compasse fly consisting sandy hils hath two village hence reckon twenty eight mile sea hamburg germany whether purposed goe assoone wee cast anchor master ship went aboard admirall certaine ship vsed lie guard mouth sea hee spake concerning passage hamburg deliuered letter commanding ship haue man war wast admirall lay continually harbour guard passage sea commanded nine ship vpon occasion wast hollander hamburg defend dunkirkers pirats time one men warre harbour admirall himselfe might goe forth cause tempestious weather wee staied sunday vpon monday winde faire v contrary men warre come losing winde must haue expected without great irkesomnesse second winde bring men warre third winde carry v iourney master ship carrying sixe great peeces hauing tenne musket associate himselfe seuen little ship hauing pike sword boldly wisely resolued passe hamburg without man warre monday morning hoysed saile calmed noone cast anchor fly left hand toward west another little iland shelling right hand towards east lying wee might see two little barkes houering vp downe wee thought fisherman nothing lesse pirats dunkirke till euening tossed waues vse bee violent vpon coast faire winde arising shippes gladly weighed anchor time happened anchor ship brake consort went master according nauall discipline put sea one anchor returned backe harbour fly buy new anchor v foolishly cursing fortune starres tuesday morning wee sadly walked shoare vvee might see consort comming backe torne sailes dead men quarter men lying hatch beholding great astonishment tooke boat board demanding newes told v little bark saw day vvere dunkirkers hauing eighty souldiers great peeces taken spoiled ship chiefe lightest good carried away prisoner dunkirk passenger chief marriners first wrung forehead twined rope many horrible torture forced confesse money presently could procure ransom mourning voice told v pirats inquired much ship saying bride meant dance cursing destroyed thousand tun diuels swearing foreseene escape would haue assailed v day rode anchor added left good could carry weight changed ragged shirt apparell poore marriners indeed iust cause bewaile escape shippe laded many chest spanish ryalls whereof ignorant vsing haue spy place share booty would haue betrayed brother iust cause praise almighty god thus deliuered v lawes death wee much cause bewaile rashnesse yea wickednesse striuen yea repined diuine prouidence humble hearty sorrow confesse glory sacred name iland paied supper bed ten stiuers breakfast dinner eight stiuers wednesday faire winde terrour last escape made v stay harbour euening went lodge village paied tenne stiuers supper bed saw great store kindes shelfish sold small price since iourney sea besides expectation proued difficult selfe though seene city vpon sea coast germany yet preferring safety charge trouble way resolue passe hamburg land purpose acquainted consort suddenly al passenger resolued leaue ship go land resolution master ship stormed v payed doller passage amsterdam fly well pacified selfe nine consort company hired boat thirty stiuers man paying three stiuers vpon thursday foure houres space wee sailed three mile harlingen city west freesland passing aforesaid inland sea day hiring boat man paied six stiuers wee passed mile city froniker vniuersity passing water midst pleasant little city passed two mile lewerden lodged paied supper ten stiuers next morning friday wee passed six houres space two long mile dockam man paied boate hire three stiuers without delay afternoone entred barke saile west freesland one vnited prouinces east freesland prouince german empire scarce one mile towne cast anchor expect floud lying heard land great noise barking dog cry men sounding bell proceeded spanish freebooter breaking groning spoile peasant next day wee sailed euening better safety wee cast anchor neere man warre whereof appointed lie inland sea guard friend state early next morning sunday wee set saile rising sunne landed iland rotermere diuided continent inland sea hath maine sea side whence soone parted put land east freesland prouince empire passing one mile foot came city emden said state maintained men warre inland sea vsed send lesser boates body men search barkes whether friend body men vulgarly called dieiagt hunting metaphor taken hunting dog passage dockam emden paid ten stiuers supper breakefast paid twenty three stiuers though ordinary rate sixe stiuers meale without wine pound cherry paid eight stiuers iourney stode first day wee came sixe houres space three mile village detrem vpon confines county emden passing fruitfull corne field faire meadowes eight waggon paid fifteene stiuers hence went mile wild fenny field village open foure consort paid waggon three stiuers waggon driuen woman graue count oldenburg hath castle man paid supper seuen groates night passed foure mile wild heath oldenburg foure consort paid ten stiuers waggon haue little horse part draw waggon like gallo way nag scotland second day wee passed two mile halfe foure houres space sandy heath ground thicke wood oake came village man paid dinner foure stiuers dinner passed mile like wooddy heath three houres space came delmerhurst count oldenburge hath faire strong castle though poore village man paid halfe stiuer count waggon ten stiuers day passed mile sandy pasture three houres space came breme man paid waggon foure groat supper fiue lubecke shilling breme passed foure mile wild field yeelding little corne thicke wood sixe houres space came poore house man paid dinner fiue lubecke shilling carried merchandise paid tole one man hauing packe man might carry shoulder paid foure lubecke shilling goe study vniuersities merchant free imposition dinner passed three mile fiue houres space furd man paid supper fiue lubecke shilling next day two clocke morning seuen wee passed three mile heath wood oake came stode man paid waggon breme twenty two lubecke shilling stode space boat fiue mile hamburge paid passage water three lubecke shilling supper foure one bed early morning passed six mile sixe houres space wild fenny field wood oake field corne came village altslow seated bogge whereof hath name paid dinner fiue lubecke shilling halfe giue leaue tell ridiculous toy yet strange true hamburge gate leading lubecke found dogge followed v passenger credit assured mee many yeeres dogge lien gate euery day without intermission watching first coach came forth followed village altslow bayting place noone dinner returned backe hamburge gate another coach comming lubecke coach passe daily betweene city dinner passed foure mile foure houres space hils thicke wood many place bearing good corne came lubecke place coach day paid twenty lubecke shilling night foure mile long vpon shoares prussen muscaw suetia sea seemes little moued many time frozen ice shore farre sea waues thereof stirred wind high neither water sea thing salt otherwhere ship sayling therein doe sinke deeper least three span german ocean manifestly appeares white side ship aboue water come sea enter said ocean seeme strange haue seene egge put salt pit swimmes borne vp salt water master lubecke ship passed denmarke gaue beere foure lubeck shilling dutchman dane drinking largely paid one lubecke shilling euery man prouided victual himselfe paid passage twenty foure lubecke people neuer seene stranger shouted mee barbarous fashion among people many marriners commonly rude occasion conuersation city round forme king castle obserued beauty magnificence castle built freestone quadrangle city built timber clay hath faire market place reasonably well fortified paid three meales breakefast eight lubecke shilling much beere king time lay roschild purposing shortly goe dukedome holst appointed meeting gentleman flansburge receiue homage vppon roschild old piuiledges refused doe vnto denmarke therefore went foure mile foure houres space wild hilly country roschild called king fountaine selfe one companion paid twenty lubecke shilling waggon though moneth august yet wind blowing strong north sea cold beene winter roschild hath bishop though walled hath title city well deserues numbred among faire pleasant village shew whet stone albrecht king suetia sent margaret queene denmarke despising woman scoffe bidding whet sword therewith queene tooke said great mast rent made great crany therein hatch top second struck top said maine mast againe rent wise would scarcely beare saile till wee might come dantzk best mastes sold good rate first day sayled day rode three mile fruitful plaine corne feldkirken paid nine creitzers dinner foure horsemeat dinner rode two mile side lake left hand towards south beyond lake boleslaus king poland lie buried another place effigiem christi qui transis pronus horona non tamen effigiem sed quod designat adora esse deum ratione caret cui contulit esse materiale lapis sicut manus effigiale nec deus est naec homo praesens quam cernis imago sed deus est homo quem sacrum signat imago thou christ image passest fall yet image signifies adore reason god whose essence stand materiall stone formall workemens hand image thou seest neither god man represents god man entry chancell throne duke made walnuttree carued aboue head duke sit wont couered carnation satten couered cloth gold giuen king persia two thereof renewed westerne emperours soile dukedome fruitfull corne wine almond oliue tree sweet fruit wine martiall thus writes de spoletanis quae funt curiosa lagenis malueris quam si musta falerna hib spoleto bottels meet say falerno must sweet fourth day morning wee rode ten mil stony barren mountaines fiue mile fertile plaine wherein grew together corne vine oliue tree tree obserued alwaies grow stony ground soyle italy vseth firtile seuen mile firtile plaine end whereof city narni whose situation altogether like spoleto italian told soyle territory made dirty sunne wind dusty raine since haue found confirmed learned cosmographer southside narni riuer negra fals great noise steepe rocke friar leandro hath best discribed italy affirmes riuer velino make fen cicero number among wonderful thing fen endeth lake old called veanus vulgarly called lago di pie di luco betweene running water fountaine neptune pliny hath described lake nauell midst italy lastly water falling lake wheele put vpon second high cable vpon boat slip forward drawne men hand first low cable bed tyber broade place hath spring far among high apenine mountain falling thence great force would carry away seuen foote long hath foure doores answere one another man may see roomes neere church saint clement wonderfull theater vespasian vulgarly called il coliseo people wont see fighting fencer hunting wilde beast like game receiued one hundred nintie others say eightie fiue thousand person outside old round inside oual forme high top mount celius obserued building bricke foundation sixtie walking pace broad haue foure rowes seates one aboue inside foundation seates bee eight walking pace broad one hundred thirtie fiue pace long ruines like theater lesse built statilius lie neere church sancroce foresaid church saint clement giues title cardinall wals ruined part inhabited neither streete paued thence church croce memory say pope ioane great childe hauing gone folemne procession saint iohn lateran said church holy crosse returned way amidst pompe deliuered childe neere said theater vespasian lie triumphall arch erected constantine great ouercome maxentius faire curiously carued neere church saint marie new giues title cardinal garden monument idoll serapis triumphal arch erected vespasian titus hee came destruction ierusalem hath one arch lesse former erected constantine lesse adorned action engrauen neere said church saint marie new lie vast ruines famous temple peace roofe whereof richly engrauen neere kind gibet called old tygillum sororium sister rafter horatij three brother killed curiutij three brother yet onely one horatij remaining aliue returning citie finding sister weepe priuate losse day publique ioy killed owne handes shew iustice cicero made oration people antiquary agree marketplace also foote capitol old pillar called milliare aureum shewed way gate whether soeuer man would goe also day church brasen dore treasurie people hath name latin tongue also italian plague inuaded citie troopes rebell catilina ouercome fled thither whose posteritie seated hath nourished greater plague perpetual faction shewing thereby race came subdued florentine yeere place also returned subiection said haue name ligornus sonne phaeton cosmo de medici duke florence began fortifie againe ancient towne measure circuit streetes thereof duke francis tooke vpon goe forward vnperfected worke dead duke ferdinand brother time liuing brought forme strong fort faire city time streetes began replenished house duke made place sanctuary offender vpon vsed impose punishment either dwell euer least yeeres adde one house building city faire populous filled citizen guilty crime ciuill conuersation selfe hearing men perhaps preiudicate opinion thinke lookes barbarous made looke warily selfe thing city seated plaine somewhat longer north south broad east west sea lie vpon partly north partly south altogether west side hath one tower north side another one south side reaching sea hang light night direct saylers betweene tower full west side hauen great ship sea also neere city compassed wals thereof two hauens gallies small barkes riuer arno running east west passeth city north side fals sea corner north side strong fort paid vpon reckoning two giulij supper much next day dinner returning pisa water paid seuen creitzers passage two weekes thus spent thought good returne florence might receiue money receiued feare inquisition onely staied easter day dutch inne therefore hiring horse foure giulij rode forty mile florence pleasant valley arno partly tilled manner lombardy field yeelds corne wine wood partly diuided sweet pasture way hapened brake bough mulbery tree shade sunne falling company honest gentleman told seemed stranger carried bough since tree planted high way belonged duke preserued silkewormes imposed great penalty vpon breake bough thereof passed bough village sure taken kept prisoner till pay great fine whereupon presently cast away bough many thankes gentle warning florence came subiect house medici title great duke must hereafter shew discourse florentine commonwealth florence vulgarly fiorenza time set downe briefly discription city field adioining sweet city abounding wealth citizen much commended curtesie modesty grauity purity language many virtue city innobled duke court stately pallaces built within without wals stately building sweet situation worthily called florence beautifull vulgarly fiorenza la bella said haue name florentia latin either fluentini neighbour people come perpetuall happines grew like flower citizen wealth city beauty flourishing like flower pauement city flint rome bricke sienna broad faire free stone house manner italy built low roofe excepting pallaces stately built free stone engrauen windowes city italy excepting venice alone glased either lie altogether open take aire couered oyled paper linnen cloth streetes broad haue open aire discribing citie begin without walles first towards north east compassed pleasant hill planted excellent fruit tree lying forme amphitheater behind high mountaines apenine somewhat remoued instead strong walles citie also south side hath like hilles distant mountaines towards west lie open pleasant valy arno valy continueth farre pisa seaside side without walles pallaces gentleman frequent house citizen distant aboue three foure close one whereupon emperour charles fifth beholding citie countrey high steeple affirmed florence greatest citie whole world hee perceiued stander doubtfull meaning added good earnest reputed pallaces without walles compassed hilles mountaines walles bee within circuit citie seated center italy betweene aire arezzo producing quick wit peter aretine poet borne sharp wit though hee abused wantonly aire pisa lesse pure yeelding men strong memory hath temperature aire many citizen well sharpe learne science strong retaine riuer arno running east west diuides citie vnequall part farre greater part lying northside lesse southside bridge passe one almost middest city fairely built yet magnified stranger deserues hath little house vpon couered vpon side goldsmithes shop make small shew ordinarie time duke ferdinando brought dutchesse daughter duke loraine citie enterance shop furnished vessel siluer many rich iewels yet borowed citizen purpose howsoeuer stranger may wonder yet compare bridge bridge london goldsmith shop daily shew goldsmith cheapeside shall finde cause wonder thereat bridge hath two hundred twentie eight walking pace length built vpon seuen arch bee three bridge ouer arno farre lesse bignesse magnificence former riuer shallow scarce couering sand stone though beyond citie increased water subiect ouerflowing vpon great raine citie round forme vpon walles thereof lie eight fortes whereof greatest strongest lie towards south farre greater part citie north side riuer lie plaine lesse part south side riuer house towards northeast built vpon side mountaines dwelling scattered hauing many large garden part place vulgarly called le ruinate ruinous house haue often ruined earthquake shall find inscription latin duke cosmo yeere forbad house mountaine rebuilt thrice fell fault soyle neere place lie lane vnpaued memory virgin dwelt yong man loued borne family contrarie faction betweene many cruelty exercised mutually louing despairing get friend consent mariage last impatient delay resolued danger soeuer meet together happened yong man ascend virgin chamber ladder surprised saue reputation virgin confessed came rob house whereupon condemned die led execution house virgin dwelt laying aside shame came running loose haire eares embracing confessed truth publikly accident parent moued laying aside former malice contracted affinity young man deliuered bond hangman tied sweet bond marriage wonderfull euent florentine thought good keepe memorie posteritie duke hath two pallaces within city whereof one called pallazzo di pitti seated part city gentleman florence name lucca della casa de pitti began build falling pouerty able finish forced sel cosmo de medici great duke florence shortly conuicted treason beheaded stately pallace citie garden whereof called belueder many sweete shade among pleasant groues together pleasant caue fountaine say one mule bring matter building memorie whereof verse written vpon picture said mule lecticam lapides marmora ligna columnas vexit conduxit traxit ista tulit litter stone marble pillers wood carry leade draw beare mule good outward side pallace freestone engrauen ornament within regall betweene two chamber wherein duke dutchesse lie apart faire gallery chamber dutchesse second bed like owne duke pleaseth lie table wrought siluer pretious stone valued crownes dining roome many faire statuaes figure thirty cardinal chosen one time pope leo tenth house medici court two great loadstone strong fort called saint meniato lie ouer vulgarly dozina shall pay meale two giulij stay long shall pay two meales wont giue stranger chamber diet house tenne crownes moneth crowne ten giulij purposed liue state florence summer especially desired spend time learning italian tongue reputed pure part end resolued returne sienna liue vniuersity many dutch english gentleman liued acquaintance solitarie conuersing italian best fitted purpose rather chose liue castle casciano pleasant seate lying eight mile florence way san casciano sienna liued publique inne great highway shortly passe dutchie millan subiect spaniard warre england auoiding danger iourney giue dutchman staied much longer purposed happened time roman inquisitor pursuing english gentleman escaped hand rome stead cast another english gentleman prison lay sienna much vnlike howsoeuer first gentleman escaping second shortly set fiee yet chance made inee make lesse haste sienna besides diet easie rate spending aboue giulio meale yet hauing meate desired neately dressed diligently attended especially pleasing conuersation gentleman dwelling called nicolao della rocca made vnwilling leaue castle rather made acquainted learned kinsman raphaele columbano florentine freely confesse curtesie manifold vertues gentleman nicolao della rocca tooke impression shall onely long liue dearely loue memory bee glad doe pleasure least friend florentine aswell generall good desert sake specially companion viewing pleasure territory among thing see many delightfull groues vulgarly boschetti net catch bird ragnaij garden purpose vccellart al belonging noble florentine family buondelmonte guicciardini hauing pallaces neere adioyning sport shall largely speake due place treating italian exercise make delight stay place particularly iustified explane euents therein mentioned adde two epistle writ subiect first place second florence departed castle written italian also turne english illre sigr il sigr h nobile inghlese mio ossmo pisa casaa di messier mandato ch io hebbi le meie lettere la vulta di vos signoria stetti di lane fin hora sempre su locchi lorecchie non senza rincrescimento della tardanza badando le suoe queste beanedette lettere tanto badate hormai capitate spieghai con tanta furia non che fretta che piu non hebbe mai laffamato di mettersi tauola e lodato sia iddio poiche e indugiato vn pezzo finalmente il parto se fatto maschio che tanti cosi varij sono soggetti proposti da lei che paiano rechiedere risposta distesa onde io che son scarico ogni impedimento sto sfacendato nella villa come vn romito nel deserto mi stendero con sopportatione pero delle suoe orecchie nel rispondere tutti particolari esse e prima le diro raguaglio piu minutamente del caso siennese sappia dunque che pochi giorni fa il sigr g con tutto che se fosse publicamente impacciato fatti di stato non dimeno per cauarsi il capriccio trauestito da suizzero par troppo come mi pareua contrafatto voise arrischiarsi dandar da fiorenza rom il viaggio gli riusci commoda c e pero non serum piu presto tornato sienna di la con suoa buona ventura senza punto tardanza messosi camino la volta di fiorenza che dalinquisitori romani sopragi se vn mandato al podesta di sienna di farlo prigione hora auenne chil sigr g l stando sienna essendo come sa lei grandone aere allegro hauendo altri contrasegni della suoa barba cera fu preso dai sbirri per linquisitori messo prigione doue seppe con taldiscretione portarsi che loro auuedutosi dhauerlo pigliato cosi escambio gli resero la liberia laquale gode stando sienna fin hora quel mandato passando olire arrivo fin fiorenza doue il sig g per via dvn amico corte non dico gia ch il gran ducane fosse con euole essendone informato di serum su l auemaria diede subito le gambe tenendo la volta di paduoa tal fretta che pareua proprio volar di la dell apennino senza le ringratiato il cielo che sia fugito saluamento che con tutto che noi altri todeschi rileua nulla pure anch io come vn forestiero attristo ho viuo risentimento delle disgratie altri che da suoi amici dalla patria sono lontani non posso tenir le risa quando imagino gli f salti ch egli fa sopre le montose scoglie contadini deuono pensar ch egli vada la caccia caprioli che forse non accorgeranno quante fiate egli riuolge gli ovcchi sopra le spalle ad ogni passo guatadi paura che qualche veltro romano non se gli auentasse adosso limportanza ch egli non se faccia securo sotto qualche frasca doue per ogni picciol vento che soffi protra essere tradito che non fermandosi per strada vil saluo inteso che gli biacchi romani per tracciar stato veneti poco state di veneti poco di la dell alpi nulla vagliano hora che vada egli buon viaggio vi diro fuora di burla chio la prima sent gran dispiaecre di questa percossa finche intese le dette nuoue mi sonrihauuto del resto buon per loro che questo gli sia accaduto nelstate fiorentino che altramente preti larebbino fatto vnmal scherzo tal sia di questo hora per ristorarci ragionamo vn poco orlando e quanto la vostra gran buona lingua toscana respondendoui capo per capo vedete come non e melsenza mosche ne vostra lettra per gratiosa che sia senza suoe punture fianchate puo far il cielo come si puo capitar male per essere frainteso chio burla di voi dio non voglia chio burla damici miei mai mai mai mi rallegro ben co tal volta che volete ch io faccia oi non conoscendo altro soggetto delle lettre di trattenemento che cortigianie baie io pensassi che l oreste scritto da buon senno mi verrebbe talmente la senapa al naso che sarei per cozzar col cappo contra il muro son chiarissimo che conquesta brigha habbitate volsuto dar la baia per farmi montar bestia contra mi stesso dunque vi replico che malgrado vostra mi stupiscio ancora di vostri toscanismi non chio pensi chabbiate auanzato petrarcha danteboccacio con quelli altri maestro della fauella volgare che dvn nouizo siate riuscito vn gran dottore hauendoui fatto gran profitto senza chio n auedesse si non quel tratto che ue deste saggio per le vostre tanto garbate gentile lettere talmente ch il torto e vostro desserui apigliato alle parole non al senso mio doglieteni poi di voi stesso per quel disagio ch il scriuere nella lingua toscana vi possa recare chio sul ragionar cauato da vostra bocca propria che questo vi sarebbe caro da parte mia spero coglierne frutto dandoui occasione di segnar le meie scorrettioni di farmi parte di quei vostri belli passi di lasco il che vi suplico far meco la libera cito mostrarmi quanto mi vogliate bene conquesta risposta state cheto sinon fo giuro dassassino che vi lodero tanto sul viso che vine verra rossore passo inanzi done mi motteggiate dhauer messo quel oime bella posta per far mostra eloquenza fatte professione essere schifo de lo scriuere per vergogna del vostro rozzo stilo buona fe riconosco lironia contentateui godeteui nel seno senza trionfaruine ch io vicedo volentieri ogni fatto dingegno pure che mi sia lecito di parreggiarui damore per vindicarmi di vostre sferzate accioche non crediate ch io cagliassi affatto per vostre brauerie toscanesche mingregnero di riuolgere la colpa che mimputate su le spalle vostre et penso durarci poca satica poiche voi sopra quella medesima parolina oime hauete fatto vn si bel discorso che vi debbano hauer vna dolce inuidia gli valenti teologi quali pero hanno il grido poter ogni poco di soggetto ragionar dalla leuata infin al tramontar del sole mi pare poich andate troppo animosamente la volta di ciarletani non curando di farui nemice queste gentaccie che se si aia nell vnghie senza essere benprouisto di copia verborum mi racomando che quanto al menar la lingua non hanno pari dauanzo la confidenza della lingua sciolta della prontozza dingegno vitrasporta dir molto male contra la cosa piu garbata che altra che si sia nel mondo cioe lettre di trattenemento per leuarui questo errore succintamente diro le cose che piu sadoperano ci deuono essere piu care laere che ci nodrisce sopra ogni cosa si pregia il pan il vino senza chi non si puo essere piu si procacciano che fasiani tordi quaglie talus sono le lettre sopradette ch ogni gentil brigata piu si ragiona di cortesia damore di ciancie che del piattire maneggiaril stato et per non fasti dirui con infiniti argomenti larte lingegno deloratare si mostrano nella rarita sterilita della materia che si tratta come nel lodar lasina nel dispregiar le scientie e cose simile os per lettre di facende non e huomo di si grossa pasta che non le spedisca destramente la narratione del biosogno vn miracomando bello finito maquelle altre se non siano abellite con linuentiono quasi lisciate con certe strauaganzo riescono fracide di poca lode al scrittore e vero ch secretarij notaij talus gente facendate scorticandosi per modo di dire ne lo scriuere impazzan done gli ceruelli hanno qualche pretesto di ragione lamentar si di complementi amoreuoli voi scio perati stando nelle citta che piu importa nelli studi toscani doureste hor maigridare viuano le lettre di trattenemento piene diparole gratiose hora fatte voi andate e si non vi pare chio vhabbia ben acconciato pigliateui spasso dell eloquenza contadienesca su l stringere mi date delle signorie per farmi piacere n auertite ancora questo si hauete tocco punto doue mi duoe et non vedete ch italia cha carestia dogni cosa delle signorie fuora che si danno buona rata infino fachini tanto che si ben io ne fosse ambitioso tuttauia per il souerchio godere ne restaria suogliato datemi allegramente del voi senza parlar astratto con l idei che non mi terro per affronto anzi per arra amore io per uedendo che le signorie non vi sono grado non vi ne daro mai alauuenire si non escambio di quelle che mi mandarete quel caso vile rondero con linteresse quanto le vostre offerte si calde damista non mi basta lanimo spieghare quanto mi son ite sangue forza responderui presente con lanimo fino che moccorre farlo con lopere pure quel mentre miui impegno miui dono per tutto quel che porta il mio valsente fatte di cio che volete tenetemiui per schiauo si bisognasse vendetemi turchi che volete altro direte poi che sonbaie anche queste non sapete chil poeta sotto parole finte adombra il vero credetimi se non volete ch io vsa di furiosi protestationi perchae ogni modo voglio che mi si creda parlo da senno commandatomi fidanza doue posio essere buono per vostro seruitto come io mi seruiro liberamento di voi il che vedrete effetto per la brigha che vi da linclusa et con quaesto vi bacio le mani anche le guancie la venetiana da san casciano li vinti tre di luglio desso guisa di fratello fine morysoni illre sigr il sigr nicolao della rocca mio ossmo casa suoa san casciano sia consegnata le mani c che possino essere consinate nelli studioli di mercatanti queste faconde per non dir peggio poiche hanno fatto non dismenticarmi di v che questo non farebbono g amai ben ainaugiar troppo farle fede della mia dolce rimebranza di lei hora essendo su la partenza per andar la volta di paduoa mi son mosso scriuerle queste poche righe con patto che non le manda al academia della crusca per essere censurate poiche essendo io per dire cauallo forza e che loro participano della confusione del scompiglio che io mi ruouo e pure possible ch vn galant huomo suo pare manca della promessa io staua vedere con che sicurta lei procedesse meco per pigliarne qualche saggio di suo amore lapeccaua parechi giorni diro liberamente non senza mio sconcio per darle l vltimi ideij poiche operismomoragine altra cagione che si sia questo aboccamento non ceriascito ne manco ci resta mezo reuederci per acconciar bocca questa brigha non cha altro remedio si non di farpace bell agio per lettre che debito io mentre che staro paduoa non mancaro da parte mia tornato che saro paese mio secondo loccorrenze raffazzonoro quel poco della fauella toscana che vn viaggio fra tante confusione di lingue auanzera le chiariro ch il suo amore mi sara assai piu cresciuto che questa non mi sara scemati duoe cose mi promano la prima e quel carico delle suoe cortesie vsate verso di che mha messo su l dosso di tanto peso quanto lei sa loquale il sigr raphaele colombani di qua anche piu aggraua chi ha inuitato amoreuolmente casa suoa ha menato la certosa somma trattomi con tanta amoreuolezza quantum non si puo dire io lo receuo come satto per amor di v che non inganno delli miei pochi merui tutta io non lene ringratto altramente perche questi simili fatti non c ha pagha ai parole il secondo artello che lauoranelmio ceruelio e ch essendo io talmente tenuto v mi sento grauata la conscienza hauerla ingannata vn certo particulare il che tanto piu mi pesa quanto piu per quel inganno mi si toglie affatto ogni speranza di poter mostra lene grati udine se per caso mi se presentasse l occasione della quale quanto io sia bramoso dio vel dica hora per sgrauar l vna sgannar l altra vn tratto per questa charta priuilegiata come le maschere di non arrossire per grande che sia la vergogna del patron le fo fede ch io son inghlese e non mica todesco come l ho dato ad intendere fin hora et accioche non ne ritragga essere abbatuto qualche iuntatore personaggio indegno di quella oa accoglienza che mha fatta sopra modo gentile sappia che per rispetti honore li io habbia tal guisa mascarato non dubito punto che le gia hormai chiara linimicitia ch abbiano nostri con spagnuoli tanto che si l vn capitasse man dell altro difatto restaria prigione infino che fosse riscattato hora hauendo io da passare fra pochi giorni pel ducato di milano mi pareua cosa sciocca di darmi conoscere spetialmente stando io vn hosteria nella strada maestra per doue tutti di quelle bande giornalmente passano ho firma speranza che lei sia per farmi buona l iscusa vero al manco per perdonarmi l errore si ricorda che le son ruitore piu che mai ne posso essere piu suo che mi sono mantenga l inghlese nella suoa buona gratia per quella suoa gentilezza propria per laquale e stata acquistata al todesco che degnandosi di commandarmi persona inghlese mi rincuoro far ogni gran cosa per amor suo che potrebbe far qual si voglia todesco et con questo abbracciandola cosi da lontano mi l offero racomando vna volta per sempre et di nuouo le bacio le mani da fiorenza li dieci aousto l di v affettmo seruitore f noble gentleman h gentleman england respected pisa house master sent mine vnto mine eye eares euer attentiue receiue answere without griefe long delaied blessed thus english letter much expected last ariued opened great haste hungry men set downe table faire fortune patient expecting last wee haue got manchilde many diuers subiects propound seeme require large answere therefore much leasure countrey hermit desart enlarge selfe patience answere particular first giue account chaunce sienna know late master w howsoeuer hee publikely imploied himselfe matter state yet satisfie owne humour would needes venter goe florence rome apparelled like switzer seemed much disguised iourney fell well yet hee sooner returned sienna thence good aduenture gone towards florence mandate came inquisitor rome put prison sienna happened master w l lying sienna know high stature chearefull countenance hauing markes beard face taken scrgiamts imprisoned inquisitor sienna hee carried himselfe discretion perceiuing mistaken set libertie hee enioyes sienna mandate passing forward came florence master w hauing notice thereof euening aue marie time friend court say duke priuitie presently tooke heeles towards paduoa haste hee seemed flie ouer apennine without wing god praised hee safetie howsoeuer chance importeth v dutchman yet selfe stranger sorrie disaduentures happening others farre friend countrey cannot hold laughing imagin selfe large steppe hee make ouer rockey mountaines countrey people thinke hee hunt kiddes marking often hee lookes backe feare least roman greyhound lay hold behind maine doubt hee thinke himselfe safe hee may bee betraied hee stay way dare assure safetie roman hound hauing little skill hunt state venice none beyond alpes let goe happie voyage tell without iest much astonished accident till restored vnderstanding happie euent well happened state florence otherwise priest would haue sifted like bran much pastime let v talke little orlando may answere point point first concerning excellent tuscan language see neuer honv without stinging bee neither louing letter without exception soone man may blamed misunderstood iest sure neuer iest friend sometimes merry would haue mee doe knowing subiect idle letter complement mirth thought written earnest take pepper nose bee readie run head wall certaine haue picked quarrell mee make mee angrie selfe therefore replie howsoeuer take still amased tuscan eloquence think passe petrarch dante baccaceo great master language nouice become doctor could perceiue giuen mee taste thereof gentle letter wrong taking word meaning blame selfe trouble haue answering mee italian tongue since vnderstood owne mouth would willingly exchange letter part bee profitable giuing occasion correct errours impart vnto mee eloquent phrase lasco pray doe freely therein shew much loue content answere otherwise sweare beggar praise much face make blush goe forward come quip began letter word ala shew cloquence ashamed write mee rude stile good finde irony content selfe gladly yeelde point wit may bee lawfull equall loue yet reuenge frump may thinke daunted toscan brauery attempt cast vpon owne shoulder impute thinke doe ease since vpon one little faire inne common baser fort hostesse whereof masculine woman night letting ruffines drinke little affraid violence bee offered mee chamber whereupon firmely resolued selfe lodge euer best inne best fame especially lombardy infamous murthers paied supper bed three reali went foote pauia going forth nothwest gate twenty mile milano rich pasture milan called la grande great large circuit thereof mare carriage whensoeuer met sorced without danger light horse though held bridle yet fierce could hardly keepe falling steepe mountaines drowned snow made repent buying though otherwise richly worth couered windowes wood lest heat stoaue goe cold enter fifth day morning rode twenty foure italian mile grison accompt foure mile towne lanzi hauing passed three high mountaines entring plaine vpon next ascent mountaines might first discerne opening towards north began discend alpes germany passage alpes many time obserue mountaines snow fal high mountaines vallies noise thundered noise many time preserues passenger ouer whelmed falling many time high way wood neere lanzi twilight euening heare hundred woolues howling towards night hired countrey churle guide vnto towne trembled feare desired make ready carbiner shoot hee said nothing terrified smell powder wished good cheare woolues seemed busie prey towne neere hand promising would forsake need let ride behind feare giuing wing head riuer rhodanus fulles lake hauing cleare colour seemes mingle standing water lake hence rode west side lake two howers space came morgen towne also subiect berna rode foure mile foure houres space geneua hauing sandy banke said lake left hand towards east pleasant hilles planted geneua vine right hand towards west way see village ruined time warre nothing standing pillar erected honour papist masse geneua seated south side lake right opposite losanna seated north end thereof east side lake lie towards sauoy italy west side towards france side also high way lie sweitzerland lower part citie vulgarly la ba rue seated plaine rest vpon hill building faire freestone citie consederate sweitzer cantones strictly berna hath defended freedome citizen profession reformed religion many yeeres great courage pietie many misery practises subduethem pretended rightes bishop duke sauoyes ambition hatred beares reformed religion lower part thereof north side lie close south side lake little hauen gallies haue built keepe free passage lake side strong fort riuer rhodanus comming lake enters citie runnes lower part thereof hauing two bridge passage duke sauoy hath long watched surprize citie possesseth east side lake citie carefull suffer build gallies thereupon vpon least rumour building armeth gallies burne therefore way sauoy lying vpon east south east side citie plaine betweene hilles mountaines citie hath built fort little circuit great strength fortification earth musket shot without walles vpon way therein continually keepes garrison farre thence riuer arba flowing easterne mountaines doth beyond citie fall rhodanus south gate publike churchyard buriall hospitall pest house without walles side within walles pleasant walke vpon hilles old pillar erected inscription emperour caesar aurelius antoninus pius foelix aug greatest bishop tribunall power consull c west side citie without walles little mountaines lying farre distant might seeme dangerous encamping enemy saue one side compassed territorie berne confederate citie side riuer rhodanus enemy passage difficult citie old repaired emperour aurelius iulius caesar make mention citie first booke gaules warre antiquitie thereof cannot doubted great contentment speake conuerse reuerent father theodore beza stature something tall corpulent big boned long thicke beard white snow graue senatours countenance broad faced fat generall comely person sweete affabilitie grauitie would haue extorted reuerence least loued walked church giuing attention speech happened church porch touched poore man box finger reuerend man soone perceiued errour hauing vsed italy dip finger towards holy water according manner papist lest omitting small matter generally vsed might make suspected religion bring danger greater consequence like sort touch poore man box mistaking font holy water say hee soone perceiue errour taking hand aduised hereafter eschew ill customes hardly forgotten taken counsell friend safe mee goe right way geneua paris great experience disswaded iourney could dangerous peace scarsely concluded countrey full band souldiers returning owne home councell found good experience mother fooles perceiued obstinately purposed passe france england aduised mee rather passe france dukedome loraine time free tumult warre whose councell thought good follow returne strassburg germany almost way came thus noone left geneua rode day foure mile morgen second day morning rode two houres space losanna fiue houres space milden payed eight batzen dinner horsemeate dinner foure howers finding consort iourney france admonished honest gentleman citie iourney would bee dangerous mee respect armie broken vp france would bee full part scattering troopes souldiers returning owne home perceiued obstinate purpose passe france england perswaded mee least sell horse goe foote said bootie good horse would surely cause mee bee robbed might perhaps let passe quietly foot disguised poore apparrell seeing mee well mounted would surely set vpon twenty one kill aswel rob france commonly kill rob would imagine mee bee souldier either king leagers side case owne side would kill feare forced restitution aduerse part would thinke mee well killed enemie besides marshal kingdome ende ciuill warre vsed seueritie iustice suppresse disorder would surely kill mee lest complaine whereas passed foote like either let mee goe peace least bee content money without offering violence mee would iudge bee base condition counsell approued howsoeuer vnwillingly sold horse sixteene french side iland built vpon pillar wood repaired yeere adorned bricke house two bridge iland old ioyned vniuersitie since time ende ciuill warre new bridge hath lately built side iland lye towards northwest denis protecting saint french two little mile distant paris hither went passing gate saint denis lying towards north east thence passed vpon way paued flint large plaine towards east hauing mount rest mocked beene wise onely foolish forced pray vnto iupiter another like shower wherein wetted himselfe also chusing rather haue loue foolish neighbour foole dispised onely wise doubt many thing wee must follow opinion common people better regarding onely men foolish alone wise say aforesaid cause change mind could make vndone done least resolued desist course onely gaue one hundred pound receiue plaine betweene highest mountaines passing plaine shewed v vpon high mountaine high could scarce discerne thing shewed though great bignesse say shewed v statua emperour maximiltan proportionable body great crucifix erected vpon occasion one day hunted wandring company lost himselfe hope get thick wood high mountaines appeared man said good angell led wilde vast wood till came safetie vanished away memorie whereof say emperour erected monument citie inspruck cathedrall church thereof sepulcher said emperour many image partly brasse partly marble erected inspruck archduke austria eight brasse erected archdutchesses among sepulcher philippina citizen daughter augsburg archduke ferdinand lately buried lying chappell without sepulcher erected tooke wife coucnant say child inherit archduke austria hence wee rode afternoone betweene mountaines descending italy lying towards south sunne foure mile halfe pleasant way lueg fifth day passed mountaine bremer rode two mile halfe sterzen subiect cardinall brixia one family archduke austria inspruck mountaine bremer dutch mile high yet nothing steepe way augsburg venice part pleasant vallyes middest mountaines winding ouer mountaines passage easie brother henrie falling sicke delt carrier paying three guldins halfe common charge company supper would stay v till next morning likewise obtained consort ease diet carrier charge sixth day rode three mile village farre distant brixia said cardinall held court way woody mountaines dinner rode three mile said cardinal territorie mountaines hilles planted vine lying towards south sunne clausy seuenth day rode foure mile straight way betweene rockes pleasant orchard pomgranats italian fruites lying side dutch call pozen dinner began leaue alpes backe rode three mile newmart wood austria inspruck hath officer gather tribute belonging cardinall madrucci lame arme foote reputed eloquent hath priuiledges citie administration iustice otherwise command citie belongs family madrucci gentleman dinner entered mountaines againe wee walked ouer way paued flint dutch call plat leade horse hand way slipperie rode one long dutch mile bersena ninth day rode three long mile bergo meane dutch mile companion dutch reckon way owne mile day wee passed infamous place robbery especially one way leade wooddie mountaines see theeues selues safetie hauing meanes come v plaine couered snow horse vpto saddle therein could hardly passe high way dinner rode two long dutch mile griguo tenth day rode two dutch mile primolano first village state venice foresaid confines empire place territorie belonged diner gentleman neither subiect empire state venice liuing free onely acknowledging hold land archduke austria also beyond primolane subiect state venice fort built betweene narrow passage two mountaines fort little hangeth ouer high way built side mountaine fort kept dutch souldiers hath gate goe forth must let downe rope enter must like sort drawne vp moreouer dinner rode venice know turkes much lesse christian carry armes except goe iourney ignorant howsoeuer christian may defend themselues theeues high way yet hard distinguish betweene turkes violent extortion iniuries ianizares high way flatrobberies theeues whosoeuer draw sword knife men turke scoffing defpising sure die ill death publike iustice notwithstanding know man carrying armes could haue patience endure therefore since turkes iournying great troopes sufficiently armed theeues euents vnfaithfull fellow souldiers christian ioining excepting ianizares soeuer make shew feare theeues may seeme better deserue wage yet haue seldome neuer beene assaulted reason wee left sword venite reason would tedious vrge chose rather vnarmed armed suffer iniuries cannot auoided selfe brother henry died yeere moneth iuly spent foure hundred eighty pound sterling iourney england ierusalem thence haleppo particular iourney death constantinople returne england say spent lauishly let know dearest brother death necessary stay thereupon desperate sickenesse fell vpon griefe much increased said expences adde pressed misery spent money brought purse suffered great losse money taken vpon exchange paid england weake sickenesse forced much increase charge taking seruant wait vpon extraordinary mischiefes god deliuer vndertake iourney yet deceiued ordinary burthen seeme enough heauy returne relation iourney mariner fashion goe sea affirme set sayle presently merchant passenger may bring good board done easily take againe though ship long delay goe last hauen therefore wee kept good lodging still inquiring scriuano dwelt hard v professed seriously hee would take shippe next day presently shipped prouisions friday aprill new stile yeere together patron master went aboard patron returned night venice lodged ship patron anno monethspast promised brother set chest vpon rest aboue hatch hard sterne shippe great wee commodity set place couered ouer head open side towards prowe place close end lying doore patron cabbin slept laid priuate good place seemed pleasant fit rest since couered raine wind blew commonly vpon sterne sea sayled commonly fore wind wind constant sea set season yeere sea time abiding hauens otherwise calme sea wind contrary yet summer time clime neere aequinoctial line could receiue hurt rather pleasure coolenesse besides thus parted mariner free louse filthinesse wherewith frenchman consort much annoied slept vnder hatch rather wore woollen stocking wee silke drawne ouer linnen slept apparell doublet linnen breech stocking doublet lined taffetie wherein louse cannot breed harbour howsoeuer wore one doublet till returne england yet found leaft vncleanlinesse therein giue leaue ioy good fortune common sort speake namely taffety lining doublet greene colour cotten growing like cabbage two foote high yeelding round apple gather cotten cotten sowed april gathered september great quantity thereof carried hence europe ramma brought house pilgrimes vse lodged ramma old great strong time fit lodge beast men say house ioseph arimathia others say nicodemus house fountaine water court yard walke roomes full dust hardly got straw lie vpon yet marble ruines building shewed haue beene faire house maronite christian brought v victual sold v pound bisket sixe meidines twelue egs one meidine cheese one rice two two english quart wine fiue salet one twelue cake hauing leauened bread foure meidines layman gaue v sixe zechines friar fiue hand interpreter giuen subasha tribute rather safe conduct know fauour done friar especially minister belonging monastery committed ordering expences one franciscan friar best experience may interpreter restored friar money part sure eies see pay much one name subasha brought v present flaggons medicinall drinke made cooling hearbes sold tauernes sell wine iointly gaue fiue meidines watchman appointed keepe doore protect v wrong man great stature called goliah walked night gate sing rather houle hoarce voice continually write onely due one zechine subasha another captaine arabian twenty fiue meidines cafar tribute half zechine muccaro let ass pilgrimes guide deceiues christian rest sure guide experience deliuers christian many iniuries offered arabian others fauour cannot sufficiently require deale sparingly complaines guardian monastery ierusalem neuer suffers sent away discontented neither want power himselfe deceiue christian pleasure beare mind ramma iointly gaue one zechine muccaro hired ass fourth iune hauing onely conduct v tooke ioutney day towards ierusalem thirty mile distant meane italy rode day muccaro warned v silent lest waken arabian turkes thecues slept like awaked offer v violence least extort money v arabian vnlike wild irish subiect great turke yet poore farre distant imperiall seat cannot brought due obedience much lesse abstaine robbery rode ten mile see vpon hill farre distant right hand ruines house pallace good thiefe crucified sauiour ruines yet remaine shew house old stately built house good thiefe beene man dignity banished robbing passenger brought magistrate hand beene condemned death hence city ierusalem mountaines rockes doe continually rise higher higher till come city way hitherto hauing beene pleasant plaine rich corne pasture mountaines passed seemed stony barren yeelded fragrant hearbes excellent corne growing betweene great stone vallies pleasant vally hieromia thinke prophet old built stately church stood little ruined neere pleasant fountaine passenger vse drinke water ass say said prophet borne place old called anatoth said excellent corne growes betweene great stone mountaines rockes neither destitute vine many fruites said valley hieromy certaine arabian seemed mower corno flew vpon v like fierce dogges yet muccaro sent away content gift bisket like sort another narrow passage mountaines paied meidines cafar neuer demanded v content money paied ramma vpon high rocke see ruines castle modon machabees buried wediscended modon valley terebintho called tree bearing black fruit like oliue yeelding kind oyle passed ouer torrent bridge stone david goliah place famous victory dauid goliah two mile ierusalem yet hauen wanted little perishing happened spachi horseman vnder great turkes pay riding swiftly crossing way suddenly turned towards v speare rest horseman carry speares buckler like amadis gaule rushed vpon v might grace god speare lighting pannell asse neuer hurt frenchman rider much astonish v till muccaro enquiring cause violence said doe dogges light foot honour mee passe heard knew must learne vertue beast rode presently tumbled ass stirrops knotted rope bended body neither therein basely wisely woe christian resists turke especially souldier beares iniury hand one mile ierusalem sec large ruines west side city old city village somewhat noone fourth iune entered ierusalem vpon west side gate ioppa written iaffa giaffa zaffa diuers nation gate staied till two friar like retreat wherein priest sect wiues child family doe lodge eate performe rite religion haue one dore streete enter church goe forth foresaid onely dore church towards south key dore kept turkes open set time admit stranger euery weeke let frier returne monastery receiue new frier church sent thence performe feuerall rite religion dore hath grate little window inclosed frier may talke friend without receiue meate sent monastery nine sundry sect christian haue monastery within city nine sect christian great turke officer haue great profit turkes selues repute monument place holy christ life frequented monument death like despise keepe onely profit said monastery frier weekely sent performe seuerall rite weekes end recalled monastery new sent place custome thinke take iewes dauid diuided twentie foure family sonnes aaron twentie foure course might one due order performe holy office temple iosephus writes course family order one liued temple sabbath sabbath performe duty nine christian sect hath priuiledges keepe monument within citie field place performe rite religion according number sect maintaine nine lampes continually burning foresaid common church vpon stone vnction many vpon sepulcher many vpon mount caluarie nine sect thus called frank namely italian georgian greekes sorians costi abissines armenian nestorian maronites religion frankes namely papist well knowne omit referre due place onely say haue keeping frankes sepulcher chappell parition therein pillar whipping one altar vpon mount caluarie performance rite georgian warlike nation inhabiting medium caspian mountaines georgian haue name saint george haue chosen protecting saint haue king making warre valiantly sometimes vpon turkes sometimes vpon persian could neuer bee conquered either yea bee oppressed either easily finde helpe mutuall hatred therfore pay tribute turkes singular priuiledge freely enter ierusalem armed banner displaied neither dare turkes offer least iniurie lest returne home reuenge vpon turkes lying neare woman warlike like amazon carrying bowes shew valour countenance behauiour men weare long haire head beard saue shauen like clerkes vpon crowne head layman fouresquare priest round forme expresly follow religion rite ceremony greekes diuine seruice vse greeke tongue otherwise speaking owne language thinke caldean church ierusalem haue keeping mount caluary altar built ouer place say crosse christ stood citie keepe house high priest anna greekes religion must speake large due place onely greekes say church keepe chauncell therein shew hole pauement compassed marble say middle point world opinion argued obiected earth round globe center middest center outside imaginarie placed wheresoeuer measurer also measuring manner outside earth palestina farre distant equinoctiall line diuideth world equall part palestina iust vnder line yet country hauing meridian middest world well palestina answered dauid saith psalmes middest world worke saluation replied middest world taken face sight world none able denie whereupon grew angry said scripture must beleeued spite cosmographer philosopher vaine dispute one learned man among greekes ierusalem say truth except greeke ilands vnder venetian haue learned men part neuer found vast empire ottoman learned greeke onely one called milesius made patriarke constantinople greekes point follow literall sense scripture cause also beleeue corporall presence christ sacrament whereas saint paul saith let bishop husband one wife c interpret priest wife die within dayes mariage yet may neuer marry againe sorians called syria prouince liue hauing owne serians patriarke neither could euer bee brought consent roman faith whatsoeuer romanes challenge due seat peter say rather belongeth respect saint peter bishop anttoch agreed greekes many thing denie purgatorie fast foure lent yeere permit priest marrie vse greeke tongue diuine seruice otherwise speake owne language take arabian hither place still third yeere vse changed friar called family frankes great turke permit french liue forbids comming spanish roman friar yet part sicily naples rome denying countrey affirme venetian knowne subiects spaine rome incurre great danger indeed venetian time two frenchman liue aimes merchant east religion part italian especially venetian yet hath monastery also rent land giuen old sicily spaine thence bring euery third yeere first arriuall present great value turkish ottoman said formerly old venetian yeerly sent gally carry pilgrimes holy land till christian oppressed exaction halfe mile distant hauen way sandy hauing many garden side way shew pillar fastned vpon hill sand say sand inchanted lest grow ouerwhelme city likewise shew pillar vnder say great multitude scorpion like sort inchanted old wasted territory thinke pillar taken away city would destroied sand scorpion length city somewhat passeth bredth lieth south north seated vpon side hill cut nature conueyes thereof plaine tripoli old yeeld two hundred thousand crownes yeerely count thereof historian write soeuer old trafficke tripoli part remoued damascus haleppo yet city tripoli still yeelds foure alexandria aegypt seated vpon one mouthes riuer nilus douecote also cairo babylon farre within land aegypt another douecote much concernes merchant haue speedy newes commodity arriuing assured mee tumult subasha city vsed great seuerity towards restraining drinking wine keeping harlot one hundred seditious ianizaries drowned heuen rest daily sought punished moreouer halil basha admirall turkey
