high mountaines ouer vntilled plaine seeing one village much least house way last comming little shade figtrees rested heate day fed vpon victual muccaro rest gaue meate beast three clock afternoone went forward like way late euening came village neere lodged open field pleasant plot grasse neere banke riuer planted tree vpon sunday wee rose early two howers space passed promontory sea turning towards land wee passed wilde vntilled hilles plaine field noone rested vnder shaddow bramble refreshing selues meate sleepe giuing meate ass three afternoone wee went forward passed castle hus say iob dwelt say possessed french kingdome ierusalem hus also passed monastery saint george possessed christian frier seated pleasant valley yeelding tree fig oliues towards euening incamped may terme open field foot high mountaine say iob old possesse territorie farre hence way leading damascus citie called hemp old called hus christian inhabitant day call citie iob valley far distant valley hus turkes haue built mosche church citie thinke built vpon ruines house wherein iob dwelt body carried hence constantinople others obiect according scripture iob could dwell write hee dwelt among idumeans robbed sabeans dare affirme dwelt dare boldly say know socretes euen two thing whereas knew one first arabian day make excursion part robbing carauans goe haleppo tripoli iob aliue hundred thousand head cattell like rob place secondly know passed sad night place neuer need iob patience happened one woman leader carauan vse haue attendance lighting fire make ready supper chance sparke flame brake stone wherewith compassed set drie hearbs field fire neglected first spread selfe great compasse whereupon gouernour prouince dwelling vpon mountaine beholding field fier sent v one ianizary armed onely cudgell fell vpon men carauan hundred number beating cudgell till fell vpon fier vpper long garment vse weare extinguished meane time selfe brother went aside lying sight aduantage high ground betweene v wee astonished see one man armed onely cudgell beate hundred men zantons priest armed sword many calliuers fire put thinking safe ioyned selues company againe soone espied errour ianizare droue v like many calues appeare gouernour satisfie damage time went slowly hee wheeled cudgell head cry wohowe rooe presently struck next brother selfe treated way giue reward would dismisse v gaue warning first run laughter see men thus driuen like beast commending selues honesty man first gaue warning struck presently assoone wee see gentleman pacified returned againe muccaro interpret word told seruants christian merchant good carauan thing doe offering reward would let v returne knew turk would take occasion oppresse v christian gouernor would haue dealt worse carauan perceiued christian thus often sled gaue said signe anger howsoeuer wee offered gift yet wee could otherwise escape blowes often returned pacified offering gift dismisse v last wee obtained giuing zechine dismissed wee lesse feare violence wee returned alone vnarmed place baggage lay going forward betweene hope feare last came safe thither hid selues til consort returne howers space returning told v chiefe carauan cause fire making paid ten piastri damage gouernour swore fire gone ouer mountaine plaine field corne hee would haue hanged v vpon highest tree top mountaine tragedy ended wee refreshed selues meate sleepe vpon monday early morning set forward spent eight howers ascending mountaine high way easie many turning mountaine selfe without manuring yeelded many wilde pleasant fruit seeming passe pleasantnesse best manured orchard vpon top mountaine met horseman army without feare violence offered v till vnderstood sent purge high way theeues armed launce shield short broad sword man would haue said knight amades de gaule neither vnprobable fiction came horseman asia since wee see mile tripoli bridge called bridge rodomont fountaine neere scandarona called amazon fountaine many like monument part wee passed foresaid high mountaine wee came large fruitfull plaine corne yet vncutdowne refreshed selues beast meate resting neere fountaine turkes require better inne beast themselues fountaine cleere water dinner went forward plaine see village vast empire rare neere one village wee sit downe night supping resting open field vpon tuesday earely morning tooke iourny sixe howers passed plaine hauing much shaddow one tree came city aman scripture second king seuenteenth chapter called hamath three dayes iourney damasco hamath citie large circuit pleasantly seated vpon two hilles third hill castle hath nothing ruines hauing riuer running abounding orchard palmes fruitfull tree neere sixe village sight rested part day next night master carauan hauing businesse city neither imported lodged haue publike innes bed house cooke euery man buyes meate dresse end wee might ready goe early carauan morning v lodged poore house suburb selfe brother sleepe yard vpon owne quilt yard declining house bottome beast tied wee laid selues downe vpon top hill morning found selues tumbled downe foot ass camel could remember english innes without sighing citie hath great traffique aboundeth necessary sustaine life muccaro bought v sower curd vulgarly caled mish mash two meidines cheese sixe three hennes three meidines twenty egg foure meidines cucumers three milke fiue aqua vitae call harach drinke largely wine ten meidines foure pound wine one zechine bisket turkes haue bread cake baked harth thirty meidines thing prouided supper carry v way yet might haue bought buy thing way excepting wine bread hardly found must carried haue guide carauan detained businesse part next day wednesday meane time fortunately happened turkish basha returning traine gouernement goe way rested company freed v rest iourney feare theeues vpon wednesday afternoone setforward company basha iournied night plaine wherein shadow one tree eight clock next morning sit downe open field resting vnder ruines old walles ianizaries basha inquired curiously condition brother muccaro aduised v giue halfe piastro receiuing promised defend v iniury meane time swallow wine spent forced drinke water vsed vpon thursday three clock afternoone set forward midnight came citie marrha muccaro diuers others payed ten meidines cafar tribute citie gate man hanged chaines also next day see another impalled sitting rotting vpon stake fastned ground thrust fundament bowel vpon friday day wee set forward passing stony barren way full walnut tree vpon many bird sit sing wee came foure houers space hospitall call caon stately built stone round forme arch round courtyard vnder arch seuerall company chose place eate rest must doe vpon ground except bring table bed neither victual sold dressed euery man bought victual village adioyning dressed manner friday foure afternoone wee went forward riding night vpon saturday early morning sleepe hower open field meate giuen beast going forward came noone day nine twentie iune haleppo iune pope new stile haue followed hitherto company italian frier famous citie haleppo english merchant liuing three house colledges entertained brother mee george dorington consul english led v house wherein liued merchant courteously entertained v plentifull diet good lodging friendly conuersation refusing take money entertainement howsoeuer wee brought onely bill exchange one hundred crownes yet complained perceiued would serue turnes hee freely lent v much vpon owne credit yea brother death selfe fell dangerously sicke forced goe part could recouer health men doubted returne england yet lent farre greater summe vpon bare word howsoeuer duly repayed comming england yet confesse cannot sufficiently acknowledge loue mee noble consideration poore afflicted stranger citie haleppo said haue name halep signifies milke prouince fruitfull word aleph chiefe citie syria haue called old aram sohab mentioned second samuel eight chapter third verse least built farre ruines thereof trafficke place exceeding great good asia easterne ilands brought hither cayro egypt portugal found way east india venetian french merchant turkey company london time richest silently enioying safety profit trafficke vnderstand wrote trafficke east indie nothing little knowne english flemmings city lie within land port whereof called alexandretta christian scanderona turkes shall hereafter describe building city house syria like ierusalem one roofe high plaine top plaistered walke vpon arch house vnder walke dry keepe shop ware city nothing lesse well fortified pleasantly seated hauing many sweet garden aire hot thought supped hot broth drew subtile christian comming hither scanderona vnhealthfull place hauing aire choaked fen continually fall sicke often die cause english factor imployed seldome returne england twentieth man scarcely liuing till prentiship may trade himselfe christian turkes christian cost drinke excellent wine white wine grow territory red wine brought mount libanus moreouer thing diet sold cheape rate indeed turkes want good meat good cooke dresse english merchant beare witnes part yeeld sheepe whereof taile one wreathed ground doth weigh thirty pound fat wooll one city gate shew sepulcher saint george turkes maintaine lampes continually burning among christian saint onely reuerence saint george garden suburbes see serpent wonderfull bignes report male serpent young one killed certaine boyes shee serpent obseruing water boyes vsed drinke poyson many boyes died thereof citizen thereupon came kill seeing lie face vpward complaining heauens reuenge iust touched superstitious conceit let alone finally serpent liued many age incredible yeeres moreouer shew well neere city report chest treasure old cast might seene passenger attempting take assaulted affrighted diuels city selfe brother henry lay sicke day helpe iew physician soone recouered health feare wanting money especially desire returne home wee made great haste beginne iourney constantinople would haue expected eight day cassenda call troope horseman guarding great turkes treasure time goe constantinople whose company wee might safely swiftly haue performed iourney namely sixeteene day whereas followed slow pace cammels scarcely arriue thirty day prouince extreamely hot time summer wee scanted money long iourney mention longer staying vnpleasing v moreouer master george dorington neuer named without mention loue respect time send carauan camel loaded good constantinople make present cady returning gouernement constantinople would take carauan protection passe company louingly making offer v recommend v like sort good cady easily perswaded take iourney presently company seruants curteous english merchant called master iasper tyant goe constantinople conclusion proued greatly losse sir iohn spencer merchant london whose good master dortngton sent v brother dying way great turke heire christian stranger dying empire turkes either thought fraudulently pretended good belonged brother tooke great turkes storehouse kept till vniustly extorted good summes money master dorington besides great losse sustained seruants camel hired vaine enter iourney hired seuenty one piastri camell carry victual ambling mule brother horse selfe much presently gaue hand muccaro couenant pay meat beast moreouer presently laid one hundred twenty piastri diuers necessary namely two long chaires like cradle couered red cloth hang two side camell chaires turkes vse ride sleepe downe slumber horse bridle tied legges one v course walking v keepe v iniuries awaken v last camel passed lest left pray theeues hauing two hundred camel carauan sort passe sleepy houres morning till seuen eight clocke time vsed pitch ourtents rest moreouer greatly afflicted v spending morning till ten eleuen clocke pitching tent preparing meat eating time rest extreme heat noone day pierced tent man think would become sickly brother case vpon friday first iuly towards euening wee tooke vp tent supping muccaro loaded beast rode ouer mountaines night next morning againe pitched tent neere poore great fen vpon eastside mountaines situation make naturally strong first wretched perceiued imminent danger deare brother death neuer suspected til day much lesse iust cause feare turke carauan piastro euery time brother descend camell ease himselfe wee ride horseman hee come behind camel set forward selfe twice night towards morning left horseman rode back brother know fared hee gaue mee answere returned horseman thinking slept towards morning afflicted wonted desire sleepe thought howers rest worth king ransome therefore selfe master iasper tyrant louing consort rode good pace village byland byland pitch tent might make thing ready receiue within short space muccaro running tent telling hee left brother ready giue vp last breth first house village seemed say goe quickly hang thy selfe possible speede ran house imbraced dying brother confounded sorrow vnderstood mouth farre euents night iourney contrary hope whereas selfe aduised leaue mule lie chaire vpon camel backe told shaken piece hard pace camell whereas offered muccaro halfe piastro time hee light ease himselfe told mee often asked fauour muccaro could neuer obtaine excusing himselfe feare left behind carauan prey theeues whereas camel hinder part higher fore part laied brother head towards hinder part raised high could pillowes clothes better ease happened ignorant way could foresee night ascending mountaines foot farre higher head whereupon told part night lien trance cause could answer time came inquire health thus mischiefe lighted vpon mischiefe make wretched state miserable vse many word case remembrance whereof mind abhorreth therefore say word deere brother henry vpon munday fourth iuly old stile yeere lord age seuen twentieth died iuly anno armes many louing speech expressing great comfort diuine meditation turkes presently snatched thing belonging great turke yea selfe cast shirt many thing good value whatsoeuer could see tent turkes hand man halfe wit could indure see nothing might renew bitter remembrance turkish officer great turkes name seazed vpon good sir iohn spencer master dorington sent v belonged brother neither could released without great bribe contrary proued presently sent english factor lying scanderona scarcely obtained paying fiue zechines haue brother body buried open field besides ianizares turkes moore came seuerall swarmes miserable case threatning hinder buriall dig vp hee buried except would satisfie insatiable extortion foresaid english factor taken vpon satisfie people taken vp purse full zechines cast among rage surely part willingly giuen selfe prey one thing aboue measure afflicted thinke iob himselfe could haue suffered namely selfe brother last imbraces mournefull speech rascall multitude turkes moore ceased girne laugh sighes teares neither know heartstrings brake desperate affliction sure day neuer enioied former health houre first old age towards euening fourth day iuly descended said english factor taking care haue baggage carried mountaines towards scanderona scanderona little distant fro place furthest northerne part vally vpon seashore hence iasper tyant louing consort misery returned back haleppo selfe knowing resolue hauing power thinke disposing selfe remained scanderona english factor house next night lay waking heard multitude woolues thought howling vpon mountaines byland seated cilicia called caramania compassed three side fenny plaine fourth side lie vpon sea way haleppo remember towards east plaine fountaine cleare water mile distant village howsoeuer water falling fen vnwholsome yet goodnes fountaine much prized merchant vse carrie meate thither eate vnder pleasant shade farre fountaine stand old castle foote mountaines call castle penthesilea queene amazon constantinople like fenny plaine lie mountaines though remote doe barre sight sunne boggy earth yeelding ill vapour make scanderona infamous death christian side asia lesse stretcheth selfe sea towards west next shoare thereof pleasant village called bias old called tarsus tarsus saint paul borne sixe mile scanderona seated prouince cilicia abounding fruit silkewormes al thing necessarie sustaine life scanderona south side towards palestina also compassed like fenny scanderona plaine farre large side finally west side towards sea italy safe hauen furthest part mediteranean sea towards east sea prophet ionas cast preserued miraculously whale part cast vpon shoare say owes sea doe much increase malignitie aire yet sea men vse sleep ship seldome come land till sunne risen aboue mountain hiding hath drawne vp ill vapour foresaid mountaines cilicia held part mount taurus scythia called caucasus part amanus haue formerly said part neere equinoctiall line haue seldome raine earth commonly moistned dew falling sunneset staied great tempest fell thunder haile raine vpon seuenth august raine fall drop pailefuls wee reade falles much violently towards west india neere equinoctiall line violent thing perpetuall tempest soone passed shortly came vnhappy village scanderona griefe mind cast great sicknesse perfect health passed many kingdomes europe time flower age first began wax old sicknesse brought first weakenesse body second proceeding another griefe returne england tooke mee thought youthfull pleasure demonstratiuely taught poet truly said cura facit canos care maketh grayheaded languished lasting sicknes hapned vpon occasion looked vpon two testimony giuen brother self ierusalem hauing little astonished see time cut skin parchment written hand inck yet brother part eaten wormes mine altogether vntouched wonder day testimonie giuen brother eaten wormes time mine still remaines vnperished foresaid sicknesse vehement long men doubted would neuer recouer friend england heard brother death aduertised within weekes selfe also dead part though nightly dreames walking caues sepulcher italy might haue somewhat discouraged though phisitian barbersurgean ship yet could neuer doubt recouering health minde still presaged returne home yet diuers time began presently heate clime ill aire place cast downe againe resolued follow counsell perswaded trie aire sea would strengthen therefore deare friend master george dorington hauing sent one hundred zechines expences great summes money spent accident brother death sicknesse particular expence omit griefe weakenesse minde note onely taste remembring paid piastro day poore man continually cooled heate fan master dorington say hauing sent money hauing prouided necessary octo iourney last vpon thursday tenth october new stile yeere carried aboard french ship marsiles partly helpe porter partly boate weake could stand ship called iohn baptist christian name master simon couenanted paying thirtie piastri duckets selfe seruant set v land good hauen iland candia possible chiefe citie thereof called candia lying north side iland whence resolued take iourney constantinople leauing thought going land vpon friday eleuenth october sayled prosperously windes grew contrary driuen south candia therefore french marriners murmuring v hereticks causing ill passage hope left windes set v land candia chiefe citie master ship sent v boat marriners hee least esteemed might sayle land fiftie mile distant thus vpon thursday three twentieth october hauing sayled eight iland candia howers great danger towards euening landed vnder promontory candia neither citie village house cottage plenty raine falling night yet forced lie open boat companion seruant knowing danger slept soundly selfe durst neuer close mine eye fearing lest marriners marsilians time little loued english offer v violence gaine good consort seruant mine english man profession cooke come part serue master sandy sent london english consull haleppo passed constantinople thither died asia minor disease whereof brother died moneth seruant master death returne england tooke attend mee might company auoide solitude mittigate part sorrow sooner entered french ship presently fell sicke able serue himselfe could giue expected comfort much lesse doe seruice greatly increased charge spending vpon purse much troubled hauing himselfe least skil forraine language recouering till came venice among christian small vse helpe hee rather burthen comfort enter french ship laid prouisions hennes egges damaske prune thing languishing stomack desiring able digest salt meate prouisions fell share sicke seruant self nothing skin bone one languished consumption bloud humour renued salt meates could weaken future health hauing alwaies leane decay naturall heate became fat hauing lost retentiue faculty stomack continually cast lay vpon soone morning came aire remedie weakenesse taking tobacco french marriners brought v shoare candia parted v friday twenty fiue iuly new stile early morning iland candia well rewarded paine first shewed aboue wilde rockes called calisminiones monastery greek three mile distant called santa maria ogidietra left alone staying fasting till noone last espied called v two men passing vpon mountaines thinking v bee pirats fled away fast could presently behold man comming wood bringing asse hee found perswaded lay baggage beast walke softly towards monastery willingly tried strength leaning vpon two sword want staffe yet often falling went forward like snaile till despairing going fell vpon ground howers space shepheard passing shewing gold naming monastery word vnderstood swiftly ran monastery telling monkes called greekes caloiri state condition presently sent seruant v italian tongue telling v great danger wherein staied vpon mountaines till night aduised v make haste monastery thus driuen feare incouraged company tried againe goe forward great trouble passed one mile ouer mountaines leaning said two sword vpon passage steepe mountaine reason lightnesse head creeping vpon hand feete great difficulty went farre able goe saue life behold boy came water assears fountaine adioyning seruant monkes gaue piastro whether would tooke asse set vpon last wee passed two mile longer three english mile came monastery caloiri monkes receiued v curteously gaue v victual namely pomegranate oliues bread sharpe wine good meates sicke men hauing fasted almost two dayes also conferred louingly v still desiring v keepe aloofe bed time gaue v straw mat lay vpon plastred floare bed better prouided matterasses quilt owne though lying vpon ground yet slept soundly safety italian regard clime curious receiue stranger time plague appoint chiefe men office prouiding publike health calling place meete office health also without city especially state venice haue publike house called lazaretti part pleasantly seated whether passenger merchant good must first ariuall retire till prouiders health haue curiously inquired come suspected place haue infectious sicknesse haue thing necessary abundance may conuerse talke man till obtaine grant free conuersation called la prattica man speake must inclosed house stay fortie dayes triall health triall called farla quarantana moreouer goe land italy must bring testimonie health called boletino passe conuerse venetian curious vsing triall plague know reason except bee citie constantinople seldome neuer free plague whence many ship come mysterie good traffick commonwealth lye hidden vnder pretence custome man dare enter citie conuerse till haue gotten license prouisors neither dare merchant dispose good till brought house searched officer see cause preface make iland candia subiect venetian prior monastery would sort giue v free conuersation till letter wee signified state prouisors health residing chiefe city candia til send answere backe vnto v meane time shut v vp garden house plesant walkes store orange like fruites country people bringing v partridge many good thing eate man hauing skill dresse monkes furnishing v necessary wee could otherwise buy wanted conuentence make time abode seeme shorter onely good bed thus forced write following letter italian tongue send messenger candia chiefe city allillustrmo excellmo sigr il sigr nicolao donati proueditore inquisitore generale nel regno di candia mio offerumo sa sigria illustrma se degna intendere chio fynes morysoni inghlese con vnmio luome si siamo partiti li tre di questo mese dalessandretta per venira la volta di candia et che quelpaese tutti contorni sono sani come porta la mia patente netta sigillata colsolito sigillo di san marco il patrondella naue francese chi di la e imbarcato non mantenendoci la suoa parola di metterci terra qualche buona villa di questa isola ci mando con la suoa fregata calisminiones doueti lasciosoletti di la con grandisagio domandando la strada da villani arriuammo vinti cinque del presente san maria ogidietra doue frati finche conoscano la volonta di vostra eccellenza non ci vogliono darprattica moda nessuno et quel mentre channo rinchiso vna casa parte il viaggio mio e di passarpiu inanzi fina constantinopoli per fatti dell illust mo ambasciatore dinghilterra il perche humilmente suplico che suoa eccellza se degna hauer rispetto vnpouero forestiero anche natiuo dvna natione molto affectionata la suoa et che per suoa gratia mi manda libera prattica accio che io possa seguitaril mio viaggio che di qua oltre il rincrescimento della solitudine anche ogni cosu mi da noia con questo assicur andomi che vostra eccellza haura compassione dvn suo seruitore con disagi grandissimi per mar per terra battuto priegho iddio per l accrescimento del suo honore et le bascio humilmente le mani da san maria ogidietre ai vinti cinque dottobre vso nuouo l divos sigria illustma humilmo seruire fynes morysoni letter receiued following answere al molto magco sigr il sigre fy morysoni suo come fratello molto magco sigr come fratello per le vostre lettre scritte alli del presente al vso nuouo illmo sigr generali et da s s eccellza madate qui allofficio nostro habbiamo veduto il suo bisogno desiderando fauoriret agiutarla questaoccasione con il riguardo anco della salute pubca mandiamo duoi stradiotti per accompagnarla con il suo huomo et condurla di qua doue sara bentrattata li si dara commodita di poter con loccasione di qualche vassello seguitar il suo viazzo vsate prima le debite ca tele per assicuration delle cose di questo pero senza pratticar altrte seguitara questa guida che le mandiamo vegnera di qua con animo consolato di trouar christiani amici obedendo per adesso esseguendo l ordine da noi dato detti stradiotti come cirendiamo certi che fara et v c offeriamo di candia alli aottobre vso vecchio periera con essa la suoa fede sine patente div come fratlli li proueditori alla sanita letter follow translated english illustrious excellent lord lord nicholas donati generall preuisar inquisitor kingdome candia respected illustrious c excellency may please vnderstand fynes morison englishman seruant third moneth set saile alexandretta sayle candia part free infectious sickenesse appeares testimoniali sealed wonted seale saint marke master french shippe passed broke couenant land v hauen candia chiefe city kingdome sent v boate wild promontory calisminiones landing leauing v place altogether disinhabited thence asking way countrey people much trouble last come monastery saint maria ogidietra vpon fiue twenty present new stile frier till may know pleasure excellency wil sort giue v liberty conuerse meane time haue shut v vp solitary garden house iourney lie constantinople affaire lord ambassadour england abiding wherefore humbly pray excellency vouchsafe haue fauourable respect poore stranger borne nation well affected excellency fauour licence may bee sent freely conuerse take iourney city candia since solitary liuing delay many thing place irksome vnto thus assuring selfe excellency haue compassion seruant tired many misfortune sea land beseech god increase honor humbly kisse hand san maria ogidietra fiue twenty october new stile yeere excellency humble seruant fynes moryson letter sent answere thus follow noble gentleman master fynes moryson deare v brother noble sir deare v place brother letter dated fiue twenty moneth new stile directed illustrious lord generall excellency sent office haue vnderstood request desirous fauour occasion due respect publike health haue sent two horseman shall guide seruant hither shall curteously receiued shall want opportunity barke finish iourney haue taken due order according office preseruing publike health therefore without conuersing man follow guide wee haue sent come hither cheerefull heart christian friend faile follow order haue giuen guide whereof doubt tender selues candia twenty october old stile yeere bring testimony health place brother prouisors health testimoniall aboue mentioned tooke venetian consull knew disease free infection parted alexandretta fore knowing necessity thereof foresaid two horseman arriued great curtesie sent conduct parted monastery goe company city candia eight thirty mile distant passe almost whole bredth kingdome middle part thereof bredth iland containes fiue forty mile length two hundred thirty mile circuit ortelius writes fiue hundred twenty others say six hundred seuen hundred mile ancient moderne writer reckoning diuersly iland distant cape otranto italy fiue hundred mile others write fiue hundred often iustly feared ianizare lesse either feare repentance sin shed abundance teares erylis old called heraclea famously knowne hauing seat greeke patriark many christian emperours left boat hired constantinople hauing found vnfit passage howsoeuer wee hired gallipoli yet marriner would remit nothing couenanted price hence gallipoli hired eight hundred asper greater barke called cayke second march notwithstanding rage windes waues set saile landed iland marmora fiftie mile sayle iland formerly marmora mention thereof formerly made let adde inhabited greek greek fearing lest ianizare maner would pay nothing necessary yong vnexperienced man carrying authoritie ianizares doe could get lodging diet house til last selues promising pay honestly al took receiued house wont slept vpon owne bedding hauing conuenient bed paied two egges one asper caponet fiue twentie asper fier fiue twentie asper vse house fiue twentie asper likewise place landed wee paied commonly sixteene asper mile found great ship venice anchor daring goe aboard night wee slept little boat fastened shoare little inconuenience rained night fourth march gaue ianizare guide three hundred twentie eight asper ship passenger suffered passe castle except bring pasport great turke chiefe visere basha vseth grant vnto thus ship without knowledge chiefe visere either passe castle leading mediteranean sea two castle aboue leading euxine sea noted e surely foure castle greatest strength constantinople sea said castle found venetian ship description constantinople noted letter w x commonly called castle gallipolis old noted letter w called sestos citie thrace faire hero borne dwelt noted letter x called abydos citie asia lesse leander dwelt famous loue hero castle diuided hellespont two mile broad least narrow leander said often haue swomme ouer beloued hero castle sestos specially seated fertile soyle nairo next adioyning towne yeeldes excellent wine necessary sustaine life plentifully howsoeuer ship ought vse bee staied three day yet faire winde blowing duty performed patron ship large gift officer sometimes obtaine leaue depart sooner say passenger pole payeth one zechine tribute perhaps belongs onely merchant selfe seruant english gentleman company hauing giuen betweene v one zechine substitute venetian bailiffe ambassador called dismissed vpon motion yet moreouer gaue fortie asper ianizare fiftie asper chiauslar fee office vnwholsome sleep aboue hatch ship time yeere though summer time made choice sleepe sailed venice ierusalem three namely selfe english gentleman seruant gaue v three zechines pilot partner cabin office hee proper himselfe castle ship patron master ship diet paid v rate fiue zechines halfe moneth well sea harbor passage ioyntly paid ten ducat venice still paid two part three expences besides wee brought v hundred egges vessell excellent wine palormo ambassadour constantinople gaue v vpon monday seuenth march old stile vsed turky christian others afternoone set sayle passed straight hellespont night sayled foresaid iland tenedos sea called pontus adiacent prouince asia lesse named pontus prouince containes tenedos colchis famous old merchant continually reside hauen zante commodious ship trade seaes vsing put harbor good diuersly transported thence vulgarly falsely esteemed natiue commodity iland hath scarce sixtie mile circuit mountaines round vpon seaside inclose pleasant fruitfull plaine hauen like halfe moone increasing chiefe towne called zante lie little plaine vpon innermost part thereof length building house two walles thereof castle gouernour called il podesta venetian inferiour magistrate dwell giue law people iland turkish pirats saint mauro morea hauing lately set vpon taken huge venetian ship lade seuenteene little barque pretious good thereof namely clothes gold damask grogerans value thousand thousand zechines report went setting ship fire tooke away marriners slaues time iland seuen turkish gallies lay vpon coast robbed venetian ship falling hand howsoeuer peace turkish ottoman yet ship durst stirre hauen whereupon hauing occasion send ship corne magistrate forced master english ship lying assaile though betweene england spaine war long time bin proclaimed contesting course iniurious yet could dismissed till gaue word ship assayle day night long lay hauen spanish ship long time vse giue billes exchange onely letter credit receiue set summes money large much traueller shall want third kinde receiuing money forraine part shall hereafter speake foresaid billes exchange shall lose fiue hundred yeere small quantitie bee made ouer shall lose rate fifteene hundred yeere ordinarily shall lose rate ten hundred yeere reason aforesaid vncertaintie receiuing money billes yeerely summe confesse frugall course first pay money home receiue beyond sea first receiue repay home would aduise make ouer money foresaid manner billes exchange withall carry letter credit abundant caution euents vpon crosse accident may rather incurre small losse money vnrecouerable losse time yet euen money taken letter credit reckoning time repaiment merchant vse exact greater gaine ten hundreth yeere especially honest men haue bond friendship traueller friend home confident repaiment without doubt arising either trauellers sicknesse friend ill keeping credit remaines adde somewhat generall experience rate selfe receiued money foresaid bils exchange letter credit first confesse negligent omission noting rate exchange whereof matter moment much repent reason reader must beare set downe briefly fit instruction england scotland ireland traueller shall haue many opportunity carry monies inspecie kind exchange without losse exchange england stoade hamburge germany vseth beare rate pound twenty shilling sterling receiue fiue twenty hamburge shilling sixe penny selfe deliuered forty pound england rate twenty foure hamburg shilling eight penny english pound rate imperiall doller solemne oath publike crosse prouince stedfast rebellion traytor sought pardon vsed insolent behauiour might well shew thought mindes subiects alienated english well religion gouernement could bring one hundred horse three hundred foote field vpon priuate reuenge would protest able serue state sixe horse foote euery actiue borderer solliciter rebel almost euery one greatest state rebell client concluding small assistance could promised irish howsoeuer queenes army great yet durst boldly say playster would doe couer wound dayes rest good part english force drawne together noble lord lieutenant gaue entrance first action progresse commonly receiueth kind ominous luster staine therein hee attempted head rebellion according aduise england queen expresse commaund induced counsell state aiming owne priuate interest publike good leade force rebel mounster tooke castle cahir belonging edward butler baron cahir making great prey rebel cattle part cast terror force weakest enemy scattered constrained flie wood mountaines hide themselues fifteenth iune lord lieutenant yet mounster iourney receiued aduertisement captaine imployed sea north spie tyrones action two ship lately come spaine put confidence tyrone went dungannon loughfoyle businesse brought onely munition treasure tyrone giuen force brian mac art sonne art mac baron hee might take pledge watch ouer neale mac brian suspected charged mac genis doe like ouer mac cartan also suspected possibilitie parley according instruction giuen lordship tyrone kept great pledge shane oneales sonnes iland within strong fastnesse yet neither gathered home receiued forraine part treasure tyrone odonnel agent iles scotland sollicite redshankes assist pay king spaine promised aide men would haue landed vlster port mounster galloway connaght scot daily carried munition trafficke might hindred two gallies oares ship vsing sayles could stop passage grosse northerne rebel vlster part connaght drawne together would nine thousand foote one thousand foure hundred horse confident draw warre length vnsupportable state england end odonnel hired masse redshankes cessed connaght mounster tyrone hauing deadly fewde left force resist english garrison sent thither blackewater ballinemoyree himselfe purposing meet english army wood ballinemoyree betweene dundalke newry hoped make best drop fall backe pleasure like vvhen shall come maiesties hand know whensoeuer hath honour giue leaue humbly beseech maiesty tell hauing passed prouinces lemster mounster vppon frontire connaght gouernour chiefe prouince dare begin giue maiesty aduertisement state kingdome hearesay beheld mine owne eye people generall haue able body nature haue gotten custome ready vse armes late success boldnes fight maiesties troopes pride value man themselues affection loue nothing idlenesse licentiousnesse rebellion haue end shake yoake obedience maiesty root remembrance english nation kingdome say people generall find onely greater part thus affected generall quarrell irish doe professe either false accompt made irish nobility lord countreys doe onely heart affect plausible quarrell diuided v religion haue especiall quarrell english gouernement limitteth tieth euer haue beene euer would absolute tyrant vnder sunne townes inhabited men religion birth rest carried away loue gaine furnish rebel thing may arme inable state themselues wealth kingdome consisteth cattle oatemeale victual almost rebel hand euery prouince till comming haue beene master field expectation rebel present confident spaine either inuade maiesty shall haue leisure prosecute succour get townes hand ere maiesty shall relieue reinforce army maiesty resolue subdue rebel force many framed souldiers warre force great costly long maiesty seeke breake faction amongst themselues couetous mercinary must purchased iesuites practising priest must hunted taken doe sodder fast close together maiesty haue strong party irish nobility make vse must hide purpose establishing english gouernement till strength irish broken shall see safety maiesties protection maiesty assured possession townes keepe supplying want rebel must haue garrison brought able command make capital offence merchant ireland trade rebel buy sell armes munition whatsoeuer good subiects may haue mony maiesties store shall appointed order may serue necessary defence whereas tradable rebel giue extreme excessiue price neuer bee kept maiesty secure realme danger inuasion assoone direct mannage maiesties intelligence giue notice preparation readinesse enemy must aswell waft vpon first allarum discent enroling training subiects charge maiesties owne cofers prouiding magazine neuer losse vsing may saue kingdome vse may haue old store sold well handled maiesties profit arming maiesties ship heare enemy armes sea agreeable owne prouident princely course pollicy prince state world returne ireland againe haue shewed maiesty danger disaduantages seruants minister shall doe meete withall great worke reducing kingdome well represent maiestie strength aduantages first rebel neither able force walled towne castle house strength keepe get maiesty keep army strength vigor vndoubtedly mistresse townes hold whatsoeuer meanes maiesty haue good minister wealth land shall drawne hand subiects soldier winter shall casefully lodged readily supplied want command maiesties force may make warre offen siue defensiue may fight safety occasion offered secondly maiesties horseman incomparably better rebel foot vnwilling fight battell grosse howsoeuer desirous skirmish fight loose maiesty may alwaies mistresse champion country best part kingdome thirdly maiesty victualling army england garrison burning spoyling countrey place shall starue rebell one yeere place el supply fourthly since warre made without munition munition rebell cannot haue spayne scotland owne townes maiesty still continue ship pinaces vpon coast pleased send printed proclamation vpon paine death merchant townesman subiect doe trafficke rebell buy sell sort kinde munition armes doubt short time shall make bankerout old store hope seaman keepe receiuing new fifthly maiesty hath rich store gallant colonel captaines gentleman quality whose example execution vse rest troopes whereas men best qualitie among rebel leader horseman dare neuer put themselues hazard send kerne hireling fight maiesties troopes although common souldiers hard new men yet able stand gallant men charge sixthly maiesties commander aduiled exercised know al aduantages strength order great fight beate rebel neither march lodge fight order benefit footmanship come goe pleasure make attend whole day still skirmishing neuer ingaging themselues hath euer fault weakenesse maiestis leader whensoeuer haue receiued blow rebel doe watch attend vpon grosle ouersights please maiestie compare aduantages disaduantages together shall finde though rebel number maiesties army haue though doe vnwillingly confesse better body perfecter vse armes men maiestie sends ouer yet maiestie commanding walled townes holdes champion country hauing braue nobilitie gentry better discipline stronger order mean keep queene much offended mounster iourny cast letter fault counsell ireland whose aduise reason long experience warres thought fittest follow first entry withal gaue maiesty ful assurance would presently leade army vlster tyrone himselfe yet letter scarce deliuered others signified necessity iourney ophalia leax neere dublin oconnors omores brake ease leading ophalia sending sir christopher blunt marshal leax men vnder command sir charles pearcy sir richard moryson returne taking view army found weakened letter signed himselfe counsell hee desired supplie foot england inable presently vndertake vlster iourney thus resolued march northward commaunded sir conyors clifford gouernour connaght draw force vp belike hee might force tyrone send force way assailed side sir conyers clifford accordingly marched way one thousand foure hundred foote pole earle southamptons troop one hundred horse vnder leading captaine iohn lephson irish horse comming curlew mountaines left munition carriage vnder guard horse til passing forward foote tried passage gone farre ororke rebel vpon aduantage wood bogges stony causey assailed men first valiantly repelled till rebel finding munition men beginning faile renewed charge greater fury time men discouraged want powder almost spent store behind carriage also wearied long march made skirmish began saint take themselues flight rebel pursued killed one hundred twenty place among gouernour sir conyers clifford worthy captaine sir alexander ratcliffe lost besides many hurt whereof greatest part recouered doubt rest perished horse valiantly succored lord dunkellyn day valiantly behaued himselfe sent word captaine iohn iephson distresse presently charged vpon causey skirt wood resolution rebel either thinking horse could haue serued expecting aduantages vpon boggy place stood gaping gaue way without resistance good space men leasure retire ouer ford plaine carriage thence abby boyle neere place afterwards rebel began charge horse powder almost spent captaine iephson safely retyred losse horse consultation earnest haue marched forward next day lord dunkellin sir arthur sauage captain iohn iephson many best iudgement considering gouernor lost troopes vtterly dismaied odonnel come downe force part thought fit men retire garrison captaine iephson night kept ford foote silent night retired morning safetie hee horse vnder command went softly castle athlone strange rebel present two hundred men old soldier defeate could giuen small accident militarie affaire often cause strange great euents haue heard mischance fully attributed vnorderly turning whole body van though toward enemy yet mistaken common souldiers flight caused generall rowte meane time foresaid supply one thousand foote sent england lord licutenant according counse request day lordship signified letter england could doe season yeere draw thirteene hundred foote three hundred horse border vlster whether came ides september tyrone two dayes together shewed himselfe troopes vpon distant hilles english tyrone sent hagan lord lieutenant intreat parly betweene lordship lordship refused answering tyrone would speak find next day armes head army next day light skirmish one tyrones horseman cried loud voice tyrone would fight would speake lord licutenant vnarmed withdrawne aside force next day lordship marched forward hagan met againe declared tyrone besought queenes mercy would vouchsafe speake one word granted would humblenesse attend lordship foard ballaclinch neere chiefe towne county louth lordship sent view foard found tyrone hee assured howsoeuer water something risen yet might easily heare one another side lordship come thither tyrone leauing troope horse vpon hill far came downe alone putting horse vp belly water al humblenesse vpon another could neuer haue assented could haue suspected haue beene vndertaken heard action therefore doe wonder answered seeing yourattempt capitall traytors countrey haue increased list true haue maketh warre v part minister seconding place attempt offered doth see course continued warres like spend v kingdome beyond moderation well report successe part hath blemished honour andincouraged others smal proportion know cannot much fayle iudgement vnderstand world seeth time dallied though thinke allowance counsell whose subscription ecchoes serue satisfie v would haue derided man else februarie lordship could effect since arriued ireland vntill twentie sixe moneth also army presently farre diuided greater part thereof earle ormond whensoeuer returned discharged company must presently bee reduced else many men armes bee meerely lost lord iustices lately found experience determining cast company one hundred fiftie pole hundred oldest best souldiers purpose next day deliuer captaines vpon diuulging thereof onely three whole company armes could found transmitted letter formerly written perswading two thousand might still continued pay lordship receiued following answere maiestie dated fifteenth march elizabeth regina although haue vpon earnest request whose affection duty doe repose trust confidence yeelded continuance fourteene thousand foot small time conceiue according reason giue good assurance plantation loughfoyle reduction lemster preuent present terror proud attempt tyrones passe ouer kingdome hath stricken heart subiects would increase presently haue abated number yet must welet know doe expect hand doe determine assoone present bruites passed shall diminish little little hereafter according first determination haue good proofe gouernement know discerne mischiefes seruice haue growne lacke discretion order vaine iournies whilst better opportunity haue beene lost vndiscreet carriage secret purpose placing captaines small merit experience aboue nourishing irish snake bosomes whilst hold doe conuert vpon selues experience strength haue gotten making souldiers therefore shall vnderstand although haue beene content grace noble house others haue drawne blood rebel charge company yet find growne common opinion good rebell subiect rebel find feele shall hired euen whole company pay onely forbeare harme hauing done seruice may make irreconciliable see others pay owne countrey farre seruice neighbour tarry shew chiefest meanes vnder hand helpe rebel powder munition small charge put hand vsed point therefore command henceforth bee considerate induced put pay spend treasure onely owne aduantage vpon supposition bragge must runne enemy entertained consider effect deriued charge haue many foote horse irish entertained onely saue owne cowes country opinion went armes rebel better seruice v saue treasure pay body seeing liue warre better doe peace intend nothing lesse seruice therefore command onely raise shall decaied keepe vnsupplied already waste casse band neuer allow entertainement whilst forced keep men seruice may keepe captaines vncassed giue warrant supply company irish doe also require doe seeke meanes possible irish entertained vse seruice farre owne country may wherein pray especially take care prouince connaght many irish band together rather draw serue else send english stead shall serue present answere dispatch wherein doe write know loue commandements directly point desire haue charge abated doe counsell together would haue apprehend seeing thinke opinion would good army shall soone abated hope wherein notwithstanding doe referre thing discretion trust charge men seeing haue committed whole kingdome c lordship second dispatch master secretary written tyrone hauing passed pale mounster one thousand fiue hundred horse foote sort many queenes worst men able encounter mounster army thousand reputation attended queenes army three thousand foote three hundred horse commaunded earle ormond onely dregges queenes army neare notwithstanding hoped bee able draw one thousand fiue hundred foote three hundred horse therewith make head tyrone returne regard plantation loughfoyle ballyshannon occasion seruice whereas thing left discretion hee would haue deferred plantation ballishannon time safety one thousand men munition bee sent thither would attend tyrone passage great aduantage likely purposed prosecute rebel lemster one thousand foote hundred horse lodge rest garrison vpon north sudden might diuert tyrone resisting present plantation loughfoyle hee would presently send thousand old souldiers dublyn loughfoyle likewise lie garrison ballishannon vnder command sir matthew morgan difficulty could yet setled yet lying loughfoyle meane time might doe seruice alwaies ready sent thither tyrones confederate discouraged fearefull retreat north could haue beene greater beene broken army vnreasonable dayes march hearing lord deputy drawing towards within one houre sitting downe presently rise againe seuen clocke night assaulted scattered band still marched leauing sword many men ingaged leauing leesing carriage almost euery day head rebel others sent many seruices late done therecouery prey garrison naas killing many rebel defeat one hundred forty rebel sir francis shane whereof forty fiue killed foureteene owne hand rebel lemster daily made meanes receiued mercy onely townes store rebel stood saucily vpon priuiledges sharpe rod strong hand requisite amend cause lordship aduised castle lymerik might repaired bridle town seemed importance city kingdome whatsoeuer dispairing rebel tirones cunning raised hope two ship lately come north spaine brought rebel munition either assurance great present succour tyrone least vsed comming purpose rebel beleeued aussrance giuen besides many priest came ship one termed himselfe pope legat leger ambassadour king spaine archbishop dublin giuing content suffer death preached dublyn michaelmas day whereupon rebel beganne auow themselues king spaines subiects onely expectation loughfoyle garrison together doubt succour kept pale boldnes professe lastly lordship vehemently complained maiesty absolute command disposed charge kingdome could neither pleasure owne friend reward maiesties best seruants yea hauing already giuen gouernement leax sir richard moryson friend confessed especially loue would vndertake beas worthy profession time queene kingdome lord letter signifying maiesties pleasure forced friend owne disgrace conferre place another conclusion besought maiesty recommendation leaue somewhat choice dismay subiects part briefely set downe sir george carey hauing newly receiued letter pattents bee lord president mounster resoluing presently repaire charge departed dublin iourny thitherward seuenth aprill vpon ninth came kilkenny earle thomond company one hundred horse attend earle ormond told appointed parley rebel part wherof owny mac rory chiefe desired accompany tenth aprill rode kilkenny twentie horse earle ormonds follower others mounted vpon hacknies lordship refusing haue lord president horse guard rode eight long mile place meeting earle ormond left company two hundred foot two mile short place rebell owny came wood fiue hundred men well armed leauing shot grosse troope calieuers shot distant earle came vp choise pike hower spent nothing concluded lord president moued earle returne would first speake iesuit archer rebel calling lordship reproued archer called traytor meane time grosse rebel crept ouer shrub compassed round earle companie lord president disliking prayed earle returne turned hackney rebel tooke prisoner owny mac rory laid hand lord president earle thomond rushing vpon horse made leaue hold escaped swiftnesse strength horse push many pike wherewith earle thomond slightly hurt backe treacherie said plotted owny archer others knowne many thought earle spy feared among rebel lordship would haue notice thereof either feare loue wanted others thought earle willingly surprised howsoeuer rebel hurt person onely one earles men slaine fiue hurt fourteene taken prisoner lord president one hundred horse attending sixe hundred foote sent mounster kept vnsetled humour part present tumult earles true follower wanting head ill affected standing awe power liberty countesse ormond much afflicted husband misfortune feare daughter estate diuers pretended heires earle sir edward butler brother respect bloud attainted sir walter butler earles nephew reason vicount mountgarret likely seeke haue earles sole daughter hand besides controuersies bred distracted humour among gentleman others part lord deputie hearing hereof presently dispatched sir george bourcher command chiefe sir christop saint laurence assist guarding countesse daughter earles house force appointed lord deputie seruice namely earles company foote foote company sir christopher saint laurence earles troope horse horse saint laurence sir george bourchers horse yet lord deputie conceiued earles surprise bee euill spetious materiall seeing reason counsel warre stagger vpon wel ill whereas opinion willingly taken would declare himselfe tyrone lordship resolued continued faithfull country might easily defended otherwise easily wasted since garrison planted loughfoyle part backe tyrone hee bee able spare force seruice whereas many thought newes would much amaze court england lordship contrary since neither lord president himselfe deserued imputation euent parley contriued without lord president priuity contriued executed without making himselfe acquainted therewith conceiued would make army better carefully seconded england whereas thought accident would erect rogue spirit began bee deiected hinder submission many lordship knowing would neuer faithfull care safetie earles daughter heire loth suddenly giue opinion herein onely professed thinke strange one full regard himselfe proceeding easily ouertaken lordship gaue confidence butler declared offering commander leading company refusing goe manifested suspected emulation whereupon lordship caused foureteene strong company allotted gaue command chiefe sir oliuer lambert conducted victual led men iudgement valour strongly fought comming especially going yet performed seruice great losse discouragement proud rebel fifteenth aprill lordship aduertised master secretary good seruice thirtieth industrie rebel made trench fortified place three mile length lordship former end aduancing towards may drew newrie incamped way towards armagh foote horse hauing notice rebel inquired time fight moyry earle southampton sir oliuer lambert sergeant maior come army hearing said earle sergeant maior day arriued dundalke lordship earely morning may sent captaine edward blany foot horse secure passage pace moyrye marched campe moyrye faghard hill dundalke danger made stand leauing foot two squadron himselfe horse passed dundalke told earle force lord deputy sent conduct assuring lordship rest army would meete two clock afternoone causey beyond pace whole pace hath name moyrye hereupon earle hauing besides conuoy foot company sir oliuer lambert sir henry follyot horse voluntary gentleman marched faghard hee commanded one two squadron aboue mentioned march carriage lordship horse followed second squadron marched last two foot company sir oliuer lambert sir henry follyot captaine blany commanding vanguard aduanced towards fouremilewater forde inuironed wood middest dangerous pace called moyrye comming within halfe mile discouered rebel side wood whereupon earle directed vanguard passe ouer water make good rising hill beyond came within musket shot perceiued two hundred foote enemie lodged beyond water aduantagious place captaine blany diuided men three maniples sending right hand vnder captaine henrie atherton many left hand vnder captaine williams lieutenant keeping rest middest himselfe sergeant maiors direrections gaue charge meane time lord deputy hill beyond pace sent vanguard consisting two regements one vnder sir charles percy vnder sir richard moryson two colonel army aduance towards pace instant captaine blany gaue vpon rebel said lord deputy vanguard appeared left side within two musket shot vollyes either side rebel right hand right captaine blany quitted place retired wood earle southamptons reare captain blany passing water made stand appointed doe till carriage horse passed lord deputy vanguard come passage said water maintained resolure skermish rebel left hand altogether secured earles troopes side therebels thus beaten side left one hundred shot skirmish lord deputy vanguard retired earle southamptons reare came desperatly men horse foot sir henry follyot made good stand sir oliuer lambert fearing left men distressed incourage tooke colour owne hand together earle southamptons vangards best men sent back rere hastened towards assaliants second earle time horse charge assailing rebel beate musket shot back still pursuing til hauing spent powder throwne staues dart innumerable stone recouered place tyrone stood himselfe horse foote sight besides far greater number hid wood neuer came vnto fight men thus gained much ground earle commaunded march towards army presently sir richard wingfeild marshal army ireland came order l dep since repulsed rebel like giue second charge continue march following lp troopes directly newry conflict men slaine capt atherton mast cheut shot hurt sword weapon rebel side foot thus aduantagiously lodged horse tirone confessed ten men died ouertrauelling hasty march besides killed whose number could certainely learned may lp aduertised sir arthur chichester gouernour carickfergus english sent plant loughsoyle safely landed small resistance taken newcastle belonging sir iohn odogherty whose country spoiled wasted sent forth vpon draught taken good store cowes killed odonnels people busie fortifying derric many country southward passe cowes moueables scotland depending specially vpon hope spanish succour brian mac art rebel bordering carickfergus left fastnes kilultagh lay border lecale purposed assaile rather sent men assist tyrone diuers gentleman others daily flie rebel resort vnto good number cowes would come doubted faithfulnes free imputation keepe iames mac surley enemy till reuenged brother death imployed colonell egerton inuite rebell submission receiued onely temporising answeres whereupon according lp direction hee written sent messenger purpose lord clantyer ilander scot stirre vp iames mac surley wrongfully possessing rightfull inheritance part ireland offering ioyne queenes force vnder commaund power bring recouerie right would yeeld due tribute obedience maiesty vpon king scot late proclamation al bearing armes ready attend king iuly next following prosecution ilander scot giuen refusing pay tribute feared lord would bee diuerted imbracing busines howsoeuer aduantageous receiued con mac neale son neale mac brian horseman maiesties pay would shortly waste father country whence brian mac art bonnaghtes hired souldiers maintained fed finally thought fit rebuild olderfleete leaue ward hauen commodious succour weatherbeaten ship going supplie garrison loughfoyle necessary may lord deputie receiued letter lord england full answere late dispatch earle ormonds detension signified maiesties griefe greater attempt made recouerie like proue ruine maiestie written countefse send earles young daughter heire england sir arthur oneales demaunds vpon comming serue maiesty first point concerning religion maiesty bare took proceede ignorance presumption wishing l dep let see maiesty pursued none part religion satisfie wise contract condition next andothers suit land entertainements ouertures like daily made submitted themselues protraction sending fro might lose many opportunity first touching sutes land maiesties direction particular case following rule lord deputie graunts kind first sir arthur oneales demaunding tyrones estate could granted reason tyrone vpon pretence old inquisition extended limit countrie incroched far south east maiesty pleased giue tyrones principall seates reseruing place fort land maintaine reseruing dependancy vriaghtes neighbour lord also reseruing land tyrone reward seruices gentleman serue vnder sir arthur warres onely hold maiestie letter patent rest sir arthur oneale chiefe tyrone well superioritie reuenue touching neale garues demaunds donnels estate maiesties pleasure reserue porte castle land reward seruices country gentleman intending specially mac swynes depend onely vpon maiestie haue right land letter patent touching mac guires country maiestie directed like reseruations land fortes reward seruices generally grantes charged reserue maiesties ancient right secondly touching suitor entertainements pay maiestes pleasure signified allow one thousand pound moneth long lord deputy counsel thinke fit imployed way according lord deputy discretion lordship aduised warily obserue know offered submission alwaies archtraitors practise let slip could defend might saue good liue vpon maiestie without intent doe seruice lastly force meet fought way killed diuers rebel whereof lord deputy left fifteene dead place besides many hurt met together noone seuenteenth day army marched towards fastnes rebel stored great plenty corne freckleton target pike shot totall totall greatest part army haue neither armour murrions neither mentioned sicke hurt place besides dundalke yet warder allowed company fourteenth september lordship began another iourny north fifteenth incamped hill faghard three mile beyond dundalke lordship lay till ninth october extremitie weather would haue hindred passage enemie withstood lordship tent wet often blowne downe lordship came tyrone vttermost strength possessed moyry strong fastnesse rebel lordship resolued march ouer hee stopped way make know kerne could keepe fortification queenes force many skirmish fell happily v two seuerall dayes rebel beaten trench great losse till last vpon eight october left passage cleere army day refreshed dundalke lordship marched twenty one october newry passing moyry caused rebel trench laid flat groud wood cut downe side pace newry want victual lordship staied till second nouember set forward eight mile towards armagh incamped rebel horseman shewed themselues vpon hil wherupon sir samuel bagnols regiment hauing reare yet come campe directed march towardes bog v rogue quickly drew fastnes next morning lordship rode quarter mile campe viewed place sir iohn norreys formerly intended build fort liking choice set downe army build place hill like promontory inuironed bogges riuer great store wood right hand ouer riuer great bogge little firme ground another bogge ouer faire countrey house much corne lordship could meanes send ouer horse foure mile wherefore commanded regiment foote aduance first peece firme ground thence send ouer next bogge men bring corne tymber house direction make retreit grosse enemy horse fall downe way left hand bogge ouer bogge great wood continueth fastnes ouer bogge left hand hill tyrone day time army lay muster himselfe men day horse foote fell ouer farre right hand vpon straglers went retired firme ground ouer first bogge beganne betweene foote good skirmish till men beate brought great store corne wood killed diuers meane time sconts side somewhat busie neal oquin taken prisoner chiefe fauourite vnto tyrone next day beganne worke building fort impeach worke rogue beganne skirmish v side excellently maintained men sent saw many killed vnderstood lost great number whereof many horseman best sort lighted incourage men fight well beaten would neuer offer meddle v till returne carlingford ninth nouember fort finished lordship called mount norreys honour master tearmed vnder hee serued apprentiship warres left therein foure hundred foot vnder command captaine edward blaney six weekes prouision victual weather grew extreame blew downe tent tore piece killed many horse tenth day lordship putting army armes drummes trumpet great volly shot proclaimed tyrones head promise pound brought aliue pound brought dead done face army lordship marched newry purposed plant garrison armagh mile beyond mount norryes rebel cowes eaten vp grasse thereabouts haue fed horse time yeere weather vnseasonable purpose whereas lordship resolued returne pale carlingford discerne whether way way moyry safe army might runne continuall hazard resolution confirmed carlingford fight necessity victual carlingford none newry dundalke twelfth nouember lordship came army narrow water whence sent sir iosias bodley three hundred choyce foot possesse peece ground keepe enemy hindering passage ouer water streame whereof found exceeding swift like dangerous venture horse ouer first tried doctor latware lordship chaplaine horse led boat side thirty foot went ouer lordship perceiued great difficulty passage passed foot ouer fast might sent sir henry folliot possesse pace faddome made horse garrons goe way meane time wee might see rebel force draw ouer mountaines towards pace carlingford come close men first landed yet neuer offered skermish night encamped directly ouer narrow water betweene pace faddome pace carlingford hauing midnight gotten ouer men vittels came water carlingford lordship caused deliuered day army fasted two day eaten little bisket cheese butter neuer men went greater iollity thirteenth nouember rise early otherwise could passe carriage sea side determined breake day scoutmaster brought word tyrone army lodged pace exceeding thicke wood foote great mountaine reaching downe sea side betweene sea place much space seuen may march ranke place lesse none full water onely narrow deepe high way wood captaine thomas roper broken company sent pale went forlone hope day course fell captaine beniamin berry lord deputy regiment vnder command vanguard sir christopher st laurence reare vanguard sir richard moryson vanguard rere sir samuell bagnoll reare reare two body vanguard rere thus subdiuided captaine treuor many captaine roper point led forlorne rere regiment lordship appointed three strong wing goe right hand left hand sea commanded captaines first captaine billing second captaine esmond last captaine constable ground rebel chiesely chose make good little plaine like semicircle whereof sea made diameter thicke wood circumference next corner v ran sea riuer wood foard good aduantage enemie along circumference made diuers trench euen close vp corner furthest corner made barricado reaching good way wood downe sea first shewed themselues horse foote vpon plaine lordship commanded giue performed presently roundly horse drew wood foote trench neuer shot till vanguard drawne ouer riuer partes powred vpon v great vollyes shot presently captaine roper gaue farthest trench right hand corner captaine billing next wing hee led captaine berry rest vanguard gaue vpon farthest corner barricado reached wood sea made good resistance many lost liues pike sword last trench made greatest shew opposition soonest quit though strongest greatest purpose arrest v reason lordship conceiued place furthest retreat feared forlorne hope wing led captaine billing might cut betweene gained trench vanguard made stand rere countenance occasion lordship stood troope horse voluntarie gentleman next lordship betweene van next body foote sir henrie dauers lordship troopes horse time entertained skermish part army still falling towards rere time lordship secretarie master george cranmer killed betweene sir william godolphin mast henrie barkely master ram lordps chaplaines horse killed gentleman lordship chamber called master done carried cloake shot leg forget one accident might haue proued great consequence stand lordship roade vp little hill edge wood vnderneath men skirmish rebel beyond somewhat musket shot side hil little house stood troope seuen eight horseman foote horse lordship caused footeman shoot alwaies carried long piece within two howers told lordship one time one number killed next man tyrone whose shoulder time leaned sir henrie daners came vnto lordship desired might take twentie owne horse fall rere saw enemy horse fall thitherward irish horse onely day rere lordship gaue leaue withall sent young iames blount shot vanguard captaine caufeild captaine constable many sir richard morysons regiment reinforce rere rogue continued good skermish almost halfe hower vntill horse foote comming little plaine somewhat farre skirt wood sir hen daners charged home brake beginning charge shot thigh charge presently drew foote mountaines horse strand ouer narrow water rere captaine richard hansard captaine treuer sore hurt sir garret more ensigne hugh hanlon killed wee lost twenty aboue threescore hurt enemie heard certaine fourescore killed outright within two day lordship vnderstood maguire lost two hundred marshall serieant maior alwaies van rere either place fight grew hottest generally commander souldiers serued extraordinary forwardnes alacrity conclude credible report rebel lost iourney aboue tyrones reputation thing reputation cleane ouerthrowne place began seeke pardon protection part whole iourney two hundred killed dead hurt hurt shortly recouered giue leaue digresse little continue iournall trauels writing whereof hath occasioned relation irish affaire earle essex went lord lieftenant ireland lord mountioy first named place wherevpon brother sir richard morysons inwardnes obtained lordship promise follow ireland place chiefe secretary imployment failing v retired selfe lincolneshire liued till lordship last spring sent ouer lord deputy diffidence vulgar report knowledge lordship imployment certainely beleeue change deputy till lordship ready take iourney besides extraordinarily hastened queenes command necessity affaire kingdome yet letter swifter selfe came lordship hand going receiued honourable answere knowing become already receiued three secretary yet wished follow would find fit good imployment indisposition body reason ague staied moneths countrey iuly taking iourny ireland came cambridge whereas yet one fellowes peterhouse master fellowes speciall indulgence continued vnto mee place leaue trauell yeere present iuly yeere time modest importune louing friend hauing foresaid assurance preferment ireland yeelded vp fellowship former absence yeelded twenty pound yeerely society knit vp louing course towards gaue mee aforehand profit place two yeeres come curtesie education must euer acknowledge strict bond loue seruice particular whole body iointly thence went london westchester whilest staid passage receiued another letter gather lordship purposed imploy writing history iournall irish affaire pleased god gracious prouidence may neuer leaue vnmentioned dispose better staying wind till end september one lordship three secretary either auoide trouble danger warres reason best knowne came ouer told left lordship seruice thus better hope preferment crossed sea tempestuous weather putting sea carkasse broken ship swimming v entring port dublyn another ship cast away crossing one shoare another wherein bishop whole family drowned day spent dublyn tooke iourney dundalke northerne border brother sir richard moryson gouernour lodged till lord deputy returne army thirteenth nouember day carlingford fight aboue mentioned whilest walked brother garden sensibly heard reuerberation wall sound vollies barkely supplie place prouisionarie gouernour prouince connaght time lordship wrote england authoritie passe vnto certaine submitties country reseruation maiesties right condition profit seruice particularly behalfe connor roe mac guyre put chiefery country tyrone quitted al possession good come queenes seruice tyrone two sonnes pledge elder lately escaping rebel likewise submitted himselfe serued valiantly late northerne iourney father horse killed vnder sonne killed three rebel owne hand thence going fermanagh drawne many country follow queenes seruice diuerting countrie assisting tyrone besides late skirmish taken cormock tyrones brother eldest sonne young man greatest hope north rebel purposed create oneale tyrones death respect better pledge tyrones son youth brought lord deputy great hazard conuoy pound ample condition offered ransome moneth nouember many northerne rebel great troop among mounster man pier lacy english race famous rebell drew brenny meaning passe shannon side mounster strengthened broken rebel pale assistance passage stopped tooke effect sixth december lordship aduertised honourable friend court late proceeding mentioned men much honour queen vttered himselfe gracious kind speech lordship extolling valour worthy part euer heard vse till time rebel mountaines neere dublyn called glinnes gaue allarums almost euery night suburbes dublyn time insolency bee chastened come obirnes hauing phelim mac feogh chiefe sept death feogh mac hugh formerly mentioned inhabited glinnes bordering plaines dublyn extending foure fiue mile way neerer tooles confederate insolent vpon city counsell residing lord deputy farre seruice horseman lordship purposed scourge according singular secrecie keepe counsell divulging cunningly masked intent came vpon secure confidently giuen lordship meant presently vndertake seruice omores leax oconnors ophalia purpose meant lie houshold monastreuen great house kept constable queen yea make proiect beleeued lordship sent arras hanging many prouisions house force hauing beene refreshed lordship twenty two december monday rode nasse twelue mile distant dublyn rendeuous appointed day lemster garrison fit bordering north left strong wednesday lordship sent houshold right forward monastreuen thirteene mile distant himselfe rest seruants force suddenly turned left hand glinnes day night tedious march ouer steepe mountaines couered snow arriued thursday christmas day phelim mac feogh house suddenly wife eldest sonne taken himselfe hardly escaped backe window naked wood kept cold christmas lord liued plentifully house prouisions made bonnaghs kerne keepe merry christmas vent anger daily offered slight skirmish vpon aduantage heart nothing eased therewith continually beaten lordship queenes force lay countrey till twentieth ianuary time troopes spoiled ransacked country rannelagh cashay swept away part cattle good burnt corne almost house leauing little nothing releeue finish worke lordship planted two strong garrison vpon one wicklo east side able come neerer ship tooles instrument beaten backe ill weather could arriue time tullogh vpon west could long hold submitting flying thus hedged done lordship came monastreuen purpose vndertake more connors hauing day setled correspondency proceeding seruice betweene force part neighbouring sept odempsies suspected subiects whose faith till lordship stood assured discerning more weake leax killing chiefecashe oway mac rory burning spoiling leax iourney meanes keepe bonnaghs hearing oconnors fled far part ophaly neither could found make resistance reasonable strong force lordship leauing part company assist subiects rode monastreuen twentie nine ianuary abiconal nine mile passing ruined city kildare altogether disinhabited thirtieth passed liffye came milhussy one master hussyes castle eleuen mile passing pleasant village menouth faire house belonging earles kildare hand countesse mabell old widdow thirty one came trym eight mile champion ground pleasant towne seate inhabitant sutable boyne runnes hath ruines sumptuous castle place lp thought fittest present residence captaine tirrel chiefe rebel ophalia draw force south country hence lordship might easily fall back rebel west desired passe mounster intended force disposed could escape without fighting v vpon diladuantage neither fell lordship purposed plant
