erne maiestie opinion seruice turbulent spirit could doe state grant three hundred foot one hundred horse maiesties pay condition bring men seruiceable maintaine without charge maiestie trym lying eastmeathe lordship eleuenth februarie passing barron trimblestones house rode lord deluins house westmeath eleuen mile distant twelfth passed ten mile molingar shire towne westmeath compassed bogges thence fourteenth wee went ballymore sir france shanes house ten long mile sixteenth sir tibbot dillons house seuen mile thence seuenteenth athlone fiue mile gouernour prouince connaght vseth lye strong castle belonging maiestie scituate connaght deuided towne riuer faire bridge stone eight arch lying westmeath countrie champion whereof greatest part lay waste lord returned back eighteenth february sir tibbot dillons house nineteenth danoar twelue mile brian mac gohagans castle westmeath lordship lay castle rode forth twentieth february view strong hold seated plaine little iland compassed bogges deepe ditch running water thicke wood fastnesse captaine tirrel boldest rebel lay first approch bogge two shot rebel came horseman standing hill moued continually selfe raw souldier stood stil white horse gaue rebel faire marke first shot flew close head apprehending danger turned horse second flew cloake light padde saddle saued life brused thigh presently lordship seat sir christopher saint laurence captaine winsor captaine roper captaine rotheram wing foote wood discouer fortified iland side sent captaine leg purpose skirmished rebel lying intrenched master darcy riding skirt wood shot neck two twenty day lordship drew forth againe carried hurdle fagot passe iland water carrying away lordship guard well seconded irish wee came losse captaine rotheram shot proceede must digresse little matter iourney begun twentie two december lordship receiued commandement pardon mounster require commended lord president assurance spaine intangled warre sauoy irish rebel could time haue small succour thence lordship writ master secretary procure leaue start ouer england kisse queenes hand conferre irish seruice professing hee reputed honourable friend much disdaine humour subiect would thinke tyed respect hauing affection free loue beginning februarie lord president mounster excused himselfe lord deputy hee made stay force lordship directed come thence hee intelligence northerne rebel sent inuade mounster lordship knowing stopped passage could goe great number perchance escaped againe require force might sent vnto time plot tyrones head managing whereof commended sir richard moryson gouernour dundalke whether sir william godolphin sent troope horse second plot tooke wished effect vndertaker henry oge oneale failing courage faith returne lordship action hee lay maghogans castle two twentieth february lord receiued packetout england vnderstood earle essex committed tower treason much dismaied neerest friend wrought strange alteration whereas stood vpon termes honour secretary fell flat ground insinuated himselfe ward loue absolute dependancy secretary time estranged himselfe two neerest friend open declaration made dependancy earle essex yet rather couering extinguishing good affection credible influence earles malignant star worke vpon poore snake selfe almost stranger yet neerenesse incloud one lordship aboue named friend made perhaps seeme lordship improper vse seruice neerenesse lordship promised begun doe next day tooke secret paper hand yet giuing keeping owne cabinet blow neuer fully recouered staied ireland truth lordship good cause wary word action since confession england himselfe tainted priuity earles practises soeuer continued still importune leaue come ouer yet doubt meant nothing lesse rather sent purposed said friend saile france hauing prinately fitted themselues money necessary thereunto howsoeuer lordship dangerously ingaged therein yet hee hee priuately professed fully resolued put necke vnder fyle queenes atturnies tongue lordship former seruice necessity future imployment together good successe strengthened without great vnthankefulnesse popular obloquy could haue beene questioned vpon weake ground twenty two february lordship colmsell resolued proclaime rebel good discouer guiltie treason none vpon paine death parley rebel countrey bring victual campe man vpon paine death take without paying price market thus purposing force rebel fortified iland plant garrison abbey neere adioyning charge new submitted subiects loyne garrison seruice also take order safe victualing gone lordship resolued next day make another attempt iland wherein terril lay preparing thing second taking order bring victualls campe part especially athlone boates twenty three february lordship drew forth abbey hee lodged foure hundred souldiers hee dined proclaimed terrils head two thousand crownes dinner drawing iland diuided force sending part put boates water assaile iland causing rest led wood fetch rebel corne burne house thing reliefe could bring away twenty foure february shrouetuesday fell great snow forced lie still next night rebel steale away leauing iland lordship next day wee found much corne murrions peeces eight cowes garrons twenty six lordship drew force beyond iland pleasant valley wherein ruined house sir edward herbert ground well plowed rebel men burnt house corne lordship gaue angell souldier swim ouer water burne house another iland came riuer diuideth west meath orphaly countrey lordship sent diuers company vnder sir christopher saint laurence spoyle twenty seuen lordship rode six mile sir iohn tirrels strong castle wee passed way tirrels pace compassed bogges hilly wood knight subiect lordship rested next day first march lordship rode klonegaue house sir terrence odempsey ophalia twelue mile first part whereof wee passed dangerous part tirrels fastnesse lordship receiued gracious letter maiesty whereby made known vnto earle essex death vse word professed regard approued fidelity loue alleuation griefe eiaculate first maiesty required look wel general vpon disposition captaines whereof preferred earle might perhaps haue hollow heart towardes seruice shee pleased pardon popular fashion outward profession sincerity beene seduced blindly led shee carefull seuer chaffe corne depriue malicious meanes preiudice seruice secondly whereas secretary lordship name moued maiesty might haue warrant come ouer yet regrad spanish ship yet passed narrow sea flaunders whether surely sent nothing lesse ireland howsoeuer traytor made vse like rumor maiesty wished hee would conceale desire time promise call home next winter vse seruice neere person time lordship receiued letter lord england giuing allowance maiesties name passing tirconnell neale garne vpon aboue mentioned condition yet aduising hereafter countrey absolutely bee passed inhabitant depend vpon one man would still kindle new flame rebellion letter lordship vnderstood supply money victual munition ready according demand lordship aduised plantation garrison strangford preuent assistance scot gaue rebel third march lordship rode ten mile bally britton sir henry warren house leax kept queene constable warder midway passed phillipstowne otherwise called dyngen strong fort ophalia otherwise called king county day lordship sent many party souldiers wood tirrell oconnors scatteredly lurking part lordship receiued lord direction siluer mony proclaime new coine three ounce fine base money sent ouer onely impouerish rebel pretended made warre queene owne treasure conclusion vndoing queenes seruants man cared lay vp thing bought excessiue rate exchange england failed exchange proclaimed held three city england foure ireland reason great summes coyned rebel stranger abuse namely merchant notwithstanding money duly changed excessiuely raise price exchange soone failed heart therewith serued discomfort came home beggar onely treasurer paymaster thereby infinitely inriched cause blesse author inuention fourth march lordship rode fiue mile sir edward fitzgerald house scituate meath pleasant fruitfull countrey fifth march rode ten mile mormeere pleasant house belonging sir iames dillon thence next day two mile trym sir richard moryson gouernonr dundalke lately aduertised lordship turloghmac henry tyrones brother captaine fewes taken oath priest vpon masse booke would submit himselfe maiesties mercy without condition st patrick day next following aduertised lord clancaruin humbly desired receiued mercy better ratifying hereof said sr richard moryson brought said turlogh person lordship lying trim fifteenth march lordship drew arbrachin bishop meaths house sixe mile distant lordship appointed adioining garrison meete next day presently arriuall lordship tooke horse towards euening thence marched night darke morning suddenly fell ferney possession whereof euer mac cooly one mac mabowns vsurped burnt house spoiled good inhabitant sir richard moryson gouernour dundalke garrison sir oliuer lambert troopes captaine thomas williams force ardee comming diuers wayes meeting lordship countrey small resistance made rebel either party nineteenth marched fiue mile ardee twentieth seuen mile mellisant sir edward more house twenty one two mile drogedagh lordship staied till sixteenth aprill returned waterford thomas fitziames bastard sonne iames fitzgerald late lord decies chiefe rebell county waterford fearing present prosecution made sure receiued maiesties mercy lord president granted aswell draw titulary earle desmond part strength open passage betweene waterford yoghall land formerly shut vp nothing could passe way sea twenty three aprill dungaruen lordship receiued aduertisement florence mac carty many fauours state wholly hispaniolised great power carbry desmond according plot tyrone entered open action terme rebellion captaine flower sergeant maior mounster hereupon entered carbry foot horse burning spoiling killing many rebel florence leuied prouincials bonnaghs call waged souldiers foot yet neuer attempted english till returne came within fiue mile corke fastnesse midway betweene corke kinsale assailed english beaten rebel slaine conflict captaine flower two horse slaine vnder twenty foure lord president came corke receiued state prouince relation sir henry pore sole commissioner mounster since killing partner sir warham st leger mac guire likewise killed fight vnderstood rebel strong master field supplied necessary townes perswasion priest couetousnesse townesmen time fitzgibbon called white knight either ill vsed tyrone mounster fearing prosecution submitted himselfe maiesties mercy likewise florence mac carty perswasion friend vpon safe conduct came lord president protested loialty maiesty refused giue sonne pledge left waged souldiers cast countrey till lordship threatned lay aside seruice sharpely prosecute whereupon consented pledge required haue county desmond giuen title mac carty earle clanoar like high demand reiected desired leaue sue grace england promise serue maiesties force meane time wherewith lord president satisfied hauing end present make stand neutrall whole force imploied titulary earle desmond iames fitzthomas called suggon earle nickename one dermod oconnor hauing land yet marriage daughter old earle desmond great valour leading bonnaghs lord president hoped ragine rebel one another time wife said dermod agent lordship plotted vpon promise great reward kill iames titulary earle desmond like fore one iohn nugent rebell vpon promise pardon reward within day vndertake kill iohn said earles brother beginning may redman burke leading rebel lost aduentured take prey countrey nourished lord president hope baron letrim drew men ormond purpose leade connaght tyrrell leader northerne men staied long behind pretending discontent dermod oconnor indeed fearing plot head beene long rumored lord president would take field sixth may made rebel draw head spend victual ten dayes forced disperse themselues twentieth may lord president tooke field marching towards lymbricke setled warder castle secure passage thither kilmallock lymricke lordship vnderstood iohn nugent aboue named ready vndertaken kill iohn brother titulary earle desmond accident hindered discharging pistoll apprehended put death well iohn titulary earle brother terrified herewith durst neuer keep together thought themselues least secure head owne men like practises lord president marched iohn burke countrey spoyling fame forced seeke maiesties mercy last obtained though difficulty lordship hauing gained plenty graine army sent fiue hundred foot omulrians countrey spoiled killed many rebel lordship returned limricke without losse beginning iune diuided army garrison far distant lordship though time fit seruice might attend plot dermod ocannor killing titulary earle desmond could well done except rebel dispersed would keepe together long english army field besides lordship vpon breaking tooke aduantage settle garrison asketon without resistance dermod ocannor tooke titulary earle prisoner name oneale pretending forged letter plotted death lord president presently sent wife money promised reward wishing lord president draw force kilmalloch would deliuer prisoner lordship accordingly sixteenth iune rebel hauing notice hereof drew together foure thousand number stopped passage set titulary earle liberty besieged dermod ocannor castle till lord president marching thither iune forced forced leaue siege lordship kept field tooke chiefe castle knight vally wherein slaine threescore warder tooke castle many good seruices rebel great number lying neere neuer fight reason ielousies whereupon connaght men sutors lordship returne home without impediment time ocannor kerry yeelded castle queene receiued mercy lord president last granted passe rebel connaght lord burke knowing thereof priuat reuenge set vpon marched home three score besides many drowned sixteenth iuly lord president bestowed army garrison iuly lordship againe releeue men formerly sent kerry marching thither took chiefe house lord fitz morrice many castle griefe whereof said lord died yet leauing sonne dangerous himselfe lord president returned cork eighteenth august leauing sir charles wilmot gouernour kerry valiant gentleman chiefe commander vnder first ranke instrument vsed seruices short time brought freeholder kerry due subiection droue titulary desmond part garrison time haruest gathered much come could destroied rest made rebel able subsist yeere following sir george thornton hearing titulary earle desmond passed neere kilmalloch sent garrison captain greame charging troope horse killed conflict english got garons laden baggage pike peeces weapon horse english horse killed fight titulary earle desmond could neuer draw men together forced flie tipperary brother iohn pierce lacy archrebel knight glin whence brother iohn hasted vlster reliefe tirone end summer vpon departure bonnaghs connaght vlster good successe english many prouincials submitted themselues yet sent rome dispensation middest october iames fitzgerald long imprisoned tower london next true heire last earle desmond released queene title earle letter pattents sent lord president promise good proportion land support end februarie vpon lordship recommendation morethen fourethousand mounster men pardon granted lord deputie passed vnder great seale second booke chap lord deputy particular proceeding prosecution rebel speniards inuading ireland yeere lord deputy lay drogheda namely one twentie march till sixteene aprill vpon day returned dublin lordship assembled counsellers state attend vpon eight twentie march lord deputie counsell wrote drogheda vulgarly called tredagh ioynt letter lord england whereby aduertised lord deputie hauing spent greatest part winter irish country lemster burning corne consuming cattel killing many scattered maine strength certaine chiefe since submitted queenes mercy rest seuered small company vnlike draw dangerous head yea tirrel opinion greatest among taken tyrones lieutenant lemster forced greatest fastnesse base kerne following driuen wanderin wood boggs seeking escape north shortly notwithstanding certaine english company left hunt walkes stop passage cooly chiefe fearny turlogh mac henry captaine fewes humble suters maiesties mercie commanded appeare shortly make humble submission course likewise sept brenny take many chastised army vtterly discouraged alreadie diuers time offered humble submission lordship hereupon called counsellor tredagh consider circumstance condition obserued taking also deliberate army might imployed vex tyrone arrowes wildfier fell downe one hundred shot close water shot playing incessantly vpon iland deliuered arrowes suddenly house fired burnt vehemently rebel lodging forsooke iland swumme shoare burnt intended garrison ballishannon owne offer proiected england besides keeping owne might also draw sufficient force meete lord deputy heart tyrone proiect planting ballishannon could take effect hoped furtherance whereof time vpon lordship command deuise cipher passe betweene lordship gouernours loughfoyle knockefergus lecaile end rebel light vpon letter contriuing meeting seruice yet might able discouer secret purpose especially since ignorant could attaine deciphering character like though farre easie cipher presently sent aboue named gouernours lordship resolued councel write lord england haue six thousand trained band readines sent ouer presently vpon suspected inuasion forraigne power haue magazin victual munition limricke aswell answere seruice mounster make discent part likely drawne thence galloway case inuasion made answere prosecution connaght rebel intended winter following thing thus proiected following prosecution warre lordship two twentieth may beganne intended iourney aboue mentioned dublin twenty three came tredagh twenty fiue dundalke lordship lay till dispersed company could draw nethither victual brought composed controuersies betweene late submitties setled correspondency betweene aswell make concurre defence one another also defence pale lordship receiued twenty eight may letter lord england requiring captain supply company passevolants pleasure onely men bee sent england supply captaines refusing shew company required commissary muster checked two moneths pay pensioner cheked without speciall licence absent seruice speciall care punish preuent souldiers dismissed captaines pass running away colour duly returne england nine twentieth may vpon intercession lord president letter according course held direction england lord deputy granted warrant drawing maiesties pardon cuocher omulrian munster rebell chiefe sept name eighty three follower aswell men weomen child sept second iune resolued councell letter written lord president mounster requiring draw force vnder towards lymricke part imploy part following summer well ready attend discent forraigne enemy fitly laid giue countenance prosecution rebel connaght whether said lord president directed send thousand foot fifty horse according aboue mentioned proiect end rebel prosecuted prouince might haue leasure ioine north disturbing planting garrison ballishannon sir henry dockwra plant way loughfoyle fifth iune lord president aduertised warning beene giuen mounster sending men generall hoasting aboue mentioned lord deputy appointed meet according old custome hill tarragh feared scarcity victual want furniture would either hinder full appearance make small vse seruice sixth day vpon lord president letter warrant giuen charter pardon without fine granted one hundred fifty one inhabitant moghely county corke well men weomen child life land good like granted oswilliuan prouince follower eighth iune monday lord deputy drew force dundalke marched two mile hill fagher neere pace moyry encamped lay lordship caused fort built said pace three mile water rising thence till made fort defensible leauing warder workemen might absence finish building thirteenth iune campe fagher lordship published proclamation new coyne monies hauing beene decried three day lordship direction like proclamation printed dublyn thence formerly sent loughfoyle knockfergus prouinces connaght mounster time published together place foureteenth campe lordship counsellor wrote following letter lord england may please honourable lordship perceiuing lordship letter eighteenth may victual expected answere purpose planting ballishannon connaght could arriue quantity time might inable v proceed iourney receiuing argument lordship inclination sir h dockwra offer plant garrison loughfoyle grew new consultation sort make warre summer first propounded army march lecaile part colrane end whereof haue beene haue brought subiection woodman vtterly taken tyrone part vlster colrane loughsidney blackewater whence heretofore traitor hath gathered greatest strength passage dangerous hauing commodity sea supply v haue made warre way great purpose good conueniency perhaps might haue fallen ouer banne tyrone wayes extreame danger enter countrey except one loughfoyle chiefe difficulty arise proiect danger wherein leaue thing behind v spaniard land carried chiefe force kingdome vttermost corner thereof next able leaue great guard pale haue left naked attempt tyrone new reclaimed rebel mercy pale mercy end grew resolution first interym betweene appointment generall hoasting supplied carriage time expect victual munition england first wherof sparingly prouided may warrant ingaging selues great businesse second vtterly vnfurnished wee scarce haue powder maintaine good day fight tooles prouisions fortifie must chiefe worke carry rebel v dwell determine assure passage moyry plant garrison lecaile conuay men sir arthur chichester gouernour carickefergus garrison supply together aduantage stirring place giue may goe neere work little lesse effect whole army haue done lastly purpose lie force neere tyrone victual munition arriued hope receiue last iune time appointed generall hosting purpose god willing neere wee imploy maiesties force according inclosed proiect proiect haue formerly set downe particularity sir h dockewra purpose plant ballishannon sent captaine vaughan lordship acquainted onely master treasurer hath told v proposition generall wee doubt withall hath propounded lordship meanes accomplish worke must supplied thence v receiue little assistance imploying whole force according inclosed proiect euery part done much may aduantage neither worse easily haue intelligence often heare one another perceiue shall find impossibility plant ballishannon wee thinke aduise whole grosse strength fall tyrone time shall blackewater whereby may fall shall helpe god meet dungannon vtterly waste country tyrone vnto course driuen must resolue make warre following winter connaght first leauing northern border good strength hope reduce prouince ruine donnel keepe connaght cannot long subsist hope continuall assurance prouince plant next yeere ballishannon facilitie planting many garisons doe seeme continuing greathesse armie draw long maiesties charge wee doe first thinke recouer kingdome preserue hereafter chargeable bee necessary ballishannon loughfoyle garrison ban lecayle mount norreys armagh blackwater place continually kept place may euer victualed sea neare together without dangerous passage betweene land may victualed sea land without force owne euery fort little keepe tower stone built warres decrease occasion shall serue place may bee guarded men continue bridle peace fit place put men great purpose rebellion shall time breake neither neede little castle bee workes great charge may easily made people hardly force proceede proiect summer seruice victual alreadie contracted mustarriue due time lordship supply v good quantity hereafter onely way ruine rebel must make possible wast meanes life done supplied england shall aswell starue selues especially wee must make warre farre reliefe friend nothing gotten enemy except great chance since country wil lightly either hide spoile conuey inaccessable fastness greatest seruice done long sudden iournies cannot done without victuall victuall cheese well carried souldier without garons carriage iades must humbly desire lordship send v great quantity cheese prouision whereof whatsoeuer inconueniences lordship shal find assure ten time counteruailed seruice lastly army already weak english iourny without extraordinary fauor god must need diminish much wel sword sicknes humbly earnestly desire lp assoone conueniently may bee send v shot carlingford supply returne may strengthen english company meane leaue behind v north wee carry v winter seruice time exceeding fit arriuall besides succour may receiue grow weake returne come ouer well cloathed winter may haue time rest seasoned till christmas till warres vnactiue part yeere may bee imployed till end may onely season plague rebel summer past wherein rogue reuiue liue like fly garrison well planted army strengthened english wee may begin cast irish company cleare english company must continue good subiects starue goe haue queenes sword hang ouer wheresoeuer goe meane time thinke necessarily entertained wee take many men rebel giue vnto selues facilitie plant foundation owne ruine v v wast themselues wee entertaine wouldlie vpon countric subiect except defended many themselues would waste liue vpon effect number entertained would grow one reckoning particular instance benefit ensueth entertaining irish thinke giue lordship account aboue one hundred haue yeere killed bullet fighting side formerly rebel wee speake questionlesse would haue againe liued haue put queenes pay wee humbly desire lordship make fauourable construction counsel success since ground whereupon doe iustly build resolution may alteration giue v iust cause alter course want meanes either matter time expect may vtterly hinder especially case forraine succour doe arriue whole frame proiect broken must presently relieued england else kingdome shall suffer much hazard lordship last letter gaue v light might leaue informe likelihood wee could receiue would wee haue first intelligence send lordship many report next haue constant late extraordinary conceiued confidence people lastly iudge wise powerfull enemie doe best easie doe wee haue many reason thinke spaine send helpes yeere thinke otherwise saue hath often deceiued expectation malice spaine continue england haue easie dangerous step thereto ireland doe imbrace occasion yeere doubt next euer loose vnto must please lordship proportion succour force likely offended v expect owne effates may please lordship consider power kingdome consisteth maiesties english army irish company themselues english company serue mercenary nobilitie townes inbred people nation liue subiects lastly meere irish lord people lately reclaimed still remaine rebellion english farre dispersed irish serue many therefore likely follow golden hope townes people obstinate contrariety religion without question grow malicious gouernement affect power spaine declare themselues irish lord motiues v last necessitie ioyne especially townes stirred new coine though spaine doe arriue may securely established yet breede many dangerous inconueniences may therefore please haue readinesse sixe thousand trained band country best transporting ireland sent ouer mounster vpon first power arriued part nauy readinesse greater portion munition artillerie v otherwise warre require doe hope giue maiestie good account kingdome selues vntill wee shall haue cause sue reliefe fall spaine haue warre england shall glad england may made ireland wee poore seruants shall haue happinesse strike first blowes royall kingdom god preserue long queenes price gotten garrons carrying victual mount norryes garrison intended plant armagh marched sixe mile neere mount norryes sir henrie dauers garrison met hauing able difficulty execute lordship betweene v small hurt hauing rabinet falcon made hill shot rebel troope farre distant whereupon puppits brauery suddenly vanished according wonted manner hidde themselues wood presently lord deputy rebel lease beggered diuers preyes cattell taken among sept more killed burnt hanged forty least slaine fight connor mac lyre men hurt many escaped day great store victual fort came newry conuoy tenne mile distant passage pace blackwater plaine countrie lay open yet part boggy tyrones men lay intrenched side riuer trench made impeach building new fort blackwater cowardly quitted aboue mentioned rebel bestowed vollies shot lordship troopes returned safely hauing onely one man hurt one three trumpet tyrones pay ran campe one thirtieth day lordship drew day first august next following cut downe wood cleare said pace lying betweene v said passage ouer blackwater day rebel attempted cut guard placed remote hill second workemen cutting wood workemen stoutly receiued second beaten backe time accident almost lost best horse alarum giuen horse frighted skirmish diuers horseman hurrying answere alarum broke headstals ran backe armagh best farre newry whether men following recouer rebel horseman followed doubt might haue caught defeated men loosely following aduantage haue done v mischiefe could otherwise haue done force doubled second august lordship army rose marched backe armagh end might shun pace thence haue open passage art mac baron countrie marched sixe mile armagh three rawlagh incamped sir henry dauers three hundred foote fortie horse sent fastnesse burne twentie faire timber house performed time set watch hee returned towards campe retreat tyrones force guarded three hundred horse skirmished men seconded campe came orderly rebel following campe powred country aboue eaten rebel creaghs cattell al way marched rebel fastness drew downe closeby followed v way strong commissary tooke view army field lordship regiment first sir beniamin berry lordship lieutenant foote list pole present campe regiment sir oliuer saint iohns list pole regiment sir hen folliot list pole regiment sir christopher saint laurence lyst pole totall list pole herein contained either officer present sicke hurt vpon occasion absent fourth day company drawne cut pace armagh rebel sight offered skirmish towards night drew downe strong wood hil vnder lay encamped faire meadow came cry sound drummes bagpipe would attempt campe powred two three thousand shot hurting onely two men lordship commanding none campe stirre lodged trench foure hundred shot charging shoot till rebel approached neere men giuen volly theirteeth drew away heard drummes bagpipe onely mournefull cry many best men slaine among rest one horseman great accompt one pierce lacy archrebell mounster next morning found dead body skirt wood three scattered peeces hence lordship sent direction sir iohn barkeley bring campe regiment annaly liseannon tyrone growne strong comming mac guire mac mahownd cormocke mac baron comming frontires loughfoyle fifth day lordship sent againe shot pyoners cut pace close rebel sixth day lordship purposed rise meet conuoy bringing victual newry staied ill weather sent early horse stay conuoy till lordship drew downe towards part day lordship gaue order master treasurer proportion new monies sent market townes change sterling proclamation made decry old sterling monies onely make new currant seuenth lordship rose draw towards newry marching mount norreis encamped neere said fort eight day lordship dispatched earle clanrickard connaght command force part hauing sent sir iohn barkeley come regiment campe lordship gaue warrant passing maiesties pardon land life good arthus mac gennis chiefe sept follower lordship receiued letter england mr secretary signifying lord president sent maiesty diuers aduertisements spaniard would presently land part mounster whence lord deputy necessity lately drawne one thousand foot fifty horse connaght maiesty well allow lordship care drawing men seruice leesing present certainty apprehension future assured probable king spaine would doe something vpshot though credible would send ten twelue thousand men ireland yet since february last begunne foundation prouide force lowcountries ireland affaire require since lowcountry army reinforced land italy maiesty thought might ease transport foure fiue thousand men ireland like doe might time turne state ireland would thinke well bestowed leese yeeres end respect maiesty resolued leauy fiue thousand men readines send two thousand presently mounster arriue tenth moneth spaniard land lord president might enabled keepe prouincials reuolt till lord deputy might come thither force might sent england inuade ireland lordship might keepe one thousand drawne mounster finish worke whereof laide happy foundation heartily wishing lordship might happy instrument saue ireland professed himselfe tied constant honest friendship praying lordship esteeme ready second besides publike duty proceed much extraordinary respect lordship bestowing company sent mounster gone meaning earle essex made great monopoly bestowing place himselfe great confusion euery lord importuning preferre friend follower part sought man preferrement herein onely aduised might first respected came ouer lord deputy recommendation lord president earnestly moued good sort challenged haue hope procurement meanes gratifie follower friend obtained maiesty company might sent ouer vndisposed left disposall secretary giuen second rather place bestowed england without thankes eather lord deputy lord president protesting soeuen loued lord president would scant due respect lordship wherein thought giue least discontent conceiued spaniard would make difcent corcke towne guardable noryet lymricke though fit scituation enemy ingaged farre kingdome could hope supply maiesty take due resolution oppose rather iudged galloway fit place discen giuing commodity ioine northerne rebel seated countrey rebellion else waterford respect goodly riuer people affection spaine adui fort dungannon carefully furnished commander men necessary lastly ostend obstinately besieged archduke thirteene thousand foote sixty peeces battery howsoeuer state left two thousand dutch yet army bercke whence would raised town beene carried within ten day sir francis vere throwne himselfe one thousand sixe hundred english maiesty sent one thousand men prepared send succour place part army italy come downe arch duke ninth august lordship counsellor present campe writ lord england army bin imployed preparing maiesties fort fitting winter war present spoyling rebel corne way ruine hoping keep army field til haruest past impossible cut corne garrison might haue opportunity gather rest rebel might hindred gathering except tyrones corne neere dungannon wherunto passage difficult lp little thought good hazard al especially since sir hen dockwra want match written could meete lordship tyrone according former proiect whereof lordship notwithstanding professed himselfe nothing sorrie regard meeting would haue giuen arch rebell power fling dice againe recouerie fortune vpon vnequall hazard setting rest vpon either apart diuided three body vnder lord deputy said sir henrie dockwra sir arthur chichester euen whole force northerne partaker though friend kept aiding disposall force besides spoyling corne lordship search found ensie way pasle dungannon hitherto neuer guide made knowne v cut broad pace thick wood two dayes labour came riuer purposed soone might build fort bridge thence dungannon lesse foure mile plaine would cut archtraytors throat howsoeuer name oneale reuerenced north none could bee induced hetray vpon large reward set vpon head yet hope assistance spaine taken away seeing corne spoyled vpon expected supply seeing v enter tyrone could see apparant confusion howsoeuer summer cowes taken worke proper winter warre yet forced feede within fastness vsed keepe feeding winter must either starue keeping winter hazard taking garrison feede abroad future seruice besought againe inabled sending one thousand shot england supply rather tyrone strong appeared note deliuered shane mac donnel groome hauing tyrones marshall receiued seuen twenty iuly besides experience strength day since powred three thousand shot campe thing wee bee driuen sit still make rest maiesties charge vnprofitable sir cannot quiet iudgement make large perfect discourse time affaire continually full present busines haue little rest sometimes rogue keepe v waking night short dare assure see faire way make vlster one quiet assured profitable prouinces spaniard doe come doe cannot say shall first resolue till euent see purpose prouide place spaniard make people liue course presume maiesties power giue king spaine great blow quit country euer checkes queene doe finde weakenesse army disclaime fault without wise honest mustermaster good reputation still present army queene kinde wil neuer well serued vpon officer doe continually call care matter according desire sent v one thousand supply shot newrie aduanced seruice expresse must need send v able leaue garisons strong winter part troop haue haue stricken blowes recouerie kingdome continuall action therefore must wonder weake sir henrie dockwra plant ballishannon thinke fit sir neuer placed one displaced haue left nomination could obtaine last supply came since queenes pleasure must beare doe continually great deale patience though willing know haue iust feeling thing yet mac mahowns countrie taking prey lighted said number sixteene hundred cowes returne hardly laied vnto say great number yet haue heard present aboue senenscore lose prey according manner irish haue kind retreat fell flat running away fort poore captaine esmond command reare valiantly made good place sore hurt afterwards taken prisoner forty fiftie side slaine cannot learne english among account losse taking captaine neither doe rebel bragge thereof scaped free loosing neere many men wee knew dealt countrimen doe hold shame runne like fight though wee meane call account thereof humbly take lordship wrote trym sir robert cecyll following letter sir comming part found distempered borne hand make doubt spaniard doe come shall able giue maiesty good accompt charge hope rather opinion since haue staied long come winter though desire leade conceit omit selfe prouide worst may happen therefore haue sent master marshall towards leax almost thousand foot horse neere lord president mounster may fall way prosecute tyrrell meane two hundred rogue gotten thither remaine moore connors follower could cut last yeere altogether drawne aboue foure hundred connaght haue appointed sir oliuer lambert many company spare vntill may vnderstand maiesties pleasure know actiue find necessity imploy force way long brute spaniard comming doth continue especially odonnell doth make residence prouince sligo might otherwise doe hee lift without impeachment selfe thinke fittest stay hereabouts hence may aptly draw towards mounster connaght need requires fall backe towards north soone gather certainty spaniard comming may supplied shot earnestly desired former letter without foundation manner ouerthrowne strengthen english company assure growne exceeding weak otherwise would put maiesty charge make doubt shall able doe maiesty seruice winter shot landed carlingford newry victual munition meanes desired spaniard shall thenceforth able get footing doe v great annoyance especially would please procure addition rest two hundred shot sent supplying sir arthur chichester carickfergus place haue discouered entrance heart tyrone likelihood soon ruine archtraytor sir arthur may enabled meanes shall want yeeld haue inclosed sent note may see garrison planted northward command absence sir francis stafford hath chiefe command ouer best meane make ioine vpon occasion seruice ninth september lordship receiued aduertisement lord president two thousand men embarked england mounster arriued part corkharbour part waterford company left lord maiesties counsell direction disposall earle ioyning countenance sute altogether without priuity praied lordship beleeue since lordship promised fauour vpon first occasion protested neuer thought make needlesse request england therewith hee sent lordship list said company newly arriued one thousand foure hundred vnder foureteen captaines named england one hundred increase lord president earle thomonds foot company fiue hundred hee vpon border lemster meaning kilkenny fittest place meeting tooke iourney thitherward arriuing kilkenny thirteenth september night receiued aduertisement lord president spaniard met sea bearing ireland therein informed mounster craued pardon hee came meete lordship whose pleasure hee conceiued bee case hee absent part enemy discent expected prayed lordship fashion affaire lemster north force meant bring might readinesse withall protesting staied second direction receiued would come without delay lordship next day lordship wrote following letter sir robert cecyll maiesties secretarie sir hauing left northerne border well guarded prouidence could command wherof left sir ioh barkeley hauing sent sir oliuer lambert counaght settle part sir rich wingfeild marshal leax prosecute tirrel adherence wrote president mounster meete kilkenny hee conueniently might desire establish full correspondencie resistance forraine force arriue otherwise making warres part winter rather know present galloway consequently asherawe planted might supplied munition prouisions mounster part seeming small purpose deuide birnes cauenaghs holding intelligence ioining tyrrel nourish ouerture haue lately entertained chiefe moore bring tirrel aliue dead desire passe secret omoloy hath already giuen pledge performe might disinable force come kilkenny onely accompanied threescore horse without one commander captaine army hauing left commandement resident charge onely came neere master marshall sent conferre accompanied none counsell onely sir robert gardner chiefe iustice entred kilkenny receiued intelligence lord president spaniard sea returned messenger desiring stirre charge aduertise often occurrent selfe purpose returne presently carlogh whether vnder colour prosecute tirrel draw many force imploy meane time ready answere occasion shall fall mounster thing stand place best giue direction part assure dangerous sir desire aduise hence great sudden thinke fit make dispatch great matter confident propound much better iudgement thinke first fittest thought may please lord send ouer two thousand men last letter signified chester expedition one thousand carlingford dublin intend thrust company make full man whereby queene shall serued body yet lyst way increased charge transportation desire many least may sent carlingford confident best counsell whether spaniard land strengthen part armie able assure pale way ruine northerne rebel sort shall power forraine force make liue worst happen therby inabled come v send cannot except fetch generall warre must send great magazins munition victual resolue many men send haue sent proportion bee easily cast vp minister haue kind best place greatest quantity dublin thence may finde meanes transport place shall haue neede except th warre connaght onely lymrick galloway prouisions must come connaght chiefly expect spaniard first discent yet difficulty front warre galloway athlone lymricke throughly supplied prouisions forraigne force doe arriue prouisions lost winter odonnell must forced connaght else get hath lost tyrconnell winter must doe endeuour doe like vlster ruine tyrone worke small difficulty great consequence perswaded would onely turne profession people euen heart maiesties obedience loue tyrone quit affection hope fortune failes doe dependancy fall feare greatnes shall taken away beleeue sir obserue much deceiued irish reclaimed lord great desire continue subiects might see apparance defence though perchance much honest disposition smart yet feele bitter prosecution heare forraigne power great number arriued must resolue send least horse england two thousand men well armed must beleeue sir warre ireland warre england made ireland beat kingdomes quiet euen best danger hope euer liue see prouide v men wee send word spaniard landed wee write whether desire sent howsoeuer presume maiesty shall repent putting ouer many men hither hope ease charge shortnesse worke aide arriue forraigne force arriue england gather intelligence may send hither new men assure place fit bee kept may bring ouer old souldiers captaines two three thousand wil vndertake shal strike good blowes ten thousand ordinary men haue made subiects lately reclaimed time suspected put themselues blood already since comming hither euen heare lord mountgarrets sonnes haue killed clarcheeres tyrrels follower since contested father somewhat heard suspicious sir againe aduertise affaire shortly desire pardon hast kilkenny foureteenth september assured friend doe seruice mountioy lordship returned kilkenny carlogh disposed force answere seruice part lemster thence wrote lord president meet time kilkenny possibly could within day hearing lord president hauing left sir charles wilmot force corke iourney towards lordship parted carlogh nineteenth september met laughlin whence rode together kilkenny proceed briefly adde affaire mounster till time mounster collected lord president letter setling peace yeere interrupted allarum spanish inuasion generally giuen beginning yeere moneth aprill mounster rebel fledde last yeere connaght vlster attempted againe returne mounster hauing beene strengthened tyrone lord president sent captaine flower one thousand foote confines force mounster one side sir iohn barkeley connaght force side persued moneth forced breake returne vlster florence mac carty notwithstanding protection procured sending said rebel north besides many rebellious practice time laded barke hide bring munition forraigne part lord president ceased lay continuall plot apprehend ticulary earle desmond hauing often driuen lurking dennes seruice lord barry hauing company maiesties pay noble endeuours last lord president vnderstanding lurked white knight countrey lordship exasperate feare owne danger moneth may tooke prisoner brought corke hee condemed treason intitle queene land time kept prisoner moneth iune lord president receiued gracious letter queene written owne hand faithfull george euer seruice worth performed shorter space haue done deceiued among many eye wituesses haue receiued fruit thereof bid faithfully credit wit courage care may truly find haue throughly acted charge beleeue shall neither vnremembred vnrewarded meane beleeue helpe prayer shall neuer faile soueraigne best regard e r beginning iuly lord president aduertised lord deputy according direction hee would presently send connaght foot fifty horse mounster list though vpon good fresh intelligence arriuall spaniard daily expected prouince force remaining sufficient guard kinsale waterford yoghall killmalloch lymricke cork last whereof according lordship direction would haue care specially strengthen giuen chiefe leader said force sir fran barkely direction return vpon letter maiesties seruice opinion require praying lord deputy allow direction since hee meant recall vpon sudden reuolt prouincials arriuall spaniard prisoner vsurping title earle desmond many euidences made manifest rebel vlster especially spaniard relie vpon helpe said prisoner florence mac carty florence though protected assured best aide preuailed councell held vlster spaniard land neere cork hereupon lord president apprehended florence sent together said earle prisoner england safe tower time knowne spaniard might perhaps diuert inuasion ireland doubt laying hand two archrebels much aduanced maiesties seruice following inuasion whereby lord president deseruedly wonne great reputation thus much haue briefly noted time aboue mentioned lord deputy wrote lord president meet confines mounster meeting said laughlin rode together kilkenny twenty landing spaniard day september sate counsell earle ormond rest counsel purpose soone resolued meetest course present seruice returne seuerall place charge day newes came post postes newly established purpose spanish fleet discouered neere old head kinsale whereupon determined stay next day haue certain aduertisement therof three twentith day another post came sir charles willmot aduertising spanish fleete come harbour kinsale agreed counsell lord president returne corke lord deputy countenancing seruice mounster draw clommell gather force hee could presently draw kinsale nothing doubting forwardnesse howsoeuer otherwise army neither number men sufficiency prouision fit vndertake taske would couer many defect spied country least stop currant generall defection irish vehemently feared resolued counsell lord president giuen comfort find victual munition corke first much troubled draw force thither suddenly bring victual munition thither vnderstood lordship fed souldiers summer cesse preserued maiesties store victual thought wasted exceeding ioyfull newes without iust desert highly commended lord president prouident wisdome said important seruice state day wrote letter lord england may please lordship spanish fleete long expected rebel harbour kinsale corke may appeare vnto lordship certainty copy inclosed letter sir charles wilmott maior corke much newes haue yet receiued iudge whether whole fleete set spaine whether part thereof comming bound harbour onely haue reason thinke weather falling late exceeding stormy tempestious ship could hardly keepe together report whole number least seuentie earnest sutors lordship supply v thing needefull weighty action speedily possibly may two thousand foote already conceiue chester desire may presently lent waterford neither carlingford dublin deputie thought fittest last dispatch meant haue vsed north two thousand least neede come soone vnto corke inuested comming bee landing must waterford yoghall three hundred horse conceiue wee haue reason demand therefore expect one soone may also munition victuall must sent ten thousand men come likewise waterford vnlesse lordship heare v contrary two kind royally supplied men mony serue v little purpose recommend lordship consideration whether fit send part maiesties nauy lie vpon coast aswel assure passage sea attempt something vpon spanish shipping thus hauing briefly set downe request sparingly may danger considered think impertinent acquaint lordship cause meeting purpose thought fit vpon expectation forraine force held certaintie conferre lord president mounster consult vpon generall disposall force kingdome make warre vpon arriuall could hardly doe without thorowly informed state prouince meanes victuall munition prouisions finde draw army thither thence driuen make warre connaght wee found would bee exceeding great difficulty vnlesse wee might haue good helpes mounster purpose meeting place vpon munday one twentieth present next day wee consultation came first letter maior corke assuring v discouery fleete neere old head kinsale whether friend enemy knew made certaine rest letter came since presently grew resolution president returne speede possible though hee left prouince hee tooke order vttermost could bee done prouidence aswell settle defend place likeliest inuaded concluded deputy draw forward farre clommell neere chiefest brunt warre vpon present apprehension thing thers giue direction rest kingdome yet omit occasion inuasion whilest marshal drew vp many force best conueniency expedition since two thousand supposed chester came carlingford dublyn time supply company northward might haue gone prosecution haue resolued leaue part sufficient keepe garrison place wee hold bee purpose vntill maiesty send hither greater force though still opinion best course proceed maiesty would pleased enable v otherwise cannot looked shal go backward greatly busines thus confident lp carefull v take sufficient vppon sudden since way necessary fit v lordship wisdome experience best knowne doe humbly take leaue assurance leaue nothing vnperformed may giue true testimony world value duty gracious soueraigne tender preseruation kingdome committed charge know ought liues liuings doubt giue maiesty good account doings kilkenny three twenty september lordship humbly command c signed lord deputy councell foure twentith day lordship wrote following letter master secretary sir euer thinke forraigne force arriue would doubtfull lay finger sound part kingdome supply come time haue left northerne garrison strong might good sort haue prouided resolution bend selfe suddenly forraigne force wee beat let trouble though heare ireland doth reuolt grace god shall haue returne presently halter neckes doe prouidence bestowed place vaine till know particularly many place haue made discent cannot write much present apprehend world difficulty much comfort euer poore man haue faire occasion shew prodigall life aduenture shall finde seruice deere mistresse vnto confident god hath giuen life doe acceptable seruice haue done sing nune dimittis day expect receiue light ground write large ready president take horse whose fortune mine shall one leaue god continuall blessing hast kilkenny foure twenty september day master marshall dispatched pale draw company thereabouts towards mounster procure councell dublyn thing necessary businesse sir henry dauers sent company armagh sir iohn barkeley direction bring company laid nauan l deputy night rode kiltenan castle dwelling lord dunboyne great day iourney assured spaniard landed entered kinsale fiue twenty lordship rode clommell sir nicholas walsh one councell came resolued lordship goe corke proceed cause six twentieth lordp rode glonowre lord castle seuen twentieth lordship rode glonowre corke accompanied lord president sir robert gardener sir nicholas walsh counsellor eight twenty day lordship aduertised scot comming lisbone spaniard sent kinsale sixe thousand number commanded iean del aguyla beene generall britaine one thousand scattered tempest since arriued baltemore directed kinsale promise great succour pretended earle desmona lately taken sent england florence mac carty lord president vpon suspition lately taken like sort sent prsoner england spaniard gaue assoone could haue horse tyrone irish rebel hope brought foure hundred credibly aduertised saddle would keepe field therefore would fortifie kinsale vpon reuolt countrey king spaine meant part inuade england whereupon eight twenty day lord deputy resolued counsell letter bee written england giuen spaniard mounster sixe thousand certaine fiue thousand commanded iean del aguila whereof three thousand arriued kinsale viceadmirall siriago diego de brastino admirall fleet foure ship scattered tempest arriued baltemore irish account repaired excepting dependant florence mac carty whose imprisonment spaniard heard landing perswader comming port keepe rebel ioining behoued v presently keepe field requisite send queenes ship might preuent supply giue safety supply england coast coast might bring v carke artillery battery munition victual likewise write presently three hundred northerne horse two thousand foot chester two thousand write sixe peeces battery biggest demy cannon field carriage bullet certifie lord artillery could brought dablyn irish ship mast tackle strong enough take besides easterly northerly wind onely seruing bring rate season yeere greatest peeces mounster lay vnmounted ground lastly write powder fiue thousand shot sixe peeces battery must sixty last fifty tunne lead like quantity match fiue thousand pyoners tooles day lordship letter aduertised friet souldiers habit dispatched kinsale foure twenty september passed clommell naming himselfe iames flemming thence went waterford hee aboad dayes named himselfe richard galloway buls pope large indulgence aide spaniard sent catholike king giue irish liberty english tyranny exercise true olde apostolike roman religion authority excommunicate letter plot person ioyne maiesty pope excommunicated thereby absolued subiects oath alleagiance euery generall vicar diocesse charge keep secret till lord deputy passed corke assured lordship either generall defection able vnderstand proceeding hearing thereof imploied haue leisure preuent gaue spaniard kinsale besides dispersed tempest landed baltimore hauing treasure munition victual two yeers tyrone would presently come vp assist kinsale furnish horse onely expected brought saddle furniture lastly aduice therein giuen lordship write corporate townes chiefe lord beleeue fabulous report take aduice giuen feare defection onely good continue loyall subiects nine twentieth lordship lord president aboue named counsellor tooke horse guard rode view towne harbour kinsaile spaniard fleete vpon view might resolue fittest place campe sit downe found spaniard possessed towne greatest part shipping haue put sea spaine thirty foure ship arriuing twelue remained harbour lately put seene vnder sayle saw done till force arriued north lemster inabled england keepe selues breaking take field first october lordship counsell wrote lord england according proiect resolued eight twentieth september beseeching lordship pardon earnest writing munition victual though great proportion already sent respect magazine formerly appointed best place spaniard discent vnknowne farre diuided could without great difficulty make vse part time present spaniard master sea queenes force drawne towards kinsaile rebel might easily intercept land especially great vse might made prouisions place tirone come mounster force doubt would namely magazin lymricke would serue excellently prosecution formerly intended made connaght though sea land could brought corke without great difficulty danger adding present lord deputie forced draw force north mounster leauing onely fortes guarded pale able defend selfe tyrone whereas hoped haue enabled continue prosecution north also besiege spaniard one time whereof yet hee altogether despaire lordship would speedily furnish thing earnestly desired good seruice confidently opinion way make speedy end rebellion quicke dispatch spaniard ireland make warre roundly north mounster one time also aduertising spaniard certaine heard brought onely sixteene hundred saddle vpon rebel promise horse also great store armes common people vpon hope giuen generall reuolt humbly praying lordship regard greatest strength aduantage consisted horse would cause thousand quarter oates speedily sent corke without store horse like starue within short time case approued prosecution north bee continued without intermission would bee pleased send like quantitie oates kept store carlingford lastly praying lordship send hether master gunner sixe canoniers second october lordship wrote following letter master secretarie sir doe thinke shall finde force spaine aboue foure thousand aboundantly prouided munition artillery armes besides owne vse arme countrie people great store treasure victual flesh chiefes rebellion loose sword men presently take part lord haue reclaimed doe defend tirone must returne vnto vpon first good countenance spanish army shall make feare many declare themselues vpon first blow shall receiue hope god preserue v doubt would fall generall reuolt commander spanish army one greatest souldiers king spaine hath captaine vnder ancient men band italy terceraes bisonioes specially well armed shot heard musket haue brought sixteene hundred saddle armes horseman light shot whereof make account prouided ireland may well part christendome likewise haue horse saddle therein thinke deceiued yet come vnto v force onely found prouince vpon arriuall first troopes looke howerly shall send word good blowes passe betweene v meane dwell close grace god put sir king spaine hath begun inuade maiesties kingdomes put ireland generall commotion hath chosen worst place doe lay sudden foundation warre england best hath beene deceiued expectation state spaine must make good errour doubtlesse ingaged supplie defect commodity offered vnto maiesty shee may sooner preuent spaine prouide maiesties faithfull workeman bold propound taske may please send presently good part royall fleete prouisions battery write least many horse foote letter haue sued victual munition aboundance fit winter sharpe warre made vlster keepe spaniard important succour ruine euer traitor warre well followed made seuerall gouernours effect great haue performed thorowly must make one gouernour vlster fittest man bee chosen england ireland sir arthur chichester resolue course must continually receiue demand onely three hundred horse wee write good sent north one hundred foot send england supply company loughfoyle knockefergus aboue proportion much better armagh part shall receiue v course hope soone make end warre ireland spaine ireland perchance spaine long time england doubt conceiue action bee lesse importance goodly hauens part shipping many fighting men irish may hence king spaine carried inuasion england want two kind hath beene chiefe impediment hitherto well know beleeue sir experience king spaine preuaile ireland may carry aboue ten thousand men hence ioined army vse inuasion england chosen part christen dome sir know hope worst cannot dissemble confident beate spanish don well euer irish mack oes make perfect conclusion warre ireland soone interruption neuer happened wee haue god blessing queenes ordinary meanes without none infinite power worke beseech eternall god preserue maiesty kingdomes send happinesse kisse royall hand conscience hauing done seruice desire sir doe wish happinesse euer corke october sir assured doe seruice mountioy day lordship wrote another letter master secretary followeth sir diuers worthy men fit haue charge haue followed war voluntary great expence look meanes haue command vpon comming ouer next company send serue supply haue meanes keep going thither vse helpe friend get company promising thing doe course conceiue ease trouble importunate sutes would breede hold ready seruice vpon sudden thinking pollicy time spare may giue furtherance great worke haue hand please doe fauour procure company come ouer may appointed captaines nomination shall able satisfie gentleman expectation perswaded fitter imployment sent thence finding aduancement tied taske iudgement endeauour deserue best eye meanes thereof seruice sake chiefly affect though content sir acknowledge vnto would gladly haue world see lesse graced imployments predecessours haue beene people doe little obserue present especially hold matter consequence without shall lesse able weeld great businesse successe otherwise hopefull haue queenes pinnisses whereof time great want comming north althougst rebel generall giue hope forraigne succour yeere thinke policy make v flow call supply yet tyrlogh mac henry assure vpon life spaniard would come told one bathe agent tyrone spaine since returned sent scotland whence presently returne whereupon deliuered description man captaine button willed lie vpon coast apprehend assuring selfe haue wrested certainty thing since time haue heard nothing captaine queenes pinnis vnder command pray sir let v haue queenes shippes expedition without shall able conuay thing vpon coast place place way land dangerous sir wish happinesse third october lordship counsell wrote lord england following letter may please lordship hauing seriously considered great worke haue hand wee obserue besides forraigne enemy spaniard wee first deale knowne traitor rebel already armes two sort people wee doe carefully prouide soone adheare vnto rest make party strong iudgement wee cannot see shall well able encounter vnlesse good prouidence preuented marke aime one two sort subiect hath land good take wee must prouide defence else liuelyhood wee sure loose therefore wee omit nothing meanes stretch may preserue cherish content sort haue liuing thing afford maintenance yet hitherto haue shewed themselues disloyall though bee swordmen many gentleman discent able draw many follower sort wee heare certaine spaniard make offer great entertainement wee sort doe like wee cannot reason looke must fall partie wee haue therefore necessitie resolued take many maiesties intertainement wee haue hope truly sticke vnto v confident wee shall make good vse spaniard wee meane thorowly put though wee faile expectation finde cold slacke seruing v yet bee great countenance seruice shew person many men side otherwise would haue v assure lordship haue serued turne spaniard vntill wee haue freed ourselues without danger case maiestie charge wil longer hold entertainement meane time shall spend little queenes victuall paid new coine prouide themselues may bee lesse oppression countrie sort entertained would spoile put otherwise continue subiection course humbly desire lordship approbation though wee sparing entertaine shall necessary warrant master treasurer make paiment hold v beseech excused resoluing acquainted lordship seeing enforced thereunto necessitie seruice sake since many actiue would otherwise haue serued enemie wee could sooner write vnto lordship euen c day sir beniamin berry came corke lordship guard commanded company till time lordship part army band mounster lyst ninth day company came corke sir richard wingfield marshall drawne pale sir iohn barkeley sericant maior drawne frontier lemster connaght tenth day saturday company came corke sir henrie dauers drawne armagh northerne garrison day sir richard wingfield marshall sir iohn barkeley serieant maior sent horse foote view chuse fit ground neere kinsale army might sit downe besiege towne next day horse foote sent keepe irish selling victual spaniard twelfth two french men ran spaniard v confessed three thousand spaniard landed first kinsale beside sixe hundred since artiued great ship scattered tempest day one aduertised lordship vnder pretence fauouring spaniard discent spoken general inquired whether l deputie person came view kinsale number answered person foure hundred foote lodged farre sight foure troopes horse asked souldiers lord deputy answered eight thousand besides daily arriuall others army lemster north souldiers new weapon artillery lord deputy hee answered addition strength said generall presumed contrary wind england heard arriuall though hee told english fleete plymoth seemed beleeue made countenance haue enough doe defend english coast inuasion much insisted vpon copper money queene sent purpose make irish slaues promised gold siluer mastor inquired tyrone odonnel seeming distaste farre way dangerous owne want horse therefore prayed gentleman certifie tirrell lord leytrim hee expected tyrone horse beeues hee praied supply meane time sending notice came adding himselfe bread rice pea wine eighteene moneths store treasure inquired much strength corke queenes new fort lastly aduertised ship returned foureteene six king owne one thousand run least admirall generall saint liage great admirall castill diego de bruxero twelue remaining smaller embarged arctied serue king whereof irish ship baltemore men view kinsale royally prouided prouisions war hauing many saddle horse vpon tyrones expected comming intended take field thirteenth resolued presently take field though wee yet prouisions fit purpose day two dayes following could stirre corke reason extreame raine foule weather neither artillery munitio victual yet come dublin yet thought fitter thus vnprouided take field discouery want giue irish opportunitie courage ioyne spaniard chap ii besieging spaniard kinsale deliuery towne lord deputy returne spaine yeere day october lordship army rose corke encamped fiue mile short kinsale place called owny buoy army rose marching towards kinsale encamped within half mile towne vnder hill called knock robin shot spaniard offered disturbe sitting downe soone beaten home wee time scarce much powder would serue good dayes fight neither wee competent number tooles wee could intrench selues prouisions yet come dublin day captain morgan came england one queenes ship master gunner came waterford aduertising ship prouisions sent dublin come port enforced stay contrary wind southerly eighteenth army lay still viewed fittest place incampe neere towne artillerie come remoued night spaniard made salley much greater former disturbe campe men soone repelled without losse v ninteenth wee lay still expecting prouisions day men sent view ground slight skirmish enemy deu iean professed hee neuer saw come willingly sword men night sir iohn barkeley appointed giue alarum towne beate spanish guardes set without towne trench next night sixteene hundred spaniard came top hill vnder wee lay either purpose cut scout attempt thing campe sir iohn barkeley lying party exceeding three hundred discouered skirmishing killed dead place tooke armes spoyle hurt diuers beate backe towne without losse one men onely three hurt one twentieth cormock mac dermot irish man chiefe countrie called ministerie came rising souldiers countrie shew lord deputy end spaniard might see meere irish serued side commanded returne passe spanish trench made without towne top hil lodged strong party enemy fight second irish first went wel beat spanish guard ground according custome suddenly fell left one lord president horseman ingaged charged two spaniard sir william godolphin commanding lord deputy troope saw danger vnhorsed charge one way vpon grosse captaine henry barkley cornet troope charged another way instant droue shot trench rescued horseman horse comming one man hurt onely one horse killed great number spanish shot whereof foure left dead place diuers carried dead towne many hurt two twentieth day captaine button arriued corke queenes pinnis called moone wafted ship bringing victual munition dublyn day came campe aduertising shippes come waterford towards corke night lordship sent backe bring ship kinsale harbour take captaine ward shippe oyster hauen lay guard victuall munition brought v two ship commanded annoy castle rincoran seated close vpon harbour kinsale possessed spaniard spent many shot vpon castle without great effect ordinance small lay still keepe harbour neither castle towne might releeued water chiefe end comming three twentith dublyn shipping arriued corke directed come presently oyster hauen might vnlade artillery could brought land prouisions present vse army foure twenty day resolued rise incampe close towne shipping come artillery necessary day spent dispatching england night captaine blany captaine flower sent lie fiue hundred foote intertaine spaniard drawne towne came men returned day lordship counsell wrote lord england following letter may please lordship since last dispatch corke bare date fourth present moneth spent time expecting comming old company pale northerne part hoping supplied victual munition necessary dublyn without saw would little purpose take field staied till sixteenh prouided munition none come v dublyn lymricke whether likewise sent haue brought v wanting victual prouisions belonging necessarily great siege yet inuest town spaniard lodged receiuing succour victual disposed ioine withall auoid opinion countrey beganne conceiue weakenes wee draw field resolued sixteenth day rise next day sit downe within lesse halfe mile towne keeping continuall guardes round enemy assure lordship doe thinke selues much stronger thing number whose army setting sea beare reputation sixe thousand haue cause iudge since last letter lordship arriued another ship kinsale brought fiue hundred men vnto aboue foure thousand pole point number reputation pole differ much may please lordship consider whole force draw prouince leauing pale connaght north prouided may appeare inclosed note measure doth exceede lyst enforced leaue part vpon border towards lymricke stay whole countrey must reason thought company generally weake number seeing haue supply long time desire two thousand reinforce besides many taken necessary ward sicke many northerne company lie yet hurt since late great skirmish tyrone performed good successe little sent come hither wee doe assuredly expect many ioine tyrone hee onely come vp towards part almost swordmen kingdome keepe field countenance master thereof ill prouided soeuer wee doe find selues wherefore wee humbly earnestly desire lordship hasten away least full number supply horse foote doe write last please lordship beleeue v countrie ioyne tyrone make defection chiefe securitie horse must receiue england already much weakned harazed continuall employment euery seruice may also please lordship consider siege foure thousand men spaniard possessed place whatsoeuer bee necessarily required royall prouisions great number force neither bee thought sword season yeere continually waste army enforced earnestly desire lordship action hand send v continuall supply without army able subsist although grieued maiesties huge expence loth propound many men conceiued needefull profitable present prosecution dangerous warre yet wee opinion men maiesty presently spare imployed countrie safe sudden end make charge without cause moued solicite lordship consider thereof since wee perceiue haue army old disciplined souldiers v foure thousand spaniard assuredly expect far greater supply much twenty thousand fighting men furious warlike nation irish wee may iustly suspect declare themselues v supply strength england doe see v likely preuaile prouincials carbry excepted appertaining florence mac carty yet stand firme better neutralitie expected best affected possible discouer affection vntill tyrone irish force doe enter prouince councell dublin write prouiding come hither supply spaine presently expected arriue army strengthened england towne kinsale taken must thought generall defection kingdome wherein wee may except townes ensue warre drawne great length euent doubtfull queenes ship doe time come kinsale taske bee heauie small army force strong enemie well prouided necessary warre wherefore wee humbly beseech sending away onely giue v speedie course winne towne also assure coast supply giue exceeding stay countrie enemie fearing nothing subiect desiring nothing much arriuall maiesties fleete sixtie last powder sixe piece battery necessary victual thing else written former letter wee humbly desire may presently bee dispatched hither although great masse victual needefull cannot bee sent instant wee desire may bee sent bee prouided directed hauen corke wee shall bee able doe till supply come wee cannot say shall haue reason feare except come time lordship may iudge onely wee assure lordship maiestie helpe god shall finde wee omit nothing possible bee done shunne thing may bee suffered doe seruice wee owe vnto meane time letter councell dublin others countrie haue occasion write giue spaniard bee number three thousand meanes scant miserable person weake sickely hope dismayed amazed hope lordship conceiue countenancing party keepe many falling v side iean de laguyla spanish generall hath vsed many argument moue irish defection among forceable fearefull vnto wauering spirit telles first great action king master hath vndertaken assures hath protested receiue scorne making good enterprise rather hazard losse kingdom honour enterprise priest likewise terrifie conscience threaten hell damnation irish doe assist hauing brought bulles purpose send abroad indulgence take part like pollicies offering sixe shilling day euery horseman serue doe preuaile barbarous nation wonder vnto v present staggering fall flat defection soone doe discouer abilitie giue v one blow comming supply meanes wee earnestly solicite lordship hasten assuring lordship nothing confirme state kingdome arriuall maiesties fleete wee resolued best iudgements may imployed part preuent arriuall forraine succour yet meane time omit nothing shall feasable force haue neither haue idle since comming hither hauing continuall skirmish whereof two especially well performed men first twentieth moneth enemy night sallyed thousand foote cut guard horse kept neere towne purposing attempt something campe three hundred men led sir iohn barkley incounter beat backe losse many men body left field whose spoile men incouraged returned triumph next day cormock mac dermot chiefe lord muskerie comming campe shew v rising willed returne spaniard trench might see irish serue side entertained good skirmish soone falling horseman engaged vnhorsed sir william godolphin troope rescued charging close trench way flancked two trench filled great number shot yet returned great maruell little hurt hauing beaten strength killed many men whereof left behind besides others wee saw carry beginning hope god blesse iust quarrell shortly shall haue cause enforme better successe vnderstand tyrone presently come hither doe lordship iudge weake deale spaniard day lordship wrote following letter master secretarie sir desire affaire disposed haue general letter lord desire vnremoueable affection may held conclusion absolutely granted may trouble ceremony shall finde value life fortune world make assured demonstration thereof shall haue happinesse haue power occasion shew onely touching point lord president comming ouer take doubt owne particular could earnestly concurre doe protest christianitie know man kingdome could haue better pleased haue deliuerer affection action himselfe vnto might haue deliuered receiued much desire doe neither know conceiue could haue deliuered sufficiently present state kingdome propounded greater purpose maiesties seruice course fittest england embrace mine owne priuate desire hath opposed peremptory distaste motion protestation hate vrge besides seemes publike commodity weighty cause send away worthy instrument depriue selues assistance receiue thereby time especially stage great action chiefly owne prouince successe gouernement doth best shew authority iudgement presence doth carry conclude sake owne mine especially publike time cannot well spared hence besides hath vowed fall vrged although spoiles ambition vnwillingly shared men profession yet protest glad euen great goale honour runne equally participate aduentures band honour beare mutuall affection hauing chiefe knot seruice dearest soueraigne corruption may likely dissolue therefore hope tied hand god shall power man loose assured thinke state england cannot conceiue importance worke act est alia betweene england spaine doe play game haue least interest stake though winne loose liues shew doe play booty wherefore hope forget v vestrares agitur let onely argument could confirme many circumstance oppose selfe counsel sell birth rite heauen selfe please owne enuious partiall pallates warre lowcountries begunne hath beene maintained naturall spaniard arriued already putting armes discipline people warlike auxiliary sir trouble longer desirous doe somewhat worth writing god send v easterly winde vnto much happines doe wish vnto owne soule campe kinsale this24 october sir assured euer doe seruice mountioy fiue twenty army ready rise weather falling foule direction giuen dislodge foure naturall spaniard came day v enemy next day sent corke night sir iohn barkeley went three hundred foot hauing captaine flower captaine morris captaine bostocke fell spaniard trench beate towne fell gate killed hurt aboue twenty spaniard hauing three hurt men hitherto lodged cabbins rained vpon v bed changed shirt sixe twenty army dislodged incamped hill northside kinsale called spittle somewhat musket shot towne intrenched strongly fat downe discouered spaniard gotten prey two hundred three hundred cowes many sheepe iland seemed vpon southeast side towne beyond water wee could passe going eight nine mile necke land goe captaine taffe sent horse foot vsed expedition businesse attained place night hot
