horse foote totall whole army ireland horse foote sixe thousand nine hundred foote kinsale mounster one company one hundred conuerted earle desmonds vse kept england placed vpon border prouince bee stay countrie old band called north pale connaght deficient number hauing long worne skirmish sickness without supply lately sent england though much often desired sixe thousand nine hundred foote distributed regiment commanded colonel shall appeare increase list next moneth seuen twentieth day artillerie prouisions sent dublin landed oyster hauen munition brought campe front quarter faced towne strongly fortified campe round intrenched workes perfected could bee done day reason foule weather spaniard held castle rincorane first landing commanded harbour kinsale shipping could safely land prouisions neere campe thought fit make taking thereof first worke purpose sir iohn barkeley sir william godolphin captaine iosias bodley trenchmaster sent chuse fit place plant artillerie castle day two coluerings long vsed made fit next day mounted spaniard towne foure thousand strong wee many campe pole though lyst night spaniard issued towne water relieue castle captaine button ship beate backe thirtieth day two culuerings began batter castle one brake cauening meane time spaniard gaue alarum campe drew demy canon towne wherewith plaied camp killed two first shot neere lord deputy tent shot next tent paymaster wherein lordship secretary lie brake barrell paymaster money two barrel lord deputy beare next cabin shot made fell lord deputy quarter neere owne tent night spaniard attempted againe relieue castle sir richard porcy hauing guard lord president regiment vnder command repulse one thirtieth day coluering battered castle morning another culuering canon planted plaied without intermission busily attending principall spaniard came kinsale shew go relieue rincorran land drew toward guard kept betweene rincorran towne leauing great grosse second vnder walles vnder colour giue safe passage boat castle whereupon diuers broken company regiment campe armes drew voluntarily way sir oliuer saint iohns sent captaine roe lieutenant colonel sir arthur sauages lieuienant one hundred men seeing likely draw round skirmish hee himselfe tooke thirtie shot owne companie went vpto found captaine roe skirmishing enemy shot two hundred hauing another grosse lying neere towne second seeing spaniard come vp close pike giue charge ioyned captaine roe incountring beate backe second making retire hastily spaniard playing vpon men shot euery house part towne charge sir oliuer saint iohn receiued many push pike target one slightly hurt thigh hee killed leader common souldier owne hand lord audley comming vp regiment shot thigh sir garret haruy hurt hand horse killed vnder captaine buttlers lieutenant slaine foure part sir arthur sauages lieutenant shot body fourteene part weee hurt enemie left ten dead place besides hurt men apparantly saw many next day heard seuentie one saw brought house hurt men lay reported eight died night likewise skitmish iuan hortesse del contreres taken prisoner serieant maior force britain men got diuers good rapier good armes piece battered castle till six clock night castle beate drumme lord president lord deputie left himselfe euening returned take care camp admitted come vnto drum came irish man borne corke name rest prayed armes bagge baggage might depart kinsale lord president refused said hee would conclude commander castle neither commission accept composition yeelding maiesties mercie presently sent another drumme serieant lord president refused speake returne commander himselfe alfiero ensigne called bartholomeo de clarizo captaine legge broken came vnto lord president insisting condition depart armes bag baggage kinsale offer refused put safe castle wee began afresh battery hotly euer bestowed vollies shot v first nouember two clocke morning found castle weakened fury battery againe beare drumme parley refusing many attempted escape vnder rocke close water side men perceiuing drew close vp castle hindered escape first nouember earely morning lord president came campe made relation night proceeding lord deputie determined would render castle armes vpon promise life spaniard onely promise send safe spaine receiued mercy concluded speedie taking castle importance easie furnishing v prouisions harbour reputation side also could enter breach without losse good men esteemed pretious pole campe spaniard towne besieged v reason company deficient number list hauing supplied england long time noble dealing spaniard castle might induce kinsale leaue towne vpon like composition felt misery whereunto wee hoped ere long bring one hower day alfiero sent word lord president time returned would quit armes render place might suffered thus vnarmed goe kinsale refused hee intreated himselfe alone might hold armes bee put kinsale also refused resolutely resolued burie himselfe castle company seeing desperately bent yeeld threaten cast breach might receiued mercy last consented yeeld people disarmed castle committed captaine roger haruy captaine guard see done alfiero weare sword till hee came lord president render vp done brought prisoner campe immediatly sent thence corke spanish thus yeelded number fourescore sixe foure woman whose name haue omit breultie besides great multitude irish churles woman child swordmen skilfull way escaped one dermot mac carty excepted pensioner king spaine heretofore follower florence mac carty also thirtie spaniard slaine defence castle yeelded v kinsale making one shot men standing men amased second nouember finding much doe taking rincorran castle weake prouisions concluded attempt kinsale towne vaine till wee better furnished businesse notwithstanding made daily countenance take hand day drew ordinance castle camp third day nouember spanish serieant maior britauny taken skirmish alfero yeelding rincorran obtained licence write iean de l aguyla one drum licence carry letter staied towne following night day lordship receiued letter supply sent england whereupon wrote counsell dublin sir arthur chichester make stay certaine company lately hee directed bee brought north pale campe kinsale touching said supply maiestie writ lord deputie letter following elizabeth regina right trusty well beloued wee greet well vpon aduertisements wee haue receiued diuers place fleete dispatched spaine good number men warre bee landed realme assistance rebcls haue thought good send hence force increase army enable better make head shall fortune land wherefore haue caused leauied number two thousand men appointed embarked twentieth day moneth october aboue two thousand lately sent vnto two thousand leauied cannot certainely iudge whether shall finde commodious seruice either vse filling vp decaied band retaine company employ filling vp decares company retaine band haue thought good leaue disposition discretion aduice councell onely authorize hereby forasmuch part shall retaine seuerall band aboue number establishment payment whereof neither treasurer haue warrant may giue warrantto treasurer paiment whole part said two thousand shall find necessarie retaine pay band seuerall aboue number establishment former warrant limited said paiment made lending apparrell souldiers paied begin day landing since writing thus much concerning two thousand preparing wee haue receiued aduertisements landing spaniard kinsale whereupon haue added supplie three thousand men sent may shall haue cause increase alter number armie seruice shall require doe therefore giue warrant giue order time time paiment number men either horse foote aboue number limited establishment shall bee priuy councell sixe whereof treasurer england principall secretarie two authorized retaine pay seruice shall require giuen vnder signet mannor richmond fourth day october fortie thee yeere raigne postscript al number two thousand shal imbarked ship fourteenth october rochester shal secured transportation two thousand shall bee sent twentieth moneth bristow barstable fifth odde thousand shall sent loughsoyles leauie fiue thousand men day lordship receiued another letter queene owne hand signed aboue vsually signed followeth since brainesicke humour vnaduised assault hath seized heart causelesse foe doubt gaine baine glory shame euer thought thereof humour agrees fightly wee thinke fortunately happened rule shew better whose owne hand writ hath told v late doe beseech almightie power highest guide hand nothing light vaine prosper heede nothing left behind might auaile praise selfe venturing farre make foe prey tell army v make full account euery hundred beate thousand euery thousand doubled bolder pronounce name euer hath protected righteous cause blesse putting first place end scribling hast louing soueraigne e r day lordship receiued letter lord england signifying renne shippes warre set sayle rochester first wind eight october last attend coast mounster wherein sent two thousand foot army mounster vnder captaines appointed two thousand leuied bee sent army way bristow barstable left lordship bee disposed supply company hee thought fit one thousand foote sent supplie loughfoyle garrison two hundred horse sent lordship army fifty horse loughfoyle sent lordship besides former twenty last powder thirty last sent large prouisions victual greatly commended lord president prouidence made souldiers former ly liue pay money preserued former store victual mounster time without army could haue kept field till new prouisions ariued last part lp letter followeth word hereunto must adde whereof selues haue good hearer obseruers prince apprehend better acceptation lordship proceeding kingdome maiestie doth much vsed often speech would wish army safetie people better hand principall officer state army doth obserue difficulty well entertained alacritie resolution must let lordship know maiestie read priuate letter mee principall secretarie written kilkenny owne hand assoone heard newes forraigne enemie pleased maiestie cause bee read v written stile wherein shee discerned strong power owne minde promising selfe happy successe enemie liuely affection beare person desire bee made sacrifice wherein although haue deceiued former expectation yet maiestie would haue know shee doth doubt shall liue doe many seruices haue made prouince mounster serue sepulcher new conquerours foure thousand men maiestie sendeth mounster wee send onely two thousand vnder captaines rest wee leaue conductor vsed shall please arriue displace wee doe send thinke sufficient therefore till wee heare wee haue say wee account selues one ship wee concurre aduance ministerie whatsoeuer maiestie shall resolue doe v hauing one ende one desire inable maiesties principall instrument free kingdome malicious attempt forraine power redeeme ward misery intestine rebellion fifth nouember foure barkes munition victual sent dublin arriued kinsale harbor vpon certaine intelligence tyrone comming vp great army ioyne spaniard resolued counsell state colonel councell warre next day camp fortified tyrone north side furthest towneward next day following lord president two regiment foote consisting two thousand one hundred men lyst three hundred twentie fiue horse draw border prouince stop least hinder tyrones passage purpose lord barry lord bourke force countrie direction attend lord president sixth day campe accordingly fortified seuenth morning lord president said horse foote left campe time concluded counsel wee could attempt nothing towne vntill either lord president returned new force prouisions promised england arriued iudged great worke v meane time continue lying towne since spaniard towne number besieged seuenth day lordship counsell wrote lord england following letter may please lordship first second present moneth receiued maiesties lordship comfortable letter fourth sixth last speciall care pleaseth take v doe yeeld haue iust cause humble heartiest thankes protesting labour deserue continuance pleaseth lordship promise thereof vttermost endeuours seruices euen sacrificing liues meane time humbly pray lordship accept good part fauourably report vnto maiestie hitherto haue able performe though nothing affect meanes answered desire little expected come fome dublin sent vpon spaniard first landing fauourable wind arriued sooner hoped wee beseech lordship giue v leaue referre information point iournall herewithall send thereby wee conceiue best appeare wee haue done enabled doe since returne master marshall officer commander sent purpose pale part northward draw force thereabouts speedily hither v hasten hither prouisions haue need lordship fauour license v adde wee hardly proceede till supply men munition come finde worke great difficulty assured losse men expence al prouisions warre vndertake meanes haue force many men place although greatly otherwise fortified body men onely whereas towne kinsale hath good wall many strong castle wee doe looke howerly tyrone esteemed comming great armie horse foote selected rebel ireland others seduce partie comming prouincials discouer themselues either v neutral better wee doe expect except supply doe come arriuall wee shall hardly bee master field rather driuen wee feare discontinue siege yet maiesties shipping prouisions supply doe arriue time hope giue ere bee long good account place though wee desire lordship consider difficulty haue contend countrie season yeere besides force opposition enemie president doe acknowledge receit intelligence concerning captaine pleaseth lordship remember since time kept good spiall vpon haue sight paper yet cannot find thing giues cause suspect therefore thinke fit seeing company returned hither among make vse seruice find fit vntill may apt occasion dispose elsewhere without giuing discontentment vnlesse particular certaine ground charge wee must receiue thence yet meane time hee shall bee narrowly looked vnto hee haue wee doubt hee shall haue meanes hurt much seuenth day lordship vnderstanding master secretary letter dated nineteenth last moneth receiued second moneth found maiesty inclined make one gouernour ouer vlster especially like sir arthur chichester great charge whereupon hee purposed proceed therein lordship would explane himselfe hee would haue matter carried lordship wrote minde plainely therein aduising sir arthur chichester bee made gouernour vlster name please maiesty giue whereby hee might direct part prouince resident thinke fittest seruice commanding chiese came managing warre generall left himselfe except receiued particular direction vpon speciall occasion england lord deputy adding lord might speedily enformed done fit required making warre commander thought fittest charge praying lord would aduise sir henry dockwra hold good correspondency maiesties seruice since hee conceiued warre bee chiefly made two ioining together scot number exceeding foure thousand might conceit fitly entertained left disposall sir arthur chichester whose iudgement vpon state thing fittest followed hee could best chuse apt place lodge till sir henry dockwra might draw field scot ioyne would great vse spoile best seruice done vpon irish concluding written sir arthur chichester send england secretary opinion businesse doubt hee would presently doe proiect appointing gouernour vlster tooke effect reason tyrone force defeated shortly mounster master secretary time sent lordship spanish newes answere confessed likely yet thought would bee hard make ready foure thousand men christmas signified opinion necessity spanish force already ireland expected losse sea since comming hither failing irish hitherto ioine supply would hastened sooner determined aduertised prisoner taken come vnto v lordship acknowledged himselfe much bound vnto master secretary good dispatch procured last passage least maiesty pleased allow entertainement irish yet beseeched beleeue course preuented tyrone great many men otherwise would must haue serued entertainement hauing meanes liue yet hitherto done within compasse lyst white knight one comming approbation prouided carefull hee giue good contentment outcry pale answered maruel obserued iudge word pale cost queen million yet il disposed backward euen defence suffred tyrone horse number burne prey pleasure though able themselues haue beaten force besides assistance company queenes pay three thousand two thousand least yet would consider foure thousand spaniard prisoner tooke deliuered vpon saluation prisoner relation intelligence concurre possessed towneful strong house walled helped many aduantages ground though commanded place hee might easily conceiue must bee small army force since approches winter difficult trench made continually filled water decay men great continuall labour sicknesse sword bullet therefore reason keepe great body men pale guard till dangerous war fiuished preuent clamour pale meerely vnpossible though would please maiesty keepe ten thousand pay would stirre raise crie suffer themselues bee vsed malice owne heart might haue colour complaint worst sort people kingdome though protested carefull kindred speciall friend knowing well humor clamerous maiesties expence besought beleeue man looke vpon griefe himselfe reaped commoditie onely painefull faithfull distributer thereof according necessitie seruice soule desire wit endeuour seeke abridge end warre charge desired mercy god fauour bound thereto publike duty yet protested priuate estate would vrge thereunto found vnable longer continue expence forced liue growing greater mixed coyne hee euer thought would fall heauy vpon reason might value entertainement lesse halfe time old standard whatsoeuer bought new coyne raised double price whereas seemed master secretarie informed late submitted themselues maiesties mercy protection againe reuolted rebel answered true made peace tyrone truth except wee could haue giuen order defence neuer expect especially since arriuall forraine force hee thinke none ireland sure euen mounster would like armie hang ouer yea sure lord president opinion hee moued preserue thing world disaduantage might call neglecting knew fittest preserued maiesty seruice touching submitties rebellion spoile waste kill many receiued mercy made many kill others rebellion leese liues queenes seruice againe reuoulted hee doubted either ruine againe force submission vpon condition listed god pleased send v happy end war forraigne enemy atchieuement whereof hoped hee heare grace eternall god would aduenture far good fashion might expected army vpon arriuall supply men munition till hee protested wee stand hee sure without good number men store al sort munition towne manned could forced added hitherto god bethanked endeuours prospered proud enemy neuer armie better disposed commaders continually shewed sound iudgement braue resolution done particular sir oliuer iohns great honour giuen whole army sight found man come skirmish mentioned iournall spake hee extraordinarily performed owne hand farre grearer measure therein related time lord audley hurt fighting gallantly please maiesty take notice thereof would great comfort incouragement rest hoped god would enable v shortly send relation better seruice meane time euer praied eternall god preserue maiesty kingdomes send poore seruants peace quietnes added could wish pleased maiesty haue left horse disposall least haue bestowed englishman conferred though hold commander worthy gentleman faithfull maiesties seruice yet irish short time would make horse irish accompted haue receiued onely one hundred serue purpose much build horse onely chiefe strength time haue stood hereafter maiesty lessen army bee imploied absolute finishing warre purpost likelihood able make vse confessed little trouble added although foure thousand spaniard already landed horse yet doubt would auayle themselues great assistance countrey number much naturall spaniard king made long continued great warre lowcountries besides besought remember two hundred spaniard held fort lately built croyden britany till sir iohn norreis lost neere one thousand fiue hundred men god bethanked plucked one hundred fitfy spaniard eares rincorran wee hoped grace god doe like kinsale yet except god please extraordinarily worke v likely done without great losse men expence prouisions purpose beganne worke hard fortifying towne finding themselues said men deale expected c eight nouember certaine ship number thirteene discried passe kinsale westward knowne whether english spaniard tenth day newes earle thomond landed one thousand foot left lord deputy disposall hundred horse appointed england commanded said earle thirteene ship discouered passe westward time spaniard gotten knowledge lord president departure campe good part force thereupon supposing v much weakened deed inferiour body men towne drew day noone part force soone sent sixty shot pykes foot hill close campe leauing trench well lined second presently drawne entertaine skirmish came vp another strong party sent towards ryncorran bushy hill plaied flanckes vpon trench beate first sent close campes beaten backe shot thinking find second left behind disappointed quitting trench meanes driuen follow rest succour towne men follewing much fury hurt killed diuers amongst brought body sergiant possessed enemy trench enemy reinforced made many attempt regaine repulsed beaten backe towne wee heard diuers iean committed sergiant maior commanded chiefe presently fight threatned take head commended highly valour men cried shame vpon cowardise owne said beene terrour nation lost reputation hee gaue straight commandement vpon paine death hee caused bee set vp towne gate thenceforth man come seruice vntill hee fetched officer though powder spent peece broken make good place sword captaine soto one best commander day slaine made great mone twenty besides hurt could many side onely ten hurt three killed among master hopton gentleman lord deputy band sore hurt day died thereof skirmish beene readily resolutely answered part spaniard discouered smalnes number would doubt haue plied v continuall sally hardly haue beene able continue siege eleuenth day newes one hundred horse thousand foot embarked bastable left lord deputy disposall horse made new troopes foot dispersed supply raise new company lordship thinke fit arriued waterford twelfth day sir richard leuison admirall queenes fleet sent ireland sir amia preston viceadmirall arriued tenne ship warre corke wherein two thousand foot vnder captaines appointed england besides prouisions artillery munition lordship directed admirall speed bring fleet harbour kinsale thirteenth day lordship wrote master secretary following letter sir hearing last packet yet gone corke reason contrariety wind haue good occasion make addition former dispatch haue receiued letter lord thomond sr anthony cooke others diuers place supply appointed prouince safely arriued waterford yoghall corke castle hauen losse heare one victular although weather hath beene extreme tempestuous last euening enformed rumour queenes shippes discouered hauen corke whereupon presently dispatched sir richard leuyson put hauen kinsale otherwise would long ere shal able auaile selues artillery munition brought v lord president heard rebel drawne downe strong whereupon haue directed sir christopher laurence comming campe force pale repaire speedily lord president meane send vnto horse come england hope force sufficient stop power rebel make specially since tyrone heare himselfe except doe steale heard preuent come force passage confident many horse lord president shall haue neuer put themselues vpon plaine although dangerous enemy world wee driuen seeke strength passe fastnesse yet worst weakest force owne way either vpon straight plaines except steale passage feare make doubt lord president giue good accompt campe since last letter haue much doe enemy one day drew thinke whole force vpon opinion greatest part army gone v meet rebel began round fight v close trench entertained well waited home wals towne made leaue dead body behind although saw carry many haue made within lesse caliuer shot trench good fight euen thence close towne men follow great disaduantage yet beat one trench another til much adoe make souldiers come greatest losse side fell share one company killed gallant gentleman serued band called mr hopton hurt feare death think aboue killed campe ouer head wee skirmish made good muster haue thought good checke v within towne without doe worke hard haue raised rauelings mount wee contrary side keepe good watch wee receiue one blow spanish fencer ireland would take heart haue great reason secure beleeue vpon honor thinke besieged number besieger time doe continually taste v find v well warde still goe away vennies queenes ship come cast hope god ere long winne faire game queene whose money wee play without consideration iust circumstance present busines serue priuate purpose taxe mee negligent part kingdom large demand beseech sir beleeue good ground precipitate drawing hither prouisions haue craued strengthen selfe meanes worke first opinion onely lord president suddenly make head force prouince would haue reuolted wee suffered force spaine haue master field sixe dayes easily might haue sought well preuent assure se fe al townes prouince would haue reuolted current fortune would haue run violently ireland would haue late haue stopped second difficulty winter siege countrie reason great number besieged forced keep strong continual guard soone waste greater army god doe mightily blesse v weather extreme many time bring sentinel dead station protest euen chiefe commander whose diligence cannot mightily commend doe many looke like spirit toyle watching vnto good reason moued since many example enemy sally two three thousand men haue defeated army haue trebble number besides ordinary difficulty al winter siege doe waste make vnprofitable greatest part army wee make neerest approches force cannot doe without great losse although towne weake canon yet plant canon haue place absolutely command towne weak defend self yet exceeding strong offend best part art adde fortification well prouided nature one hill beat ground wee lodge neere difficulty many doe alleage way diffident great fauour god determined shew maiestie action may measure guesse wee improuident maiesties cause require army charge greater proportion fit taske wee haue performed happinesse hope eternall god blosse v say proue vnto large domine factum est hoc mirahilc est nostris sir write vnto haue desire let know publike priuate end letter time hope shall beate spaniard hauing vp night groweth foure clocke morning time lightly chuse visit guard selfe going businesse morning cold stone darke pitch pray sir think whether life take much delight heretofore england haue suite queene could lie tent summer watch night till supped god sir doe queene elizabeth doe selfe willingly pledge faithfully serue world world else beseech god going may neuer returne aliue house turffe write maieistes campe kinsale thirteenth november thirteenth day fleet recouered mouth kinsale harbour could get wind strong foureteenth day fleete much difficulty warped recouered harbour whence admirall viceadmirall came lord deputy campe night next day two thousand foot sent vnder captaines queenes shippes landed came campe fifteenth day afternoone lord deputy went aboard shippes whence returning campe enemy discerned riding head troop horse made shot town grazed neere beat earth face ship sent vnto v onely artillery munition also speciall officer attend fiue canoneers two blackesmiths two wheelewrights two carpenter day lord deputy aduertised according former direction sir christopher st laurence come pale earle clanrickard connaght lord president campe lordship wrote rebel slip carefull come vp force campe hee might arriue ioine v rebel came vp farre queenes ship saluted lord deputy going aboard thundering peales ordinance direction next day beat vpon castle iland called castle nyparke lord deputy resolued make next worke beat spaniard inuest towne side ship performed brake top castle finding greater hurt weather extreame stormy ceased shooting day lordship gaue direction hundred horse one thousand foot first landed castle hauen arriued thence harbour kinsale conducted corke refresh themselues beaten sea landed extreame weather winter campe meanes refreshed beganne die would haue beene lost made vnseruiceable course beene taken hearten day many day diuers spaniard ranne towne v vnderstood tenth day skirmish aboue named captaine soto man speciall accompt slaine seuenteenth day weather continued stormy neither day next could land ordinance doe thing moment yet day maiesties coronation lordship purposed solemnize extraordinary attempt weather would haue suffered v looke abroad wee sent night storme appeased seriant maior captaine bodley foure hundred foot discouer ground castle n parke see whether might carried pickaxe accordingly attempted engine gotten defend men worke strong haue beene within castle hauing store great stone top rumbled downe fast broke men returned losse two men proceeded course eighteenth day lord deputy called counsel counsell ireland al colonel chiefe officer field propounded since pleased maiesty graciously supply v matter prouisions warre part adulse forme might bee likely bring forth effect vnworthy princely care first strength meanes attempt place continue siege thorowly considered next number commodity enemy towne succour abroad commodity incommodities proceeding expedition keeping relife thorowly disputed end concluded soundest course vse meanes inuest speedily might possessing selues al held without towne next mount artillery place might annoy breaking downe house expose extremity cold raine exposed campe meanes might reduced greater weakenesse forced much lesse hazard since come point entering breach little difference betweene strong towne weake besieged either doe wholly trust new sudden workes enemy within good opportunity doe place yet knowledge blany presently put armes drawne neere wals towne entertained hot skirmish spaniard lodged trench close breach without towne skirmish artillery plaied vpon shewed themselues either breach trench wingfield marshall caused many great smal shot made promise pound hit beat whereupon many great shot beat durt face story eares yet skirmish continued walking braue manner without receiuing hurt many thinke best souldiers often dangerously hurt errour wound badge honour yet may befall coward assoone valiant man haue knowne aduenmrous men neuer receiued wound pardon digression warrantable iournall reason rany weather nothing could done onely vpon relation french runnaway enemy purposed sally againe men short time drawne armes vaine fourth day receiued confirmation spaniard arriual castlehauen whereupon resolued counsel first camp strongly fortified al horse drawne quarter lesser camp west side consisting onely three regiment namely earle thomond sir richard percy sir christopher saint laurence rise sit downe farther towards southgate hauing another regiment added strengthen drawne first campe north side towne lord deputy lodged lot whereof fell sir charles wilmott trench fort east side guarding cannon committed continuall guard captaine blany fort west gate captaine ghest battery cease till stormes new spanish supply irish rebel drawing neere ouer drumme sent towne offer iean liberty bury dead message receiued due respect prayed v burie promise like happening fall power drum according direction expostulated iean howsoeuer spanish prisoner well vsed v yet lordship heard one men taken last salley hurt long gaue himselfe irish man kept hospitall discouered englishman drawne killed cause iean sent backe spanish drum lord deputy intreating buriall dead foresaid promise doe like expostulation denying thing done knowledge protestation punish highly hee could discouer thing haue done first lordship promised doe christian like act though knew inequalitie offer hauing many body presently power second lordship rested satisfied yet lp expostulate drum vpon summons towne martiall manner content returne resolute answere added scandalous word terming v meschini answered protesting speech ill deliuered harquebuzier vndertooke interpret could doe rightly lordship also excepted kind challenge sent iean question betweene england spaine tried combat betweene two triall neither power commission ieans though hee power besides councell trent forbad romanists fight campo stectuto combat field message rather quarelsome honourable otherwise lordship protested bee willing accept thankes noble offer lastly lordship remembred first setting downe sent drum iean message whereas lordship vnderstood certaine lady woman bee towne offered playing artillerie free leaue depart remaining still command prouision themselues campe afforded iean made vnciuill answere would baud exception hee answered spanish shrug shouldier hauing knowledge commission satisfie lordship therein lordship protested courtesie offered hitherto proceeded honourable respect vseth passe betweene honourable enemy would euer true owne honour whatsoeuer others case conceiued proceede respect greatnes power spanish nation owne feare would hereafter shew much disdained ill interpretation courtesie lordship dismissed drum night spaniard attempted something boat sentinel soone beaten backe againe fifth day sir richard leuison though wind hindered going kinsale harbour yet towing got warspite defiance swiftsure marline one merchant caruill went seeke spanish fleete newly arriued castlehauen day foure regiment aboue named remoue new camping place determined day sixth day ten morning fleete arriued castle hauen foure afternoone one spanish ship sunke spanish admirall nine foote water hold droue shore vpon rock viceadmirall two others droue likewise ground spaniard quitting ship fleete forced stay next day contrary wind spaniard hauing landed ordinance plaied vpon ship day night following warped day returned kinsale sixt day likewise scottish barke bringing soldier spaine one fleet newly ariued castlehauen seuered sea storme came harbour kinsale put spaniard fourescore hand brought campe examined lord deputie dauid high lieth master owner vnicorne examined laid vpon oath went waterford sixe weekes agoe good waterford rochel burdeaux driuen foule weather leake groyne within hower hee anchor ship arrested himselfe taken gouernour called conde vnladen barke taken away sailes set libertie siriago part spanish fleete sent ireland ready embarke againe ireland hauing one thousand foure hundred land souldiers placed nine ship whereof examinate one admirall syriago netherlander one hundred fifty tunne therabout viceadmirall flemming one hundred twenty tunne abouts beside three french ship three scot fliboat haue great prouisions powder pioners tooles twelue great piece mounted field seuen twentieth last set saile groine direction farre examinate vnderstands kinsale departure groyne one iordan roche kinsale bound burdeaux thence southspaine comming anchor groyne taken forced king name pilot coast ship sent voiage vnderstood castle ryncoran nyparke taken hee heard also report french man hee met sea aboard ship imbarked fourescore spaniard fiue sixe woman fiue twentie tunne bread sixe butt wine whereof part spent beuerage munition souldiers weapon brought none aboard brittingdona lisbone ready transport two thousand souldiers ireland soone hee get shipping diego de brochero returne ireland landed lisbone thence posted court arriuall present dispatch made hasten supply ireland spaine make doubt ireland already thence common bruite england scotland set vpon turk fifth december made land betweene corke kinsale winde scant turned day night come seuen clocke morning came harbour opening day perceiued fleete spaniard conceiued fleete hee saith knowne bee maiesties purpose hee came put spaniard hand ship came anchor hee got boat discouered sir amyas preston spaniard hee aboard whereupon sir amyas preston manned boates towed ship whereunto spaniard made resistance lastlie heard groyne adilantado port saint marie daily expect comming offoure thousand italian purpose hee knew spaniard examined oath said fleete siriago aboue one thousand diuers taken gaoles poore naked whereof one whole companie portingals taken prison admirall laden bisket powder match two cannon battery whole fleete consists tenne saile whereof admirall viceadmirall hulkes three hundred tonne esteemed rest small barkes diuers nation siriago command fleete captaine alonzo del campo command foote chiefe captaine terceres hath old company sanedra hath another old company young souldier heard nothing kinsale besieged brittendona lisbone gathering supply knew ready spring adilantado southspaine regiment three thousand italian come ireland whole fleete bound kinsale thought queenes fleete ship spaine shipping gathered together lisbone spring foure thousand italian comming england sixth day december ordinance drawne easterne westerne platformes first camp northside towne lord deputy lodged might better attend seruice field hauing artillery commodiously placed since aduertised odonnel ioyned spaniard landed lately castlehaeuen hee together tyrone assisted rebel force ireland drawing vp towards kinsale relieue come within mile campe newes spaniard kinsale knowledge thereupon tooke heart againe otherwise ready yeeld vpon reasonable composition respect thought enough v keepe ground held enemy till wee supplied england since vpon least defeate disaster befalling v whole kingdome would haue hazarded lost reason people inclination generall reuolt fortified foresaid campe west southwest side earle thomond lay foure regiment resolued two smal fort cast vp manned betweene campe water side southward said fort campes one flancking thereby inuest towne succour countrie might cut resolued ditch lord deputy campe bee deepned trench highthned backe part furthest towne lying open hitherto bee closed made defensable tyrones force side towards towne made spaniard one time giue vpon v fort barricadoed possible art access towne betweene two campes stopped seuenth day lord deputy aduertised master secretary england particular adding daily heard hot alarum tyrones purpose relieue towne strengthened aboue named force lodged wood accessable strength neere campe hee hindered v forage horse helpes wee formerly country sustentation army neighbourhood one side spaniard kinsale kept v bay proceeding aproches battery besides last supply short time incredibly wasted new men dying dozen night hardnes winter siege whereunto inured yet lordship still made good first hope victory though deferred hee thought haue attempted safety state ease army done hazard state inseperable great action greater painefulnes souldier bee indured patience eight day artillery placed seuerall place north side campe best defence thereof fort west side campe according aboue mentioned resolution cast vp almost finished towards night slight skirmish spaniard ancient men hurt euening rebel horse discouered tyrones force shew themselues two mile supper men drawne armes vpon notice giuen v scout rebel drew nigh small time sauing watch dismissed rest night sir richard leuyson returned castle hauen queenes ship harbour kinsale came campe giue lord deputy accompt good seruice done nine ten eleuen day spent building two sconce fort formerly resolued sixth day counsell built west side towne betweene earle thomonds quarter water southward inuest towne round cast vp trench betweene fort earle thomonds quarter thirty score length fort campe slancking cast vp trench side lord deputy campe stop passage cowes horse reliefe towne spaniard made two three light sally view work west side likewise twelfth day beaten back ease losse part thirteenth day drew three peeces artillery lord deputy campe planted west side neere campe play vpon abby flancked part wee intended make new breach day spaniard taken scot ship sent england sir oliuer iohns dispatched england lord deputy counsell wrote following letter lord england may please lordship haue proceeded great businesse wee haue hand since ourlast dispatch vnto lordship seuenth last moneth wee haue thought fit set downe way iournall inclosed humbly praying leaue referre lordship thereunto auoid needlesse repetition seruices haue hitherto performed shall happily fall short lordship time haue expected selues wee acknowledge hoped wee haue made collection sundry difficulty opposition haue incountred since first newes spaniard discouery vpon coast end might appeare vnto lordship plainely view thereof wee confident nothing hath beene wanting endeuours bring worke desired conclusion slow proceeding hath beene inauoydably occasioned slow vntimely comming v meanes prouisions without impossible effectually actiue arising new accident impediment meane time made worke difficult therefore hope imputed fault since arriuall queenes shippes force altillery prouisions england haue annoied towne battery part thereof breach almost assaultable house towne much beaten downe great weakening defendant much without hope offered composition within little time haue entered force though held course much hazard losse regard within strong body men know certaine spaniard finding hardly laid importuned tyrone odonnell force come releeue accordingly come encamped farre towne one thousand spaniard arriued castle hauen great store munition artillery report greater force comming doth bewitch people make accompt countrey goe haue done already former letter signified feared odonnels force said foure thousand ioined spaniard landed castle hauen tyrones heare generally many since passage countrey hither tyrrell many lemster rebel said ioined comming also hither meanes wee induced leaue battery time strengthen campes may able indure sury wee hope shall keepe towne still sieged inuested wee hope end carry notwithstanding doe yet since apparent king spaine meanes make place seate warre onely gaining kingdome time time push england get haue taken examined doe confesse whole strength irish drawne drawing hither set vp rest get liberty call haue long sought must earnestly intreat lordship supply v speedily thing necessary great warre like hold matter necessity foure thousand foote sent v presently without staying one another come together leuied shipped away desire good choice may made men armes last much defectiue vnder captaines ill body men supply ill armes weapon wee conceiue fittest seruice deputy haue liberty put many vnder captaines cannot first bee vsed supply though chiefe meaning fill vp band already many wanting comming hither maiesty may vnnecessarily charged new band old full much deficient yet great part company extreame sicke exceeding misery winter siege present one third part last men came ouer seruiceable able doe duty whereof happily great part may recouer cannot therefore determined vntill number bee necessary supply company fit bee raised must grow view continue still sicke growne deficient death running away whereof late many notwithstanding seuere course haue taken executing terrour rest making proclamation vpon paine death none depart campe without licence giuing direction port townes staied apprehended lastly sending speciall men corke yoghall waterford wexford see duly put execution purpose haue commission martiall law well knowne euery priuate man campe yet steale away daily number besides deuises doe get passage present taken betweene waterford least two hundred ready returned though confesse misery indure iustly deserueth compassion diuers time found dead standing centinell vpon guard went thither well lusty grieuous winter siege countrey sicke hurt men haue taken best course deuise corke haue prouided guesthouse carefully looked vnto haue lending deliuered money buy market doth affoord increase held fit allowed surplusage entertainement preacher cannoneer conceaue lordship haue heretofore heard sicke sickely campe much desire keepe well possible take course first owne meanes allowed duly sir robert gardner appointed commissioner purpose souldier thing may haue right proclamation whosoeuer found selfe want repaire secondly generall contribution officer captaines army fifty pound weeke collected bestowed prouiding warme broth meate lodging maruellous great number thereby releeued yet doth serue great many still vnseruiceable haue noted greater length might appeare vnto lordship proceeds want care prouidence v keeping field season humane wit cannot preuent decay must earnestly intreat lordship fleete may remaine vpon coast warre spaniard furnish v victual munition money easterly wind rare time yeere without euery action cannot bee maintained army breake come nothing neither countrey affoord v thing much meat horse therefore wee must likewise bee humble suters two thousand quarter oates may speedily sent v without vndoubtedly horse starued particular want munition victual set downe master ordinance victualer prouince haue made choice sir oliuer iohns sollicite lordship speedy fauourable dispatch also giue satisfaction thing wherein may please lordship require particular information regard well acquainted thing haue passed otherwise vnwilling haue spared wee found vnwilling leaue seruice time deputy inioined vndertake businesse knowing hee could best satisfie lordship particular might doubt wee haue also held fit humbly signifie lordship wee heard counsell dublyn otherwise maiesties purpose send scot would much aduance seruice foure thousand scot thinke conuenient number might speedily landed ioine english loughfoyle carickfergus tyrone keepes force countrey would doubt short time make great spoile hee neuer able subsist maintaine warre great part english force hauing swept country bare might quickely doe might draw hither assistance great part prey would aboundantly releeue v victuall stop passage behind hee neuer bee able returne warre spaine ireland might haue end together whereof wee cannot wish lordship haue due consideration humbly pray excuse v making thus farre bold nothing haue led v vnto zeale affection seruice lastly whereas enemy fleet lysbone vnder conduct bretandona intelligence spaine assuredly intended part bring supply kinsale within moneth sixe weekes whereas find great importance seruice depending countenance maiesties fleet haue v well guard harbour repell enemy landing also guard magazins munition victual must kept ship hauing conueniency keepe haue made humbly bold stay fleet commanded sir richard leuison doe like sort beseech lordship victuall three moneths longer possible speed victualled onely till twentieth ianuary great quantity victual serue time hardly soone prouided humbly desire supply victual may sent vnto part made ready fleet opinion best experienced sea seruices part doe beleeue must necessarily diuided yet small serue two part humbly pray addition ship wisdom shal thought meet may sent hither forbid enemy plant place baltimore berre hauen probable meane plant diuision fleet better seruice may expected otherwise possibly performed doubt many opportunies offered fight enemy otherwise cannot looked wee humbly submit lordship fauourable consideration forgetting earnestly wee may recommend lordship good fauour sir richard leuison admirall fleete hath shewed himselfe worthy gentleman performing seruice vpon spanish ship castlehauen ournall expressed also himselfe painefull carefull wise valiant whole course affaire lordship committed charge measure thinke sufficient gallant gentleman could haud beene chosen imployment wee humbly take leaue c dispatch lord deputy wrote following letter master secretary england sir know great action accompanied many difficulty neither strange haue put minde indure thing mistresse quarrell chearefulnesse shall suffer extremitie hardnesse aduenture shal please maiesty graciously interpret labour beleeue true difficulty arise themselues defect counsel endeauors selfe protest doe faithfully propound vnto selfe whatsoeuer presume maiesties chiefe end make speedy safe honourable conclusion warre priuate man would vnsupportable selfe vpheld dutie affection seruice doe conceiue apparant king spaine resolued make powerfull warre england hath chosen countrie seate thereof maiesties minister must either marre giue way foundation bee resolued send continuall supply fortifie seuerall place warre likely grow long difficult first hard force warlike nation strength without great number royall prouisions long time hard supply either bee spared sent time farre feare estate doth already feele much necessitie making head enemie hauing heart people shal haue helpes durst doth draw army indure incommodities miserable winter siege wherein without preuention greatest part strength decay readie chiefe designe forcing towne vse otherwise vse worke aduised haste might easily hazard losse kingdome little disaster v bee conceiued ouerthrowes beleeue sir nothing containes euen best countrie inhabitant prosperitie reputation army although may please god enable v cut thread warre sooner wee see reason presume yet haue iust reason expect growing enemie great cause must please maiestie either bend maintaine royall power way attempt owne country diuert purpose otherwise persist purpose ireland grow power breake bankes opposition suddenly degree ouerflow hitherto hath pleased god prosper v haue vndertaken hath vndertaken v wee haue wonne whatsoeuer enemy possessed without towne haue taken aboue two hundred spanish prisoner wee certainely enformed aboue one thousand dead killed towne haue throughly inuested may side whole force tyrone odonnell strength rebel ireland lie within sixe mile v assistance haue spanish supplyes worst munition prouisions whole prouince either ioyned stand neutral vse soeuer enemie maketh sure wee receiue manner assistance notwithstanding hope wee shall giue good account besieged wee haue reason proceede great caution hauing desperate enemie v manie ingaged fortune behind v tyrone donnell haue quit owne country recouer else loose sir enable v great warre must continually supply v munition victual true incredible soeuer thinke two thousand men send v must account make vse little fiue hundred yet wee well iustifie nothing omitted humane wit prouide preseruation haue haue much owne sent ouer sir oliuer saint iohns presume satisfie many thing writing hardly doe thought good remember protest eternall god grieueth see maiesty ill serued muster abuse whereof haue done heretofore vtterly disclaime power reforme minister kind cipher false number beyond power discend euery particular care actiue time wherein spend meditation making onely warre wherein much weight euery man burthen doth lie vpon shoulder doe better feele expresse make beleeue discontinue consideration thing belongs owne priuate haue onely desired bearer negociate mee publike person publike matter beseech god send mee height ambition conscience hauing done maiestie seruice desire inioy quiet priuate life maiestie may neuer haue need men profession sir assured doe seruice mountioy foureteenth day rainy tempestious wind wee could stirre proceede thing business fifteenth artillerie planted campe westside play vpon toppes castle towne enemy shot placed thence might annoy men working trench platforme attending artillerie piece brake downe many castle killed many shot lodged likewise night men making new approches ordinance plaied vpon towne many volley small shot exchanged betweene v enemy sixteenth day ordinance plaied like sort vpon castle towne much hurt men lodged seuenteenth day tempestious raine especially wind continued night cause artillery plaied seldom vpon towne night spaniard sallyed brake downe platforme begun day purpose plant artillery whereupon slight skirmish fell betweene v little hurt either side eighteenth day artillerie continued play vpon towne day lordship intercepted following letter commanded translate spanish english prince oneale lord donnell thought excellency would haue come ricardo going since hee order say vpon spaniard comming castlehauen would doe fauour beseech doe come speedily well appointed may bee assure enemy tired cannot guard third part trench shall auaile resisting first furie ended manner comming excellency know better take giue giue well doe way alwaies watching giue blow resolution excellency fighting doe alwaies hope god victorie shall without doubt cause desire victory interest excellency owne nothing done bring squadron come well appointed close withall mingled enemy fort wil doe much harme v commend selfe ricardo lord keepe excellency kinsale eight twentieth new stile eighteenth old stile december though well fitted beseech excellency dislodge come toward enemy expedition import needfull horsebacke greater haste better signed del aguyla nineteenth day extreme rainy could doe little nothing twentieth morning faire ordinance plaied brake downe good part wall towne end might sharpen tyrone whose lying neere annoy v keeping reliefe v hee like hurt v attempt tyrones force came vp sooner wee might proceede roundly day another great breach made beneath platforme though many shot made hinder v yet next morning worke brought good perfection night stormy great lightning terrible thunder wonder considering season yeere night came certaine intelligence tyrone drawne ieans importunity determined presently set vp rest reliefe towne next night would lodge within mile halfe campe one twentieth ourscouts confirmed towards night tyrone tyrone shewes himselfe horse foote shewed himselfe horse foote vpon hill within mile v way corkes whereupon two regiment foote horse drawne campe made towards saw men resolutely come forward fell back fastnesse wood water encamped night light continuall flashing lightning spaniard sallied againe gaue vpon trench newly made beneath canon sooner repelled wee kept strong guard ond euery man ready armes reason tyrones neere vnto v two twentieth tyrones horse foote often shewed themselues hill beyond incamped wood yet artillery still plaied vpon towne breaking downe wall turret whence spaniard shot annoyed men many intelligence confirmed tyrone one side spaniard purpose force campe night spaniard sallied gaue vpon trench close westside towne serieant kept quit sir christopher saint laurence appointed second came vp foote heat spaniard towne could doe great hurt saue onely little defacing artillery still plaied vpon towne might see wee went businesse wee cared tyrones comming withall carried fashion wee meaning make breach wee thought fit offer enter put hazard vntill wee might better discouer tyrone meant doe whose strength assured bee great wee found letter ieans wee intercepted hee aduised tyrone set vpon camp telling could bee chosen men much decayed winter siege wee hardly bee able maintaine much ground wee taken strength greater wee well put one side side hee would faile part doe resolutely true men dailie died dozen sicke runnawaies considered wee growne weake first setting downe supply foure thousand foote strength regiment three twentieth december lord counsell lord president master marshall thinking intended enterprise enemie accident bee broken suddenly one lord president horseman called dore told tyrones army come vp neere campe sir richard greame hauing scout night hee discouered tyrone force foote marching towards campe presently aduertised lord deputy thereof lordship alwaies readinesse intertaine seldome going bed night time said setting counsell heard aduanced within three quarter mile campe caused men draw armes quarter himselfe marshall attending aduanced towards scout whence sent marshall sir richard wingfeild take view enemy hee brought word place formerly aduertised vpon returne lord deputie left defence great campe northside lordship owne regiment vnder lieutenant sir beniamin berry lord president regiment lordship absence command camp chiefe earle clanrickards regiment lord audlie regiment sir richard moryson regiment done lord depuputie sent corporall field vnto lesser campe quarter commanded earle thomond gaue order disposing foure regiment earle thomond sir richard percy sir charles wilmot sir christopher saint laurence directed set company seuerall guard former note finde sir richard percy regiment quartered earle thomonds campe find reckoned among greater campe earle clanrickards regiment lesser campe whereof remember certaintie sure soeuer changed regiment number time thus disposed two campes time marshall defeate tyrones force foure hundred horse sir henrie power regiment answere alarum drawne time three night like occasion aduanced within twenty score enemie ground rising high betweene men could see one breake day whereas midnight time appointed rebel meete isans force spaniard set vpon lesser campe earle thomonds quarter tyrrell leading rebel vantguard spaniard lately landed castlehauen tyrone leading battaile donnell reare set vpon chiefe campe conceiuing themselues sufficient strength force campes one instant make great worke lord deputy lord president company come vp force led tyrone resoluing giue battaile commanded sir iohn barkeley serieant maior draw campe two regiment sir oliuer saint iohns sir henry follyot vpon comming vp enemy finding v resolued fight retyred himselfe ouer foard marshall seeing disordered retrait sent word thereof sir froncis rush lord deputie desiring leaue fight lordship sir samuel bagnol gaue leaue order seruice according hee discretion find disposition enemie therewith sent backe sir george carew lord president three troopes horse great campe command camp chiefe make head spaniard sally towne spaniard still expecting comming vp rebel according mutuall proiect neuer imagining wee small force could draw sufficient band meete beate rebel contained themselues within towne walles till sequell shall appeare sailies could little profit said message sent marshall presently earle clanrickard came vp exceedingly importuned marshall fight whereupon marshall drew squadron foote drumme foard willed sir richard greame horse march directly foard enemy retired hastily horse foote ouer boggy ground firme land hoping keepe boggie passage v marshall directed sir henry dauers commanding horse vnder horse sir henrie power regiment foot aduance presently came ouer foresaid foard vnto lord deputy vpon hill two regiment foote commanded serieant maior attending second men foote marshall hauing earle clanrickard sir henrie dauers aduanced hundred horse began hundred harqubufiers led lieutenant cowel valiant gentleman marked red cap wore special instrumet fight giue occasion skirmish bog side rebel loose shot entertained three batallions standing firme one side bog fort otherside skirmish foot put vp hard horse marshall perceiuing put forth shot made rebel retire towards battaile moshiall finding way foard ground rebel stood possessed foote presently passed ouer earle clanrickard sir richard greames captaine tasse captaine fleming horse offered charge one rebel battailes one thousand eight hundred men finding stand firme horse wheeled sir henrie dauers rest horse sir william godolphin lord deputy captaine minshall lord president troopes kept lord deputie answere accident serieant maior two regiment sent lord deputy second regiment sir henrie power marshall came vp whereupon marshall horse charged home vpon reare battaile irish vsed fight plaine ground something amazed blowing vp gunpowder bagge hauing vpon like fright defeated english old blackwater discouraged see horse flie chiefes sept gentleman number fiue sixe hundred suddenly routed men followed execution two battailes stood stil finding routed made haste succour whereupon lord deputy sent instantly captaine francis roe sir oliuer saint iohns regiment lieutenant colonell charge flanck vanguard presently retired disorderly followed foote horse spaniard landed castlehauen marching good foote irish drew themselues yet sir william godolphin leading lord deputy troope soone broken killed rest chiefe commander alonzo del campo taken prisoner namely two captaines seuen alfieroes forty souldiers whereof good qualitie meane time many light footed irish van escaped likewise almost rere aduantage execution done vpon spaniard maine battaile body farre greater either killed onely sixty abouts thus irish horse first leauing foote two battalion routed fell flie life men execution vpon many place part sir richard greames cornet killed sir henry dauers sir william godolphin captaine henry croft scoutmaster slightly hurt onely sixe souldiers hurt many horse killed hurt irish rebel left one thousand two hundred body dead field besides killed two mile chase tooke nine ensignes drummes powder got two thousand armes men greedy spaniard spoile rich foote tired continuall watching long hard winter siege horse especially spent ill keeping want meate many day reason tyrones neerenesse day battaile resolued counsell send horse campe want meanes feede tyrone laine still suffered himselfe bee drawne plaine ground spaniard importunitie horse must need haue sent away starued impediment wee cut throates rebel assembled neuer made head followed execution scarce euer looked behind euery man shifted himselfe casting armes running life much tyrone confessed himselfe ouerthrowne sixth part number ascribed wee must doe god great worke beyond man capacitie withall acknowledged lost aboue one thousand field besides eight hundred hurt vnderstood faithfull report one came day told l deputy moreouer tormented exceedingly ouerthrow battell lord deputy middest dead body caused thanks giuen god victory presently knighted earle claurickard field many faire escape garment often peirced shot weapon owne hand killed aboue twenty irish kerne cried spare rebell captiue spanish commander alonzo del campo auowed rebel sixe thousand foot horse whereas lord deputy one thousand two hundred foote lesse foure hundred horse noone lordship returned campe commanding vollias shot ioy victory spaniard perhaps mistaking cause dreaming rebel approach presently sallied soone beaten towne especially saw triumph perceiued horseman hill west side waue colour taken battell among rest especially spanish colour rebel wood vsing martiall brauery day old written booke shewed lord deputy wherein prophesie naming soard hill battell giuen foretelling great ouerthrow befall irish place note giuen one tyrones follower losse ouerthrow tirlogh ohagan sonne art ohagan commander fiue hundred slaine himselfe company except twenty whereof eleuen hurt seuen died eighteenth day returne kedagh mac donnell captaine three hundred slaine men except threescore whereof hurt fiue twenty donnell groome mac donnell captaine hundred slaine himselfe whole company rory mac donnell captaine hundred slaine himselfe company fiue clancans captaines fiue hundred themselues slaine company except threescore eighteene whereof eighteene hurt sonnes follower number three hundred vnder leading captaine mulmore oheagarty slaine said mulmore sauing one thirty whereof twenty hurt colle duff mac donnell captaine one hundred lost company three neales captaines three hundred sent cormack mac barron lost sauing eighteene whereof nine hurt captaines slaine fourteene souldiers slaine souldiers hurt fiue twentieth day christmas day spaniard afternoone made flight sally finding v ready entertaine presently backe yet hinder making trench wo beganne found would doe much hurt sallied againe strongly nine clocke night maintained fight till eleuen wherein ensignes captaine roper captaine ghest diuers others part hurt hard wall short space beaten towne many hurt perfected worke sixe twentieth night spaniard made another sally west gate formerly vpon new trench wee kept close towne hotly inforced men quit hauing liefetenant guard ten shot spaniard made vpto lower four presented volly shot teeth killed fearre hurt eight drew towne seuen twentieth lord deputy dispatched sir henry dauers england following letter touching happy ouerthrow tyrone lordship counsell lord england may please lordship last dispatch sent sir oliuer iohns longere time hope safely deliuered vnto hand large reuealed vnto proceeding siege also estate wee hauing v towne spanish force backes tyrone odonnell army since whose departure dislodged place camped lay campe within lesse two mile v way towards corke whereby passage campe corke blocked vp prouisions reliefe thence could come vnto v vnto army agreat annoyance manner better besieged enemy proud strength resolued set vp rest accounting v opinion lost men vnable resist great power therefore generall consent determined part giue vpon campe well towne spaniard irish side according resolution christmas euen day tyrone army rose force horse foote breake day presented himselfe order battell pleased god goodnesse giue v gracious victory handfull men respect army particular whereof long insert letter humbly referre lordship relation sent wherein large particularly related ouerthrow gained many spanish letter great consequence effectuall send vnto lordship herewith together briefe abstract reserue vnwilling trouble lordship lesse monent view intelligence aduices relation spanish prisoner account vnderstanding wee haue conference second preparation forraigne enemy apparantly discouered dispatching away sir oliuer iohns therefore may cease humbly importuue lordship regard threatned supply sea land great speedy vse haue men munition victual treasure formerly moued lordship letter sent said sir oliuer iohns admit long delay lordship onely pleased supply v presently therewith proportion may inlarged euery point wisdomes vpon due regard intelligence sent herewith shall thought meet vnderstanding occasion aforesaid inabled know enemy dsignes euery kind v formerly written little much chiefe strength army consisteth horse troopes seruice principall meanes instrument ouerthrow giuen enemy wel giuing first charge following execution preseruation strength humbly pray lordship two thousand quarter oates formerly written may presently dispatched hither regard whole countrie harried wasted cannot yeeld v reliefe without corne horse beginne must daily weaken army hazard perish timely preuention thereof humbly pray lordship addition oates may giuen said proportion although yet time time sent hither conueniency shipping giue leaue dare assure lordship want horse beene growne feeble enemy horse foot escaped lordship pleased send away best expedition munition habiliment warre already written send possible haste according demand sent herewith subscribed master ordinance without charge prouisions purpose also pray lordship pleased haue consideration send hither compitent fleete guard coast opinion gather collection haue probably made king spaine fleete great granted ship haue enough supply occasion considering must dispersed defend coast prohibit sending arriuall second also answere seruices wherein shipping necessary imploied much ending deuersion warre resteth chiefly weakening disinabling tyrone whose reputation last ouerthrow forraigne enemy owne follower much blemished may apparantly conceiued spaniard longer maintaine tedious chargable warre remote kingdome hath strong powerfull party safe meanes landing therein disinable assurance hope vnderstanding sending foure thousand scot vlster would doe excellent seruice ioined maiesties force loughfoyle carickfergus would either absolutely banish tyrone thence possessing hold place strength vlster else constraine make defence home keepe giuing helpe spaniard bee vtterly reiected hauing either credit aide hereafter time lord deputy wrote master secretary following letter sir haue written lord estate desire doe wish may please conceiue material great must stop breach king spaine hath already made countrey slender opposition resist carried away inundation send supply haue already miraculously ouercome one dangerous brunt god hath giuen queene greatest victory euer shee obtained countrey beleeue sir one place defended good men goe neere breake army doth force though carried haue forced two place already held spaniard remaines possessed fortified foure seuerall place great store munition artillery victual supply horse foot certainly comming vnto say great number haue indured dare boldly say miserable siege extremity weather labour age hath beene heard please god inable v effect impossible army vndertake season place wil diminished present seruice without rest beleeue sir must make peace prouide chargeable warre nothing carry place without roiall prouisions maiesty thinke owne occasion v poore minister cause huge expence shall willingly indure purgatory line sacrifice time life liuing doe best seruice find shee conceiueth worse cooke dresse diet chargably beseech sir may euer deserue loue vse vttermost power rid speedily office dare presume haue made euill way successour tread would faine write much vnto wet heat last ouerthrow haue taken cold head doth make write great paine beseech sir pardon esteeme honest poore friend resolued euer glad send sir henry dauers ouer good newes assure hath taken exceeding paine lost blood last seruice besides necessity owne hath long desired opportunity come ouer time sir beseech god send v peace weary warre kinsale seuen twenty december sir assured doe seruice mountioy day december lord deputy aduertised syrriago principall commander spaniard landed west part hauing receiued newes tyrones ouerthrow suddenly gone spaine without acquainting spaniard therewith hee carried shippe hugh odonnell thus old prophesie fully accomplished often wee heard namely mounster destruction three great northerne hughes hugh mac guyer lord fermanagh first robinhood great rebellion long since killed neere citie corke hugh tyrone hugh donnell ouerthrowne kinsale whereof hugh donnell fled spaine whence neuer returned hugh tyrone drew faintly last breath north without hope better liuing woodkerne fugitiue abroad likewise hugh mostian famous rebell time fled donnell spaine nine twentieth day lordship aduertisements diuers place tyrone flight mounster passing blackwater lost many carriage hundred fortie men drowned feare making hasty could attend passing owne fellowes much lesse fall water last december iean generall spaniard offered parley sending drumme maior towne alfiero bringing sealed letter spaniard parlies lord deputy required sent next dispatch sir richard moryson lord england appeareth gentleman speciall trust sufficiency might bee sent lord deputy towne whose pledge spanish gentleman like quality sent iean campe vpon conference would acquaint said gentleman condition vpon stood granted lord deputy chose sir william godolphin imploied important negotiation sent town conferre iohn hee likewise sent pedro henrico remaine campe first conference sir william godolphin tended hauing found lord deputy tearmed viceroy though sharpe powerfull yet honourable enemy irish onely weake barbarous hee feared persidious friend hee farre affection reconciled one distasted thereby induced make ouerture composition might safe profitable state england least preiudice crown spaine deliuering viceroyes power towne kinsale place held spaniard ireland might depart vpon honourable rearmes fitting men warre forced necessity receiue condition willingly induced iust respect relinquish people king master beene notoriously abused betraied viceroy liked intertaine parley would please vnderstand rightly make proposition sutable men resolued rather bury themselues aliue giue way accord taste dishonour confident present strength royall second spaine former respect leade disingage king enterprize sir william godolphin directed onely receiue demand returned campe related lord deputy counsell answer sent backe howsoeuer lord deputy lately defeated irish well vnderstood weakenesse vnresistable difficulty pressed ere laboured couer yet knowing sacred maiesty mistresse would mercifull disposition repute victory blemished voluntary effusion christian blood content intertaine offer agreement vpon honourable tearmes fitting aduantage maiesty next conference lord deputy required first article iean leaue treasure munition artillery queenes naturall subiects disposed maiesties pleasure iean vowed rather indure last misery guilty foule treason king reputation prosession though vnable subsist much onely meanes sustaine warre hope patience constancy attaine best end busines adding tooke ill misunderstood hauing article nature propounded mentioned viceroy thenceforth vse aduantage sword benefit former proffer hee said viceroy cause rather iudge two hundred thousand duckets well disbursed queene haue spaniard quit possession baltimore alone say nothing kinsale castle hauen beere hauen perishing yet baltimore might easily kept arriuall spanish fleet second master deepely ingaged please send might draw powerfull inuasion first vndertaken vpon false ground instance base barbarous people hauing discouered owne weakenes armed king master relie owne strength tied honour releeue people thus ingaged said hee speake case viceroy able force kinsale assure selfe hee cannot hauing vpon honour two thousand able fighting men old souldiers besides sicke daily recouering better inured climate induring hardnesse besides conuenient meanes foode spaniard well liue vpon store munition importing confident assurance shortly haue new supply thing adding preserued strength able front v breach heart failing hand brest stop trebble force though would giue viceroy right men passing good yet spent tired winter siege obstinately continued beyond expectation caution good guard hauing watched aduantages could neuer make salley without losse part wherein hee acknowledged himselfe much deceiued grounding vpon errour approches promised himselfe defeate one thousand men least one blow said meete breach confident vpon good reason lay fiue hundred best men earth losse make great hole armie hath already suffered extremity lastly concluded king master sent assist two count neale donnel presuming promise ioyne force within day first long expected vaine sustained viceroyes army last seene drawne greatest head could make lodged neere kinsale reinforced company spaniard euery hower promising reliefe last broken handfull men blowne asunder diuers part world donnell spaine neale furthest north finding count rerum natura vse word commanded ioine moued accord rather disingage king master assisting people weake must beare burthen war perfidious perhaps requitall fauour might last bee wonne betray relation conference made lord deputy counsell considered treasure iean brought first one hundred thousand ducates whereof greatest part could spent paying souldiers moneths occasion expence good reason concluded stand vpo first article especially since many strong reason made agreement honorable seeme profitable state england namely army wasted tired winter siege dangerous attempt breach defended many able men wee lodge breach yet hauing many strong castle towne much time might spent ere could carry fleete want victual might bee forced leaue v time army onely prouided sixe dayes munition artillerie make one batterie one place fiue piece crased vpon disaster befalling v irish like reuolt besides taking kinsale place held spaniard baltymore custle hauen bearehauen would haue made long dangerous warre infinite charge state england strongly fortified well stored prouisions warre army tired could attempt without first refreshed supplied necessary vnsupportable charge sate must haue carried sea place vnaccessable land lastly time king spaine could send powerfull second thus farre ingaged honour besides long warre wee bee hindred prosecution rebel broken short time must needes brought absolute subiection many going fro certaine article agreed vpon second ianuary towards end yeere according english end begin yeere lady day lent reliefe earle desmonds sister aduertising eighteene hundred quarter oates sent mounster horse troopes would transportation cost maiesty fifteene shilling quarter bee issued troopes rate day lordship receiued letter dated foure twentieth december lord england followeth right hearty commendation lordship haue last long great expectation receiued letter sir oliuer iohns arriued yesternight court although maiestie hath receiued much satisfaction hoped vpon former probability contained dispatch yet relation hath made great alteration anxiety maiesty remained report haue brought place respect long vnexpected silence part wee could way giue contradiction hauing receiued particular aduertisement since arriuall sir thomas sauage therefore way able make iudgement estate thus described first irish rebel lodged close campe full misery penury great slander kingdome lastly six thousand spaniard landed last particular lord ormonds man relator preuention vncertainty hereafter commanded maiesties name require hence forward aduertise v frequently time time proceeding intent maiestie may still haue meanes prouide support may looke receiue hence time shall vse except wee may daily informed beforehand particular circumstance fall place come therefore present dispatch wee haue perused iournals seruices done difficulty haue interrupted proceeding hitherto whereunto wee meane make replie wee know iudgement affection maiesties seruice well must say thus much wee doubtfull haue done much could haue reason hope course taken hence beleeue know maiesty hath sort neglected demonstration whereof shall first vnderstand arriuall sir oliuer saint iohns maiestie giuen order foure thousand men sent mounster supply munition victual maiestie thought fit prouisionally send though lacke aduertisement wee could make particular iudgement much little know body spanish force kingdome shall defeated like body army greater arriue maiesty shall put warre end howsoeuer state may vndergo excessiue charge continuall leauies transportation wil well consider intolerable burthen kingdome circumstance considered yet extreme difficulty maintaine army realme must fight forraigne army vniuersall rebellion climate full contagion kingdome vtterly wasted wel foresee wil draw pernicious consequents euer state subiect whosoeuer shall behold beginning malitious designe king spaine must well conclude although hath begun action vpon false ground find powerfull party kingdome first discent wherin hath bin measure deceiued yet seeing deepely ingaged well findeth errour value honour high rate suffer worke dissolue first foundation consideration whereof maiesty like prouident prince resolueth presently send strong fleet owne coast preuent new reinforcement doubting disaster happen force remaine long vnremoued ireland cannot beleeue maiesties fleet shall yet great possibilitie defeate new supply way purpose maiestie perceiuing dangerous thing fleete ireland lie sea winter weather must doe intended shall hinder descent superfluous thing maintaine fleet lie harbour maiestie pleased reuoke greatest part royall ship hither adde great proportion send coast spaine leauing still competent number ship may sufficiently blocke vp harbour giue securitie countenance transportation end haue written letter maiesties name reuoke sir richard leuison leaue sir amia preston charge ship contained note haue giuen direction thing apply himselfe course shall thinke expedient seruice shall also vnderstand haue directed sir henrie dockwra send eight hundred men pole knockfergus sir arthur chichester commanded make vp one thousand speede said sir arthur himselfe march vp thousand best men reinforcement mounster thus hauing present little else write vnto till heare doe conclude best wish vnto happy speedy successe remaine c court whitehall foure und twentieth december eleuenth day ianuary lordship receiued letter lord dated seuen twentieth december signifying whereas
