carried citie corke certaine merchant haue told thinke find ship carry folke spaine excellency would giue license pasport humbly beseech highnes also great beniguitie excellency haue pitie prisoner runnawaies siege thirty together many said prisoner sent england rest lean writes still prisoner foure twentieth ianuary lord deputy councell wrote lord england letter following may please lordship wee haue receiued letter foure twentieth december eleuenth ianuary first wee receiued england since arriuall sir richard leuison munition supply although haue vpon euery important reuolution businesse dispatched vnto lordship estate desire yet humbly desire lordship pardon omission dutie enforme often present estate chiefe cause thereof respect feare wee haue possesse falsehood seemeth doe vndertake liberally aduertise lordship estate affaire place doe intelligence come apparrelled euen neerest vnto deceiueable mist vntill time great obseruation discouereth truth write vnto lordship often according best information wee present reuerent iudgements ridiculous contrariety would giue occasion confound determination condemne v generall beseech lordship remember wee haue dispaches declared hope ouercome difficulty confidence good cause alacritie serue maiestie haue continually propounded great difficult warre ingaged without god miraculous preseruation army winter siege would decay must haue pleased lordship continually supply men victual munition also propounded held matter small danger great difficulty force many men place least aduantage wee expected lesse generall reuolt powerfull combination rebel v lastly againe humbly desire lordship remember haue promised nothing vttermost faithfull counsel endeauours accomplish seruice maiesties purpose therefore heartily sorry faithfull sincere counsel extreame induring execution thereof howsoeuer euent speedily happy desired laboured yet happinesse maiestie receiue much satisfacti sir oliuer saint iohns wee hoped haue giuen vpon former probability yet shall please lordship throughly consider difficulty true relation thereof materiall circumstance presume appeare could haue done must attribute vnto god haue done much sir henrie dauers lordship haue acquainted large proceeding vntill present since time effect victory pleased god infinite goodnesse giue v traitor vpon christmas eue haue appeared great vnexpected good thereof insusuing rebel broken dispersed donnel redmond bourke hugh mostyon archrebels haue imbarked themselues sirriage spaine without tyrones knowledge contrary aduise hauing left behind mounster prouinciall rebel tyrrell small force dispersed smal company carbery beere desmond kerry county lymrick tyrone great feare speedy march hasted prouince mounster loosing vpon euery foard many foote especially passing riuers broadwater may connolagh abbey owney malryans country foards water high informed lost aboue two hundred men way went wearied foote cast away armes country gathered vp tooke head many might haue done regarded duty ought tired horse slaine rider hurt men escaped ouerthrow carried away vpon garrons died vpon way foure principall gentleman whereof wee vnderstand tyrone himselfe one mac mahown another rest knowne yet caried litter since departure mulryans country heare nothing assure lordship dismay still incredible vpon newyeeres eue iean sent letter vnto deputy copy whereof within sent vnto lordship next day sir william godolphin sent instruction receiue iean point whereof hee desired treate whose discreete carriage weighty cause wherein hee performed much discretion iudgement could required without gentleman wrong may omit recommend honourable fauours experience may truly report wise valiant many extraordinary good part copy article agreed vpon betweene v iean subscribed either part lordship shall likewise receiue hoping haue done nothing shall agreeable lordship suppose present estate duly considered vehemently vrged v imbrace great care hasten spaniard away iean affirmes lesse pole three thousand fiue hundred defect shipping chiafe want wee equall paine lesse desirous bee gone send away contempt scorne spaniard hold irish distaste irish haue bee beleeued present see behauiours heare speech insomuch may probably opniecture time iean sorces arriued spaine difficult thing irish hereafter procure aide spaine copy contract rate iean must pay tunnage victual men returne lordship shall also receiue ninth moneth wee dissolued campe brought hither v iean remaines hostage performance couenants betweene v day following capt roger haruy capt flower dispatched westward receiue spaniard castle castlehauen baltimore beerehauen winning place iudgements although kinsale taken force would haue difficult vnto v kinsale aswell respect incommodities wee haue found keeping strong furnished army remote place respect naturall strength place espetially baltimore little art would bee made great strength since comming corke deputie ease maiesties great vnsupportable charger haue discharged two thousand foote list wherein without respect fauour cast weakest company assoone wee may bee better secured spaniard purpose forbeare attempt realme moneths appeare many possibly spared shall bee like sort cashered suppresse present rebellon mounster deputy haue designed foure thousand foot three hundred twenty fiue horse layed conuenient place wee intend lay hope short time rebellion bee extinguished vntill wee bee better assured attempt spaine kingdome remainder armie dispersed remote place prouince eastward corke deputy doe purpose remaine vntill may secured cause draw army backe part paul iuie inginer best expedition may shall bee sent part baltymore beerhauen chuseout fit ground fortifie like must done kinsale better holding city prouince due obedience whose assurance case spaniard preuailed wee cause doubt wee thinke vnder lordship reformation expedient euery cittadels raised guarded men hauing piece artillerie euerhave power command place thus strengthened port forgotten may fit spaniard acommodating enterprise hence vpon england lie desmond kerry connaght haue large sea passe england subiect infinite inconueniences coast within saint george channell danger infinite feare port notwithstanding hath pleased god giue v happie successe freeing realme spanish army vnder iean yet fearing second vnder another commander may employed hither humbly beseech lordship bee pleased send victual wee wrote sir oliuer saint iohns spanish supply come shall haue cause expend prouince come care shall bee shall preserued dispensed best vse maiesties seruice like sute make munition wee wrote supply required v dispatch wee made sir henrie dauers lordship may please make stay till occasion use onely one thousand thereof haue great neede reinforcing company weake therefore desire fiue hundred may land corke fiue hundred waterford rest may readinesse haue new occasion send till time vnwilling charge maiesty trouble lordship draw new force part hath made v giue direction sir arthur chichester one thousand men lordship haue commanded leade hither shal stay newry make warre aswell defending pale annoying tyrone sir arthur shall neere enough v fall occasion draw men hither sir richard moryson made bearer letter haue chosen satisfie lordship thing wherein happily may doubt particular wee haue acquainted date letter wee haue sent lordship since landing spaniard hee informe lordship owne knowledge deputy haue written thus often namely three twentieth september first third foure twentieth october seuenth thirteenth nouember seuenth twelfth seuen twentieth december present dispatch haue miscaried found slow passage lordship expectation satisfied time seruice fit beseech pleased consider like may happen sent hither may appeare lordship letter last receiued eleuenth ianuarie noted beginning letter receiued lordship foure twentieth december another seuen twentieth moneth touching apparrell third two twentieth december yea fourth two twentieth nouember wee haue licensed captaine iosias bodley passe england vpon priuate businesse importing haue addressed lordship receiue pleasure resolue vpon fortification kingdome gentleman experienced practised art one workes wee haue principally emploied hath great hazard labour sufficiency discharged find men imbrace much gladnesse maiesties resolution leaue apparrelling souldier much better contented haue full pay without detaining summes clothes hope meane make captain keepe company strong lordship haue directed vpon notice decease earle desmond company allowed discharged saue hath pleased continue sister archbishop casbell power order also taken oates sent ouer hither shall issued high rate hath neuer beene hitherto seene price exceeded ten shilling quarter thinke cannot issued higher rate souldier cannot liue paying rather suffer horse starue would greater inconueniency seruice oates come though way also must haue starued siege continued spaniard shipped hence plymoth either runneaway spaniard ryncorren castle nyparke yeelded vpon promise liues onely much deputy signified letter gentleman part land purpose made knowne lordship might accordingly suffred passe france countrey much desired c corke foureteenth january lord president desirous goe ouer dispatch pleasing newes court lord deputy loth spare till spaniard gone relation businesse much concerned lordship honour thought necessary chuse messenger part fit busines especially sound affection chose sir richard moryson beene inward till death earle essex time lordship began grow something strange towards regard mr secretary conceiued displeasure passage dependancy said earle yet lordp euer professed continue loue promised fit time make peace master secretary purpose lordship chose occasion concurring owne end onely lordship aduised sir richard moryson entreat l president approbation carrying packet said end much importing lord president nobly gaue consent hee dispatched lord deputy lord president letter master secretary especiall recommendation behalfe among instruction directed first arriuall repaire sir oliuer saint iohns learne present estate lord deputy affaire court communicate proceeding one imaginary question vse made first breach north east gate kinsale hee directed answere first battery chiesly intended annoy spaniard beating downe house take vse place whence might annoy v beating downe gate made breach found yet attempted made neerer approach whereupon spaniard made strong salley vpon approches vpon cannou next day wee intelligence tyrone odonnell rebel encamped neere v wee ingaged selues worke garding cannon far campe might three houres haue fallen vpon v side great aduantage made v draw cannon campe leaue worke chusing rather inuest close west side lay open might easily way receiue succour rebel ioine force reason set downe moued lord deputy counsell make composition den iean namely weakenesse enemy strength since army sickenesse runawayes death fallen almost weake first sitting downe whereas spaniard three thousand men pole suffering winter siege falling vpon v field vpon towne besides taken kinsale force army could possibly haue marched westerne part possessed spaniard till beene refreshed till new supply victual munition could easily arriue easterly wind winter rare vpon coast besides ere could haue forced spaniard west likelihood new spanish supply would haue arriued taking remote place would haue beene difficult dangerous kinsale king spaine would haue bin ingaged long war composition like ended besides army consisted much irish vnfit seruice entring breach therein must necessity haue vsed old english company probability must haue lost great part esteemed spaniard themselues gallant fellowes euer met truth losse would formany yeeres vnrepairable wee beene repulsed blow giuen v reason doubt irish yea army would haue turned sword v yea breach beene entered towne kinsale built stone spaniard house would haue made v new worke lesse difficult former moreouer sixe peeces battery crased wee could make one breach spaniard hauing many hand large scope ground within might easily haue stopped one gap v could haue made diuers breach yet powder bullet sufficient purpose small shot besides men wasted could guard diuers battery neither wee sufficient inginers purpose howsoeuer stood vpon tearmes iean leaue munition treasure maiesty yet finding make obstinate opposition thereunto forced aboue named reason many like make present composition likewise among instruction diuers reason set downe mouing iean make said composition namely malice spaniard generally conceiued irish whose aid late discouered confidence could iudicially bee placed comming succour tyrone odonnell could neuer see men saying rerum naturas existent also iean hauing instruction keepe field defend kinsale since ouerthrow irish hope able come field moreouer best men long siege spent continuall watch new men grew weake feeding onely vpon ruske desire disingage king master warre wherein little probability preuaile respect small assistance conceiued might expected irish also treasure brought first one hundred thousand duckets great part exhausted paying souldiers sixe penny per diem commander entertainements remainder hope worke reuolt among irish giue satisfaction couetous humour already rebellion nine twentieth ianuary lord deputy counfell wrote lord england following letter may please lordship since last dispatch sir richard moryson hath extraordinary matter happened might giue v iust cause soone write againe pleased lordship last blame slacknesse late wrote seldome command hence frequent aduertisement proceeding lordship satisfaction carefull performe chiefe point late wee haue applied selues hath beene dispatching away spaniard countrey till haue freed countrey may safely leaue prouince follow seruices part desire next vndertake doe earnestly labour end wee obserue setled hatred people iean spanish generall wee gather vpon many good ground could returned new supply come spaine king would easily induced forbeare ingage himselfe businesse wihall doe protest vse best endeauours effect hold vnfained wind continuing hitherto westerly part somewhat southward withall much stormy neither shipping good space lay aboard take first occasion gone meanes get harbour shipping come easterly part transportation rest find meanes come hither three ship haue beene long ready goe westward take castle hauen baltimore beerehauen industry worke thither purpose though know haue care earnestnesse endeuoured grow doubtfull force spaine arriue ere get home therfore cannot wish preuention thereof maiestie bee pleased continue resolution sending fleete sea much expedition may tramontana moone ship small burthen fittest seruice coast may presently bee sent hither rather bee none left onely swiftsure vnder command sir amia preston two merchant ship appointed lordship stay one sent away sir richard leuison imploied transporting spaniard reason ship purpose vpon ground wee humbly pray lordship send away one thousand foote supply else desired former letter may bee vnprouided worst may happen although wee good hope ere bee long haue good reason ease maiesties charge countrie without danger seruice humbly beseech lordship procure v maiesties warrant passe vnto neale garue donnell country tyreconnell sort promised vnto vnder hand almost yeere agoe warranted direction maiesty thinkes time long till hee hath grant late letter deputy protest doe seruice vntill haue seene grant bee performed though haue blamed iustly might vnfit fashion writing subiect yet rudenesse education forwardnesse abilitie doe seruice considered cannot acknowledge hold meete performe vnto promised doe want warrant maiesty therefore desire haue lordship next dispatch know wil earnestly call vpon doe heare head importance strength remaines gathered together rebel hope spanish succour doe arriue force quickly come nothing cannot assure subiects assistance rebel shall receiue spaine king send wee presume doe farre greater measure heretofore hauing experience trust force rebel therefore reason relie vpon owne strength wee humbly desire lordship continue honourable care affaire enable v withstand whatsoeuer shall bee attempted forraigne enemy send imploy sinceritie best endeauours aduancement seruice maiestie doth require expect v c last ianuary lord deputie aduertised one comming west part beerhauen thirteenth moneth spaniard number sixtie oswylliuan three hundred irish spaniard knowing ieans composition lordship build fort tree earth neere castle planted three smal piece ordinance therein whereof greatest carried nine pound powder hee came thence baltimore hee found one hundred spaniard fortifie hearing ieans composition hauing two ship shipped ordinance ready goe sea time one richard owen came tyrone mediate lord deputy maiesties mercy towards whereupon lordship gaue leaue gentleman pale tyrones old acquaintance parlee according following instruction dated fourth february speake shall tell vnderstand richard owen came lord deputy commission tell lordship desired receiued queenes mercy life might bee secured whereupon finding conformity ancient loue former time bare glad alteration therefore friend vndertake long iourney perswade course might best answer duty prince repaire estate opinion desperate find desirous bee receitied mercy shall giue hope promise furtherance effecting vpon condition shall token penitency according duty rebell naturall prince first vnder hand write letter submission lord deputy humbly crauing maiesties mercy promise redeeme errours past future seruice likewise hee shall write publike submission maiesty imploring hand forgiuenesse fault likewise promise amendement life willing desire doe fome acceptable seruice recompence transgression protesting serue maiesty men either ireland forraigners shall endeauour disturbance countrey shall put maiesties hand eldest sonne assurance future loyalty foure principall gentleman blood hee formerly promised hee shall charge find workemen build fort county tyrone place lord deputy shall thinke fit shall permit throughout tyrone maiesties officer iustice sheriffes others haue free liberty execute office accustomed prouinces county realme answere duty formerly agreed vpon shall onely vndertake himselfe pledge lie dwell vpon land onely contained letter pattents way vndertaking rest tyrone turlogh brassiloes sonnes mac mahound cane macgenis macguire two clandeboyes east side ban neighbour shall continue rebellion none people shall harboured tyrone likewise none tyrone shall consent knowledge succour rebell giue assistance offender shall happen discouered either himselfe maiesties officer vpon knowledge thereof hee shall doe best endeuour prosecute party offending either take whereby may tried lawes realme kill may otherwise bee shall assist maiesties officer taking vse good chattel offender retinue shall onely truely pay maiesties rent duty time forward due vnto tyrone also pay arrerages many yeeres haue beene detained respect great charge hath put maiesty vnto although thousand part disbursement nomine pene great offence accustomed towards victualing maiesties garrison shall pay two thousand cowes within sixe moneths county tyrone may bee limited possessed contained letter pattents territory tyrone may diuided shire haue gaoles hath formerly desired put liberty sonnes shane neale prisoner english irish thing shall onely propound selfe yet conceiuing demanded hand receiued draw large ouerture agree vnto perswade telling greater assurance doth giue state loyalty greater safety shall conster good meaning free offer thereof shall haue lesse reason lealous fifteenth february lord deputy counsell wrote lord england following letter may please lordship foureteenth last moneth disparched sir richard moryson letter lordship place nine twentieth wrote againe captaine butler yet day wind nath continued still westerly since departure sir richard shipping v either england lordship desired waterford wexford part directed carry away spaniard hence yet vntil sunday seuenth hereof could ship stirre lay ready kinsale sent baltimore castle hauen beere hauen gone hope seruice done possessing castle sending away spaniard presently accomplished although wind hath serued scantly wee feare hardly recouer place whereunto directed onely one scottish ship gone kinsale spaine carried one hundred sixety spaniard part artillery lie ready harbour first wind much shipping carry away one thousand fiue hundred bee yet remaining kinsale aboue one thousand spaniard first shipping come port shall imbarked iean stay goe last appeareth letter intercepted wee send herewithall vnto lordship king spaine purposeth send larger supply hither expedition iean assures v doe best stay arriue first spaine make doubt disswade comming come departure promiseth returne according couenant contract doe come vnder command hath commission part king irish haue late receiued letter odonnell encourage rebel perseuer rebellion assuring present aide spaine meane time best doe temporize ready assist come especially come strength bee thought reason hauing found first errour maiesty must therefore pleased charge erect fortification beere hauen kinsale place commodity weakenesse place well knowne spaniard v speed erect cittadels lymbrick corke waterford though bee onely assure townes reuolt appeareth king spaines letter duke heart much set vpon enterprize ireland therefore vnlike may send supply ieans arriuall spaine either vnder commander hee doe also likely sent shortly preuention thereof lordship wisdome shall thought meet doe humbly beseech foure thousand supply heretofore desired lordship intended may bee presently sent hither whereof two thousand erected company captaines named supply army exceeding weake men die daily greater number died camp infection greater thought kinde plague people townes die farre greater number souldiers though hope contrary wee doe desire maiesty pleased hasten fleete coast spaine comming timely opinion hinder enterprize ireland least shoule faile renew former motion tramontama moone may returned serue vpon coast mounster proportion munition victual desired former letter may speedily dispatched hither victualer without impediment may come place releeue v already great dearth begun famine must ensue rate thing incredible new money much repined notwithstanding vttermost endeuors aduance matter great importance humbly desire lordship giue v leaue deliuer opinion freely hauing assured ground king spaine continue war country hard preserue maiesties army kingdom without altering currant mony general dislike thereof insolently begin already refuse come forraine aide maiesty think may securely continue army concerneth regard liue wholly vpon entertainement god willing indure aduancement seruice though sensible losse excessiue enhauncing price thing wee lieu vpon cannot bee holpen long new coyne continues currant tyrone since ouerthrow departure hetherto haue heard little neither doe thinke hee able doe great harme without aide new supply spaine wee humbly take leaue c corke c fifteenthday lord deputy wrote master secretary england letter following sir strange continuance windes west south make mee looke backe danger maiesties army kingdome haue passed sir richard leuison maiesties fleete taken opportunitie winde bring hether giue rest supply great difficultie passage port v doubt contrary windes time day continuing affaire maiestie extreame hazard consider first likelihood could expect lesse powerful supply spaine greater king find ingaged army stand need seconding except might time aduertised ouerture haue made disimbarke fairely enterprize presume minister beleeue perswade vnfit longer imbrace wind haue haue onely serued carry danger men peace haue made since syriago departure presently ouerthrow iean del aguyla neuer able send away dispatch may hope arriued spaine lastly haue credible intelligence king resolution forwardnesse send men strong speedy succour consider thing cannot feare heauy warre bee towards v doe constantly beleeue preuented pleased god send v winde time haue sent away spaniard least assured relation estate thus continuance contrary wind part doth make apprehend extreame peril wherewith maiesty shall bee driuen make warre country extreame charge spaniard perseuer purpose without huge magazins great waste continuall charge shipping land carriage warre cannot made perswaded maiesty good giue ouer first defence country intend war without making prouisions loue seruice doth make sensible wil boldly protest man liuing whatsoeur burthe state doth feele loue shuld make suffer alacrity waight vneasie charge dangerous way wherein walke perceiue poore asse worse liked doth carry much treasure cofers howsoeuer doe vnwillingly beare away feeleth nothing heauy burthen thereof inclination haue found measure labour successe endeauours haue confesse discouraged difficulty euer passed may expect sauing thankefulnes cannot chuse yeeld vnto god successe hath pleased late giue protest neuer accompanied vnquiet thought since last comming corke continue noysome towne full infection seeing end labour finding measure yet fearing valued little merit rather likely draw dislikewherefore owne heart doe vtterly distaste vnhappy profession ambition set downe quietnesse vnder mine owne vine conscience hauing beene vnprofitable seruant maiesty sir vow god acknowledge euerlasting bond meane procure harmelesse fortune may aboue thing desire serue maiesty henceforward pure euer doe faithfull deuotion make selfe ready another world thanke god doe hate blame beseech sir apprehending fortune much discomfort since doe onely perceiue enemy haue ingenious industrious vrge proceeding disaduantage find malice take effect maiesty moue vnsatisfied endeuours wherein owne conscience cannot acknowledge thing omitted within power belonging duty whatsoeuer successe beene sir neuer deserued ill deed except maiesty better seruice doe word doe thinke speake token good doe force mee vnto protest doe much scorne malice barking many whelpes would little troubled thinke false euidence doth sway opinion supreame iudge title fauour desert doe remember doubtfull fortune warre cannot feare one disaster shall put ballence labour endeauours therewithall conclude confesse couet mortall fortune bee fairely rid part play dangerous stag serpent may find aduantage hisse whereas otherwise beene secure maiesties fauour viper tongue confidence alacrity goe towards greatest danger rise god hath hitherto stopped mouth hope maiesties good mine continue fauour prosper thing doe sincerely intend seruice c eighteenth day lord deputy receiued letter lord england signifying besides two thousand last sent greatest part vnder captaines rest left lordship disposall vpon second leauy two thousand appointed bee embarked sixe twentieth last moneth left lordship disposall excepting one company giuen captaine thomas dutton vpon lordship letter speciall recommendation day lordship receiued queene following letter elizabeth regina right trusty wellbeloued greet well report letter dauers haue brought v successe hath pleased god giue rebel spaniard combined receiued v contentment great happy accident could affoord wherefore although euer haue done happinesse hath befallen v ascribe highest praise thankes diuine maiesty yet forasmuch wee doe accompt seruants state like action made participant second degree fauour bestowed vpon v vertue industry wee cannot hold worthy thankes v haue receiued honour among chiefe onely chiefly put trust v plainely perceiue vigilancy labour valour late action wee could forbeare let see sensible merit true good successe vpon rebel wee daily attention haue heard quicker attempt vpon towne made respect owne letter tended sence especially protraction time brought apparant danger well accesse new supply forraine enemy defection people vnconstant disposition rebellious gouernement nation euer haue beene wee time hauing vnderstood iournals committed st iohns dauers reason haue moued course haue taken rather haue vsed speed attempting seeing assault accompanied losse euery losse time multiplied rumour wholly conuerted practice preiudice cause question maintained thing doe stand reputation army wee doe conceiue workes haue foundation vpon reason thought aduantagious seruice remaineth therefore desire may made knowne army haue serued vnder manner shall thinke best expresse doe know haue indured many incommodities siege wee would haue beene glad could haue auoided hauing made good proofe valour loyalty haue done time rather seeke preserue best treasure prince suffer wast otherwise kingdome could haue beene kept danger forraigne conquest intestine rebellion expect hand better sort seruitors shall well infused mind rest whatsoeuer either owne direction expending treasure could doe preuention difficulty follow army inseperable warre made climate il tempered winter siege hath beene royally prouidently afforded matter much charge vncertainty care direction haue attended wind weather curtesie conclude answere demand supply men although wee hope time neere finall conclusion happy successe remnant stranger poore towne pressed many want dispaire late victory adde herevnto hardly supply sent v come haue taken effect yet may perceiue much wee attribute iudgement thing affaire desired haue counsell hath beene signified vnto giuen order foure thousand men sent thither hand full proportion munition desire kind prouisions find great consumption must require take better order haue distribution thereof bee obserued quantity haue beene daily sent ouer yet daily want pretended expence bee found insupportable much rather men know whatsoeuer irish company receiue except action continually conuerted money vse rebel giuen vnder signet pallace whitehall yeere raigne twelfth ianuary beginning letter aboue queenes hand signed following word ouerwritten queenes owne hand viz though feare worse end desire confesse thought direct end worke either enemy rebell could increase perill honour yet wee hope aduenture shall bee made confusion bee ere lighted owne head let clanrickard thomond know doe thankefully accept endeauours selfe acknowledge diligence dangerous aduenture cherish iudge carefull soueraigne twentieth february twenty spanish captaines common souldiers imbarked kinsale six english ship sailed spaine seuen twenty day lord deputy counsell wrote lord england following letter may please loedships since last dispatch fifteenth hereof spaniard lien aboard shipping harbour kinsale take aduantage first fauourable wind spaine found meanes set forth scant wind vpon sunday last twentieth present wee haue ridde selues aboue pole reckonining wee sent corke england two hundred last number truly mustered one owne commissary shipping could get waterford wexford easterne port whence onely two haue yet recouered kinsale though rest haue beene good time ready sea doubt within foure fiue day wee able dispatch away rest though remaine yet great number certainty whereof doe know captaine haruy sent westerne part ship away spaniard take possession place certaine possessed castle hauen vpon friday last set forward towards baltimore whereof time make account possessed also hee busie sending away spaniard first wind though haue yet heard since friday last eighteenth receiued two packet lordship one twelfth last moneth time came harbour fiue company foot whereof foure vnder captaines namely dauys holcroft bradbery barker one hundred vnder conduct three last good store shipping came likewise victual day next sunday arriued kinsale time spaniard left port two barkes laden munition artillery working tooles thing written lordship carefully prouided haue iust cause thankefulnesse acknowledge hath pleased maiesty lordship supply v roially plentifully desired lordship well note speciall comfort prouidence care v thing necessary readinesse supply notice v need wee resolued prouisions come keepe good force west part prouince settle hitherto haue stood wauering may besides prosecute haue shewed themselues worst affected place needfull may fortified since wee signified last vpon intercepting certaine spanish letter great likelihood new supply spaine come speedily strongly behoueth v readinesse intertaine making place knowne strong curbe townes cittadels erected otherwise reuolt fall spanish party shall see come strongly well prepared foure thousand men wee perceiue lordship appointed v humbly leaue lordship consideration vpon sight letter spaine send whether shall thinke fit send v presently else haue readinesse supply arriue spaine might time make vse company come men well chosen well appointed armes good ought yet find men neither changed armes apparell embezelled yet haue beene strictly viewed mustered commissioner specially appointed like course meane take rest doe come lordship haue appointed yet wee leaue wholly lordship best iudge number meetest v intelligence send especially lordship receiue spaine conduction men abused themselues maiesties great losse doe best find truth ground thereof informe lordship haue directed carefully performe else lordship letter haue commanded lordship conceiue omission deputy many armes lost humbly answere able looke vnto thing selfe gaue commission master marshall sir robert gardener sir oliuer iohns take particular care charge thereof cannot relate haue done onely remember wee haue heard alleadged captaines charged armes company answere souldiers ranne away others assaying make escape stripped apparel armes selues saw true many found returned naked campe truth lost way spoiled broken seruice cannot denied part put ouer supply company rest could recouered cashered captaines entertainement short time nothing due whereout might defalked must answere lordship england hence went soone discharged captaines last come others desire warrant entry might beare date day lordship apointed water side receiue company acknowledge thinke reason haue else imprest remitted otherwise haue nothing beare charge themselues officer time landing often time sixe weekes month time imprest vsually spent afterward defalked must long without intertainment vnable liue wee humbly desire know lordship pleasure herein formerly vpon like occasion hitherto haue receiued answer lordship signifie vnto lordship victualer issue saith direction one pound halfe beefe per diem souldier little liue vpon yet rate victualing nothing abated intollerable beare likewise victualer thinkes may issue oates lower rate quarter seuen shilling six penny barrell high rate horseman entertainement cannot allow much horse meanes horse starued oates perish spent time plenty ordinary rate oates ireland twelue penny barrell yet well content pay six shilling barrell highest rate souldier giue particular wee humbly pray redresse lordship c corke c first march lord deputy letter lord england required send ouer lieftenant one late cast company still remaining ireland end might answer lordship certaine complaint made whereas many officer late leuies men receiued country able sufficient men wel serue vnder themselues conducted ouer disposed lord deputy whereof diuers sum money dismissed many sea side pretending lame sicke taken better men place neither pretence true lordship purposed inflict exemplary punishment great offence therefore required lieftenant sent ouer accused among aboue rest eight march sir oliuer iohns sent england kinsale newes good successe taking rincoran nyparke castle happy repulse spaniard sallying vpon cannon returned backe corke brought queene following letter elizabeth regina right trusty welbeloued greet well genlemans relation last sent vnto v letter receiued much contentment newes rendition kinsale place held spaniard kingdome wherein although comparing report brought v diuers onely misery victuall penury men fiue hundred strong conceiued might haue giuen stricter lawes composition doe perceiue easie matter neerer hand matter warre mistaken yet vpon consideration haue obserued iournall last sent ouer containing many important circumstance leade course amongst one hath much moued v assault would haue shed blood subiects dearer v reuenge glory doe account successe one acceptable accident hath befallen v carriage thereof discerne haue beene guided many part able prouident minister haue vsed seruice like nature therefore hold iust necessary v yeeld testimony gracious acceptation endeauours haue beene accompanied much paine perill remaineth seeing state thing owne desire doe require wee speake something thing fit thought time come whereof seeing euent hath already begun like worke great alteration aduantage could wish aime sum next safety kingdome giue possible ease state diminishing great consumption treasure late yeeres wee haue sustained yet direct precisely meanes parcel euery particular done hard v present especially vntill shall receiue counsell light information state thing success together owne opinion thereupon onely apparant v already letter iudgement hauing due sence infinite inconueniencies daily multiplied vppon kingdome occasion immediatly rendition cast part army stay supply comming hence course doubt doe continue farre forth thing may beare taking care army weakened holding small garrison necessary may good reason say obseruation hath passed latter yeeres agreeable owne opinion one charge great v yet without manner ground safety cause aduenture entertainement great number irish wherein note vnto two consideration first thing hazard v owne spirit doubtfull seruice might reaped secondly heretofore haue beene vsed hath beene seene either entertained rate pay owne nation mixed common regiment euer kept apart company seuerall vsed place seruices proper course although extraordinary danger kingdome hath giuen occasion dispence yet doubt owne conceit thinke meet conuenient speed reforme giue beginning degree dimunition measure shall find good seruice matter hath beene moued archtrairor commend handling offer haue kept dignity place hold therein yet doe mislike desperately reiect conclude thereby opening scope desire though till next ouerture haue little write vnto yet may say thus much generality monstrousnesse fact stained many deepe spot offence seuerall nature degree though none odious ingratitude quicke sence haue alwaies biemishing honour doth permit v hold way plaine way perdition therefore doe aduise course may winne v glory vpon armes must accompanied part mercy rather imploy receiuing secondary member vriaghts life left standeth make much account vile head thinke worthy recouered rather abandoned god men may left feele iust reward foule demerit notwithstanding mislike heare againe haue discouered guide resolution according occasion hereupon haue thought good returne gentleman sir oliuer iohns thus much mind vpon late letter matter counsell may haue charge impart vnto one whose good discretion affection seruice well perswaded end vpon arriuall time much seene euent late happy successe may enter solid consideration forme gouernement hereafter held proportion army continued thing may likely settle state safety forraigne attempt better obedience v heretofore haue debated resolued seemeth good vppon point contented send backe gentleman hether againe instructed therewith also needfull furtherance resolution haue good vnderstanding ciuill part gouernement well martiall sute hath beene made vnto v sir robert gardener chiefe iustice licensed come hither shall like well send end vpon report conceipts may enter particular consideration thing incident vpon arriuall wee shall better able doe giuen vnder signet pallace west minster eight day february foure fortieth yeere raigne day sir oliuer iohns brought lord england following letter lord deputy hearty commendation good lordship haue late dispatch little cause fill paper thing commendation lordship wise proceeding congratulation maiesties happy successe vnder time intended mixe acknowledgement extraordinary contentment late victory spaniard particular direction especially seeing change haue made countrey freeing forraigne power howsoeuer infested still intestine rebellion must men knowledge acquainted affaire state haue brought many change hardly tell aduice direction offer new vntill may receiue thence light present state kingdome whose owne eye iudgement neerest ablest performe consideration seeing hath pleased maiesty owne letter onely giue notice royall gracious acceptation noble endeuours direct lordship also send ouer hether sir robert gardener gentleman sir oliuer iohns relation particular fit knowledge expectation hereof forbeare enlarge letter best wish lordship perfect health happinesse euer found c eight day iean remaine spaniard kinsale embarked ready gone next morning lord deputy left corke taking iourney towards dublyn arriued night yoghall stormy weather contrary wind kept spaniard still port kinsale lordship forced stay towne day whence wrote master secretary england vpon twelfth march aduertising thereof giuing notice spaniard beerehauen castlehauen baltimore gone spaine iean sent corke pledge promised eight article agreement fiue english company lately arriued waterford lastly praying excused rest lord maiesties counsell hee forbare write vnto till came waterford within day hoped meete earle ormond counsell vpon conference bee better able satisfie lordship thing concerning present state kingdome according maiesties pleasure lately signified letter pledge aboue mentioned lie safe returne ship wherein spaniard embarked pledge principall commander among one captaine moryson whose bold seruice mention made sally vpon second december gentleman inuited lord deputy accompany dublin rest fellowes still remaining corke whether hee returne vnto together shipped spaine vpon safe returne ship iourney dublyn gentleman aboad familiar conference name sake vnderstood family spaine discended english gentleman followed emperour charles fifth warres bounty seated spaine day chiefe name good reuenues lord deputy come waterford write together rest counsell vpon eighteenth march following letter lord england may please lordship eighth hereof wee receiued sir oliuer iohns corke dispatch pleased lordship make may omit humble thankefulnesse acknowledge great comfort contentment haue taken appeareth thereby relation sir oliuer maiesty lordship haue graciously fauourably accepted allowed poore endeauours carefull haue directed send sir robert gardener vnto lordship soone deputy get dublyn sir robert gardener shall haue considered debated counsell businesse wherein lordship looke thorowly informed meane space aske time wee haue thought fit acquaint lordship thing stand since last dispatch spaniard certaine gone beerehauen castlehauen baltimore day sir oliuer iohns arriue corke heard spaniard kinsale last iean himselfe shipped readinesse set saile since heare vntill saturday thirteenth hereof could get forth harbour night beaten backe sunday ready set againe since time haue heard thence lay aboard mouth harbour men possessed towne haue obserued wind since time good wee good hope gone pledge according agreement come corke three captaines long continuance haue cause thinke iean hath dealt sincerely v hope troubled spaniard yet prouided worst may happen long spanish cloud hang ouer v wee haue deuided victual great part munition sundry harbour along sea coast prouince ready answere occasion may fully appeare note wee send herewithin meanes maiesties charge grow great wee cannot acknowledge seruice north ward goe slowlier would otherwise might apply selues wholly way beseech lordship fauourably consider necessity leade v thereunto least leauing place vnprouided facilitie inuite comming thither regard wee haue giuen intention fortifie seuerall place beerhauen castlehauen baltimore creekes passage along coast whereas spaniard gone god thanked haue meaning doe regard haue answere lordship touching point thereby conceiue maiesty wil vndergo great charge though continue stil opinion safest course fortifie place spaniard come againe without strong fort cittadels vpon chiefe townes late experience shewed v apparantly wauering neither haue safetie retreate diaster befall v commoditie victual munition altogether would danger whole hazarded loste instant point hold selues bound dutie prouide therefore maiestie like make cittadels townes city noted fit former letter hold great necessitie harbor corke kinsale yet wel fortified haue already begun kinsale haue viewed mouth harbour corke raising one good fort entry another vpon iland riuer harbour aptly secured victual munition vse commodiously defended enemy hold matter great importance workes shall erected ten culuerings ten demyculuerings iron mounted vpon vnshod wheeles platformes bee placed fort bee made two harbour must forth sent bullet either corke kinsale whole store victual diuided sundry part prouince note appeareth doubt wee shall want wee enter prosecution northward vnlesse lordship pleased continue course supply confesse haue prouidently hitherto afforded v conceine seemeth haue informed may furnished victual v strange past beleefe make apparant vnto lordship may please consider impossible make end warre without wasting spoiling countrie must doe still wee haue long time earnestly laboured effected great measure possibly deuise reason thought wee starue rebell yet preserue victual country souldier must conclude faile victualing england vpon hope haue found realme man vnderstanding army either starued driuen breake vpon sudden power helpe wee beseech lordship beleeue haue made vse experience yet possibilitie thereof wee haue conferred may bee prouided pale quietest part mounster wee certifie lordship besides doe apparantly foresee apparrelling souldier left vnto captaine yet best content party exchanging new coyne royally kept vp souldier worse case thing already growne deare scarse since new coine went currant clothes excessiuely deare quantity money must necessarily bee prouided england brought hither cannot exchange faile neuer little souldier vnclothed rather indure runne away though sure hanged feare likewise meane breaking army decay sicknesse otherwise already great notwithstanding wee doe yet haue wanting prouidency wee humbly craue haue supply sent time time till rebellion broken forraigne force arriue hope short time vnder captaines conductor find experience captaines sent hither company conceiuing shall stand long either negligence corruption loose men turned ouer supply others scarse ten hundred first comming ouer conductor better call strict account finde men fill vp company disposing know best preserue neede reinforce company irish cannot come english meanes company wee confesse full irish till supply come cannot well holpen whereas deputie haue euer bin dutie desirous diminish maiesties lyst end onely haue taken occasion death captaines extinguish entertainement also haue meerely discharged aboue fiue thousand since nouember captaines men thus discharged thinking fortune ouerthrowne neuer consideration necessitie imposed vpo onely looking vpon owne losse esteeme disgrace become many enemy many clamorous proceeding whereas lp letter pleased let know sending many captaines proceedeth recommending many vnto humbly assure lp almost came ouer stranger rest haue letter wrote request onely testifie behaued theselues otherwise honestly least could afford forced take away company maiestie expect abatement lyst beseech lp consider hard condition discharge send ouer doe onely become odious vnto offend many lordship whose fauour obtained charge discharge old captaines found whose sufficiency haue since continuall experience often aduenturing bloud liues onely returne vnto maiestie importunate sutors armed good iustice craue reward selfe incurre iust dislike friend maiesties seruice grieueth thereby disinable selfe hereafter doe maiestie seruice heretofore haue done next vnto god must attribute valour sufficiency touching irish whose discharge meane make small abatement haue heretofore laboured vnsensible degree deminish charge chuse fit time fully effect sudden whereof might cause rather increase decrease maiesties charge haue lately recommended incorporate townes lordship may happily haue occasion doe like draw might bee affectionate furtherance seruice least hold contentment though indeed haue affoarded v helpe might ought yet meaning thereby presse lordship inlargement franchise happily thereupon sutors confesse truly lordship think corporate townes generall haue already great many priuiledges immunity vnlesse better knew would readily endeuour deserue thought meete time giue lordship taste least might otherwise make vse letter intended desire lordship perswade maiestie resolue presently make cittadels chiefest townes without shal neuer bring performe duty c iean whether without authoritie giuen spaine know often discoursed lord deputy abode together corke vnlikely difficult worke make peace betweene england spaine yea went farre vrge lord deputy deale therein lordship onely made answere knew maiestie graciously inclined hold good amity christian prince yet confident owne power thing iealous honor especially point wherein royall meaning bin intertained like state spaine whence receiued ill measure late treaty purpose men discouraged made instrument therein whereupon iean sware vnto lordship left state spaine affected vpon knowledge thing easie effect thing much desired haue firme peace betweene england spaine added vpon arriuall spaine finding thing stand condition returne ship thence giue lordship inckling thereof vpon reputation lordship dealing state england matter loose honour thereby lord deputie hitherto done answere ieans proposition ciuill tearmes wherein hee spoken priuate man might lawfully haue done licence confer yet lest might thought haue exceeded commission nice discourse hauing good reason imagine god many time doth worke vnlikely yea contrary meanes hee iean commission make warre one vpon might proue commissioner making peace lordship aduertised thus much master secretary england praying haue warrant instruction thought fit hee proceede therein ieans silence spaine ouerture passed dreame tooke effect long queene liued foure twentieth day march last day english writing yeere lord deputie counsell kilkenny intertained earle ormond house wrote following letter lord england may please lordship hauing certaine intelligence since comming place iean rest spaniard departed kinsale tuesday hereof wind since time hath serued well assure selues neere coast spaine wee thought fit hereby giue lordship notice therof may know free since hath brought notorious rebell one william mac hubbard lately taken vpperossery late hath done great spoiles murder part haue caused bee executed towne great terror many time executed sonne garret mac mortaghes named moris mac garret died hurt lately giuen fight dangerous young man like trouble countrie death two rebel also notorious rebell birth mounster lately slaine called dermot mac awlye inward man great practising instrument tyrone greatly quiet part lordship hardly thinke great change wee finde already happy timely cutting sir fynneen dryscoll donneuan two sonnes sir owen mac carty follower since comming growne odious rebel part well diuided faction among themselues failen preying killing one another conceiue much auaile quieting part deputy day going towards dublin whence lp shall heare according direction giuen lordship president returning mounster attend charge haue much importuned army generall touching abatement halfe pound beefe vpon euery flesh day euery particular souldier two hearing euery fish fish day horse troopes likewise find themselues grieued victualer chargeth two shilling sixe penny increase issuing euery barrell oates without warrant priuat letter wade clerke counsel although conceiue wade hath signified ouer vpon purpose lordp2 good ground yet inregard importunity captaines preuent generall mutiny army regard souldiers weak much infeebled late siege kinsale prises thing increased aboue measure reason new standard coyne country generally much harryed wasted thereby great scarcitie want grow wee hold meete accordingly gaue direction commissary victual issue oates formerly sixe shilling barrell allow souldier two pound beefe eight herings dav according formerly accustomed till lordship resolution returned behalfe humbly pray expect hauing matter time worthy presenting lordship wee humbly take leaue c lord president hauing accompanied lord deputie kilkenny thence returne charge prouince mounster kilkenny lord deputie began feele himselfe sickly hauing formerly complained distemper likely effect watching cold taken hard wintersiege kinsale lordship sicknesse grew vpon next day carried horselitter iourney till came dublin hee ariiued eight twentieth march beginning yeere distemper stil continuing applied himselfe take phisicke conclude act yeere past following abstract maiesties charge realme ireland first aprill nine twentieth march totall charge well establishment warrant gardener sir oliuer iohns relation present state kingdome besides instruction present state lordship sent following letter lord england dated fifth may may please lordship although haue good reason guesse difficulty warre ireland long continuance exceeding charge thereof time vnder rebel strength euer grow slow progresse though still better hath made must confesse vnder gouernement yet since doe conceiue none personall actor therein especially time wherein fashion force people much altered wont bee thorowly apprehend many impediment cross opposition vndertake proceede thing humbly desire lordship giue mee leaue satisfaction discharge duty open vnto cause doe better feele expresse haue hindred speedy conclusion warre maiesty great prouidence large proportion expence might happily expect first arriuall found rebel number time bin since conquest farre naked people time generally better armed knew better vse weapon men euen exceeded v discipline fittest aduantage naturall strength country many expert shot excelling footmanship nation meanes make better vse strength offence defence could haue bin made squadron pike artificiall fortisications townes regard whereof presumed man wit could hardly find course ouercome famine wrought seueral garrison planted fit place altered vpon good occasion plantation could made army must first settle remoue strength enemy required time plantation conueniency almost necessity summe many eminent reason especially meanes might bee prouided horse liue winter without garrison would proue little effect beseech lordship best leaning fortune despaire army discouraged themselues beleeue mee lord hardly beleeue much contemned rebel none garrison stirred abroad returned beaten enemie farre master field tyrone measured whole length ireland comming backe vnfought mee began warre suburb dublin time choice whole army euen euerie company left behind drawne mounster earle ormond beit desirous loose time opportunitie ophalye time accounted great dangerous seruices fifth may drew towards north chiefely diuert tyrone northerne force giuing opposition plantation loughfoyle withall purposing found meanes victual carriage haue left garrison armagh first thorowly effect gaue way loughfoyle land settle quietly drew tyrone chiefe force vpon selfe fight made know fortune began turne brake bound circuit whence hee wont affront greatest army last called northerne iourney army consisted almost double number horse foote traytor forced arrested within confines pale returne finding obseruation iourney wherewith whole counsell concurre opinion garrison loughfoyle would doe little hurt tyrone except force left armagh since might easily flie reach enioy betweene dungannoa pale one largest fertill country ireland wee became sutors lordship iune men prouisions would enable v plantation meane time intended seruice ofalie leax strength rebellion lemster dangerous rebel ireland whereas last time army passed leax one greatest hath time together kingdome encountred almost distressed onely natiues countrie pleased god conflict many preuailed though rebel lemster gathered together yet killing owny mac rory many best men country vtterly spoiling exceeding rich meanes life haue neuer since able make head otherwise liue dispersed little number woodkernes daily consumed weare away yeere recouered earle ormonds pledge vpon arriuall supply sent lordship although time yeere farre spent indeede ouerfarre plant garrison great purpose next ensuing winter instant ill prouided victuall money yet set forward fifteenth day september came dundalke incamping two mile thence within halfe mile entrance moyry found pace passe naturally one difficult passage ireland fortified good art admirable industry enemy hauing raised mountaine mountaine wood wood bogge bogge long trauerses huge high flanckers great stone mingled turffe staked side pallades watled possessed one greatest army euer able make maine within eight small mile armagh called mount nerreys armagh grasse consumed could haue liued horse place haue beene made tenable garrison thought ncessary possessed though armagh selfe beene planted meane time little lesse effect far stretch victual improue time prouisions hauing tyrones army continually within little musket shot v within two day made fort guardable left therein baggage meanes carriage euen many owne horse wee might newry conuay much victual thither might performed short time yet good time wee forced fast two day returne garrison could bee effect bee wee victual enough repeate manner fight number returne wherein rebell seldome scaped without blow namely pace carlingsord hee receiued notable ouerthrow neither set downe thing amplifie owne doings endeauours giue lordship account season lost making plantation taking effect winter short time haue broken heart rebellion let appeare vnto lordship many difficulty opposition wee found onely bending way vnpossible beene v time number haue planted place beene necessary haue made sudden end warre among consideration lordship may bee pleased conceiue albeit lyst force ireland vnitely considered may appeare bee sufficiently great yet diuiding part three thousand mounster three thousand loughfoyle one thousand knockefergus almost two thousand connaght remainder whereof haue beene onely able preuaile selfe wherewith haue sustained burthen warre lemster north hardly beare deminution army subiect vnto deficient men many subdiuisions necessarily constrained make guarding important place earle ormond leaxe ophalia diuers part defend subiect incursion rebel yet leaue competent army trie fortune rebel north wee must bee prepared seeing diuersion expected foresaid garrison able hinder light footed kerne hauing fled creaghts fastness ioyning vtmost strength partes associate lesse three day warning whereas wee contrary case present vse hope manner assistance disioyned troopes within compasse many weekes besides impediment many neither time since meete hurtfull proceeding restraint extraordinaries want al kind necessary lordship perswaded onely fit royall warre whereas substance extraordinaries growing chiefly huge prouisions carriage conuay victual waste therein large proportion pyoners workemens tooles diuers sort engins enginers fortification passage ouer riuers place otherwise vnpassable material reward spials seruices boldly affirme presume proue lordship warre world effectually followed doth require liberall expence prouision thing extraordinaries sauing charge great artillery whereof also measure though farre lesse place haue great vse many perchance forcible present vnto lordship oriely two reason army arrested many riuers vnpassable marsh secondly warre made best effect find meanes victual necessary prouision bring v redeeme losse opportunity plantation good effect haue vndertooke army greater reasonable garrison make warre lemster depth winter first fell glinnes fastest countrey ireland till part lemster onely vntouched first spoiled countrey made donnell spantgah receiued maiesties mercy ioine therein forced phelim mac feogh tooles pestilent infestors pale submission haue since shewed apparance good subiects euer knew heard rebel going vp downe farre athlone fell fercale forced tyrrill exceeding great strength banished effect oconnors ophaly north returning towards north spoiled ferny iourney present wherein besides many killed two euer mac cooleys sonnes wasted fuse sir richard moryson planted garrison aboue twenty mile pale brenny sir oliuer lambert returning drogheda generall aduice counsell tooke turlogh mac henry lord fuse euer mac cooly farmer ferny sir ohy ohanlon northerne lord many macmahowns orellies besides greatest oathes gaue v thought best pledge loyalty loose part beginning yeere hauing setled new submitties lemster border north great assurance could drew againe north generall hosting yeere could readinesse cleared assured passage moyry cutting downe part wood building fort went lecayle wholly possessed mac gennis tooke castle part thence went armagh placed garrison albeit time continuall rumour wee heard preparation spaine made v proceede somewhat irresolutely maine course plantation making warre tyrone selfe yet went forward intent draw sir arthur chichester loughsidney tyrone plant garrison blackwater force passage somewhat beneath meet building fort bridge vpon passage haue made dungannon selfe center whether without great difficulty garrison loughfoyle armagh knockfergus mount norreys ell north might time meet together beate absolutely banish archtraitor owne country performing thereof haue spoiled rebel corne sauing within command garrison countenance army haruest time wee resolued enable make large prouisions thereof themselues horse farre wee proceeded course wee forced tyrone blackwater hee lay army fortified enreached great art cleared passage intended dungannon making bridge onely excepted wee meant supply floate spoiled part standing corne time assured newes come vnto v ariuing spaniard first staying cleane diuerting course driuen comming bend counsel defend maiesties kingdome forraigne inuasion busie recouer inward rebellion end breake worke leaue prosecution businesse place already possessed onely preserued continued time wherein army first led action induring season fight thinke euer army short time lordship must wonder make head spaniard wee drew vp weake company besides deficients sicknesse death many company thirtie fortie hurt men yet vpon vncertainty probable soeuer loth loose maiestie chiefe benefit one whole yeeres seruice till fully assured landing therefore first drew selfe onely horse mounster neuer sent force till last pinch necessitie thus haue lordship also reason second yeere lost without laying new foundation rooting rebel though god thanked wonne defending kingdome powerfull ambitious inuader dishonour hope also sound sudden subuersion rebel speake nothing seruice kinsale since great comfort doe finde maiestie lordship well satisfied therein behoofefull publike good conceiued make cleane riddance countrie much might assure performance departure necessarie keepe army part vntill quit giue lesse aduantage purposed falsely presently conueyed cannon iland doth absolutely command hauen kinsale sufficient guard beginning fortification instant maintaine tooke order haue victual sold vnto presumed would serue day day prouision bread effect spent owne stoare could haue able time inuest againe ill worse condition left wind prouisions serued departure winter farre spent wee could fittest time returne company garrison otherwise could wee haue done place stored victual prouision horse yet little remnant left defend place many excellent seruiees hope lordship shall daily heare whole force returned course haue thought next summer trouble lordship repetition thereof set downe deliuered sir oliuer iohns onely beseech lordship giue leaue remember publike durie much soeuer may seeme taste priuate end continually enioyne much endeuour decrease list yet still send ouer new captaines command bestow company giue vp england others recommended vnto whome deale plainely doe sell euen late haue receiued lordship letter increase particular men company cast captaines lordship send ouer procure hate many lordship displeasure besides owne friend fauour doe increase commend doe incurre like cast company captaines many trial doe know bee best able doe maiestie seruice heere shall dispaire least bee diffident hereafter good yet haue reason condemne iniustice importune lordship otherwise relieued haue spent mouds continuall labour euen mine aie recouerie defending kingdome humbly desire lordship since heretofore fortune hated preserue mee becomming odious fittest seruice haue alreadie tasted spleene god knoweth haue forced cashere though haue delt fauourably loth harme haue rather commended onely fault punish since hope god blesse worke ere bee long wee shall much diminish number labourer great cashering meanes preserue best captaines would bee loth bee man vndertake conclusion warre doe humbly desire lordship pardon mee great care satisfie thing haue troubled long feare mee vnworthy letter lordship reading c instruction giuen sir robert gardiner sir oliner saint iohns whereby might satisfie maiestie point touching present state affaire kingdome lord deputie commander diuers voluntarie gentleman seruants attending rode dundalke whilest hee attended comming vp force arriuing victual necessary might enable take field lordship thirtieth may receiued maiestie letter following elizabeth regina right trusty welbeloued wee greet well whereas paiment army kingdome hath late yeeres made partly money certaine weekely lending partly apparrell course paiment instituted vpon good consideration preuent fraud diuers captaines euill disposition exercise vpon company notwithstanding haue letter report person haue credence deliuer counsell manner paiment hath wrought effect expected causing company bee kept fuller yet reason late alteration standard monies chargeable v paiment readie money would bee haue therefore thought good cease manner payment henceforth reuiue old manner payment money rate eight penny day new standard souldier course pleasure shall begin take place first day moneth aprill continued warrant treasurer directed shall made time time way imprests captaine himselfe companie disaretion according state company necessitie seruice vntill dayes full pay wee pleased shall bee made twise euerie yeere viz feast saint michael archangell annuntiation virgin marie time pleasure armie shall fully clearely paid whole wage defalcation due vpon formerly deducted purpose wee prouide time shall bee treasurer hand money sufficient make full paids whereas latter letter written since conncell signified vnto wee pleased restore kinde pay doe require establishing thereof contentment army two thing may bee obserued one treasurer may haue money hand sufficient time time performance payment exchange bee duely maintained side without alleadge arise inconueniencies intollerable army pleased satisfaction herein assure oints wee take order neither treasurer shall want monies new standard payment necessary realme bankes sterling monies make good exchange according established proclamation although point cannot omit let know see cause vehemeni complaint letter doe import default exchange vppon examination doe find three foure fifty thousand pound returned last yeere vnpaied present aboue sixe thousand pound considering excessiue charge yeere ought giue much cause offence two point like pleased obserue manner haue written end thereby army subiects may perceiue great care receiue contentment thing due vnto otherside straight obseruation part without good correspondency remedy inconueniencies thereby may cast vpon v may proue burthen v wee admonish obseruation two point necessary part obserued first whereas heretofore manner paiment money onely receiued vse corrupt disposition captaines want good discipline force great fraud committed well v keeping full number v allowed also souldiers detaining wage part thereof deceit without good caution vsed may againe renewed doe therefore expect shall establish good course discipline ordering band point wee shall hereafter abused decay number heretofore haue beene shall neuer well preuent alien men mind like fraud insticting notorious exemplary punishment vpon captaines officer fault kind shall appeare notorious onely casting pay degrading note ignominy military discipline vsed iustly done men shamelesse action doe onely bring shame profession publike seruices notable impediment manner euident treachery first change payment apparell paid money first motion deputy principall captaines officer army note perill exchange bee maintained true must supported v shal know none must preuent captaines taking pay soldier apparell bestowing selfe whose care iudgement haue great reason assure selues loue seruice honor second point recommend vnto due execution former proclamation touching matter exchange assistance master exchange minister therein end fraud discouered late haue vsed hy merchant abuse princely intention therein priuate gaine may remedied therein chiefly vse monies descried may taken away people countrey withall sterling money may bee brought exchange vpon condition proclamation containe wee doe find intent erection new coyne way soone take place withdrawing monies whereby rebel may exercise trafficke forraigne nation relieued wherefore may adde remedy said proclamation mentioned good meanes indgements shall thought meete vsed publish proclamation name aduertise v conceit end may haue warrant fro v shal think meet done therein haue thought good admonish forasmuch winter apparell already deliuered souldier wil bee run vntill fourteenth day may inclusiue likely seeing know already purposed take away deliuery apparell haue furnished company lieu thereof money way imprests whereby may fall shall double charged therefore deputy shall take order treasurer vpon halfe yeeres full pay ended michaelmas next defalcation made much company shall haue receiued betweene first aprill fifteenth may aboue weekely lending much shall ouer paied company giuen vnder signet mannor greenewich eight twentieth aprill foure fortieth yeere raigne beginning iune lord deputy hauing gathered force together lord deputy enters tyrone tooke field marched vp blackewater passage last yeere discouered conuenient carry maiesties force way heart tyrone passage lying fiue mile eastward fort blackewater lordship incamped south side riuer hauing small pace skirt wood betweene riuer pace yeere cut downe many tree time passage soone cleered hence lordship sent sir richard moryson regiment possesse north side riuer securing army passage attempt rebel thus queenes force entered tyrone incamped lordship spent time causing bridge built ouer riuer fort adioining guard passage owne christian name called charlemount left captaine toby cawfield company one hundred fifty command campe countrey plaine open dungannon distant sixe mile workes hand might see towne dungannon tyrones chiefe house seated set fier whereby apparant tyrone force meant flie quit part lord deputy sent sr richard moryson regiment possesse dungannon whether lordship soone marched rest force time sir henry dockwra gouernour force loughfoyle hauing planted many garrisous part lately planted garrison omy twelue mile distant dungannon whence came force met lord deputy dungannon thus lord deputy hauing driuen archtraitor owne countrey high castle row vpon ban sent party spoile prey countrey farre eniskillin vpon lough erne tooke tyrones strongest ilands namely one wherein strong fort recouered three peeces maiesties artillery another iland called magherlowni next dungannon chiefe place aboade magazins warre dungannon lord deputy sent sir richard moryson fiue hundred foot meet sir arthur chichester came force carickfergus passe loughsidney land within mile dungannon met according lord deputy direction begin raise fort meane time lord deputy hauing vtterly banished tirones partaker part marched fiue mile dungannon loughsidney sir arthur chichester lay force lordship encamped till made fort defencible containe aboue one thousand foot one hundred horse victualed carickfergus way said lough fort lordship barrony called mountioy made sir bentamin berry lieftenant one colonel army gouernour present seruice done command fort left captaine francis roe likewise present seruice sir arthur chichester commanded chiefe force left might draw vpon occasion seruice garrison part towards carickfergus lordship encamped vpon loughsidney hee receiued eighth iuly letter maiesty signifying owne hand shee glad recouery sickenesse surprize many care labour body mind siege kinsale commending much prouidence notwithstanding owne state body set foot preparation summer prosecution nothing wanting time serue soeuer sensible feeling subiects burthen caused daily call vpon minister speedy carefull easing thereof yet hee wrong himselfe beleeuing thereby errours imputed himselfe whose endeauours kingdome much improued opinion rather conceiue thereby shee would giue occasion call others seuere accompt place vnder neglected seruice priuate gaine sought prolong warre iudgement valuation seruices making guilty owne griefe farre disposition towards since summer hee meant lay axe roote tree prosecuting archtraitor nothing beare vp false rumour spanlsh aide summer euer time end warre since supply sent state shee stopped currant spaniard progresse siege ostend also set chargeable fleet sea attend vpon coast spaine preuent arriuall force ireland reducing archtraitor sword onely agreeable satisfaction shee could receiue mischiefes fallen vpon louing subiects iniquity shee conceiued ready meanes effecting draw chiefe captaines country purpose pleasure lord deputy receiue mercy truely humby sought wherein without prescribing particular course best knew circumstance onely shee gaue caution prouide former mischiefes whereas commonly rebel fearing spoiled wont contract vnderhand archtraitor submit themselues thereby present saue countrie giue succour rebel creaghts vnder hand returne army reuolt againe hee consider inward motiues crauing mercy hee could ruine without spending time charge maine action would permit deale easie manner otherwise giue sharpe imposition condition submission wasting good make obedience durable shee iudged one condition necessarie pardon vpon seruice done onely vpon particularly hated vpon bee directed argument confidence gaue power warre peace onely one thing professed see cause leaue vnexempted namely pardoning arch traitor monster ingratitude roote miserie people thinking mercy proscription manner prosecution meerely incompatible iustice therfore commanding receiue vpon condition vpon simple submission mercy al thing life excepted make pleasure known complices perswaded hee may bee pardoned pleasure fearing leaue least bee left superioritie reuenge concerning fortification forraigne inuasion maiesty gaue allowance repaire fort waterferd build fort harbour corke kinstle build fort galloway carlingford last effected lordship lesse fearing discent forraine force within saint george channel build small fortification hee lord deputy thinke meere aswell present planting garrison tyrone otherwhere imploying therein captaine bodley captaine hansard army paul yuye mounster lordship knew fit ouersee contriue work concerning neale garue held part odonnels country yet custodium maiestie gaue warrant passe letter patent yet reguard tickle disposition make restriction therein hee lord deputy counsell thinke meete pretend bee done maiesties speciall direction lord deluin vpon succour giuen rebel conference tyrone comming north mounster doubtfull time siege kinsale since imprisoned castle dublin maiesties pleasure hee bee called triall counsell tho came effect dying prison time prefixed calling answer matter enough charge vnderhand fauouring rebel howsoeuer peraduenture would found plaine matter question life wherein maiestie offender although effect shee done little nothing yet shee thinkes mercy bee much remaineth therefore resort explane selfe former aduice others wished though warrant conclude life onely notwithstanding seeing warrant sufficient heare case forbeare discouer highest would lowest intent faithfull counsellor found state without submission subiect others comming would idle offer nothing opinion thereupon might maiesty see might haue come shee would content good kingdome descend greatnesse owne heart full iust indignation thing touched infinite caution wherevnto experience misfortune friend respect whatsoeuer vnlesse knew friend confident false wicked countrey owes much duty distinction make great oddes question letter therefore shall examine circumstance would quickely discerne shall spend yeeres together seruice selfe giue ouer profession doe neither heart haue euer beene accusable basenes friend though kind haue seuerall taste ingratitude onely take still assurance proceeding letter hath beene sent dublyn treasurer vpon taking iland tyrone yet wee moued expresse simpathy good fortune duty publike particular affection selfe god hath made happy instrument maiesties seruice wee haue likewise heard president mounster taking beerehauen whereby well hoped prouince would haue proued lesse troublesome yet hope first many prouinciall rebel next hollownes reputed subiects appeareth many way though visible onely maintained assurance haue succour spaine whereof haue often said wee make iudgement able doe hath doe hath done hath onely beene hindered remaining maiesties fleete vpon coast shee resolueth maintaine till winter well come seeing done much maiesty doe many difficulty home himselfe action others abroad may make suspention diuertion spanish inuasion thinke lordship shall doe well take time serueth vlster seeing perceiue haue ordred matter land north neere south haue meanes draw force kingdome make head wee haue little else say present commend proceeding expect successe although find lordship good reason draw away sir samuell bagnoll extraordinary company content spare till taking castle donboy yet haue thought conuenient worth lordship knowledge let vnderstand spaniard shall attempt land ireland army intelligence doe confirme mounster vpon neerer part conuaght summer betweene bartholmewtide respect thought good remember lordship haue care moneth two send force strengthen prouince aboue lyst whereby first discent maiesties force may keepe reputation prouincials whose eye onely vpon army may grow insolent gouernour bee forced leaue field purpose thinke amisse presently send horse though spare fewer foote considering weakenesse number answere occasion north although wee doubt odonnell fed hope mounster rebel yet doe expect great force land part northerly towne galloway furthest wee haue wherewith hold time recommendation action god protection court greenewich eighteenth iuly army refreshed day rest lord deputy determined leaue newry take field againe vpon tenth august vpon intelligence tyrone purposed send brian mac carty backe killultagh disturbe part diuert prosecution tyrone much could lordship directed sir arthur chichester masserine sir henry dauers newry draw part force countrey inuest fort enishlaghlin onely hold rebel part strength thereof good fled tyrone left resolution lord
