sir henry dockwra thinke fit attempt vpon tyrone stopping passing creaghts fastnesse wherein lay lordship present whole force lordship troope horse lodged charlemount thousand foote lyst sir henry dauers troope horse lodged armagh seuen hundred foote fort adioyning party two hundred horse thousand foure hundred foote might drawne sir henry dockwra thence vpon sudden occasion force together company mount norreys mountioy fort able doe great matter vpon tyrone hee could discouer purpose good espiall yet lordship offered himselfe force left draw presently vp tyrone sir henry dockwra thought needfull rather thing fit seruice bee omitted whereas sir henry dockwra seemed doubt henry oge second lordship confident sound meaning gaue assurance part hee would onely doe thing giue state offence would aduertise thing could learne seruice rather faile would draw whole force vpon tyrone also lordship letter earnestly perswaded touching ocanes submission lordship wrote sir h dockwra would glad see came tyrone presently businesse enishlaghlan dispatched would willing giue reasonable contentment lastly lordship aduised sir henry dockwra carry businesse hee might ready performe direction spaniard againe land ireland strong rumour went shortly intended tenth august lord deputy wrote following letter master secretary cecyll sir vnderstand sir oliuer lambert fortification galloway almost finished needfull place haue foure demycannons foure whole culuerings thinke well culuerings iron thinkes make great vse spaniard happen land suspecteth great workes thinke must necessarily haue good great ordinance therefore beseech sir meane wee may speedily supplied score iron peeces well furnished fitted placed elsewhere mounster aduantage seruice whereby confident whole countrey much better secured maiesty greatly eased continuing charge though present charge seemes thereby much increased protest doe apply carefulnesse best endeauours husband businesse maiesty short time shall find abatement charge owne contentment interrupted spaniard doe come doubt greater workes keepe townes neere stand great awe suddenly easily fall party otherwise likelihood would shew themselues thing strong manifestly appeare cost bestowed great good purpose keeping one towne reuolting well counteruaile whole charge maiesty shall planting fortification yet afterwards bee bridle country shall neuer bee able rebell againe conceiue placing constable conuenient ward shall thought fittest maintained maiesty shall better cheaper serued laying company part company must vpon occasion remoued one man onely hath charge thereof knowes must accomptable doubt haue much greater care may commodiously fitted thing necessary must treat sir take order place bestowed court vpon sutors kind make accompt many since partly know already shall thereby disabled doe maiesty seruice affect become meerely vnprofitable officer much soone obserued place left disposall best know euery man deserues man seruing fittest little purpose make eye witnes well deseruing power reward rather vse meanes maiesty lord hoping get aime much easier shorter course confesse sir doe greefe obserue recommending many hither captaines place haue giuen ouer charge meanes neither lessen queeries charge would cashing company preferre others thereunto see daily haue well deserued meanes come selling company thing would otherwise neuer suffer placing captaines found beginning warre whose insufficiency almost lost kingdome beseech sir conceiue haue iust cause greeued must draw vpon selfe hatred great many discharge great cash intend euer hold ouerthrow fortune especially able bestow vpon worthiest place kingdome haue fallen within gift predecessor although god witnes doth nothing much greeue mee shall thereby bee disabled serue maiesty would make speedy end warre might safe durable leauing place know best able serue imploy time continuall seruice might iustly presence importune reward former seruices sir c time lord deputy wrote following letter maiestie may please sacred maiestie haue receiued inestimable comfort gracious letter fifteenth iuly none indeuours doe satisfie mee seruice vntill finde approued maiestie haue done vttermost effect labour doe appeare little owne zeale doe often ashamed present vnto faire royall eye onely cause doe often presume present maiestie account proceeding led hope restlesse desire improue vnto degree might bee worthy knowledge whereas pleaseth maiestie restraine mee hearkening vnto archtraytor tyrone respect desire cut suddenly chargeable thread warre could nothing come welcome vnto bee continuall scourge fauour god already brought verie low ebbe vtterly cut cast countrie although haue great reason presume hee bee assisted forraigne power ruine estate certaine yet vagabond woodkerne hee may preserue life long know yet therein humbly desire maiestie beleeue omit nothing possible compassed caution maiesty doth vouchsafe giue mee taking submitties aduantage abuse mercy beseech maiestie thinke matter great importance affection suffer commit grosse fault seruice doe thing able giue good account aboue thing desire doe owne royall feete seruice may giue leaue fill eye onely deare desired obiect beseech god confound enemy vnfaithfull subiects make hand happy heart zealous doe seruice maiesties truest seruant mountioy fort enishlanghen aboue mentioned inuesting whereof made lord deputie deferte taking felld seated middest great bogge way accessable thicke wood hardly passable two deepe ditch compassed strong pallisadoes verie high thicke rampeire earth timber well flancked bulworkes defence place fortie two musketeres twentie swordmen lodged force good industry made approches first ditch besieged yeeld place queene themselues absolutely mercy ward english left castle spoile thereof taken wherein great store plate chiefe good best men countrie fled tyrone men taken brought bound newry presented vpon nineteenth august lord deputy day lordship wrote letter following master secretarie cecyll sir haue lately written large haue matter importance trouble onely since last haue taken enishlaghlen place great importance strongest haue heard bee held rebell ireland henrie oneale eldest sonne shane oneale broken prison brother like long doe cast themselues without condition maiesties protection cannot vse well thing stand doe see great vse made feare shall troubled still morrow grace god againe going field neere vtterlie waste countrie tyrone preuaile garrison corne keepe horse winter done leaue garrison take effect well prouided aswell placed doe armie sir except thing fall much contrarie wee haue good reason expect presume queene keepe garrison strong well prouided winter shee may next spring send kingdome sir robert gardner good commonwealth men pleasure much euery man shall hold land lawes shee haue currant confident bee obeyed neither reducing prouince bee little regarded ill inhabited industrie part wasted assure earle tyrone time warres raise vpon vlster aboue fourescore thousand pound yeere fall excesse thinke might bee brought yeeld queene willingly much euer expected presently time dare promise winter thinke may withdraw garrison onely leauing wardes place bee much deceiued shall find men bee last ireland forsake queenes party presume winter doe queene good seruice spaniard come come cannot tell may build perceiue last letter likely bee many although may stoppe yet hope shall ouerthrow worke bee inuasion doe much deceiue selfe doe queene seruice countrie aduantage comming ouer michaelmas doe gentleman sir richard treuer perceiue settle himselfe part hee may doe maiestie good seruice vnfit land hee hath giuen lie waste bee much better bee ordered men worth qualitie sir beseech god prosper queenes affaire make v able doe seruice maiestie doth expect sir doe seruice mountioy next day twentieth august lord deputie tooke field incamped midde way betweene newrie armagh vnderstanding tyrone fled fermannagh thereupon conceiuing warre chiefely bee made way lordship resolued first spoile countrie tyrone banish inhabitant thence inioyning would become subiects liue southside blackwater tyrone returned hee finde nothing countrie queenes garrison preuent returne make warre conueniently vpon remnant rebel lordship resolued plant garrison agher cormocks chiefe house seated neere fermanagh neere monaghan whither sir henrie dockura might draw greatest part force whether one dayes march passage made force northerne garrison might drawne together nine twentieth day august lordship passed bridge charlemount ouer blackwater night encamped dungannon lordship made defensible leauing ward keepe place bee retreat men going vpon seruice preserue oates growing abouts horse winter lordship receiued following letter master secretarie good lord packet nineteenth nine twentieth luly yesterday deliuered withall priuate letter maiestie dated tenth august well allowed hereafter particularly shall aduertised rather aduertise receit left extraordinary matter write vnto contained last dispatch hence whereof writing owne know could aduertise receit one great cause writing priuate letter see much doth distract minde thinke spaine behind north fearing bee diuerted conclusion labour may perceiue estate preparation spaine certainely aduertised one owne newly arriued port lisbone tooke shipping one twentieth iuly last stilo veteri two great ship one thousand tun one called saint andrew shall viceadmirall name forgotten besides twelue shippes two hundred tunnes downewards resolued send fifteene hundred men haue relieued siege beere hauen newes taking whereof first knowne tenth iuly written watersord lisbone fifteene hundred men eight hundred came groyne part transsported ireland groyne remaineth odonnell onely great saint phillip ten small barkes mightny importuned sent north sent beere hauen mounster hoping vpon arriuall one thousand fifteene hundred men haue raised siege possessed part made beginning plantation hereof great benefit must needes haue growne rebel small number haue landed mounster bruite rest follow alwaies multiplied would haue made distraction vlster prosecution petty descent vlster would haue raised new hope northerne rebel truly lord considered great benefit king spaine consume queene charge ireland bestowing onely yeere forlorne company besides hee thereby keepeth vp kind reputation europe following first designe sending though added spreadeth great number filleth world continuall rumour vndertaking humour cannot secured wil stil feede fier fewel although know vanitie beleeue fond report mightie preparation army way able imbrace lordship may bee assured whatsoeuer heare gathering number land place haue onely defence attempt ignorantly suspect queene lowcountries continue obedience within kingdom south part more haue bin apt take armes gallies wherof haue heard many brought holy intended enterprise vpon larache bruite haue come ireland idle true sir ki leuison defeated gallies come far norward lisbone vnder conduct spinola vndertook bring lowcountries sluse eight two sunk third spoiled neuer able togo sea likewise torne slaues mangled wee look heare quarter summer assure though carick proue nothing much expected hauing much pillaged many good taken wet yet hath sir richard lonison seruice deserued extraordinary repetation thus haue deliuered rather priuate affection priuate opinion great army intended meane contest contrarie opinion continually multiplied thence great army king spaine amasseth hinder preparation may come hence whereby kingdome may receiue comfort first know bruite leuies must needes giue helpe proceeding next know folly case concerne kingdome disswade manner supply whereof lacke may proue perillous especially state exhausted warre ireland onely easie worke diuert action charge especially whensoeuer may thinke secure opinion maintaining ground incline whose place principally belongeth giue best iudgement forraigne intelligence onely therefore conclude sorry finde soueraignes heart great magnanimous though must confesse hath iust cause contented haue made vertue necessity pardon greatest rebell haue dissolued strength combination still vnited mindes dispaire multiple still alienation whereof potentan enemie king spaine euer make benefit opinion hee sure bee pardoned liue securitie qualitie greatnesse wearinesse miserie rest hee would bee made one best instrument kingdome haue gone farre sauing apt take occasion exchange thought letter praying almightie god blesse endeuours may enioy others company good maiesties ieruice commit god protection court hisham seuenth august lordship louing assured friend command ro cecyll lord deputie spent fiue dayes tullough oge oneales old custome created spoiled corne countrie tyrones owne corne brake downe chaire wherein oneales wont created stone planted open field sir henrie dockwra onely horse meete lord deputy vpon thirtieth august brought ocane late submittie hauing left english foote omy like sort part cane young donnells horse foote victualed owne charge ready attend seruice lord deputy command day lordship vnderstood sir arthur chichester comming towards killetro randoll mac sorley offered serue queene iourny fiue hundred foote fortie horse vpon owne charge whereupon lord deputie resolued march army dunnamore thence agher second day march vpon sixth september lordship receiued letter lord president mounster foure twentie spanish ship bruited arriued beerehauen newes though lp kept secret yet whole countrie presently ful al part receiued like alarum insomuch amongst irish constantly beleeued spanish ship arriued carlingford notwithstanding lordship left garison agher castle seated iland intrenched large piece ground greater force sir henrie dockwra draw thither vpon seruice castle lordship brought away two brasse piece tyrone brian mac art mac mahownd cormack mac barron fled bottome great fastnesse towards end lough erne lordship followed farre hee could possibly carry army yet came within twelue mile besides way thence orurkes country army could passe mac guyre lately left receiued queenes protection sir henrie foliott vpon condition put good pledge loialty giue oconnor roc mac guyre land belonging build vp castle eniskellin lately brake downe deliuering built owne charge queenes possession tyrone abouenamed confederaies poore rebel following aboue sixe hundred foote sixtie horse vpon seuenth september lordship vnderstood letter sir oliuer lambert called back prosecution orurke like newes spaniard arriuall day lordship sent backe sir henrie dockwra directed draw force much victual could put vp omy thence agher twelue mile distant faire way rendent make warre till haruest past alwaies ready follow lordship direction vpon landing spaniard likewise next day lordship sent backe sir arthur chichester directing lie mountioy garrison clearing country tyrone inhabitant spoile corne could preserue garrison desace al ilands formerly taken ready draw vpon rebel make head yet aduile bee likewise readie answere new direction spaniard arriue lordship marched backe army vpon ninth september diuided waste land southside blackwater towards newry betweene hen mac shane con mac shane son shane neale leaue liue creaghts follower come vnto till maiesties pleasure knowne inioyning sow corne next yeere vpon plaines thus lordship bringing backe pale fourteene company foote one hundred horse came newrie eleuenth september next day counsel letter lord england relation former seruices wrote followeth haue taken best pledge could become subiects al haue assisted v cowes carriage men owne presence forraigne force doe arriue make doubt bring rest termes shall bee fittest maiesties honour profit wee haue thought fit suffer natiues tyrone rest put ouer riuer bann follow henry gon mac shane perchance many wil quit though traitor returne grow strong cuents haue spoiled meane spoile corne respect garrison blackwater creaghts hurdly returne wil stil command proue false haue good bridle vpon time follower vpon leaue dwell tyrone easily forsake follower seeme desire nothing hold land queene without dependancy vpon oneales howsoeuer present wee thinke good hold thus together partly good seruice giue two young men liuely hood rest vtterly reiected might desperate course much prolong warte partly wee must confesse freely humane commiseration hauing eye daily seene lamentable estate countrie wherein wee found cuerie men dead famine much ohagan protested vnto v betweene tullogh oge toome lay vnburied thousand dead since first drawing yeere blackwater aboue three thousand starued tyrone sure poore people part neuer yet meanes know god acknowledge soueraigne neales make mee comm serate hope better hereafter wee haue conferred rest counsell dublin better informed state part againe presume write lordship meane time hasten thither finding subiects others fully possessed spaniard comming already arriued like opinion heare generally ouer al ireland vpon ground know haue heard substantiall intelligence excepting bruite aduertised lord president generall bruite brought hither shipping huge preparation spaine whether desire feare make report beleeued strange see generally strongly apprehended wee must renew former motion lordship spaniard doe land wee may speedily bee supplied munition artillery thing else wee haue written lordship wisdomes shall finde needfull v best iudge fit action great consequence shall necessarily enforced wheresoeuer happen arriue draw force kingdome together make head meanes northerne part especially left bare haue readily best argument sincere meaning submitted themselues maiesties mercy intent liue dutifully becommeth subiects left againe tyranny archrebell want defence beseech lordship consider whether profitable maiestie though present somewhat chargeable inable v make warre vpon spaniard yet go prosecution measure lacke conuenient force kept foote loose benefit trauell summer charge maiestie hath planting garrison kept would bridle country neither haue benefit spaniard landing spaniard vse victual country commanded garrison would keepe stirring ioyne others feare loosing owne home true putting new men hither shall haue drawne old spanish army worke necessitie cannot expected seruice new men worke effect old band would yet may hoped effect bee sufficient keepe irish ioyning spaniard seeing part shall liue garrison shall neede bee drawne field vnlesse onely short iourney last aboue two three day time maiestie pleased like motion seeme vnwilling disfurnish selfe many men armes humbly leaue lordship consider whether would bee fit purpose entertaine two three thousand scot thinke might readily sent ouer loughfoyle carickfergus inland scot irish scot good securitie serue maiestie faithfully would likelihood better endure winter hardnesse happily sound fitter seruice new men come vsually england yet moue remembrance perceiued last yeere matter thought vpon spaniard come doubt giue lordship good account thing maiesties liking yet must desire speedie sending ouer victual contracted haue come iuly august last part yet landed heare without victual garrison vnfurnished depend wholy thereupon moue lordship cause sent ouer great proportion salt bread preybeeues gotten rebel good number protectees haue caused furnish v mony haue vsed great kind sparing victual store excepting hath receiued succour onely letter pale tyrone hath many way made importunate meanes receiued mercy still reiect published maiesty commanded hearken vnto yet still continued vrge become suter queene true haue euer loth negotiate otherwise sword find dangerous selfe considering queenes resolution vpon receit lord president letter new spanish inuasion aduentured thus sarre entertaine motion would sweare submit himselfe absolutely maiesties mercy please receiue whatsoeuer succour receiue meane time would onely vndertake become humble sutor vnto maiestie notwithstanding till knew pleasure would desist prosecution day sent one agreeing much propounding certaine article desired bee granted whereupon misliking wise capitulate commanded messenger presently depart forbad send cut hope party haue directed garrison anew proclame head like done creaghtes become subiects meane time n n owne head general authorie giuen al commander parley rebel hath spoken tyrone effect owne letter euen receiued spoile vpon enemy haue commanded meddle tyrone thinke fit would imploy one better instructed purpose true sir many respect haue fearefull deliuer freely opinion course thinke fit taken tyrone shall please maiestie trust authoritie hearken vnto would neuer vse bee sure giue good account proceeding therein lower brought queenes honour shew mercie thought might bee made excellent instrument spaine continue purpose kingdome queene bee resolued neuer receiue necessary vlster presently made prouinciall gouernement people seeme thirst iustice meanes dependancy vpon oneales soone extinguished queene loth augment charge thinke much better institution connaght discontinued like officer transferred hither true ireland good generall seruice place fit deputy resident athlone connaght would little neede gouernour haue little time much therefore cannot write thing largely would purpose doe come dublyn onely pray sir resolue next haue worst intelligence instrument prince christendome doth imploy waighty businesse doe know doe thinke fit imploied spaine traitor yet though know selfe honest may proue knaues queene confident faith shee pleased make best interpretation shall doe therein able doe perchance good seruice giue selfe greater light thing haue shee mislike onely say sword though darke letter reasonable booke deliuer conceipts mine thinke necessary let know kingdome wherefore dispaire doe till may haue happinesse see certainety feare spaine past would make great diminution lyst wherefore pray sir haue england assurance thereof let know soone looke euery hower say pale held sure already come shew inclosed letter pray put finger latter part blot yet thought queene would bee angry would giue lady leaue come brother loth make warre weomen especially since shee great child twelfth day september lordship wrote newry sir oliuer lambert gouernour connaght following letter sir yesterday comming towne messenger deliuered mee letter containing relation proceeding since going abby boyle returne thence perceiue haue knocking side rebel many note haue good cause bee glad sped wel parted good reputation side little losse withall doubt proceeded chiefely good command managing businesse may omit yeeld many thankes neither sparing testifie much may redound due well deserued commendation yet must withall note somewhat grieues obserue great alteration late seemed desirous least vnwilling receiue maiesties mercy haue reason bee doubtfull sudden change proceedeth altogether certaine expectation spanish succour opinion haue conceiued purpose haue dispossesse principall men land liuings get maiesties hand indictment office found thereof entertaine conceit assuredly put vp hazard vttermost mean shun reclamed must acknowledge rather doubt tybot ne long hath grieuously complained committall cosen dauye bourke hard vsage towards himselfe seemes fearefull come therefore desire license go england haue sent purpose giue contentment much may bee yet come mee meane schoole hope hold good termes time especially doth behoue v bring great worke better conclusion make question connor sligo rest doe somewhat iuggle play hand serue owne turnes therefore truly deserue lesse fauour doe part yet winke since behoneth v greatly draw warre end ease maiestie exceeding charge consumption men armes maiestie state england growne verie wearie indeed vnwilling continue much longer wee imployed chiefe instrument effect earnestly desired must beare country good owne nature well endure therefore let mee aduise much earnestnesse apply selfe vnto onely sole meanes make doings acceptable england must censured next let know certainly pray whether haue done thing already intituling maiesty land prouince whether haue way attempted giuen cause suspect shall well satisfied answere presuming doe sincerely yet thing pray proceed labour meanes winne know maiesties pleasure multitude subiects glory prince euery way fittest reclaime rather destroy good meanes might wrought connor slige know restrained liberty rebel thinke vpon letter sent vnto hee hath iust pretence standing long action shall enter neither shall able disproue allegation though perhaps himselfe innocent neither beginning must therefore content thinke doth compulsion though indeed doe thinke reason apparant selfe stone worke galloway bulworkes feare proue chargable long yet doe recommend good husbandry discretion may best iudge fittest tyrone yet gone ouer earne lie betweene ruske haue planted garrison another agher hard clogher lie fitly doe seruice vpon former garrison neere blackewater mountioy monaghan may fitly draw vpon occasion haue lefe order sir arthur chichester hath chiefe care latter omy twelue mile sir henry dockwra hath promised put vp force loughfoyle lie himselfe eniskillin sir henry follyot hath direction draw whole force leauing ward onely ballishannon beleeke already done hee hath boates yet great hinderance vnto therefore pray send speed possible gone already touching motion master atturney returne dublyn cause moued table rest yeeld thing fit meane time may vse chiefe iustice business hath allowance diet great experience continuance prouinee thereby hee may best know euery man disposition pray let heare stom againe much speed touching state prouince vnder gouernement hoping late bruites shall yeere troubled spaniard number shall small master secretary hath confidently written england commend right heartily newry twelfth september lord deputy arriued dublyn summer seruice ended since composing irish trouble henceforward bee wrought afterwards get vpon information lordship haue onely called victualer account great abuse committed haue perused former order taken time yeers contracted appoint commissary keeping issuing victual whose default minister seeme lewd part plaied therefore lordship satisfaction first point answer tolles cockain suffice doe absolutely affirme sent victual thither contract tied send though send often bee transported lordship may know expect assurance wee haue required lordship diuers letter appoint certaine discreet person port bee landed vnladen see visit victual take knowledge quantity kind goodnes good vsage likely continue space fiue moneths landing thereof direction duly obserued performed lordship needed certificat satsfie respect wee haue vsually receiued master newcomen surueyor victual exact certificats quantity victual arriue also goodnesse vpon contract sent vntill contract full victual sent thither satisfie ouerplus reserued next contract vndertakers absolutely denie sending victual thither serue souldier performe contract victual accompted maiesties prouision therefore farre easier lordship haue like certificat thus wee haue remembred vnto direction haue giuen vnto lordship wee haue thought good acquaint rest course hold shal vnderstand manner vpon euery contract make giue victualer imprest hand prouide victual contract whole summe haue agreement neuer receiue vntill doe produce true certificate officer port full proportion tied contract prouide laden shipboard ready transported good wel conditioned victual according contract therefore lordship bee strict call certificate vnlading doe cause inuoy perused abuse case considering victual sent thither commeth magnzines much soeuer vse souldier point lordship doth complaine minister doe sell victual peremptory vntrue respectlesse answeres vnto desire victualer information generall lordship onely informed particular abuse committed officer commissary take seuere course see exemplarily punished haue giuen licence selling victual lordship hath beene acquainted contract made victualer august two yeeres word possible great masse prouisions care may vsed reason transporting tossing fro perish decay case lordship pleased foresaid commissary deputed merchant shall permitted vtter sell poore market townes reside neere vnto victual decaiable vnfit vttered souldier instruction giuen commissary clause whereby restrained shall fall wast prouisions either leake moisture casualty accident transportation land sea vnfit inconuenient roomes place house victual acquaint chiefe commander colonell counsell therewith procure sufficient testimony manifesting truth quantity decaied surprized ambush enemy fier ineuitable danger become vnfit vsed may appeare happened negligence default certified maiesty case beare losse wast thereof therefore maruell lordship would indure insolent answere made inferiour officer knowing wee alwaies doe send lordship coppies agreement article wee make victualer article consideration onely leade v long keeping often remouing casualty victual shall fit souldier lordship prouinciall gouernour shall appoint acquainted therewithall thought fit doe otherwise may sold poore next market losse light maiesty neuerthelesse case wee referre lordship iudgement discretion maiesty doth trust great gouernement order shall see cause conclude therefore caution wee tooke good souldier euill victual bee thrust vpon shall abused peruerted supply need rebel souldier worse serued thinke matter worthy strict examination seuere punishment may inflicted vpon offender high degree earnestly require may done like case lordship consider maiesties counsell absent thence doe proceed generally matter reason doth direct v receiue light counsell lordship doth know state kingdome see particular course disposition thing fit fit may easily reforme inconueniences abuse happen committed informe v particular within knowledge matter may carried perfect order rule good souldier whose wellfare onely intended sought herein maiesties excessiue charge great trouble another great abuse though pertaining matter yet reason late haue discouered common haue thought good informe lordship therof earnestly pray rest counsell giue strict order may auoided matter wee find diuers examination taken common practice seruingman countreyfellow labouringman happen maimed grieuously hurt mischance disorder country neere seaside port shipping doth goe ireland hee find passage follow army company doe seruices able hath gotten knowledge countrey captaines chiefe officer procureth pasport captaine else getteth name inserted generall pasport man reason hurt receiued vnfit seruice vpon comming ouer hither againe hee recommended countrey pension meanes country burthened kind men poore souldier indeed maimed warres disapointed hindered pension ought haue reformed two meanes first order taken maimed men haue receiued hurt seruice sent away generall passe statute doth require particular certificat generall certifying hurt maimes souldier hath receiued next remedy pasports giuen subscription lordship prouinciall gouernours chiefe colonel vnder doth serue expressing hurt maimes souldier hath receiued seruice vnder captaine office place held company generall direction obserued auoid number counterfet souldiers giue due way reliefe maimed souldier indeed without particular certificat ought statute releeued want thereof hath beene great hinderance many poore men therefore nothing doubting lordship take order herein accordingly bid lordship heartily farewell court oatelands august eighth october lord deputy wrote lord president mounster howsoeuer reason carmacke escape could present spare horse foote aboue mounster lyst vnder command sir samuel bagnoll yet hee would faile send fiftie horse presently connaght whether hee purposed shortly take iourney busie preparation lordship prayed send good proportion victual store limricke water athlone without force could kept together prouince accordingly lordship gaue order boat sent athlone limrick fetch wheras lordship written sheriffes mounster leauy certaine beeues army prayed lord president giue assistance taking vp sending connaght conuenient speede fifteenth october lord deputy aduertised lord president carmock mac dermott lately escaped made sute reconciled state vpon answer would iustifie himselfe innocent haue iust triall would confesse fault would suter l deputie pardon hee said carmock made choise sue pardon rather stand triall meane time castle country possessed maiesty follower disposed vnder lord vpon good assurance beside faction nourished among neerest kinsman thing made vnable doe hurt lordship occasion imploy connaght force mounster aboue list prouince lordship might dispose pleasure lord president aduertised vnderstood one iames blacke lately come spaine donnell dead newes certaine twentieth october lord deputy dispatched captaine blany dublin commission gouerne garrison ruske monaghan recalling sir christopher laurence captaine esmond command repaire lublin lp might heare compose difference risen betweene order leaue captaine atherton gouerne fort mount particularly matter yet hath pleased command v let know master treasurer although shal neuer need excuse integrity neuer doubted yet free minister ouersights haue encreased burthen exchange though one euer thinke maiesty euer intended merchant haue suffered sell merchandize cost one turne vpon exchange captaines officer would make ouer foure time money one bill whole entertainement come yeere person misliking vnreasonable billes haue looked suspence paiment made may speak scandalously either past future already deliuered deputie master treasurer ten twelue thousand pound shall follow towards discharge come followes doth require expedition lp shall vnderstand greatnes maiesties army cannot beare vp without extreme preiudice state kingdome hath commanded v hereby let know shee satisfied abatement doth command possible expedition reduce army foot horse matter findeth good wisdome onely necessitie expence iudgement shall sufficiently able prouide defence forraigne power charge shee spanish army kingdom haue also thought good let lordship know great confusion breedes maiesties expence counsell lordship hath beene wholly conuersant millitarie cause haue called answere according desert haue punished commissary victual haue made priuate gaine selues sale victual committed charge without warrant v direction purueors superiours whereof haue receiued aduertisement mislike especially counsell haue neuer called vpon strictly charged commissary bring account much remaineth yet vnaccounted thing wee know whole charge victual wee haue carefully sent ouer whereof wee haue receiued certificate safe arriuall space almost two yeeres masse reckoned lordship shall find little lesse value one hundred threescore thousand pound whereof lordship may thus conclude either summes defalked great remaine treasurer hand else remaine specie great commissary maiestie might haue spared prouisions lately sent ouer treasure hath mightily exhausted else wasts must bee onely bee reiected account author thereof seuerely bee punished matter wherein wee write earnestly lordship wee would haue exception taken wee assure selues deserue heare great part waste shall bee excused accordingly liking well amongst othings intend cut dependancy vpon irish lord one necessarie consideration lastly lp counsell may know although looked hand prince vnnecessarily keepe company pay reliefe captaine yet maiesty owne disposition intendeth nothing lesse neglect seruitors shall testifie haue deserued extraordinarily like suffer penury cashering shee hath willed v let know shee pleased continue euery captaine many officer thinke necessary ordinary pay whereby may bee enabled maintaine themselues many good purpose vntill occasion offer itselfe imploy elsewhere company fall within gift conferre vpon done entertainement may cease perceiue maiesties resolution whereof shee hath much hastened sending away vnto respect wee cannot particularly touch thing would wee must conclude howsoeuer maiesties pleasure errours subordinate minister matter accompts reckoning thus mentioned lordship counsell onely make appeare serious reformation expected though shee seeth fearefull lordship without particular commandement number diminish haue made large abatement shee commandeth knowing soone might haue cause vse seruice yet maiesty farre imputiug errour iudgement lacke zeale seruice shee confesseth shee hath beene blame commanding whose care toile perill haue beene gouernour hath vndergone may lordship take comfort also successe hath pleased god giue doth make selfe acceptable minister prince countrey maketh v glad publike wee owe first duty owne priuate shall euer find thing fit v performe towards court whitehall nouember lyst army stood first ianuarie deputie following letter right hon good lord argument letter shall onely testification priuat duty little discourse touching neale garue irish must freely confesse seeke sort gouerne vse benefit dunagall helpe gaue men greatest want donnell besieged losse brother seruice trial fidelity standing firme dangerous time lastly good forsook owne serue queene half pay argument neither vntruly gathered vniustly alleaged make much fauour otherside extreame pride ambition infatiable couetousness want knowledge well delt importunitie thing right wrong continuall begging vnprofitable wasting whatsoeuer hee get aptnesse desperate vnspeakeable discontent trifle worth facillitie bee misliked men best qualitie vnderhand iugling apparant many index rebel hee truly bee charged good seruices acknowledged yet discountenance challenge fault raise new warre driue whole country vnseasonable time obdurate alienation mind english gouernement discharge people shall finde singular want spiall many thing giue v light wee likewise gathering prey whensoeuer wee goe iourney besides armes haue got amongst v charge haue put maiestie vnto one would hardly recouered hand vnworthily thought bee ill peece seruice make vtterly lost againe side giue continuall aduertisements aswell v rebel v fort place strength alone themselues neither dare abide without helpe make peace donnel shal uer finde difficulty ioyne spaniard come neere part may vndoubtedly bee neuer little discontented inconueniences one side necessitie see iudgement better course bee held temporize somewhat feede humour though bee chargeable queene mingle lenity seueritie bee punished notorious abuse apparantly proued let rage storme wil others winked whose fault apparant yet closely carried direct manifest proofes testimony witness therwithall get faire meanes force see best occasion temper best pledge hath himselfe best people hand possessed keep till see greater cause assurance fidelitie least lesse occasion suspition course alreadie entred vnder good colour hauing taken second sonne elder dublin together two chiefest men owne consent name pledge others truth himselfe ignorant grieuously complaine course many owne nation whet forward want knowledge truth blinded priuate malice owne person whatsoeuer shall happen amisse vpon cause discontentment imputed corruption dealing flie honour succour gladly submit selfe better course may instructed state businesse betweene without partiallitie malice vpon dutie alleageance perill soule together letter sir henry dockwra sent lordship copy following letter lately written lord england honourable lord iourny mentioned former letter intended vpon ocane set forward captain vaughan departed riuer hauing first shipped necessary prouisions planting garrison colrane seene downe lough faire wind carry thither set forth hauing passed countrie effected manner thing owne desire come vnto place found ship apparance newes become master excuseth leaue lordship iudge whether sufficiently bearer instructed full state cause summe effect iourney notwithstanding sent downe captaine orme two hundred english irish enishlowen passe ouer greene castle water end entring one end countrie prey might assuredly take least spoile done selfe went ouerland passed two pace without resistance entred third beate defence set fire camp containing great house full corne tooke ocanes brother prisoner perfidiously reuolted queenes seruice sacrificed place passed wood ordinarily passage faire way lie sea side hard came plaines heart countrie burning spoiling till met night captaine orme place strength agreed vpon betweene v comming way least looked lighted vpon killing people small prey fifty cowes fiue hundred sheepe rest sudden comming made away got mountaines foure day space together afterwards deuided force three body trauersed first country spoiling burning quantity corne number house hardly haue beleeued small circuit ground could haue afforded seene failed meeting ship held course towards tyrone intending vnder one iourney haue wasted spoiled high dungannon preuented sudden thaw weather long frost snow raised riuers much difficulty could recouer home returned met letter dunagal aduertising great want victuall reason ship moneth dispatched away prouisions arriued whereupon hauing diuers reason also draw way resolued make next iourney thither settle establish garrison ballyshannon one hundred gartons loade bisket munition passed vnto happily relieued greatest want seasonable time comming found ship galloway arriued within harbor calbeg time sent fro hence came also harbor extremity weather ancie witnes vnto neither able put either ballishannon dunnagall time twenty dayes fruit comming thither consisted onely caused neale garue make cutting vpon country cowes wherwith garrison plentifully releeued went ashrawe left foure company foot fifty horse carried thence besides dunagall setled got sufficient quantity corne feed horse neere winter long fet turffe old house fewell commodity garrous carried saw scituation bundroise dulike part countrey returned dunagall tooke mac swine fannaght others countrey neale garue vndertaken deliuered pledge owne truth made choice bridle himselfe great assurance thinke howbeit state thing stood termes chiefely reason extreme foulenesse weather altogether vnwillingly drawne accept subiection vpon slender assurance time serued compell condition hardly haue delt withall giuen care vnto sort aduantage thinke selfe haue gained taking neale garues importunitie satisfied humour altogether restrained vndoubtedly proue desperate rebell himselfe settled full possession owne countrie keep furnished meanes feede people could rid would wring queen store besides bee alwaies complaining hee still halfe pay notwithstanding lesse hearkened vnto iust reasonable cullour banished priuate meanes owne maintaine clearely taken away opportunitie gained men plaied false returned home good thinking themselues safe sure vnder protection may vpon iustifiable reason hereafter bee looked seized least expect worst auoide whose good meanes would neuer bee got concealed done away amongst rebel shall neuer finde benefit settling garrison lordship may easily gather owne knowledge bearer able adde somewhat hauing liued good space time thereabout going furnished many instruction remembrance purpose also lay downe vnto lordship state army commissarie necessary requisite place man specially chosen captaines kind businesse requested labour solicite behalfe castle ballishannon could take reason piece artillery come manner prouision much boarde bee purpose thing sent away windes seruing fitly bring thither businesse bee easily effected lordship must vnderstand barre comming shallow whatsoeuer vaine men talke contrary rode open without couered manner land meere necessitie ship shall imploied bringing thing must bee small burthen get yet weather arrise forced whether great small make place vnlading dunagall whence must bee carried place land charge trouble thereof much expected could euer rightly informed till saw haue assembled force make another iourney tyrone vnfit season weather yet hold shall forced suspend till alteration make riuers high way passable next meane god willing without question vndertake accomplish first intent settling colraine know selfe able performe though whole force rebel bee returned vndertake shall force bee farre extended diuided asunder bare keeping hold wee possessed shall able doe till new supply men arriue opinion come seasonably towards ending next moneth cowes corne gone onely reliefe easiest fet away spoiled impeachment wee shall haue spaniard though daily threatned many thundering rumour yet see great reason suspect comming hither shall respect relie selfe vpon lordship better intelligence honourable care according occasion shall offered onely must put lordship mind army able master v field comming rowrke countrey wherein army foure thousand english ready assist assurance maiesty incensed orowrkes contempt shee resolued neuer pardon promise countrey heires hee ioined force expell rowrke lordship assured barre rather furtherance hope hauing brother land hee would neuer take sir neale garue thing merly giuen promised hee could proue since submission hee committed treason wherein could honourable triall iustifie himselfe hee sure lordship would satisfie best expectation ninth ianuary lordship counsel letter lord england relation present affaire wrote followeth iourney deputy receiued maiesties expresse direction reducing highnesse force twelue thousand foot one thousand horse doe willingly obey performance thereof tooke present order fully put execution though vpon sudden monies realme realme england also necessary prouidence keeping sterling monies hand rebel also transportation forraigne country chiefly said rebel factor done erect exchange vse sort subiects others vsing entercourse realmes conuerting monies new standard realme sterling monies england english monies realme reciprocally hoping honest vpright carriage merchant equal exercise trafficke two realmes would haue caused said exchange indifferent mutuall commodity merchant trade v payment intention haue concurred preseruing sterling monies rebel transportation forraigne country little time experience haue made thereof yet two yeeres past wee haue found expectation greatly deceiued scope giuen first institution exchange exceedingly abused slight cunning merchant though wee immediatly vpon beginning exchange discouer breeding yet wee thinke would euer haue growne hight since haue perceiued wherefore restriction limitation seeke containe fraud within reasonable bound falleth remedy proposed haue beene farre easing griefe whatsoeuer hath beene v prescribed redresse hath serued ground pretext new inuentions deceipt cunning craft merchant scope giuen proclamation said exchange abused merchant hath brought commodity kingdome hence hath beene content sell reasonable gaine hauing raised price commodity much new monies doe true value siluer almost counteruaile sterling paid viz cost ten shilling sterling thirty shilling irish rate cost pound pound hath returned exchange pound answered sterling yeeldeth profit three one great gaine aduenture merchant part trafficke doth yeeld v burthen permitted nothing else effect make exchequer mart cunning merchant worke vpon besides many haue purpose make profit said exchange bought vp old bils debt diuers person payment hath vpon iust consideration beene deferred compounding small summes money new standard returned whole vpon v exchange whereby haue made exceeding profit conrrary true meaning proclamation intended vse benefit exercised honest direct course merchandize fraudes euer great quanrity monies new standard returned vpon v sterling monies realme neither proportionable quantity sterling monies brought exchange sterling monies rebel transportation forraigne country little brought merchant countrey currant vsed amongst good subiects find partly transported partly falling hand rebel wherewith haue beene better enabled continue wicked course wherefore redresse great abuse daily practised merchant doe hereby publish meaning day publishing hereof place exchanging monies shall onely dublyn realme ireland london realme england vse trade merchandize others pay haue wage v army otherwise shall bancke maintained corke heretofore receiue bils bils receiued shall paiable onely london fot vse passenger souldiers departing realme england shall likewise exchange bristoll chester souldier passenger doe bring thither bill containing aboue sum offoure pound merchant shall said place chester bristoll payment bils returned onely city london manner hereafter expressed pleasure meaning said exchange shall extend onely hereafter time time shall pay seruing v field ward garrison officer gouernement iustice reuenewes exchange others contained establishment euery pleased allow benefit exchanging monies new standard realme monies currant england wanting onely twelue penny sterling pound viz yeerely rateably degree much doth saue aboue expence hee doth receiue yeerely v ought receiue cleerely pay deduction defalcation foreprized fraud vsed abusing liberality fauonr conttary true meaning others gold threescore pound mixt monies new standard realme shall receiue said master exchange deputy bill directed bancke exchange england playable whereby hee shall receiue hundred pound deliuered manner onely doubt propounded according desire send much speed businesse importance reduced new deliberation could dispatched liberty maiesty giue either proceeding respite suspence publish proclamation according iudgement shall make vpon consideration dangerous effect shall find apparant likely ensue haue rightly acknowledged maiesties gracious respect vnto chiefest minister state shee reposeth speciall confidence care wisdome opportunity haue present contemplation thing neere hand vnder eye discerne discouer inconueniencies apply medicine accordingly therefore although pleased take resolution together v counsell set downe said proclamation hoping would meanes cure preuent intollerable fraud enormity practice exchange intended instituted ease excessiue charge good subiects yet much haue shewed great distrust feare dangerous consequence forthwith haue proceeded publishing proclamation vpon aduised consultation maiesty assureth selfe haue propounded point doubtfulnesse accompanied letter shee well pleased giue credit opinion shee hath vpon new deliberation v counsell caused temper moderation set downe chiefe point whereof doubted may appeare vnto forme proclamation differing former sent vnto wherein may readily obserue particular alteration former proclamation comparing together wee need make rehearsall satisfaction doubt onely haue thought good say somewhat concerning sixth seuenth article abstract make question course best bee holden discouery fraudes vsed merchant others exchange meanes vsed maiesty ouerburthened exchange vpon question owne opinion thereof deliuered wee cannot omit make two obseruations one selues doe acknowledge intollerable fraud merchant others vsed exchange whereby onely maiesties gracious intention meaning exchange hath beene extraordinarily abused subiects realme excessiue rate sale commodity haue beene vnconscionably ouercharged therefore selues cannot denie dangerous exchange vpholden without remedy fraud second asmuch cannot bee certaine rule order prescribed auoid fraud shall free euasion cunning deceitfull person onely remedy doth consist carefull diligent ouersight maiesties minister trust committed maiesty thinketh selues truely find fault abuse none better prouide remedy present especially treasurer whose minister errours maiesty hath beene much preiudiced whereas especiall cause fraud imputed multiplicity bils exchange wee willingly mind reduce vnto one place dublyn wee find treasurer vary opinion hauing signified heretofore particular letter v possible way remedy reducing banckes one place yet letter iointly rest counsell deliuering opinion establishing two place vnto opinion conceiue wonne vpon consultation counsell haue applied consent therevnto end may plainely appeare vnto merchant others abusing exchange doe fraudulently serue turne vpon maiesties subiects bee true hath beene informed v person good credit comming thence improue commodity treble price respect coyne likewise vpon maiesties excessiue losse returne money vpon exchange wee haue thought good send estimate calculation gaine one may make supposed doth make course vpon expence one hundred pound vttered commodity making raising therevpon two one whereby may iudge vnreasonable aduantage may made vpon profit three foure one merchant ill disposed find meanes corrupt minister vnder treasurer combine wee bid right heartily well fare court whitehall december computation sent ouer inclosed former letter gaine merchant may make exchange bringing exchange one hundred pound forty pound sterling supposing merchant without sterling money store without credit vse exchange directly conuert one hundred pound sterling ware sell ireland rate two one viz two hundred pound irish doth thereby gaineas followeth haue benefit exchange must haue fourscore pound sterling supposing buieth fiue shilling irish twenty shilling sterling fourescore pound sterling doth cost one hundred pound irish commeth exchange one hundred pound irish fourscore pound sterling minister giueth bill receiue england one hundred seuenty fiue pound sterling hee must loose fiue pound exchange one hundred irish hath purse england one hundred seuenty fiue pound defalking first stocke one hundred pound resteth cleere seuenty fiue pound may doe vpon many returnes maketh yeere obiected cannot buy sterling money low rate fiue twenty shilling irish doe pay thirty shilling irish twenty shilling sterling gaine lesse nineteene pound yet shall gaine sixe fifty pound supposing merchant necessity sterling money irish borrow friend though pay twenty pound hundred gaine manner hundred pound sterling conuerted ware sold ireland two hundred pound irish bringeth exchange one hundred twenty pound irish fourescore pound sterling borrowed receiueth bill paid england one hundred fourescore foureteene pound loosing sixe pound returne one hundred twenty pound irish hath purse england one hundred fourescore foureteene pound deducting one hundred pound first stocke resteth fourescore foureteene pound gaine allowing fourescore pound pay much borrowed yet resteth foureteene pound hee hath remaining hand ireland fourescore pound irish remaining two hundred irish whereof brought onely one hundred twenty pound exchange haue fourescore pound returned exchange hee must borrow two thirty pound sterling shall hee haue bill paied england one hundred eight pound looseth foure pound exchange fourescore pound irish one hundred eight pound abating two thirty pound borrowed resteth gained seuenty sixe pound whereunto adding foureteene pound aboue mentioned whole gaine fourescore ten pound whence take interest one hundred twelue pound borrowed three moneths twenty hundred yeere three moneths sixe pound twelue shilling cleere gaine towards freight custome forbearing money charge fourescore foure pound eight shilling end ianuary lord deputy returned connaght dublyn way receiued letter rowry donnell vndertaken february signifying rorkes strength much increased repaire many chiefe rebel countrey present nether able attempt rorke defend himselfe attempt till english force draw vp assist hastning whereof prayed might haue leaue put vp creaghtes time towards ballishannon better safetie fiue twentieth february lord deputie wrote following letter lord england sent hand lord president mounster time going better preuaile submitties haue laied aside owne defence betaken themselues protection iustice state many haue tasted much sweet intertainements rather desire warre continue quiet haruest might arise honest labour doe find none pernitious instrument new warre meane time tyrone shall liue blow euery sparke discontent new hope shal lie hid corner kingdome hee shall vtterly extinguished make many blases sometimes set fier consume next subiects vnto perswaded combination already broken apparant meanes subsist power ouerthrowne long may liue woodkerne new accident may fall doth liue know ifit kingdome dangerous inuasion mighty forraigne prince strong party countrey difficulty roote scattered troopes many vnaccessible den lurke nature extreame strength perill attempted vnpossible people naturally art make greater vse though infinite danger doe beat one yet possibility v follow agility flie another sure neuer traitor knew better keepe owne head subiects haue dreadfull awe lay violent hand sacred prince people haue touch person neales hath pestilent iudgement euer nourish spread owne infection hath ancient swelling desire liberty conquered nation worke vpon feare rooted haue old fault punished vpon particular discontent generally ouer kingdome feare persecution religion debasing coyne grieuous vnto sort dearth famine already begunne must necessity grow shortly extremity least alone haue beene many time sufficient motiues driue best quiet estate sudden confusion keepe spirit setling breed new combination feare euen stirre town themselues solicite forraigne aid promise cast themselues protection although true pleased maiesty haue longer continued army greater strength better haue prouided cloudes doe threaten sooner easily either haue made countrey rased table wherein shee might haue written owne lawes haue tied ill disposed rebellious hand till surely planted gouernement would haue ouergrowne killed weed haue risen vnder yet since necessity state doth vrge diminution great expence dispaire goe great worke difficulty interrupted forraigne force although perchance wee may encountered new eruption often aduenturing diasters may lordship shall sometimes heare spoiles done vpon subiects impossible preserue place farre greater force euer yet kept kingdome although hath beene seldome heard army hath beene carried continuall action enduring without intermission winter breathing difficulty time keepe force place must make warre especially horse almost beyond hope preuent yet fauour god maiesties fortune doe determine selfe draw field soone haue receiued maiesties commandements commissioner hath pleased fond ouer meane time hope owne presence direction set euery party worke doth adioyne may bee drawne force doth remaine rebellion iourney successe must bee hand god confidently promise omit nothing possible v bee done giue last blow vnto rebe lion paine anguish impatient present doth vse change remedie bee impossible v settle mindes people vnto peace reduce vnto order feele smart sensible grietes apparant feares haue remembred lordship without hope redresse securitie therefore presume vnworthy soeuer since concernes prouince maiestie hath giuen humblenesse lay graue iudgements thing thinke necessarie bee considered first whereas alteration coine taking away exchange measure first promised hath bred generall grieuance vnto men quality many incommodities sort beyond iudgement heare preuent confusion estate conunuance thereof least would please lordship put people certaine hope vpon ende warre new standard shall bee abolished eased meane time armie may bee fauourably delt exchange since last proclamation lordship sent ouer doe conceiue case bee hard others haue allowed nothing indefinitely much shall meerely gaint intertainements proue nothing greater part onely possibility make liue vpon intertainement bee allow exchange greatest part thereof since doe onely pay excessiue price thing hardly get thing money although wee haue presumed alter shew though effect proclamation point retaining power selues proportion allowance exchange yet minde conforme proceeding therein according lordship next direction therefore doe humbly desire know pleasure therein opinion last proiect pleased lordship send v doe humbly leaue generall letter onely selfe made ouerture counsell sent directed onely selfe found generally concurre would proue dangerous first thinke fit otherwise declare lordship pleasure therein whereas pleased lordship last letter command v deale moderately great matter religion receit lordship letter presumed aduise delt time hold restrained hand therein thinking ourselues course take reuocation already done least incouragement others since feare course begun dublin would fal vpon rest apprehended ouer kingdom think lordship direction great purpose course might haue ouerthrowne meanes owne end reformation religion thinke great precisenesse bee vsed reforming selues abuse owne clergie churchliuings discipline truth gospell great vehemency industrie bee set forward place ordinary meanes proper vnto selfe first set forth spread meekenesse thinke corporall prosecution punishment seuere shall bee found seditious instrument forraigne inward practises thinke fit principall magistrate bee chosen without taking oath obedience tollerated absenting themselues publike diuine seruice wee may bee aduised wee doe punish body good onely religion doe professe bee faithfull subiects maiestie contrarie proued since irish vtterly rooted much lesse likelihood countrey could thereby time planted english since farre inhabiting well part haue already likely inhabited may easily chosen reserued place seaside vpon great riuers may planted great purpose future absolute reducement countrey thinke would asmuch auaile speedy setling countrey thing would please maiesty deale liberally irish lord country great reputation among distribution land haue formerly possessed rather measure mittigate iust indignation doe religiously vow first motiues vnnaturall rebellion neither practise malice ambition induced first feare life conceiued sought enemy practise stand vpon gard vnhappily led make good fault hainous offence themselues doe acknowledge deserue forgiuenesse impossible respect greatnesse proportion euen life make satisfaction doe humbly desire maiesty pardon haue beene already sufficient argument royall power hauing little left life preserue selfe may please maiesty make example princely clemency chiefest ornament high dignity may better able hereafter vttermost seruice life redeeme foulenes fault doe humbly sue vnto maiesty shee vouchsafe restore former dignity liuing estate subiect doe religiously vow continue euer hereafter loyall true obedience dublyn cannot omit mention earle tyrone vpon first hearing lord deputy relation queenes death could containe himselfe shedding teares quantity could well concealed especially vpon whole face men eye cast himselfe content insinuate tender sorrow losse soueraigne mistresse caused passion euery dull vnderstanding might easily conceiue thereby heart might rather bee eased many continuall ielousies feares guilt offence could daily present greatest security pardon needed oedipus find true cause teares doubt humble submission made queene highly proudly offended much eclipsed vaine glory action might haue carried hold till death besides coming two raignes lost faire aduantage england estate present vnsetled haue subsisted longer rebellion end least ample occasion fastning great merit new king first free submitted mercy hee would haue pretended doe onely honourable affection new prince many would likelihood haue beleeued much especially present misery ruined estate fully knowne sixth aprill earle tyrone made new submission king forme done queene name onely changed also wrote following letter king spaine may please excellent maiesty hauing since first time euer receiued letter highnesse father maiesty written letter vnto performed vttermost power whatsoeuer promised insomuch expectation assistance since repaire donnell maiesty continued action vntill neerest kinsemen follower hauing forsaken inforced duty submit selfe lord soueraigne beginning instant moneth aprill whose seruice obedience continue life therefore growing old selfe would gladly see sonne setled life time haue thought good giuing maiesty thankes princely vsage sonne henry spaine humbly desire send vnto mee poucrtie whereunto driuen haue sundry letter irish language signified inconuenient herein make relation thereof humbly take leaue dublin c highnesse poore friend hugh tyrone together wrote another letter sonne henry hasten comming spaine ireland without effect lastly lord deputic renewed earle tyrone maiesties protection longer time till hee could sue pardon sent backe countrey settle keepe friend former confederate better order vpon change state sir henry dauers lately brought letter lord deputy lord england returned backe purpose repaire presently vnto king wherevpon lord deputy commended relation following instruction signed lordship hand wherein must note lordship omits newes queenes death receiued seruant gentleman aforesaid onely priuate inteliigence whereupon hee could safely build late proceeding lordship onely insists vpon letter state could onely giue warrant instrustions informe king maiesty comming ouer hither fifth hereof letter lord england signifying decease late scueraigne mistresse found mee heere dublin earle tyrone newly come vpon protection meanes rcalme present generally quiet expecting vpon conclusion euery one conceiued likely much put hand till time would neuer doe countrey would short time thorowly settled euery one thet found himselfe danger presse manner hourely pardon foreseeing staied longest sure made example iustice state could soonest make way assuring future loyaltie seruice hopefull lay hold vpon soueraignes mercy end may acquaint maiesty farre forth haue proceeded earle tyrone vpon warrant shall heereby thus remembred often made great meanes receiued mercy often denied prosecuting vttermost ability cuer confident opinion vntil brought low driuen countrey last summer left garrison vpon tooke creaghts spoiled rest good hee would bee made fit crauc mercy humble manner beseeming great offender december last galloway importuned many message letter trusted well vowed much sincerity hee might hearkened vnto time hee sent submission framed humble manner could reasonably require sent answer would recommed maiesty vntill direction would still prosecute get head could comfort gaue yet ceased continue sutor earnestnesse hee could deuise hoping end obtaine hee desired month march receiued letter maiesty sixteenth sauenteenth february whereby authorised giue word comming going safe pardon would come parsonally assigne receine yeeld condition last two letter contained withall specially required aboue thing driue issue presently maiesty conceiued contrariety success heere change accident part might turn much disaduantage still apt beleeue hee lay wait would spin thing requisite delayes shift abridge shortly earle renewing former suit great carnestnesse humble manner may appeare letter march sent tredagh whether drawne vpon speciall occasion seuice thought fit entertaine offer submission draw speedier conclusion important busines daily intelligence spaine threatned danger vnto kingdom receiued aduertisement counsell england maiesties dangerous sicknesse least accident might haue reuiued hope added new life vnto languishing partisan vtterly changed whole frame proceeding end signed protection three weekes seuerall warrant bordering garrison forbearance hostile act either vpon person person follower vpon good terme aforesaid appointing sir garret moore gentleman well deseruing state ancient acquaintance earle much respected repaire vnto giue knowledge simply plainely godolphin purposely sent part sufficient guard attend resolution bring safely vnto condition though first seeming somewhat hard tasting great humblenes vtterly free danger person whose head set sale publike act priuate men bound take knowledged present proceeding found easier acceptance almost man would haue imagined earle peremtorily commanding none vpon pretence soeuer presume disswade obaying find great commiseration present suffering charitable repaire threatned ruines house posterity poore distressed country tatted bitternes whole course former prosecution thus perswaded left direction setling country best might sudden guard horse vnder leading sir william godolphin making great march vntill came vnto within three mile tredagh fell downe knee great assembly confessing vnworthines romish religion lawes abolishing profession allowed secondly maintaining action force armed men thirdly attempt demolish king fort south gate city fourthly staying issue king munition victual seazing would condemne chiefe citizen corke tooke aboue mentioned oath alleageance maiesty abiuring dependancy vpon forraigne potentate corke lp wrote earle tyrone meete dublyn readidinesse beare company complaint would made people reason pouerty besought lordship giue credit till might repaire lordship satisfie protesting would ready time come vnto lordship doe duty faithfull subiect lord deputy customes heresy spread world trauellers let aske wee haue knowne diuers eleuation pole would haue taught v geography representing painted world vnto v wee haue learned art yea haue discouered new haue thus compared great manifest profit trauelling light doubtfull inconueniences obiected must confesse discourage affecters great reward smal danger vnlike sophisters perswade blindnesse deafenesse priuations sences bee numbred among euils see many vnpleasing thing often heare offendeth eares one good smell draw twenty ill sauors part let dispute neuer subtilely though conuince yet shall neuer perswade mee pull eye stop eares cut nose yet preferre sloth actiue life must giue eare parent friend well priuate publike commonwealthsmen vniustly seeme feare lest young men course peruerted true religion feare disswade passing forraigne part chiefe cause mischiefe surely vessell new taketh ill sauour sticke much faster thereunto haue already professed would haue traueller ripe yeeres hauing first laid good ground art especially religion let speake selfe beheld mimicall gesture cerimoniall shew holinesse roman priest vnder shaddow whereof abuse superstition layman vnspeakable art owne ambition couetousnesse contrary obserued corrupt manner farre seduced could refraine laughter wondered cicero speakes southsayers one priest laugh hee saw another fellow priest meete faire painted face neere narrowly behold lesse pleaseth beauty true danger least sonne swallow baite search corrupted ware narrowly stinke thy nose farther seeme odorifferous painting papist english reformed church therefore sends bookes heauy thing carriage halfe yeerely either owne country place way hee returne bee kept hee shall doe well send paper bookes therewith abundant caution lest thing note way place vnderstood shall make next iourny profitable discourse make language perfect hearing much increaseth knowledge canst thou learne least thou vnderstandest instruct thee howsoeuer thou beest hardly vnderstood except thou hast interpreter thee man small meanes cannot maintaine yet case doth rich onely borrow knowledge take second hand confesse rich men hauing consort making good vse may case attaine knowledge haue helpe men eye eares feete vnderstandings may sucke quintessence obseruations poore cleanthes day time drew water gaine liuing night earnestly thirst knowledge gaine rich men doe whose wit vse corrupted fortune would think euen rich men honourable safe able vse owne sences vnderstandings men since see prince ambassadours peeres realmes welcome esteemed lesse subiect contempt doe get formes saluting calling necessary language country would seeme stranger first learning language labour know grammer rule thereof thy selfe mayst know whether thou speakest right meane curious search rule least much may make thee able distinguish number case moodes merchant woman child neglecting rule rushing rash practice language doe many time pronounce tongue speake common speech gracefully others seldome write tongue well alwaies forget short time wanting practice contrary learne rule attentiue congruity speaking perhaps doe lesse gracefully pronounce tongue meane time speake
