lodging owne countreymen hardly attaine small skill neuer perfect vse forraigne language neuer easie selfe remember one reprehended hauing thirty yeeres italy hee could speake language merrily answere dutch ah lieber kan man doch dreissig iaher lehrnen ala good sir man learne thirty yeeres true cause speaking tongue perpetuall conuerling countreymen professe freely neuer obserued liue lesse together forraigne part english made profit trauell returne purpose desire learne language hath obserued former rule let hier skilfull man teach reproue errours passing least omission let take ill man laugh stirre vp endeuour learne tongue perfectly end must conuerse weomen child talkatiue people must cast clownish bashfulnesse man borne master art say himselfe rashly speake beginning shall easily take ill formes speaking hardly forget taken artificer speake latin rudely falsly speake experience schollers vniuersities conuersant reading creero howsoeuer seldome speake latin onely disputation yea shunne occasion speaking yet come abroad forced necessarily make vse latin tongue doe perhaps first speake lesse readily short practice speake eloquently easily said polakes abroad haue practised tongue young yeeres might speake readily neither cited quantity sillables purity phrase strict keeping grammer rule moreouer speake experience commendable home setting forth learne reading vnderstanding language writing thereof yet cannot bee profitable practice speaking tongue hee haue foresaid commodity part naturall cause prescribed pythagoricall silence listen others practice speech take care speake well much last learner must beginne hee neuer thing ill neuer doe well whereas many boast haue speake many tongue aswell mother tongue doe thinke know false french haue good prouerbe entre le auengles le borgnes sont le roys among blinde pore blind king thus haue skill tongue boldly say man doth perfectly without stamering speake many tongs howsoeuer stranger liuing six yeeres forraigne part may perhaps speake tongue perfectly yet trauelleth yeeres many kingdom learnes many language shall neuer speake many naturall pronuntiation without errours stamering slownesse speech yea learnes one tongue alone many yeeres practice shall hardly attaine perfect property elegancies thereof vnskilfull man would thinke theophrastus hauing liued many yeeres athens knowne bee stranger old woman selling herbes onely pronuntiation one sillable owne particular remember passed genoa milan foote disguised habit inne farre pauia met englishman wee satdowne supper voluntarily vnasked rashly professe himselfe dutchman whereupon saluted dutch familiarly till hee betraied manifestly ignorance language excused himselfe dutchman borne vpon confines france speake altogether french likewise spake french till countenance want skill language selfe man case dissembling country quality ceased trouble wee discoursing italian tong chanced speake word io mi repentiua whereas italian would haue said io mi ne pentiua little difference adding sillable ne knew englishman found frenchman nation together english addes sillable thus supper ended tooke aside spoke english whereat hee reioyced imbracing mee swore stable commanded man make ready horse would presently haue rid away discouered selfe wee lodged one chamber bed see small thing make manifest country men whereof speake language knowledge tongue hath euer highly esteemed aulus gellius writes mithridates spake language two twenty prouinces subiect neuer spake subiect interpreter themistocles one yeere got much knowledge persian tongue hee able speake artaxerxes without interpreter ennius said three heart meaning three language claudius emperour put grecian prince iudge could speake latine sent italy learne tongue suetonius writes conclude hath heard worthy fame heroicall woman elizabeth late queene england among whose rare vertues skill language least able conferre ambassadours prince owne tongue whereas king thinke base thing speake strange tongue take honour induce ambassadour speake tongue seeme like vnto poore proud speake much rich apparrell extoll stuffes furniture small price may seeme doe election iudgement doe onely want yet would vnderstood thought fit one ambassadour treaty consent haue written language another ambassadour rather written third tongue equally knowne italian tongue treaty betweene england france meane time thinke honourable mighty king able entertaine familiar speech ambassadour prince neighbour kingdomes though lesse potent owne let v incouraged noble foresaid example labour diligently may attaine rich iewell speaking tongue last place aduise traueller haue leasure ioyne greater ornament learning write hand nation knowledge tongue especially vse countrey englishman shall doe well first setting forth passe germany spend time since vse much helpe seruants scarcely make selues ready since wee vse despise company meane people bed board wee may learne serue selues hee come shoomakers shop must find shooes fit put himselfe may learne admit company meane men many time poore fellowes yea coachman shal thrust bedfellowes drunke like men often sit v table place part lowgermany drinke alwaies round wee shall sure pledge like men drinke cup wee haue seruant owne would rather haue sit next v wee may learne feed homely meat lie poore bed among many thing wee may learne moderate aptnesse quarrell whereof speake proper place conclude gene passe germany stranger free among honest people colinages deceipts part subiect aboue others especially vnexperienced good setting forth reconciled enemy may practice ill friend absence mind may religiously composed euents abroad let often write friend health precept thesius forgotten hee beene authour deere father death bearing false signe blacke sayle lesse good himselfe friend since writes often shall often receiue letter answere one hand washeth another poet saieth well vt ameris amabilis esto wilt beloued thou bist louing see indeed hardly giuen certain signe loue contempt thr frequent rare writing especially answering letter whereof italian haue prouerbe chiscriue chi non responde egli ematto egli ha di bisogno writes answer againe foole neede doth constraine wil obserue scituation city let may without ielousie inhabitant first climbe one highest steeple hauing taken generall scituation city shall better remember order particular thing seene city end let carry dyall may shew north south east west knowne shall lesse erre description city may obserue publikely onely eye auoiding ielousie retired inne may draw paper thinke good lest want guide shew markeable thing city omit thing worth sight let confidently visit chiefe doctor man principall account especially germany affable shall say hee come see liuing monument city bold promise giue guide shew thing worth sight instruct thing fit know weomen easily beleeue tell faire though indeed bee deformed men best quality easily beleeue name knowne among stranger take visitation honour done vnto yea many especially place vitiously proud neighbour see stranger thus visit many desire haue countreymen friend bee companion iourneys well said come saeundus via pro vehiculo pleasant consort way like coach glide away rather desire consort nation may learne language thing worthy obserued selfe could neuer see profitably spend time abroade flocked together owne countreymen neither doe attribute little proficiency german giuing themselues drinke euen amongst sober italian thing liuing together forraigne part italian conuersing abroad italian shall neuer learne bashfull chastity shall man cast vice proper nation doe disuse little little shall hardly doe among countreymen inclined thereunto neither danger learning forraigne vice leauing conuerse countrey men hee propound himselfe foresaid end learne vertues cast vice bend himselfe wholly attaine end moreouer place danger difference religion proclaimed warre whosoeuer hath countreyman friend companion doth much increase danger aswell confession companion chance apprehended accident since shall accomptable drawne danger aswell companion word deed owne surely happening many danger cross way many intemperate affection onely diminish comfort haue consort euen dog hurt stone bite next cast stone may perhaps cross grow bitternes word betweene themselues yea sometimes filthily end old friendship new iniuries single combates besides deare friend consort happen dye way ill accident increase euill whereof many may bee imagined namely dying among enemy pagan hee cannot haue much honour graue surely speake experience nothing bee added calamity griefe threatens sicknesse vnto thee many ill state subiect forraigne part shall shew precept preseruing health euent take thee pleasure remembring thy danger past thou returnest home yea make bitter vnto thee vseth bee comfortable others therefore commend english withdraw themselues consorting countrimen abroad shunning vnnaturally hate onely lodging diuers house onely spending howers weeke company nourish acquaintance may bestow rest time among country wherein liue better language learne state countrie part suffer ill rather alone haue friend partner howsoeuer poet saith solamen miseris soicos habuisse doloris miserable man doth grieue lesse haue partner sad distresse bee vnderstood enemy vnknowne partner cannot thinke torment could bee asswaged like miserie friend others obiect vnspeakeable comfort marriage man wife like well paired heyfers beare burthen together surely kind ill could bee diuided equall part burthen may might bee opinion many kindes ill like soule whole body euery part thereof neither torment soule eased body suffering therefore suffer pouerty banishment torment rather bee single man married since compassion wife childrens suffering would infinitely increase misery thing granted confesse followes contrary consequence contrary traueller impart good success friend whereof cicero dreame scipio dispute man seeing pleasure paradice could take delight therein alone man might communicate conclusion since trauellers meet danger pleasure fit take consort abroad way yeelds deferre imparting good success friend till happy returne home time absence hath sharpened friend desire see discourse pleasant accident may sweeten conuersation stead companion let traueller haue alwayes good booke pocket wee reade alexander great laied homer vnder pillow let booke either fit end study containeth precept sentence daily vse desire make familiar vnto alwaies bewaring treat commonwealth religion thereof subiect may dangerous companion shall make solitude innes many irkesome thing lesse vnpleasing reade alexander great set fier owne hand wane carriage taken darius example macedonian cast away spoyles taken persian lest hinder expedition india traueller comparing small thing great must carry onely necessary thing especially place lowcountries boates waggon changed many time one dayes iourney also italy bring inne onely water side gate city place heauy carriage great burthen charge let enquire best innes especially germany also night italy may take short dinner inne italy hee lodge safely night best innes moderate ordinary expences shall auoid fraud iniuries knaues shall sleepe safely person good hee hath innes especially suspected place let bolt locke doore chamber let take heed chamber fellowes alwayes haue sword side bed side let lay purse vnder pillow alwayes foulded garter thing hee first vseth morning lest hee forget put vp hee goe chamber end may leaue nothing behind innes let visiting chamber gathering thing together last thing doth hee put foote stirrup aduise traueller learne swimme thinke skill pleasure home vse abroade yeelds small comfort helpe storme sea let men haue free opinion haue mine yet know caesar deliuered himselfe commentary perishing skill swimming neither fortunate caesar neither sea like africke selfe haue knowne many excellent swimmer whereof sight wished land haue perished rage sea waues others haue sunke waight fearefull companion knowing skill taking hold time others hauing least skill swimming trusting hold broken part shippe light chest haue escaped danger came safely shore man put trust swimming let conceale skill least others trusting therein take hold make perish like manner perswade traueller vse himselfe first hardnesse abstaining wine fasting eating grosse meates going iournies foote opinion shall better beare thing necessity forceth cherish body may neither doe commend forraigne part take iournies foote especially long way let stay home behold world mappe haue meanes honest expences men basely spare cost doe blemish estimation enioy company poore fellowes goe foote way instruct better vnderstanding besides wearying body apt fall sicknesse basely expose themselues danger wild beast theeues poore companion dare bee bold say murthers germany high way committed vpon footemen well brought vp wearied going foote spend cherish themselues innes make longer stay therein meanes onely spend almost much hired horse coches also bewray plenty mony foote companion needy oftens happens euen among german otherwise honest disposition plot mischiefe intended vast solitude wood germany offer many opportunity put wicked purpose practice hard remedy prescribed one good education weary iourney also suffer inne moreouer german account stranger according outward habit bold deiected countenance doe altogether dispise passenger foote conclude solitude way reason townes village make iourney foote tedious germany italy going foote may bee borne reason pleasant fruitfull field frequent city townes village safety theeues except vpon confines prince hosemen footemen like danger reason italian opinion respect man behauiour habit alwaies prouided iournies bee short sweetned pleasant companion part thinke best going foote according french prouerb man leades horse hand may mount pleasure must confesse haue obserued countrie men erre kinde though vndertake foote iournies yet generally thinke point frugalitie suffer forraigne part abode lesse profitable vnto v except like menedemus vex selues vnnecessary suffering ill traueller must haue great care preserue health neither last point wisedome follow aduice cicero bid bee old man quickly desire bee old man long care necessarie traueller sicke way suffer many discommodities place country men italy spaine runne high danger howsoeuer health may discreetly shunne snare inquisition yet sicke confession sacrament one kind adoration thereof changed body christ extreme vnction point death thrust vpon priest men ready die ill dissemble neither waight heauy wounded conscience wherewith sicke man bee affected hee professeth himselfe bee reformed religion phisition apothecarie forbidden helpe kitchin phisicke denied priest command hee recouer hee shall bee sure bee brought inquisition hee die body shall buried highway churchyard euents example thereof shall speake largely treaty religion italy formerly haue shewed sickly men vnfit course life preseruation yet neither reade heare follower caluius doctrine hath positiuely forbidden one profession liuing among lutheran communicate prayer sacrament may owne sure common consent confesse lutheran haue true sacrament william perkins late writer singular learning piety doth reach preaching word administration sacrament differ substance word preached heretickes true word god sacrament also true teacheth pharises though part hereticks apostataes yet christ command heard sitting chaire moses men tooke heed false doctrine concludes word hath power among hereticks haue sacrament himselfe saith doe differ substance word hee teacheth leuits heretikes teach sort breach morall law beleeued iustification workes yet circumcision administred true teacheth iudas hypocrite called diuell christ yet hee truly preached baptized point collecteth infant rebaptised sacrament true right forme vsed administred papist lastly hee concludes howsoeuer church rome true church yet hath true sacrament church true church though lie hidden sacrament onely belong yet denies followes thereupon lawfull communicate supper lord papist onely adde one position godly man another discourse namely externall worship god particular gesture prescribed word god done decently modestly according laudable customes church either standing sitting kneeling lying prostrate may inferre discourse last position thereof god gentile idol papist protestant men howsoeuer papist hostia idoll thinke erroniously yet selfe others rightly iudging true sacrament haue auereuerence according custome church wherein man doth liue like sort papist praying image christ apostle doth sinne bend knee thinkes worshipped another abhorring idolatry pray chamber church picture kneele yet sinne hauing mind worship kneele god worshipped holinesse faction honest kind dissembling religion within due limit tollerable yea outward gesture reuerence vsed church papist euen sacrament eleuated lawfull yet impious part god witnesse abhorre denying faith blessed sauiour point faith would world employ tongue pen giue encouragement wickednesse yet leaue conscience soiourne among forraigne papist altogether vpon racke giue leaue say former position granted cannot thinke great difference betweene superstitiously worship one true god three person article trinity cannot denied held papist heathen idolators worshipping imaginary god yea diuels tied write faith forehead thrust selues hand inquisitor may godly wisdome auoide snare yea cannot condemne bare kneeling praying outward reuerence church papist simply impious circumstance concurring aggrauate action especially done forraigne part offence giuen weake brother apostle cor bid v auoide rather offence auoided christian howsoeuer superstitious rather induced thinke none teacher haue knowledge euer dogmattically forbidden v heare papist sermon wee may present without sinne doubt may without sinne omit reuerence gesture due word god chaire moses howsoeuer spoken mouth pharyses maine question hearing masse adoring hostia therein communicating sacrament must confesse hold hearing masse alwayes ioined kneeling hostia questionlesse sinne godly must bewaile curiosity vaine affection haue beene seduced thereunto thereby haue communicated prayer saint without precept promise without faith haue exhibited reuerence kneeling hostia howsoeuer due god receiuing sacrament yet beholder onely eleuation priest onely receiues pretence left outward reuerence worship also must confesse whatsoeuer may concluded former like position proue papist haue true sacrament baptisme polonians part ride horsebacke conuenient frugall course passenger buy horse sell italy iourney neither shall want horseman beare company city city horseman cannot carrie bed must haue patience rest vpon bench til shall find bed vpon confines germany meane time long horsmans coat polonians hungarian generally vse may straw make logding couenient especially lined woolues skinnes like furres winter time neither shall neede feare cold since polonians vse hot stoues german haue also lodge family therein night vpon straw bench horsemeate cost two three grosh noone foure fiue grosh night italy vse coach onely state venice treuiso padoua twelue mile selfe companion hired coach eighteene venetian lyre part italy traueliers iourneys vse italy horse mare lumbardy otherwhere vpon hilly country plaine towards naples vse mule ass much commonly horse beast like sort vsed carriage posthorses hired euery city one commonly pay siluer crowne seuen venetian lyre ten mile remember haue seene vse posthorses galloping italian vsing ride slow pace passenger thinke rate deare may take frugall course enquiting posthorses returne called must returne home empty find passenger chance vse horse may bee lower rate passenger find readily euery stage vnpleasant walke foote next stage way shall commonly find horse want consort heauy baggage make walking foote vnpleasant otherwise field way pleasant city townes dwelling frequent ride vpon posthorse returne must take heede light horse townegate ride inne postmaster force take new posthorse else goe away foote whereas come inne either foote vpon hackny free horseletters furnish company hackney horse horse leuers called vettarini let horse lower rate especially passenger haue two three consort send seruant foot seede horse way bring backe except iourney short one two dayes case let horse passenger alone caution hee shall meate way iourneys end leaue inne appoint without cure meate returne yea passenger woud ride horse beyond inne hoste innumerable euery place distant another towards east west hath owne peculiar meridian diuers meridian another place yet making map like v geographer appoint one hundred eighty meridian namely ninty easterly nintie westerly lesser circle called paralells equally distant hauing relation paralells one great circle part equally distant al lesser circle haue relation one greater called paralells greater circle onely mention made paralells referred aequator lesser circle drawne neere aequator east towards west contrary vertical point seueral place heauen place themselues vpper face earth soape great quantity corne yet english seldome haue neede corne vse england many time owne transport nation buy free city doe transport others lowcountrey men buy well themselues serue spaine therewith great quantity thereof distracted part europe amber brought part gathered meluin dantzke sea side konigsperg duke prussen hold court along coast curland howsoeuer lie great quantity scattered sand sea yet safe warehouse since death take away least peece thereof first gathered couered ouer drosse polished becomes transparantly bright dantzke see two polished peeces thereof esteemed great price one including frogge part cleerely seene king poland beiyg offered fiue hundred dollers including newt transparant former thinke amber gumme distilling tree peeces falling vpon frogges like thing opinion seeme true tree hold amber distill abound germany yet amber onely found vpon coast balticke sea others thinke rather amber generated sea certaine marriners sounding farre land often find sand amber sticking plummet whereof selfe eye witnesse munster hold deceiued thinke amber gumme distilling tree fat burnes put fier concludes fat clay bituminous matter affirming onely found vpon sea coast often caught sea net add liquid often fals vpon includes little beast growe hardnes stone smels mirh diet german simple modest set aside intemperate drinking nothing sumptuous well art industry making manuall workes easily draw retaine forraigne coynes free city vse haue alwaies yeeres prouision victual laid vp publike house serue homely food people case city happen pudding pudding sauory pleasant kind mirth wish prouerbially kurtz predigen lange worsten short sermon long pudding sometimes also giue dried fish apple peares first dried prepared cinamon butter sauourily vse many sawces commonly sharpe comfort stomacke offended excessiue drinking cause vpper germany first draught commonly wormewood wine first dish little lamprey call mine augen hauing nine eye serued white vineger take iourney commonly morning drinke little brant wein aquauita eate peece pfeffer kuchen gingerbread vseth sold gate city haue delicate sawce opinion rosted meat cherry sod brused iuice whereof becomes hard like marmalade serued table dissolue little wine like moisture haue abundance fresh fish pond riuers desire eate except see aliue kitchen prepare sauourly commonly vsing anniseeds purpose especially little fish wherof haue one delicate kinde called smerling prussen eate first choked sodden wine little yet sixty sold nineteene grosh foresaid sawce cherry thus prepare keepe gather darke blackish kind cherry casting away stalkes put great cauldron brasse set vpon fier til beginne hot put lesse cauldren full hole bottome presse hand stone skinnes remaine cauldron iuice foresaid hole doth fall another vessell againe set iuyce vpon fier continually stirring lest cleaue bottome two howers space mingle best kind peares haue first cut small peeces long boile continually stirre till waxe hard notwithstanding stirring beginne cleaue vessell iuyce thus made like marmalade may long preserued moulding sort desire haue sweete mixe sugar others thing according taste desire haue put earthen pitcher beginne time waxe mouldie put pot ouen bread baked taken also pitcher must close stopped aire may enter must set sunne continuall heate come lastly make ready sawce cut peece said iuice mingle little wine dissolue vineger sugar spice according seuerall appetite boile againe halfe hower saxony misen part sometimes serue table calues head whole vndeuided part v stranger first sight seemed terrible dish gaping teeth like head monster prepare neuer remember haue eaten thing pleased taste vse common diet thing come cow neither haue obserued haue butter saxony lower part germany vse certaine white matter called smalts stead tasting like butter doe commonly eate cheese neither remember euer tasted good cheese excepting one kind little cheese made goat milke pleasant eate salt strong cheese sometimes vse prouoke drinking purpose least crum sufficient cheese compasse round thred twigges beginne midst broade side making round hole hole cheese set vp put drop wine may putrifie next time eate mouldy peeces creeping maggot dainety morsel last cheese becomes rotten full wormes said binding compasseth chance break cheese fals degree halfe thirty degree latitude lye extends fiue degree paralell forty eight degree halfe fifty three degree halfe called netherland country lying low people language manner hath great affinitie german called dutchman common name old country part gallia transalpina beyond alpes italy subdeuided comata narbonensis againe comata called people long haire subdeuided aquitanica celtica lugdunensis gelderland territory westfreesland groning vtrecht transisola county artois hath many faire city whereof arras chiefe giuing name prouince rich hanging wherwith great men adorne pallaces flanders largest county chiefe city whereof ghant emperour charles fifth borne bruges whether great concourse merchant made old stranger hearing name flanders custome impose name flanders fifteene prouinces name flemmings inhabitant flanders hath city namely calleis dunkerk ostend sleuse lying sea coast whereof sleuse municipall village bruges time selfe strongly fortified ostend taken spaniard state vnited prouinces time committed vnder pay custody english garrison vnder sir edward norreys knight prouince yeelds plenty corne flax rich making linnen woollen cloathes hath excellent pasture inriched situation first vnited prouinces consisting many ilands whereof seuen principall chiefe walcherne chiefe citie whereof midleburg famous trafficke staple spanish french wine neere city vlishing strongly fortified chiefe fort ingaged crowne england kept english garrison vnder command sir robert sidney knight second fort ingaged england lye another iland called brill kept english garrison vnder command lord barrow ilands fertile yeeld excellent corne plentifully prouince one aker thereof said yeeld double aker brabant haue sweete water good aire want wood burne turffe take plenty city may omit pleasant village hage called grauenhage count court seate vnited state wanting onely wals make numbred among pleasant city doubt village yeelding none pleasant seat prouince doth abound lake pooles water artificiall ditch giues passage water well land euery city poorest village infinite number ditch itoweth part riuer rheine rheine old running towards leyden fall little sea day reason land low subiect ouerflowings hath changed bed lobecum dukedome cleue deuides selfe many branch first runnes arnheim city gelderland vaua rena battouodurum lecca receiues water take away name rheine first branch rheine yet little branch thereof still hold name rheine running mastricht deuides two one whereof fals vecta arme sea neere munda runnes woerden long course necre leyden deuided fiue little branch whereof three fall lake fourth turnes renoburg leeseth selfe mountaines sand neere village catwicke remember water falling leyden called rheine thinke probable standing water lying betweene seuerall pasture come rheine hath lost name said rheine battouodurum called lecca runnes culenburg viana ditch fountaine isala runnes thus omit little branch battouodurum first branch rheine lost riuers lecca isala second branch bend lobecum neomagum fals brooke meroutus taking name second branch old family king among gal old castle compassed brooke name running dort holland receiues foresaid lecca isala neere rhoterodame fals mosa vnder name fals neere brill german sea third branch rheine running lobecum within two mile arnheime fals ditch drusus rather third branch germanicus runnes dewsborows city drusus receiues old isala springing westphalia name isala isell running zutphane deuentry fals tatu amstelrodame arme sea carried westfreesland fals german sea neere iland flye returne purpose holland little circuite abounds people dwelling poore selfe rich industrie wanting wine corne yet furnisheth many nation neither wooll flax grow brought make linnen clothes much prised also woollen carried indie need speake holland cheese vulgarly knowne much esteemed lastly holland famous traffique commodity roman highly esteemed fortitude faithfulnes old battani band guard county zutphane accompted part gelderland subdued state arinie ioyned vnited prouinces yeere county namures called cheese citie hath mine iron plenty stony coale contrarie coales quenched infusion oyle hath also ill smell take away sprinckling salt burnes cleere hauing water cast vpon county hath also quarry freestone marble diuers colour dukedome luxenburg hath name chiefe citie inhabitant vpper part germanes lower part like french language manner dukedom brabant hath faire city namely antwerp famous ciuil war maximilian austria brought thither fro bruges flanders famous traffique nation ditch cold doe long course side glide vpon german sea thereby gathering farre greater cold rush plaine prouinces stopped either mountaines wood mountaines scarce hils wood scarce groues hinder violent passage vttermost force like reason may giuen heate open plaine way shaddowed beames sunne opposition wood mountaines must need summer subiect heate sunne wind land adde winter frequent riuers lake pooles standing water finitely increase coldnesse aire water aswell running standing almost winter frosen ouer thicke ice beare hundreths young men woman sliding vpon pattins according custome yea arme sea called zwidersea lying within land betweene holland freseland though large deepe hauing two flat shoales yet compassed ilands continent many time winter frosen ouer victualer erect tent middest hauing beere wine fier made vpon iron furnace refresh passe vpon sledge sliding vpon iron pattern one shoare cold cause sheepe cattell kept stable bring forth young howsoeuer done italy subiect great heate yet necessitie great tendernesse italian towards cattle haue cause soeuer vse hot stoaues german doe yet weomen well home church driue away cold put vnder little pannes fier difficult preserue perishing winter cold inhabitant carelesse dainty though later time haue admitted forraigne manner luxury hath power formerly haue oft seene one apple sold blancke great cherry whereof make sawces especially fish thereupon stranger merrily dict called buttermouths much delighted white meat bawers drinke milke stead beere well men weomen passing boates city city trade carry lunchen cheese vse seeth little peeces flesh pipkins rootes gobbet fat mingled therewith without cutiosity often seeth againe setting meale weeke table newly heated addition flesh rootes fat morsel thinke needfull dish vulgarly called hutspot feed much vpon rootes boyes rich men deuoure raw morsell bread runne playing streetes vse commonly fresh meates seldome set salt meates board except beat feast prouoke drinking vse spit roast meat bake earthen pipkin ouen likewise seeth meates cold often heat serue table haue come inne kitchen could see nothing ready supper yet presently called supper haue seene long table furnished often heated meat smoaked outside yet cold inside people prouerbially said excell baked meates especially baking venison yet knowledge haue red deare prouinces neither haue inclosed parkes fallow deare connygrees onely count mauritz hath late england buckes fallow deare runne groue hage connies neere leyden vpon sandy banke sea sufficient serue inhabitant part accounted good pleasant eat neither forraigne part doe much desire feed connies either rare flesh sauoury vse eate early morning euen day cloth laid foure time day seruants two time set nothing cheese inferiour condition sit table rate innes commodious enough city frequent scarce eight mile distant one commodity lodging frequent yea hang signes doore fashion vse may city germany denmarke poland scotland ireland innes onely knowne fame made maruell notwithstanding signe obliging lodge stranger selfe though well apparelled haue diuers time beene refused lodging many innes seemed scorne flat iniury faire city leyden wanting many faire innes refused lodging sixe hardly got seuenth made gather willingly entertaine englishman neither attribute hospital nature licentiousnesse souldiers perhaps deserued ill thereby perhaps ill payment cannot blame english case butrather vnequall law england giuing elder brother lying sluggishly home thrusting younger brother warres desperate hazard penury forcibly driueth ingenious disposition doe vnfit thing reason huge imposition especially vpon wine passenger expence much increased exaction often equall passe value thing paid though man table exchange merchant wine spice fertilty much vse especially dressing fish forraigne stuffes clothes silke wooll poland aboundeth beast aswell wild tame yeeldeth excellent horse great quicke immunity subiect kingdome though haue described among prouinces germany people german language manner inhabitant borussia haue ship vsing stranger export commodity poland aboundeth foresaid necessary commodity people liue content owne yet rich want foresaid forraigne commodity farre brought deare haue little gold siluer despising respect sell commodity low rate especially daily foode vnfit exported truth selfe hauing poland ireland found strange cheapenesse dyot necessary respect want esteeme siluer obseruation make opinion much contrary vulgar certaine signe fluorishing rich commonwealth deare price thing excepting yeeres famine greater argument poore weake state cheape price make confident conclude old wiues snared papisticall superstition doe foolishly attribute late deare price change religion time ignorantly extoll former time wherein twenty foure egg sold penny age king haue royall tribute noble farre greater reuenews merchant much greater wealth euer progenitor cause thing diet appartell wanton desire sold much higher price former age rich make v able want thing serue appetite price soeuer set againe italy hath great store flesh bird fish like thing food regard populousnesse thereof yet inhabitant holding disgrace sparing diet modest apparell clenly regard generall temperance nobility disdaineth weaue silkes trade sinew countrey howsoeuer thing sold deare price yet prince considering thing considered gentleman merchant vniuersall world haue greater treasure wealth italy haue said poland doth abound kind flesh whitmeates freshwater fish haue store butter haue seene anoint cart wheeles therewith white lesse sauoury kingdome hath city stranger time soiourne shall easily find german netherlander host entertaine commodiously nation though perhaps extraordinary rate selfe found abiding netherlander crakaw innes chiefe city affoord conuenient bed plenty flesh freshwater fish fish dresse pepper spice enough kinde cookery polonians praised aboue german nation yet spite farre brought deerely sold make sawce farre costly fish selfe scarce gentleman hath skill doth vse dresse fish owne eating village small city highway passenger shall find bed may carry bed coach fit vpon conucnicntly others vse sleepe vpon straw lapped furred horseman coate vse weare haue coate must content sleepe vpon cleane straw passenger lie together warme stoaue family men weomen neither shall find place wine choice meates vse bring city coach innes place poore naked house hauing nothing sell close shamble baker brewer house passenger buy beere meat like bring inne poore hostesse dresse affording onely fier course tablecloth seemed lord place vseth impose vpon vassall charge entertaine stranger hostesse giue labour nothing except curtesie desire eate freely giue small reward three penny whole company shee thinke deale bountifully shee aske nothing also may freelie carrie away coach flesh bread wine anie thing remaines haue seene done many time countrey europe affoordes victual ata lower rate selfe companion countrey towne inuite two guest dinner foure person came foure grosh halfe haue formerly set downe ordinary expences generally chapter treating subiect first booke thirde part particularlie iourney poland first part onelie adde village little city high way haue bought tenne egges one grosh goose three partridge two loine mutton two pigge three grosh like thing small price passenger haue cooke companie haue himselfe skill dresse meate owne appetite thinke hee shall want nothing necessary delicate foode hee may expect countrey hostesse seeke curiously dresse daineties lastly polonians stout drinker german passe excepting onely saxon yea aboue euer obserued giuen vice seemed mad kind drinking prone quarrel brawling fighting giue leaue adde one obseruation seemed strange meluin dantzke prussen betweene michaelmas christmas country people bring sledge laded dead hare foozen ouer preserued aswell better powdred salt till lady day lent time frost begin first breake eate hare meane time thaw fier ouen warme stoue casting water presently set fier either rosted boyled like sort preserue phesants kind flesh frozen ouer aswell salted man thinke trauellers fiction let know credible person told mee certaine knowledge experience moscouites russia bring dead body men winter thus frozen ouer lay heapes bellfrees church lie without rotting ill smell till lady day lent snow begin thaw earth fit digging till time earth couered deepe hard snow couered yet hard continuall frost cannot bee digged time family take body dead take care burie chap v italy touching subiects third chapter going longitude italy extends fourteene degree halfe meridian twenty seuen degree italy halfe forty two degree latitude extends eight degree paralell thirty eight degree forty sixe degree italy old called saturnia ianicula oenotria ausonia lastly name italy called saturnia saturne banished country taught inhabitant country art husbandry poet fable accounted first king people called aborigine borne comming forraigne part inhabite called ianicula ianus noha affirme haue come thither deluge haue taught art plant vine sow corne haue built citie ianua called genoa called oenotria either excellent wine oenotrius king sabine likewise name ausonius son vlisses lastly called italy italus king sicilie old greeke word signifying ox shewing inhabitant haue heardsmen ptolomy describes forme chersonesus necke land peninsula almost iland pliny forme oaken leafe others aptly compare man leg thigh sole foote old writer diuiding italy gallia cisalpina togata inclose gallia line drawne riuer varus beyond genoa apenine mountaine brooke rubico falles sea neere rauenna line obliquely stretched east west diuide italy make picmount dukedome milan dukedome ferrara treuisan marquisate histria peculiar part europe prouinces time part italy better inclosed confined line drawne head brooke varus coccian alpes mountaine adula lie vpon alpes furca mount gothard rhetian alpes towards east brooke arsia confining histria rest italy compassed sea also mount appenine deriued alpes runnes length italy forme fish backe bone almost midst deuides two tract one lying towards vpper adriaticke sea towards nether tyrrhene sea howsoeuer appennine ancona seemes bend towards adriaticke sea end yet turnes thence deuides rest italy till end vpon straight sicilian sea italy worthily called queene nation neuer sufficiently praised happy sweete ayre fruitfull pleasant field warme sunny hus thicket shaddowing groues hauens sea watering brooke bath wine oyle delight safe fort defence well sea alpes neither part europe inhabited adorned city castle compared thereunto tillage husbandry prouinces thereof numbred first beyond appenine towards tyrrhene sea lie fiue prouinces liguria tuscia campania suodeuided vmbria latium campania happy lucania vulgarly calabria vpper lower also side appenine towards though courteous yet sparing italian ieast saying meete man dinner time aske vos signoria ha desinato sir haue dined answer replie would haue inuited dinner answere reply andate signor cheotta goe sir others good fellowship must needes temperate others intised meanes eate beyond hunger city many take chamber one house eate common table man hath owne meat prouided hostesse dressing seruing man owne napkin glasse forke spoone knife ingestar glasse wine meate seuerally neately laid vp hostesse table perhaps one man hath hen another piece flesh third potched egges man seuerall meat diet courtesie esteemed slaues thus liuing owne giue due honour superiours returne due respect otherwise dispise richer saying scorne let dine twise day weare two gounes enough mee haue conuenient diet apparrell haue delicate sauce rosted meates called sauore made slice bread steeped broath many walnut leaues marioram beaten morter mingled therewith together iuyce gooseberry sharpe liquor put set table city seldome raines september october onely often time violently time would beate downe house falling palefulls field watred night dewes fall whereof man stirres dores head well couered danger sicknesse men vsing keepe house till dew dried meane time day heate excessiue man hardly indure apparrell though linnen silke hang loose close fertilitie soyle generally empire exceeding great goodnesse varietie fruit equalleth place passeth italy fortility wine greete mount libanus especially palormo natolia exceeding rich good yet haue turkes lesse plenty thing europe sparingly onely serue necessity either set plant sow great part people wasted warres remaine hauing free fruition owne good great tyranny vnder liue aswell emporour vndergouernours changed least yeere generall rapacity licentiousnesse souldiers hence vast solitude vntilled desarts side yet ground selfe brings forth diuers wild fruit without tillage haue diuers kind graine wheate graine called milet barly oates rye pea al kind pulse kind like europe wheate bignesse graine rest bee preferred great abundance rice flax cotton growing field haue good plenty kind cattell yet industrious grasing feeding heards sowing planting haue egges hennes rice hony composition drinke fruit bread daily foode desire dainty greater rich since neither inioy good liue yet bequeath death nothing dangerous accounted rich caloiri greeke monkes candia abode time shewed mee sields yeere past yeelded ninety fiue measure graine one sowed candia though lie compasse turkish empire almost side yet subiect state venice iland chios vulgarly zio subiest turkes famous pleasantnesse also fertilitie yeelding mastick fruit tree lentiscus hauing abundance patridges kind foule haue iornal first part spoken fertile ilands cyprus mettilene syria haue sheepe strange bignesse whereof many haue tailes weighing twenty thirty pound bearing wooll wrethed heeles horne rammes let man thinke incredible since reported sheepe affrick confirmed consent haue part mule somewhat rare haue innumerable camel beast apt carry burthen lying patiently downe receiue able beare hunger especially thirst male female ingender lye downe belly tayle tayle heades many eiles distant one time yeere naturally prone generation fierce kind madnesse master take heede violence may doe turkes also haue many dromedaties kinde beast vnlike cammell farre passing horse swiftnesse cammels patience labour horse rather faire strong make skin shine laying vpon owne dung dried horse either runne often put spurt brauery goe foote pace vse follow laded cammels iournies taught either trot amble good short iournics able indure long iournies doe therefore turkish caualtery warre swiftnesse strength germane horse heauy easily ouertake flying easily flye beaten turkes haue great plenty sea fresh water fish bird foule christian buyer whereof great multitude especially constantinople furnish market therewith truth constantinople great varietie goodnesse kind wished onely oystors though pleatifull yet haue delicate salt taste haue mediterranean sea nothing salt ocean generall turkes reason foresaid tyranny temperance diet doe little vse fishing fowling like exercise yea reason tyranny emperour gouernours souldiers traffick turkes carelesly coldly exercise trafficke merchant grant trade natolia part owne empire cold manner make voyage sea forraigne part excepting come venice doe labour kind necessitie forceth far insatiable desire rich auoide nothing opinion bee rich iewes greekes subiect turkes confederate christian exporting commodity themselues haue ship emperour onely hauing twelue great ship well armed bring necessary egypt constantinople like sort haue marrines vnexperienced fearefull vsing greekes vassal slaues taken warde purpose much esteeme gently treate captiues skilfull nauigation townes keepe priuate charge small gallies barkes rob christian great turkes nauie consists gallies nothing comparable venice winter constantinople another haurn greece whereof shall write largely discourse turkes commonwealth among city trade haue two famous one asia affrick asia called haleppo withinland port thereof called scanderona turk alexandretta christian whence commodity merchant carried vpon cammels fifth day arriue haleppo whether commodity persia brought riuer euphrates vpon cammels backes citie taurus old subiect persian age subdued turkes indian commodity brought thither red sea gulfe arabia famous citie trade affricke called babylon named alcatero whence commodity india egypt affricke exported france touching particular subiects first chapter longitude france extends thirteene degree meridian sixteene degree twenty nine degree latitude extends eight degree paralell forty two degree fifty degree france old deuided cisalpina transalpina description italy haue formerly spoken cisalpina also called togata gownes inhabitant wore tonsa short haire transalpina subdeuided comata narbonersis comata called long haire againe subdeuided belgica haue spoken formerly description netherland aquitanica celtica lugdunensis aquitanica second part comata old called aremorica lying vpon mountaines pyrenei differ language french like tie spaniard next pyreni dwelt ansi ansitani called vulgarly guascons comming spaine chief city tolouse famous vniuersity parliament prouince another city called bordeaux hath also vniuersity famous generall concourse merchant trading french wine beyond riuer garumna running midst aquitania dwell santones ancient people whose countrey called santoigne next lie pictones pictaui vpon riuer loyer whose countrey called posctou abounding fish fowle game hunting hawking hath three chiefe city seates bishop poictiers lusson maillezais necke land adioyning called aulone ilands noir de chauet de dieu nosire dame de bouin c yeeld great quantity salt transported countrey bituriger called berry chiefe city burges old called auaricum vniuersity citizen sixe faires yeere sell great quantity woollen cloath countrey hath rich pasture feeding many flockes sheepe whose wooll cloath made besides aboundeth also wine corne kind cattell city within land called lattin biturigum two tower next lie dukedome burbonois small territory celtica lugdunensis another part comata containes part transalpina lie betweene riuers loyer seyne beyond last riuer france old extended france abounds necessary food well kind cattle fruites inferiour place italy wild boares red deare haue fallow deare bird fowle kind fish affoorded sea many pleasant riuers beef neither good much vsed sheep lesse england flesh sweete sauoury innes haue greater plenty partridge diuers kind bird countrey people neither doe may eate gentleman generally sparing ordinary diet great plenty dainty brought chiefe innes howsoeuer england happy aboundance hath dainty food proper selfe god wit kind sea fowle especially fallow deare brawne though passeth france generally plenty sea fowles well variety plenty sea fish yet hath aboundance france hath land fowle haunt wood field partridge feasants woodcock like least reason common sort feeding thereon said spare ordinary diet gentleman france seemeth larding meates commendable whereby take away variety taste making meates sauor porke french alone delight mortified meates vse much whitmeates haue tasted good butter ambassadours cause brought vnto multitude inhabitant commodity hauens chiefe towne bridgewater hath name bridge water iland auallon called britans tongue apple latin cals glasconia flourished monastery glastenbury great antiquity say great worthy britans prince arthur hath sepulcher episcopall little city called well well fountaines hath stately bishop pallace city bathe famous medicinall bath whereof three fountaines spring city wholsome body nummed ill humour shut vp certaine howers day man enter till sluces purged filth bishop welles buying city henry first remoued episcopall seate thither yet still keeping old name bishop welles built new cathedrall church city bristowe compassed double wall hath faire building well publike priuate house next london yorke preferred city england wilshire also inhabited belgae netherlander lie within land rich part pasture corne malmesbury faire towne famous woollen clothes towne wilton old cheefe county little village beautified stately pallace earles penbroke city salisbury made pleasant water running streetes beautified stately cathedrall church colledge deane prebend hauing rich inhabitant pleasant seate yet way famous hauing iohn iewell late worthy bishop called stoneheng vulgarly reputed among miracle placed merlin scarce stone ordinary building territory adioyning hamshire old inhabited within land belgae netherlander vppon sea coast regni william norman conquerour made forrest deare destroying town holy building thirty mile compasse ground well inhabited yet seruing vse call newforest southampton faire little city lie vpon sea wintchester old called venta belgae famous city time roman day well inhabited watered pleasant brooke pleasantly seated hath olde castle wherein hanges wall table round forme vulgarly called prince arthur round table gamden thinkes haue made long time hath cathedrall church large bishop pallace famous colledge founded training vp young schollers learning whence many learned men haue first sent vniuersity church commonwealth towne port portsmouth lie garrison souldiers defend part incursion french sea barkshire old inhabited atrebatij newbery famous towne inriched wollen clothes beginning ancient towne spina windsore famous king castle neither king seate bee pleasant situation draweth king often retire thither edward third kept one time iohn king france dauid king scotland captiues castle edward third built stately church dedicated blessed virgin mary george capadocian first instituted order knight called garter happy omen victory warre happily succeeding weare vnder left knee watchet garter buckled hauing mot french tongue grauen letter gold hony soit qui maly pense ceremony order hee instituted kept church county surry old inhabited regni otelands beautified king faire pleasant house richmond king stately pallace county sussex old inhabited regni hath faire city chichesler hauen rhie knowne frequented passage france county kent rich medows pasture pleasant groues wonderfully aboundeth apple cherry hath frequent townes safe harbour ship vaines iron william norman conquerour manner roman instituted warden fiue port hastings douer hith rumney sandwiche winchelsey rie chiefe hauens townes ioyned member haue great priuiledges tied serue warres warden alwaies one great lord within iurisdiction hath thing authority admirall right detford towne well knowne king ship built commentary writes thus dyet britans dyet vnlawfull taste hare goose hennes yet keepe pleasure inward part sow corne liue vpon milke flesh day english inhabitant eate almost flesh commonly hennes goose fat tender much delicate haue eaten part england preferred hare german wonder hauing venison prince keeping proper themselues hunting hare proper gentleman part esteeme hare venison seldom eate connies somewhat rare like rosted cat english connies english husbandman eate barley rye browne bread preserre white bread abiding longer stomack soone disgested labour citizen gentleman care pure white bread england yeelding haue said kind corne plenty haue formerly said english haue aboundance whitmeates kindes flesh fowle fish thing good foode ducourle french dyet haue shewed english haue proper daintics knowne part word repeate oyster england old carried farre rome plentifull lauorie part england hath aboundance godwit many seafowles rare altogether vnknowne elsewhere season yeere english eate fallow deare plentifully buck summer winter bake pasty venison pasty dainty rarely found kingdome likewise brawne proper meate english knowne others haue strange variety whitmeates likewise preserued banquetting stuffe preserues france onely may compare needelesse repeate rest bee tedions search particularly like dainty english haue greater abundance nation generall art cookery much esteemed england neither doe sooner finde master men profession howsoeuer esteemed kind exquisite art yet english cooke comparison nation commended roasted meates abundance thing make cheape rich preferring gluttonous appetite gold prodigalitie gentleman haue singular folly offer thing worth point dignity pay others lastly great money siluer hauing small coynes brasle monies pay small matter thing say great plenty make v poore greatly increase price thing also said abundance rich vulgarly increased old custome english make table plentifully furnished whereupon nation esteeme v glutton deuourers flesh yet english table furnished many dish one man dier seuerally many men appetite onely prepared family stranger reliefe poore confesse plenty variety meates euerie man cannot vse moderation vnderstandeth seuerall meates one man seuerall appetite may take hee like confesse english custome first serue grosse meates hunger spare seede serue dainty inuite eate without hunger likewise longe sitting discoursing table make men vnawares eate italian doe solitary table thing say giue v iust cause cry socrates god deliuer mee meates inuite eate beyond hunger italian sansouine much deceiued writing generall english care couer table least foure time day howsoeuer iourney sickly men staying home may perhaps take small breakfast yet generall english eate two meales dinner supper day could neuer see vseth eate foure time day professe selfe englishman passing italy famous temperance wee often obseraed howsoeuer wee might haue pullet flesh prepared v eating moderate proportion bread italian time charger full hearbs sallet rootes like meates small price would eate two three pennyworth bread since fulnesse ill bread worst thinke wee temperate dyet though eating flesh eating much bread wee true english prepare largely ordinarie dyet themselues friendes comming chance feastes inuited friendes excessiue number dish table thought well furnished except stand one vpon another neither vse set drinke table roome left cuppes glass serued vpon side table drinke offered none till call old english hospitality boldly say meere vice haue formerly showed discourse especially euer find coast ireland couered mist whereas coast england commonly cleare seene farre ayre ireland vnapt ripen seedes yet mela witnesseth earth luxurions yeelding faire sweete hearbs ireland little troubled thunder lightning earthquake yet know vpon presage yeere moneth nouember almost ended siege kinsale day famous battell rebel happily ouerthrowne nightly heare see great thundrings lightning without astonishment presage field onely apt feede cattell yeeld also great increase corne wil freely say obserued winter cold far mild england irish pasture greene likewise garden al winter time summer reason cloudy ayre watry soyle heate sunne hath power ripen corne fruit haruest much later england also obserued best sort flower fruit much rarer ireland england notwithstanding bee attributed inhabitant ayre ireland oft troubled rebellion rebel idle themselues naturall malice destroying labour men cutting vp tree fruit cause else burne reason inhabitant take lesse pleasure till ground plant tree content liue day continuall feare like mischiefes yet ireland altogether destitute flower fruites wherewith county kilkenny seemes abound part said humility aire land making fruit food raw moyst hereupon inhabitant stranger troubled loosenes body country disease yet rawnes haue excellentremedy aquauitae vulgarly called vsqucbagh bind belly drieth vp moysture aquauitae yet flameth much also inhabitant aswell stranger troubled ague call irish ague sick thereof vpon receiued custome doe vse helpe phisitian giue themselues keeping irish woman starue ague giuing sick man meate take nothing milke vulgarly knowne remedy hand ireland much bloud spilt ciuill warres became lesse populous fertility trafficke aswell great lord country inferiour gentleman laboured get new possession inheritance husbandry peopling old land increase reuenues obserued much grasse wherewith iland much abounds haue perished without vse either haue rotted next springtime bee burnt lest hinder comming new grasse plenty grasse make irish haue infinite multitude cattle heate last rebellion vagabond rebel great multitude cowes stil like nomades droue whither soeuer themselues driuen fought altar family abundance cattle irish haue frequent though somewhat poore trafficke hide cattle generall little onely men greyhound great statute neither cattell possibly bee great since eat onely day brought euening within bawnes castle stand lye night dirty yard without much lock hay whereof make little sluggishnesse little altogether keep horse thus brought night feare theeues commander ireland hath great plenty bird fowles reason naturall sloth little delight skill birding fowling ireland hath neither singing nightingall chattering pye vndermining moule blacke crow onely crowes mingled colour wee call royston crowes haue plenty pheasant haue knowne sixtie serued one feast abound much rayles partridge somewhat rare many eagle great plenty hare cony hawkes called gossehawkes much esteemed v also bee well hiues home hollow tree abroad caues earth abound flock sheepe sheare twise yeere wooll course merchant may export forbidden law made behalfe poore may nourished working cloth namely rug whereof best made waterford mantle generally worne men woman exported great quantity ireland yeelds much flax inhabitant work yarne export great quatity old plenty linnen cloth wild irish vsed weare elles shirt al gathered wrinckled washed saffron neuer put til worne horse called hobby much commen ded ambling pace beuty ireland yeelds horse good seruice war said hobby much inferior gelding strength endure long iournies bred fenny soft ground ireland soone lamed brought england hawkes ireland called gosshawks said much esteemed england sought mony meanes transported thither ireland yeelds excellent marble neere dublin killkenny corke opinion dare venture worth mountaines would yeeld abundance mettals publike good hindred inhabitant barbarousnes making apt sedition vnwilling inrich prince country slothfulnesse singular hold basenesse labour pouerty able beare charge workes besides wiser sort think pouerty best publike good making peaceable nothing make sooner kick authoritie rich ireland hath part pleasant riuers safe lange hauens lesse frequent lake great circuit yeelding great plenty fish sea side yeelds like plentie excellent fish salmonds oyster preferred english shelfishes kind seafish irish might part haue abundance excellent sea freshwater fish fisher men possessed naturall fault slothfulnesse hope gaine scarsely feare authoritie many place make come house put sea hence many place vse scot fisherman together english make profit inhabitant sluggishnesse doubt irish industrious fishing might export salted dried fish great gaine time peace irish transport good quantity corne yet may transport without license left vpon sudden rebellion king force good subiects want corne vlster westerne part mounster yeeld vast wood rebel cutting vp tree casting heapes vsed stop passage therein also vpon fenny boggy place fight english confesse selfe haue deceiued common fame ireland woody hauing found long iourney armah kinsale wood way excepting great wood ophalia low shrubby place call glinnes also obserue many boggy fenny place whereof great part might dried good painefull husbandry may omit opinion commonly receiued earth ireland suffer snake venimous beast liue irish wood transported building free spider web selfe haue seene spider habitant deny haue poyson haue heard english good credit affirme experience contrary irish hauing part great wood low shrub thicket doe vse fier part burne turfe sea coales brought england export great quantity wood make barrel called pipestaues make great gaine thereby permitted build great ship warre haue small ship sort armed resist pirats transporting commodity spaine france yet great number therfore since irish haue small skill nauigation cannot praise art confident nation bold warlike would doubt proue braue seaman shall practise nauigation could possibly bee industrious therein freely professe ireland generall would yeeld abundance thing ciuill industrious inhabitant lay wasted late rebellion see comming lord montioy daily flourish short time rebellion appeased like new spring put wonted beauty touching irish dyet lord knight gentleman englishirish dyet english abiding hauing competent meanes vse english dyet lesse cleanly none curiously doubt haue great part greater plenty english flesh fowle fish thing food vse like art cookery alwases except fruit venison dainty proper england rare ireland must conceiue venison fowle seeme plentiful ireland neither generally affect dainty foode diligently search english many englishirish haue little little infected irish filthinesse city excepting dublyn better sort waterford english continually lodging house retaine english diet englishirish manner serue table ioynts flesh cut fashion goose pullet seldome irish house hauing signes hung passenger cannot challenge right intertained must haue courtesie intreaty wild may say meere irish inhabiting many large prouinces barbarous filthy diet skum seething pot handfull straw straine milke taken cow like handfull straw none cleanest clense rather defile pot milke deu oure great morsel beefe vnsalted eat commonly swine flesh seldom mutton piece men bee searched among common souldier englishirish meere irish brought lord deputy asked hee eaten flesh dead horse thus freely answered lordship may please eate pheasant patridge much good doe best ireland wild irish said seldome kill cow eate perhaps kill one purpose distribute deuoured one time approue orderly eating meales may eate enough hungry care fast long haue knowne irish footemen seruing england nothing lesse sparing foode family lay meate aside many meales deuoure one time wilde irish assoone cowes haue calued take calues thereof feede milke reare breede rest seeth filthy poke eate nothing froth send present one another greatest part calues cast bee eaten crowes woolues themselues may haue abundance milke calues taken away cowes mad among giue milke till skinne calfe beretino haue seene weare long time constantly purpose weare life chap ii turkes french english scottish irish apparrell turk shaue head crowne leaue tuffr haire doe turkey old onely nourish haire poland ferdinand ispruck called citie wherein hold court hee married daughter duke mantua daughter heire male citizen daughter augsburg wife hee two sonnes third family archduke called ispruch citie wherein liue charles marque burgh andrew cardinall iohn died childe sixe sister leonora wife duke mantua barbara wife duke feraria margareta vrsula helena ioanna charles gratz called city held court hee fourth sonne emperour ferdinand marie daughter duke bauaria hee begat twelue child dying yeere left two sonnes besides diuers daughter fourth family archduke austria called zu gratz city wherein hold court ferdinand zu gratz carolus posthumus margeret gouerned netherland died yeare leopold second duke austria died yeare fredericke proscribed counsell constantia died yeere sigismond dyed yeere ernestus iron died yere ladislaus posthumus king bohemia vnder george pochibraccius tutor king hungary vnder iohn huniades tutorage died yeere thus haue shewed besides branch house austria raigning house austria spaine remaine three branch thereof germany first emperour rodolphus brother ernestus dying life time mathias maximilianus albertus whereof foure liued vnmarried fifth named albertus hath long married hath child second branch ferdinand ispruch waa married philippina daughter citizen augsburg whereupon kinsman difdaining ignoble issue enherit forced agree county tyroll descend vpon sonne whereupon eldest sonne named charles possesseth onely city territory burgh father power giue title marquesse burgh said county father death fell backe emperour second sonne andrew cardinal yeeres made huge stature many witnesse german old feasting tooke counsell peace warre thinking vigor mind inlarged warmed wine wont promise neighbour would ouercome fighting else die valiantly led forth war people acclamation exhorting valour returne praised except shewed scarres gotten fighting infamous lose shield many cause hanged themselues lawfull present sacrifice counsel ready fight called vpon hercules horseman vsed target lance footemen dart army lay compassed chariot cart stead trench lastly counsel signified consent shaking speares dissent murmuring day horseman germany vulgarly called schwartz reytern horseman day blacke horseman onely weare blacke apparrell also haue blacke horse make hand face blacke dressing blacking bootes wherein curious else custome hath made blacknesse ornament else thinke colour make terrible enemy german vsing brawle fight rather chide fight themselues friend desire rather fierce lookes strike feare enemy concealing strength draw fight best horse horseman territory brunswick cleaue franconia howsoeuer horse strong yet haue lesse courage taken plough heauy race neither horse horseman armed may easily bee hurt footemen thus lighthorsemen yet lesse fit seruice reason heauy horse vnapt follow enemy flying saue themselues speedy retrait hath often beene obserued warre turkes hauing swift horse could neither ouertake flight escape pursued heauy horse throughout germany excepting westphalia part waggon drawne little horse though perhaps haue greater seruice warre horseman carry two short pistol saddle sword like short weapon without launce saddle little commonly vsed passenger horseman vse warre may easily bee cast horse haue disaduantage assayled horseman bearing lance footemen vulgarly called lantzknechten seruants lance footemen day best tyroll sueuia westphalia commonly corpulent dull lesse fiery spirit yet great strength fighting battell reason strong member constant order vse fighting armed lance fit strength rather caliuers requiring nimblenesse charging discharging generall german willingly heare themselues compared bulles warfare generall day bulles bearing horne ground firme foote attend assault dogges german neither rush fiercely enemy easily broken charge prouinces germany populous souldiers mercenary forraigne prince commonly supply army faithfulnesse nation strength body prince france italy willingly entertaine guard person prince germany leuie souldiers absolute command owne warres onely voluntary men sent forraigne warres willingly vndertake men generall affection dissolute liberty warres german haue euer mercenary besides pleasant wine france italy draw warres age french hauing ciuill warres betweene papist protestant part haue often hired german part lutheran hating part well papist caluinists call distinction termed common enemy though follow neither caluin luther agree word god say hating papist caluinists nearest religion potter hate potter begger hate begger one next neighbour blamed seruing would freely professe one serue one deuill called thus seruing booty loue demeaned themselues frowardly warres much impaired old reputation nation warfare westfreesland belongs netherland furthest limit empire towards west north end city emden city hath count bearing title city late kept court emden therein citizen professing reformed doctrine caluin count attempting force profession luther doctrine long passed way citizen expelled count gaue oath senator city obey ready armes defence city remoue dwelling thence without leaue senate citizen thus confident city lie vpon confines netherlander maintained men warre inland sea vpon riuer passing wals city stop passage defend ship merchant forced flat expect returne tide generally thought emden would ioine league vnited prouinces netherland yet remained vnder empire free priuiledge yet subiect count emden count time two sonnes daughter king suelia howsoeuer younger brother loue mother obtained best part inheritance yet child thought likely haue doubt made whole inheritance would death returne child elder brother thing shall suffice briefly written generall commonwealth germany particular absolute dominion vnder empire chap v commonwealth sweitzerland according diuers subiects former chapter sweitzers deriued diuers people among others schwalen friselanders howsoeuer german language manner yet old galles gaue seat foote alpes accounted galles french till time iulius caesar commentary caesar wee find commonwealth diuided foure community whereof one namely zurech long ouerthrown army lucius cassius consul rome time sweitzers weary barren seat attempted seeke new place dwelling caesar ouercome contained home time day charles great long race possessed renewed empire west still esteemed galles imperiall dignity fell german became subiects emperours numbred among german hauing manner lawes customes day haue emperours gouerned nation gouernours vulgarly called reich vogt till last commonwealth sweitzers seuered german made free state age hath gotten great reputation worthy obserued ambition pope diuellish tyranny ouer emperours onely eight hundred yeeres christ caused almost garboyles state whereof haue heard read owne eye wee haue seene particular chiefe yea sole cause rending strong member body empire sweitzerland time abounded noble family gouernours fauoured increase owne power whereupon oppressed common people prouoked extreame hatred forced combine themselues mutuall league oppression yet common people neuer dared oppose themselues gentry empire enioied peace bishop rome often cast spirituall thunderbolt meane excommunication emperours aswell absolued subiects oath allegiance heartried ambitious traitor competitor emperours yea stirred vp kinsman child make ciuill warre confused anarchy patron wanting wicked person defend would follow party hence came emperour fredericke second yeere receiued common people sweitzerland protection gentleman likewise client monastery followed pope party whereupon people zurech vrij suitij whole nation called sweitzers three community first yeere made league three yeeres gentleman lying waite intrap little little made firme perpetuall league defence absolute liberty seruing diuers emperours parall tumult time time obtained great priuiledges drew community neighbour city partner league finally rooted family gentleman conspiracy castout gouernours archduke austria lordship sweitzerland fallen processe time attained absolute state see enioy day foresaid strife continuing betweene emperours pope lodwick bauaria contending empire fredericke house austria sweitzers tooke part lodwicke expresly ratified freedome liberty commonwealth consists three part community vulgarly called canton foure part commonwealth fellowes confederate stipendary city gouernements semler addeth forraigue league fourth part community vulgarly called orts italian canton thirteene canton sweitzers hereafter call thirteene number among canton vrij comming taurisci suitij comming cimbri vnderualdij race banished roman yeere made mutual league ten yeeres hauing ouercome battell leopold archduke austria yeere made league perpetuall lucerna fourth canton much wronged vnder patronage house austria auoide tyranny confusion empire yeere ioine selfe perpetuall league zurech free city empire like sort receiued canto canton made war vpon glarona haue possession country commodious comon good people hated gouernors appointed house austria desired freedome yeelded vp themselues canton glarona among canton according number souldiers sent townes tribute like thing gained warre shal vnder common command canton commodity subiects stipendary city fellowes league shall haue part though force ioined warre force canton howsoeuer haue part deuision booty like sort league schafhusen canton sweitzers determineth debt recouered law vsed suite league made one without priuity rest oldest league euer respected commonwealth administred great equity yet lesse seuerity iustice german vse howsoeuer country lie within mountaines wood yet high way passenger safe theeues prouerbially said may carry gold palmes hand crime seuerely punished without respect person scope butt whereat league aime euery man may peaceably enioy owne best men among may publike counsell examine cause warre iust lawfull end may neuer rashly make warre vpon common people burthened debt prone sedition curious order set downe league manner exacting debt taking pledge neither giuing liberty oppression creditor permitting fraud debtor also military men drinke excesse prone brawling blowes heauy penalty thereby insticted vpon authours iniuries duells league make frequent mention thing reproach prescribe good remedy reall satisfaction passing ouer least iniury poorest man among souldiers yea halfe drunken seldome hapneth murther wherein could wish inferiour magistrate would apply themselues lawes accommodated sweitzers gouernement english impatient reproches law giuing ridiculous satisfaction iniuries word wrong excepting maimes hath beene accounted disgracefull course seeke remedy way iniuries haue commonly beene reuenged sword single combat sweitzerland stander bound keepe peace compose strife striue remembred lawes doe obey vse punish seuerely kill another sure beheaded except escape flight case shall banished owne canton except proue witnes killed defence himselfe fame sweitzers sincere iustice many stranger neighbour iudgements desire haue controuersies ended manner sweitzers cause consent particular city prouinces except made confident concurring eminent men draw leade people approue doings case long practice fully know vnpleasing people wary notwithstanding prouinciall state community generall state hage haue ample power absolute commission expresse word doe thing iudge profitable commonwealth remarkeable thing obserue art difficult case desire protract time delude agent generall state answere must first consult prouinciall state againe answere must first know pleasure community determine hath nothing mouth consent superiours call whereas businesse dispatched doubt great difficulty would arise particular action senate generall state besides state themselues count maurice hath thinke double voice yet neuer obserued present assembly ambassadour england hath likewise voice count solms heard married widdow count egmond good desert seruice vnited prouinces hath himselfe heires like priuiledge thus commonwealth generall aristocraticall best men saue people towne haue greater lesser number senator tribute tax customes kind imposed mutuall consent great loue liberty freedome burthensome willingly beare though much lesse exaction imposed king spaine hold contrary right without consent subiects boldnesse make warre prince great power yet respect vnequal proportioning contribution somewhat od among themselues many time iarre seemed difficult thing breake concord common enemy eminent danger spanish reuenge together sweetnesse freedome tasted forced constant vnity dare say humbly offered themselues vassal queene england first infancy commonwealth priuate family frugality none vse except perhaps brew small beere family indeed doubt would find small frugality brewing beere themselues cellar lay open seruants howsoeuer tunnes diuers price according goodnesse beere namely two three foure fiue sixe gulden tunne though leyden onely brewer may sell beere diuers price feare fraud mixing yet difference tribute haue excellent fat pasture whereof aker worth forty pound purchased pay tribute euery head cattle feeding therein two stiuers weekely cow paile great number whereof may coniectured plenty cheese exported holland infinite haue child brought dowry yet shee hath right dispose halfe husband good gotten mariage supposed mutuall labor sonne may disinherited vpon cause approued law father bound giue third part estate among great power speake particularly vnited foote horse prouinces netherland generall reade haue old raised army eighty thousand men since subiects cannot pressed warre owne city towne besieged case magistrate going leading wals since number small willingly follow profession hereupon almost army consisted stranger long experience hath concluded mercenary souldiers vnfit great conquest wise men onely king england coniecture generall power sea bold adde haue credibly heard one city amsterdam time hundred shippes warre men warre foure hundred ship merchant well armed defence besides said ten thousand barkes without doubt vncredible number therefore perhaps vnited prouinces forgetting old league england late merit defending liberty shall time resolue haue warre england good nation god forbid bloody fight sea like happen former age neuer knew yet course time whereof write gaue small probability euent like happen many reason combining mind together first happy amity hath beene time mind betweene nation next bond loue part towards wee haue preserued bondage like bond thankefulnesse towards v howsoeuer ambition may neglect despise yet neuer nation obliged another kind long memory thereof liue must need quench malice betweene v besides able raise army owne men land aswell want men must consist altogether voluntary man bound serue warre except towne besieged owne magistrate leade walles haue hitherto happily vsed may euer vse men souldiers wherein britany aboundeth aboue nation neither doe much esteeme auxiliary band nation lastly wanting many necessary owne yet abounding thing trafficke cannot long subsist without freedome thereof nothing powerfull diminish wealth raise ciuill discord among barring freedome seemed easie lesse difficult king england neighbour prince boldly say neighbour prince ioined together hauing strength owne maintaine freedome sea able onely support britany defend themselues land enemy onely three passage sea one vlishing zeland another brill vpon southwest coast holland third narrow passage iland fly tassell northeast side holland whereof two first guarded said two strong city fort belonging kept garrison english souldiers stopping restraining third seemed lesse difficult nauy britany power enemy time passed part time write vnited prouinces much complained english taking good sea hindering free traffick wherein haue considered caused warre spaine bore onely second merchant forced leaue trafficke spaine great freedome amitie onely sake could thinke iust equal freelie supplie spaine food necessary warre commodity england could vented spaine onely flemmish scottish ship marriners except desired make warre eternall onely grew rich case proiect iust time made war might liue peace whereas complained prohibited ware carried prohibited place also commodity carried friend spoiled men war perhaps insolency captaines souldiers might sometimes happen doubt iniuries rare neuer borne queene inferiour magistrate could bee ignorant hardly insolency souldiers restrained land much sea good englishman may professe abstaining prohibited traffick good englishman wished good successe impunity english ship exercising
